As enacted, extends commission for uniform legislation, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 9.
As introduced, extends commission on Indian affairs, June 30, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 34.
As enacted, extends department of financial institutions, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends department of economic and community development, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends department of commerce and insurance, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As introduced, extends judicial selection commission, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 17, Chapter 4.
As enacted, extends commission on firefighting personnel standards and education, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 24 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
As enacted, extends department of safety, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.

As introduced, transfers school bus inspection duties from department of education to the department of safety. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8, Chapter 23; Title 10; Title 39, Chapter 16; Title 49, Chapter 6; Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 55 and Title 65.

As introduced, revises appointment process of judicial selection commission, clarifies that person on panel rejected by the governor cannot be on second panel of nominees. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 17, Chapter 4.
As enacted, extends Tennessee code commission, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 1 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
As enacted, extends southern growth policies board, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 13, Chapter 2.
As enacted, continues certain permanent rules filed with secretary of state after January 1, 2008. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5.
As introduced, requires governor to submit legislation to revise TCA to reflect changes in governmental structure made by executive order. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As enatec, extends department of correction, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends department of agriculture, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As introduced, increases, from five to 10, the number of persons required to petition agency for adoption or repeal of regulation. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 36 and Title 37.
As enacted, extends family support council, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 33, Chapter 5, Part 2.
As enacted, extends Tennessee student assistance corporation, board of directors, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 4.
As enacted, extends department of health, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends Tennessee community resource board, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 41, Chapter 10.
As enacted, extends child care advisory council, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3.
As enacted, extends Tennessee peace officers standards and training commission, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 38, Chapter 8.
As enacted, extends state capitol commission, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 8.
As enacted, extends James K. Polk memorial association, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 13 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
As introduced, extends judicial council, June 30, 2010. - Amends amend TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 16, Chapter 21 relative to judicial council.
As enacted, extends board of claims, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 9, Chapter 8.

As enacted, provides that students who miss school to attend required court proceedings will not be penalized for grading or attendance purposes; specifies exceptions to this provision. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3002.

As enacted, establishes that a parent is entitled to legal representation at all stages of proceedings involving abuse, contributing to the delinquency or unruly behavior of a child or contributing to the dependency and neglect of a child, dependency or neglect and termination of parental rights. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-126.

As enacted, requires the department of health to reimburse residential homes for the aged for each resident whose income does not exceed $800 per month and whose income is limited to SSI benefits. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4, Part 3.

As introduced, requires public and private institutions of higher education to accept proof of immunization from measles, mumps, and rubella derived from an antibody titer test in lieu of proof of vaccination. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As enacted, exempts persons, firms, or corporations dealing solely in recyclable aluminum cans from the requirements on scrap jewelry and metal dealers. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1, Part 2 and Title 62, Chapter 9, Part 1.
As enacted, grants the director of the board of pharmacy the power to administer oaths and issue subpoenas. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 10.

As enacted, imposes a methodology and disclosure duties on health insurance entities and pharmacy benefits managers concerning calculation of out-of-pocket costs for prescription drugs and covered services. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, provides the $4,000 limit on presumption that medical bills attached to complaint in a civil action were necessary and reasonable applies regardless of the total amount of the bills incurred or paid. - Amends TCA Title 24, Chapter 5, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes nonprofit organizations to collect and distribute donated legend drugs to indigent persons. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 1.

As introduced, requires the bureau of TennCare to reimburse crossover claims for full benefit dual eligibles at 100 percent of the Medicare allowable charge for ambulance services. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5.
As enacted, authorizes home health nurses and aides to accompany a recipient outside the home during the course of prior approved home health services, if certain criteria met.

As enacted, creates an alternative method of creating and governing a regional megasite authority and revises other provisions relative to regional megasite authorities. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 16, Part 2 and Title 64, Chapter 6.
As introduced, creates new specialty earmarked plate for national Fraternal Order of Police members. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires POST commission to establish by rule how this state will implement the federal "Law Enforcement Officers Safety Act of 2004," relative to the carrying of firearms by qualified and retired law enforcement officers. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8.
As introduced, lifts certain restrictions on carrying firearms for law enforcement officers - Amends TCA Section 39-17-1350.
As enacted, codifies the acts of the 2008 legislative session.
As enacted, revises the restrictions imposed on where sexual offenders may reside, work, or visit. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.

As introduced, creates Class E felony offense of selling drug paraphernalia and includes products sold for use in introduction of drugs into human body into definition of drug paraphernalia. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As enacted, creates procedures for dissolving certain municipal airport authority in certain circumstances; authorizes the appointing authority to remove a commissioner of the regional or municipal airport authority for incompetency, failure or neglect to perform the duties required by law, malfeasance, misfeasance, misconduct or corruption in office, or for any other good and sufficient reason, if certain procedures followed. - Amends TCA Title 42.
As introduced, increases penalty for cockfighting to a Class E felony. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.

As introduced, prohibits a person from engaging in any activity similar to the practice of medicine, unless the person has received a license from the board of medical examiners. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 2.
As introduced, extends health services and development agency, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 68, Chapter 11.

As enacted, specifies that any condition placed on a certificate of need applies to any license relative to such certificate of need that is subsequently issued. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 68, Chapter 11.

As introduced, mandates that a certificate of need granted to an applicant by the health services and development agency include the condition that such applicant provide a specified amount of health services to indigent patients. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 68, Chapter 11.
As introduced, "Jerry Cooper Highway," new four-lane segment of U.S. Highway 70S in Warren County.
As introduced, enacts the "Crime Free School Zone Act." - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 49.

As enacted, requires court to hold in contempt any person who makes false allegation of sexual abuse in furtherance of litigation; also requires false accuser to pay other party's litigation costs. - Amends TCA Title 19; Title 20; Title 21 and Title 36.

As introduced, entitles either party to a visitation agreement to file a petition for an expedited hearing pursuant to the provisions governing expedited hearings for support and reduces period of time for non-compliance with an order of visitation from six months to three months. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6 and Title 36, Chapter 5.
As introduced, authorizes parent or guardian who pays for supervision of child visitation to select provider of supervision services. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6.

As introduced, prohibits changing of custodial arrangements due to an order of protection against the custodial parent unless the child is the victim of child abuse or the effects of domestic violence. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6.
As introduced, authorizes defendant in divorce case to issue peremptory challenge against judge assigned to hear case. - Amends TCA Title 17; Title 20 and Title 36, Chapter 4.
As introduced, requires a petitioner for order of protection to pay court costs and attorney fees if the petition is dismissed. - Amends TCA Title 36.
As introduced, requires applicants for licensure as motor vehicle dealers of used cars to complete a pre-licensing course. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 17.
As introduced, enacts the "Comprehensive Illegal Immigration Act." - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7; Title 4; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 49; Title 50, Chapter 1 and Title 55, Chapter 50.

As introduced, requires the department of safety to send notices of final suspension of driver licenses due to certain events by certified mail; increases reinstatement fees on suspended licenses by $10.00. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, applies certain regulations on a state-wide basis concerning hours of operation, prohibited acts, and permitting regulations for employees and entertainers of adult-oriented establishments and adult cabarets. - Amends TCA Title 7.

As introduced, increases penalty for neglected child six years of age or younger from Class E felony to Class D felony; creates Class E felony for person knowingly endangering the health and welfare of child six years of age or younger. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As enacted, describes dangerous instrumentality as any item in its manner of use or intended use as applied to a child that is capable of producing serious bodily injury. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As enacted, describes serious bodily injury in children to include second or third degree burns, bone fractures, concussion, and permanent or protracted disfigurement. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As enacted, clarifies requirements for provisional receipt of a HOPE scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, increases amount official may charge for collection and recording of business tax from $5.00 to $7.00; requires the additional $2.00 to be earmarked for computer related expenses including computer hardware purchases. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
As introduced, states that a defendant's sentences may run consecutively if the offense was committed while the defendant was in community corrections. - Amends TCA Title 40.
As introduced, prohibits the possession of any telecommunication device by any person while present in any penal institution where prisoners are quartered. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As introduced, permits employees of Tennessee federally qualified health centers and the Tennessee Primary Care Association to participate in the Tennessee consolidated retirement system. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, classifies criminal taking of fish in same manner as theft based on value of fish taken, unless value is unknown, in which case the offense will be a Class A misdemeanor instead of a Class C misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

As introduced, specifies that in civil actions in which the plaintiff makes a demand for monetary damages, the extent, amount and other relevant information concerning any liability insurance coverage the defendant has is discoverable under rules of civil procedure regardless of whether the information may or may not lead to the discovery of admissible evidence. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 23; Title 24; Title 25; Title 26; Title 27; Title 28; Title 29; Title 30; Title 31; Title 32; Title 35 and Title 36.
As introduced, requires election of judges in accordance with state constitution; abolishes judicial selection commission. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 16 and Title 17.
As introduced, requires that instruments affecting or disposing of real property must state the acreage of the real estate in order to be accepted for recording or filing. - Amends TCA Title 66.

As introduced, permits students who, upon completion of high school, do not qualify academically for a Tennessee HOPE scholarship, but are otherwise eligible for the scholarship, to obtain the scholarship by attending college and making a 2.75 after attempting 12 semester hours or meeting the academic requirements for continuing eligibility at any time when continuing eligibility is reviewed for HOPE scholarship students; provides that the scholarship shall not be awarded retroactively. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As enacted, requires any drug testing fee that was assessed and collected in the ninth judicial district before such fee was repealed in 2007 to be designated for use by the ninth judicial district drug task force. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-420.

As introduced, requires retailers to advertise price of diesel fuel in U.S. liquid gallons; prohibits retailers from knowingly advertising price of diesel fuel in such a manner as to falsely imply that price of diesel fuel offered for sale is actually price of gasoline offered for sale; classifies violations as unfair and deceptive acts under the Consumer Protection Act. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18; Title 47, Chapter 26 and Title 47, Chapter 25, Part 6.

As enacted, creates direct shipper license to be issued through the alcoholic beverage commission that would allow an in-state or out-of-state entity to ship wine directly to consumers age 21 years or older in this state for personal use. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3.

As introduced, creates wine direct shipper license to be issued through the alcoholic beverage commission that would allow an in-state or out-of-state entity to ship wine directly to consumers age 21 years or older in this state for personal use. - Amends amend TCA.

As introduced, creates an additional class of licenses allowing the sale of wine at certain retail food stores; requires person purchasing wine at certain retail food stores to present photo identification. - Amends TCA Title 57.

As introduced, creates an additional class of licenses allowing the sale of wine at certain retail food stores; requires person purchasing wine at certain retail food stores to present photo identification. - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Small Farm Economic Revitalization Act." - Amends TCA Title 43; Title 44 and Title 53.

As enacted, establishes a uniform provision whereby an individual may transport up to five gallons of untaxed alcoholic beverages, including beer, into or within this state, even in a dry county, for personal or household use of the individual; specifies that a person may transport in excess of five gallons if the person has the receipts to prove the taxes were paid. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 7 and Title 57, Chapter 3.

As enacted, clarifies that the civil cause of action for the retaliatory discharge of an employee for reporting illegal activities applies to state employees, private employees, and certain persons paid by the federal government. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 1.
As introduced, exempts certain items of tangible personal property from taxation. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, creates a supplemental bridge scholarship program for the 2009-2010 academic year for Tennessee HOPE scholarship students; funds bridge grant program using unobligated and unexpended funds from the energy efficient schools initiative. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9 and Chapter 1203 of the Public Acts of 2008.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new TN SOLAR POWER! specialty earmarked plates for and allocates proceeds from such plates to renewable energy research by certain organizations affiliated with Cleveland State Community College. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, directs department of transportation to erect directional signs on I-75 near exit 20 for Bachman Academy.

As introduced, authorizes the county legislative body of Cumberland County to donate land comprising a horse trail acquired by the county by default at a tax sale; land to be given to Lake Tansi homeowners whose lots abut the horse trail. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 21; Title 5, Chapter 9 and Title 67, Chapter 5.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Deposit Beverage Container Recycling Act". - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211 and Chapter 86 of the Public Acts of 2005.

As enacted, clarifies that a member of the county legislative body does not have to resign membership as a commissioner to be nominated for certain offices or vacancy occurring in certain offices required to be filled by the county legislative body. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 5, Part 1.
As introduced, establishes a voluntary code of fair campaign practices for candidates for state public office. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 1.
As introduced, requires the school year, except for year-round schools, to start no earlier than September 1. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30.

As introduced, extends from three years to four the probationary period that public school teachers must serve before they can receive tenure; provides that probationary teachers with low teacher effect scores cannot be rehired for a fourth year. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, prohibits transfer or diversion of state highway funds. - Amends TCA Section 4-3-1016;54-2-102;54-2-103.
As introduced, limits the financial exposure of local governments in bridge replacement projects under the federal BRZ program. - Amends TCA Title 54.

As introduced, requests the judicial council to study and report on the present scheme for misdemeanor sentencing to determine if it adequately deters and punishes those offenders who commit multiple misdemeanor offenses; report due to the general assembly by January 15, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 16 and Title 40.

As introduced, provides for distribution of city taxes levied for educational purposes in cities in which two or more K-12 school systems operate; fixes the boundaries of the Memphis City School System at the boundaries of the system as they exist on July 1, 2009. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Chapter 30 of the Acts of 1868-69.
As introduced, requires each LEA to add a cost-of-living adjustment to its local salary schedule. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3.

As enacted, specifies that the income of an applicant's spouse is attributable to the applicant for purposes of determining whether the applicant is eligible for property tax relief for elderly or disabled homeowners; revises circumstances under which income of owner of a remainder or reversion in the property will be included for purposes of applicant qualifying for property tax freeze. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 7.

As introduced, requires certain providers of sewer and water services to meter service recipients' usage separately under certain conditions. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 35; Title 7, Chapter 82 and Title 68, Chapter 221.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of colon cancer awareness new specialty earmarked license plates; earmarks 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to promote public education and awareness about colon cancer. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, states that married couples with one or more minor children in the couple's custody are entitled to a $25,000 homestead exemption for real property owned and used as a principal place of residence by the couple. - Amends TCA Section 26-2-301.

As introduced, clarifies that the purchase of used or secondhand articles by local government may be made as long as the price is not more than 10 percent higher than the highest value of the document range instead of the price falling within 10 percent of the documented range. - Amends TCA Section 12-3-1003.

As introduced, requires department of agriculture to promulgate rules and regulations to ensure that gasoline that is not gasoline-alcohol blend is available for distribution or retail in each county. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 13.

As introduced, prohibits any state, county, or municipal elected official, or in the case of a constitutionally elected peace officer, such officer's deputy, from acting as a professional bondsman, unless acting in such capacity on the effective date of this act. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 3.

As enacted, specifies that office of constable will not be abolished in Washington and Sumner counties by virtue of either county becoming a Class 2 county based on population. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 10.

As introduced, removes prohibition on lobbyist offering or making any campaign contribution, including any in-kind contribution, to or on behalf of the governor or any member of the general assembly or any candidate for the office of governor, state senator or state representative. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 3; Title 4 and Title 8.

As introduced, prohibits nonresidents as well as residents of Tennessee from engaging in the business of home inspections without first complying with the requirements of the Home Inspector License Act. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As enacted, broadens prohibitions on window tinting to any motor vehicle operated on a public highway, rather than only to those registered in Tennessee; and creates exemption for motor vehicles registered in another state that comply with requirements of such state. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Religious Viewpoints Antidiscrimination Act." - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, increases from one to two the number of free sport fishing days. - Amends TCA Title 70.
As introduced, requires plats filed in the register's office to include total acreage and the square footage shown for each individual lot. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 24.

As introduced, increases the amount of mileage reimbursement that the legislative body of any county or the legislative body of the metropolitan government of any county may vote to pay jurors from 10 cents to 12 cents. - Amends TCA Title 22.
As introduced, requires that certain fees paid after January 1, 2010, involving PPO networks meet certain requirements. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-204.

As introduced, authorizes TEMA to establish and administer a grant program to assist in the partial reimbursement of installation costs for safe rooms and in-ground shelters. - Amends TCA Title 58, Chapter 2 and Title 68, Chapter 140.
As introduced, provides sentencing enhancements for certain crimes of force or violence when committed by a person acting in concert with two or more other persons. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As introduced, adds certain criminal offenses to the definition of "dangerous felony" for certain purposes. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, adds to qualifications to be a sheriff that person must have five years of full-time POST-certified law enforcement experience and must have resided in county for one year prior to qualifying date. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 8, Part 1.
As introduced, abolishes sales and use taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, encourages the use of certain energy efficient technologies and products by the various departments and agencies of state government. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 67.

As introduced, increases the age the victim of child abuse or child neglect must be from six to eight years old for a defendant to receive an enhanced punishment for such an offense. - Amends TCA Section 39-15-401.

As introduced, removes jurisdiction over criminal proceedings involving the prosecution of child abuse and neglect cases and the prosecution of the failure to report such cases from juvenile court to a court of general sessions or circuit or criminal court. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-103 and Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4.

As enacted, redefines the offense of child endangerment to be when a parent or custodian of a child eight years of age or less knowingly exposes such child to or knowingly fails to protect such child from abuse or neglect resulting in physical injury to the child. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1; Title 39, Chapter 11 and Title 39, Chapter 15.

As enacted, prohibits surveillance cameras on federal interstate highways, except for Smart Way cameras, other intelligent transportation system cameras or, when employees of the department of transportation or construction workers are present, surveillance cameras used to enforce or monitor traffic violations within work zones designated by the department; provided, that such cameras may be operated only by a state entity; imposes certain requirements on a state agency or political subdivision of the state that installs, owns, operates, or maintains a traffic-control signal light located in an intersection that employs a surveillance camera for the enforcement or monitoring of traffic violations.

As introduced, requires department to electronically notify potentially-affected municipalities of proposed rules, with notice to be transmitted to such municipalities 30 days prior to the rule hearing; the notice must include a fiscal impact note, if applicable. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2.
As introduced, clarifies certain water quality standards related to the presence of selenate. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As introduced, adds certain requirements concerning final decisions and orders of the water quality control board. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, requires person claiming damages under Consumer Protection Act to prove causal nexus between alleged act and person's damages; claimant must show actual out-of-pocket loss based on actual market value of good or service received in order to recover damages. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.

As introduced, provides that disabled parents receive certain credit toward child support obligations, no more than 4 percent of a parent's social security disability insurance payments can be withheld for arrearages, and becoming disabled is a substantial change in circumstance. - Amends TCA Title 36.

As introduced, allows school buses to be used up to 20 years of service, subject to annual safety inspections, by extending permissible, yearly waiver limit for their service life after initial 12 years of service from current three years to eight years. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-2109.

As enacted, permits municipal distress warrants issued by tax collector to be executed within boundaries of municipality by police officer of municipality in same manner as provided by law for the sheriff. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.

As enacted, prohibits parent from being issued arrest warrant or criminal summons against teacher without written approval of district attorney if the conduct alleged involved the teacher and a child of such parent. - Amends TCA Title 40.
As enacted, clarifies the definition of the term "project" as it relates to central business improvement districts. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53, Part 1.
As enacted, designates the tenth division of the Shelby County general sessions court as the domestic violence court for Shelby County. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 15, Part 50.
As introduced, urges the state board of education to establish a course in economics and financial literacy that will be required for graduation. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 12.

As introduced, discontinues appointment of specified members of the general assembly as members on the board of directors of district management corporations, local neighborhood development corporations, and the West Tennessee River Basin Authority. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 84; Title 13, Chapter 13 and Title 64, Chapter 1, Part 11.
As introduced, permits golf carts to be used on public streets if authorized by city or county with jurisdiction over such streets. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 1.
As introduced, exempts certain engineers from examination and experience requirements for licensure as a land surveyor. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 18, Part 1.
As introduced, designates additional segment of Duck River as Class II Pastoral River. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 13.

As introduced, creates a mechanism for local governmental units to purchase goods and services through a competitive reverse auction process after filing a plan with the comptroller to document internal controls to ensure the integrity of the process. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3, Part 10.
As enacted, requires THEC, TBR, UT, and TSAC to study veterans' tuition relief programs and the feasibility of establishing such program in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, removes prohibition on cyber-based charter schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

As introduced, prohibits THEC from increasing fees for regulation of proprietary institutions beyond the rate of inflation; requires THEC to study and report on its budget and fee structure. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires institution to which a student wants to transfer to evaluate credits from another institution without discrimination if such institution is accredited by an agency recognized by the U. S. department of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires that THEC in authorizing operation of postsecondary institutions not discriminate against any institution based on its accrediting agency, if the agency is recognized by the U. S. department of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As introduced, makes institutions accredited by agencies recognized by the U.S. department of education subject to the same reporting and disclosure requirements as other institutions authorized to operate by THEC. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As enacted, requires person subject to order of protection to surrender or transfer all firearms the person owns or possesses; creates Class A misdemeanor of person subject to an order of protection possessing a firearm. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1 and Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As introduced, requires that an ignition interlock device be installed on all motor vehicles driven by DUI offenders; installation for one year for first conviction, two years for second conviction, three years for third conviction, and life of offender for fourth or subsequent conviction; allows person sentenced to have interlock device for life to petition for removal five years after date of conviction and every five years thereafter. - Amends TCA Section 55-10-403.
As introduced, continues certain permanent rules filed with the secretary of state that are otherwise scheduled to expire.

As enacted, creates offenses regarding improper wearing of military decorations or falsely representing that one has been awarded military decorations; offense is Class B misdemeanor, unless medal involved is a Congressional Medal of Honor, Distinguished Service Cross, Navy Cross, Air Force Cross, Silver Star, or Purple Heart, in which case it is a Class A misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14 and Title 58, Chapter 1.

As introduced, excludes from workers' compensation injuries that occur during recreational activities, are not required by the employer, and do not directly benefit the employer. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-110.

As introduced, designates that 75 percent of all fines and fees collected as result of speeding ticket by municipality with a population of 5,000 or less on interstates within the territorial limits of such municipality shall be deposited into state's highway fund. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 3.
As introduced, reduces the tax on the retail sale of food and food ingredients to 5 percent of the sales price, effective July 1, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 9 and Title 67.
As introduced, clarifies the Tennessee taxpayer bill of rights. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, removes authorization for the judicial selection commission to meet in private. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2; Title 16 and Title 17.

As introduced, clarifies the excise tax exemption benefiting certain corporations organized for the purpose of erecting, owning, or operating common meeting places for more than one Masonic lodge or Lodge of Odd Fellows or certain other lodges. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-2008.

As introduced, reduces sales tax on food from 5.5 percent to 5.25 percent effective July 1, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.
As introduced, establishes certain methods for determining the party responsible for paying the bottled soft drinks tax. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-402(b)(4) and Section 67-4-402(d).
As introduced, subjects custodian's authority to invest custodial property in 529 plan to court order. - Amends TCA Title 35.

As introduced, authorizes taxpayer or commissioner to initiate litigation in the chancery court of Davidson County for the determination of proper business tax assessment when no return is filed. - Amends TCA Title 62 and Title 67.
As introduced, requires a purchase-money security interest to be perfected within 60 days, instead of 30 days, in order to have priority over a conflicting security interest. - Amends TCA Title 47.

As introduced, clarifies that alarm verification is an attempt by a monitoring company to contact a burglar alarm user to ensure an alarm is valid before contacting a law enforcement agency. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 32.

As introduced, requires that employer disclosure reports be filed within 45 days following conclusion of the six-month periods ending "June 30 and December 31," instead of "March 31 and September 30." - Amends TCA Title 3.

As enacted, requires masonry contractors to be licensed under the present law provisions governing contractors, if the total cost of the masonry portion of a construction project exceeds $100,000, materials and labor. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires the prevailing wage commission to publish its decision concerning prevailing wage rates on the Web site maintained by the state on the same day the commission gives notice of its final determination to contractors who submitted documentation concerning such rates. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4, Part 4.

As enacted, enacts the "Markie Voyles Act," which requires an adult convicted of contributing to delinquency of a minor to serve 100 percent of Class A misdemeanor sentence, which is 11 months and 29 days, if offense involved supplying substance to a minor that is unlawful for minor to possess and minor engages in conduct that causes death of another. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As enacted, expands the authority of the water quality control board concerning incentives for alternatives to discharges to surface waters. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As enacted, requires full-time, part-time, or volunteer firefighters hired or accepted on or after July 1, 2009, to meet certain minimum training requirements; not applicable in certain specified counties. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 24, Part 1.

As enacted, requires certain personal information regarding a victim who receives compensation under the criminal injuries compensation fund to be treated as confidential. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-504 and Title 29, Chapter 13.
As introduced, deletes declaration levying tobacco tax against consumer. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 43 and Title 67.

As enacted, provides that any contractor required to be licensed who is in violation of the law or rules governing contractors may not recover any damages in any court other than actual documented expenses that can be shown by clear and convincing proof. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6.

As enacted, directs the commissioner of environment and conservation to conduct a study concerning the exemption from the Tennessee Air Quality Act for the open burning of wood waste. - Amends TCA Section 68-201-115.

As enacted, requires a person to obtain a license from the commissioner of commerce and insurance as a crop insurance adjuster in order to act as a crop insurance adjuster; prohibits an insurer that sells crop insurance from contracting, employing or using any person to adjust claims made under a crop insurance policy unless the person is licensed as a crop insurance adjuster; requires commissioner of commerce and insurance to establish qualifications for licensure. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As enacted, provides that if a contractor solicits any person to sign a contract requiring the person to waive a right of lien in violation of law, such person must notify the board for licensing contractors of such fact; upon receiving such information, the executive director of the board for licensing contractors must notify such contractor within a reasonable time after receiving the information that the contract is against the public policy of this state and in violation of law; provides for action against contractor who does not correct violation.

As introduced, directs the commissioner of commerce and insurance to look at the manner in which health insurance carriers establish and market a block of business which later becomes a closed block and the effect on limits and the cost of health insurance of those persons who remain in the block once it is closed. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, enumerates certain state officials and employees who are included within the definition of "official" in the executive branch or "official" in the legislative branch for purposes of the lobbying provisions of the Tennessee Ethics Commission Act of 2006. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As introduced, subject to certain requirements, authorizes local government to provide public notice via a local government Web site or other electronic means. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plate for Tennessee State Museum; allocates revenue from such plates to Tennessee State Museum Foundation, Inc. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, allows district attorney general or assistant district attorney general to issue a subpoena for production of records related to Internet and computer use in cases of sexual exploitation of a minor. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 17, Part 1.
As introduced, creates the "Tennessee Second Look Commission." - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 3.

As introduced, expands the definition of "serious bodily injury" for purposes of the offense of aggravated child abuse to include a broken bone of a child if the child was eight years of age or less at the time the offense occurred. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As enacted, specifies that juvenile courts, general sessions courts, and circuit and criminal courts have concurrent jurisdiction to hear criminal prosecutions of child abuse and neglect.

As enacted, increases the age the victim of child abuse or child neglect must be from six to eight years old for a defendant to receive an enhanced punishment for such an offense. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4.

As introduced, redefines the offense of child endangerment to be when a parent or custodian of a child eight years of age or less negligently exposes such child to or negligently fails to protect such child from abuse or neglect resulting in physical injury to the child and expands the definition of "serious bodily injury" for purposes of the offense of aggravated child abuse to include a broken bone of a child if the child was eight years of age or less at the time the offense occurred. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1; Title 39, Chapter 11 and Title 39, Chapter 15.
As enacted, establishes alternative provisions for creation and governance of regional transportation authorities. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 8.

As introduced, reduces alcohol level required to constitute offense of DUI from .08 percent to .02 percent for person with one or more prior DUI convictions. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As introduced, requires department of safety to take necessary action with federal agency to allow state to use Systematic Alien Verification for Entitlement (SAVE) program, and requires citizenship and immigration verification via SAVE for all driver licenses. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3.
As introduced, lowers the blood alcohol level for an extreme DUI offense from .20 percent to .15 percent. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.

As introduced, allows multi-county judicial district option of sending any local funds received to the executive director of the district public defenders conference for disbursement or to keep such funds for disbursement through the districts office. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14.

As enacted, requires division of health-related boards to do an awareness campaign for health care providers concerning their reporting duties relating to domestic violence and removes the June 30, 2009, repealer for reporting duties imposed by 2007 Public Chapter 83. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6, and Chapter 83 of the Public Acts of 2007.

As introduced, provides that if obligor in noncompliance with order of support submits evidence at the license suspension hearing that obligor has been involuntarily unemployed for 30 days, noncompliance order stayed as to driver license for 90 days so obligor can find job. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 5, Part 7.

As introduced, revises certain requirements concerning the quarantine of property where methamphetamine is or was produced; revises requirements concerning the purchase or possession of an immediate methamphetamine precursor. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4 and Title 68, Chapter 212, Part 5.

As introduced, allows person convicted of simple possession of marijuana after July 1, 2009, who has no prior drug convictions to have records expunged after completing entire sentence and those convicted before July 1, 2009, one year after completing sentence. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As enacted, names portion of road between Tennessee fire service and codes enforcement academy administration building and the academy's fire station the "Helen J. Brown Boulevard."
As introduced, revises date when permanent rules filed with secretary of state expire unless continued by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2.

As introduced, redefines the measure of severance tax for coal products from 20 cents per ton to 4.5 percent of gross value of such products; creates Tennessee coal severance fund; redistributes revenue from severance tax; and provides exemptions from sales tax for certain qualified renewable energy products and services. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3; Title 67, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.

As enacted, renames the "division of mental retardation services" as the "division of intellectual disabilities services"; removes antiquated terminology that is used to describe persons who lack the mental capacity to enter into contracts. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 33 and Title 71.

As introduced, requires in-line oxygen arresters be installed in certain health care facilities when the fire marshal determines such arresters would be useful and practical in promoting fire safety. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.
As enacted, revises provisions governing expunction of records of person found not guilty following bench trial or trial by jury. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32, Part 1.
As enacted, enacts the "Uniform Debt Management Services Act." - Amends TCA Title 47.
As introduced, enacts the "Uniform Debt Management Services Act." - Amends TCA Title 47.
As introduced, transfers contested case hearings currently under jurisdiction of the department to the office of the secretary of state. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5 and Title 67.
As introduced, transfers contested case hearings currently under jurisdiction of the department to the office of the secretary of state. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5 and Title 67.
As introduced, requires the department of safety to send notices by certified mail of final suspension of driver licenses due to certain events. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Candidate Selection Integrity Act"; requires persons registering to vote to declare political party affiliation to vote in a primary election. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 2; Title 2, Chapter 6 and Title 2, Chapter 7.
As introduced, prohibits judicial diversion for persons accused of child abuse and aggravated child abuse. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 15 and Title 40, Chapter 35.
As enacted, authorizes certain retired state employees to participate in the dental insurance plan offered to state employees. - Amends TCA Section 8-27-201.
As enacted, excludes nursing homes from the charitable solicitation statute. - Amends TCA Title 48.

As introduced, clarifies those provisions of law which control challenges for collection of state taxes collected or administered by the commissioner of revenue and those which control the challenges for collection of other state taxes as well as local governmental entities. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 18 and Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 9.

As introduced, allows administrative office of the court to collect fines, costs, and litigation taxes that are owed to counties or municipalities for more than two years; allows court to order community service in lieu of fines. - Amends TCA Title 40.
As introduced, requires publicly owned landfills to refuse construction and demolition waste over a certain volume under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.

As introduced, clarifies physical presence for purpose of Web site hosted in Tennessee; exempts Web site development services provided to customers without physical presence in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires all funds received by Tennessee through the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 to be specifically appropriated in the general appropriations act. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9 and Title 67.

As introduced, makes information contained in handgun carry permit applications and renewals, information provided to agencies to investigate applicant, and records maintained relative to the permit application confidential and creates Class A fine only misdemeanor of unauthorized publication of permit information or records. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As introduced, requires judge to order that motor vehicle owned or driven by person convicted of DUI on second or third offense to be equipped with functioning ignition interlock device after period of license suspension; allows judge to order ignition interlock device on first offense DUI. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 33 and Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As introduced, expands Wilder-Naifeh technical skills grants to students attending the fire service and codes enforcement academy; limits such grants to $500 per student annually. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, raises the threshold for obtaining a certificate of need for acquisition of major medical equipment from exceeds $1.5 million to exceeds $2 million. - Amends TCA Section 68-11-1607(a)(6).
As introduced, changes Tennessee HOPE scholarship eligibility requirements for certain children of certain military parents. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, redefines "person entitled to redeem property" to include only persons who on the date of the tax sale own a legal or equitable interest in the property sold at the tax sale. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-2701.

As enacted, clarifies that only certain individuals or state licensed professionals or entities may advertise for the placement of children for adoption in this state; imposes certain requirements on out-state-licensed entities or professionals; clarifies meaning of "placing child for adoption." - Amends TCA Section 36-1-108.

As introduced, reduces amount of an immediate methamphetamine precursor from 20 to nine grams a person needs to possess for prima facie evidence of intent to manufacture methamphetamine. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As introduced, requires the location and placement of any cellular or wireless telecommunications tower to be approved by the local governing body and to be compatible with the surrounding area in which the tower is to be placed. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 24, Part 3.

As introduced, adds residing with a parent who uses or has within 72 hours used certain drugs to the definition of abuse and requires immediate removal of a child whose parent uses or has within 72 hours used certain drugs. - Amends TCA Title 37.

As enacted, requires the select committee on children and youth to study human sex trafficking, the improvements that should be made to existing laws relative to human sex trafficking, and the impact of human sex trafficking on children and youth in this state. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As enacted, creates a 2-1-1 advisory council. - Amends TCA Section 65-4-117(b).

As introduced, adds offenses to the list of those for which a convicted defendant is not eligible for probation, parole, or deferral of proceedings. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37; Title 39; Title 40; Title 49 and Title 71.
As enacted, requires juvenile courts to conduct custody proceedings in compliance with the Indian Child Welfare Act. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-101.

As enacted, requires the board of regents to study feasibility of cooperative career and technical programs between LEAs and Tennessee technology centers or other two-year institutions offering career and technical education. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, expands the categories of organizations eligible to receive matching state funds for tourist promotion plans and activities. - Amends TCA Section 4-3-2206(b) and Section 4-3-2207(b).

As introduced, requires TDEC to promulgate rules to authorize the use of segments of trails for horseback riding by the general public at Fall Creek Falls State Park and Savage Gulf State Natural Area. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 14, Part 1 and Title 11, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As introduced, creates procedure for funeral directors and embalmers to place license on inactive status. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5, Part 3.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of cultural license plates for teachers. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, removes department of finance and administration's authority to transfer funds from the highway fund. - Amends TCA Section 4-3-1016 and Title 54, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As enacted, authorizes highway patrol officers with Level 1 training to stop certain commercial motor vehicles when there is probably cause to believe the vehicle is being operated with unsafe loading or mechanical conditions; specifies that no citation may be issued but the officer will implement out-of-service requirements. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 65, Chapter 15, Part 1.

As introduced, creates interagency transportation coordination committee, composed of representatives of state departments, to coordinate transportation efforts of state and local government. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 54.

As introduced, specifies that certain for-hire motor carriers providing passenger transportation are required to submit to an annual physical examination by a physician licensed in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 51 and Title 65.

As introduced, authorizes TDOT to employ analysts and economists in addition to other employees to perform duties related to railroad regulation. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 3, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, increases from 10 days to two weeks time within which court clerk must notify department of safety of motor vehicle offense of commercial driver and within which department of safety must notify licensing authority of such offense. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3; Title 40, Chapter 33; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.
As introduced, urges commissioner to use wildflowers native to each grand division in new wildflower plantings. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of hummingbird awareness new specialty earmarked plate; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to wildlife resources fund. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires department to notify TDOT's division of multimodal resources when any county is designated as a "citizen transportation area." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 10; Title 38; Title 39; Title 55 and Title 65.
As introduced, removes outdated language from transportation equity trust fund provisions. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 56, Part 2; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 67.
As introduced, eliminates issuance of Sandhill Crane new specialty earmarked plate. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.

As introduced, removes provision providing that certain highway signs are paid from the highway fund subject to appropriation by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.

As enacted, requires a person to obtain an automotive mobility dealer license from the motor vehicle commission, prior to engaging or continuing in the business of an automotive mobility dealer after March 1, 2011; revises provisions governing automobile clubs and associations. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 47; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.
As introduced, defines "surveillance camera" as used in the rules of the road. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 54 and Title 55.

As enacted, requires the department to study the design and development of expanding qualifying HOV lanes to toll or HOT lanes and to report its findings to the transportation committee of each house of the general assembly by February 1, 2010.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked license plates for Tennessee Cave Salamander; revenue allocated to Tennessee Wildlife Fund for fish and wildlife efforts. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54 and Title 55.

As introduced, requires comptroller to report any audit of a nonprofit organization receiving funds from sale of new specialty earmarked license plate to senate and house transportation committees within 30 days of audit. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 54 and Title 55.

As introduced, removes provision providing that certain highway signs are paid from the highway fund subject to appropriation by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.
As introduced, requires TDOT to include recommended improvements to Tennessee Tollway Act in report to general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 12; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires TDOT to provide supplemental report of progress of Tollway Act pilot program to general assembly by January 1, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 12; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 67.
As introduced, defines "milldam" for navigable stream obstruction purposes. - Amends TCA Title 54 and Title 55.
As introduced, extends sight distance required for certain parked vehicles from 200 feet to 250 feet. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As enacted, requires the department of safety, in the case of a conviction for vehicular homicide, to revoke the offender's driver license for the same period of time the court prohibits the person from driving a vehicle under present criminal law for committing the offense. - Amends TCA Title 54 and Title 55.
As introduced, increases from three to five years moratorium between time plate has become obsolete and invalid until re-authorization by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, authorizes issuance of various special license plates; extends minimum order deadline for certain plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, extends period of time from 30 days to 30 business days for county legislative body to act on resolution or ordinance to levy one cent local gasoline tax following filing of petition with county legislative body to levy such tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3.

As introduced, revises duties of the commissioner to require the estimated dollar amount needed to implement the long range and coordinated statewide transportation plan be reported to the general assembly every year or more frequently as the commissioner may determine. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 54.

As enacted, authorizes designation of appropriate bridges or interchanges on State Route 840 in order to honor the memory of Chief Warrant Officer 2 Billie Jean Grinder, Captain Marcus Ray Alford, Staff Sergeant Michael Wayne Tinsley, Sr. and Sergeant David Clay Prescott, Jr. - Amends TCA Title 54.

As enacted, allows a functional replacement of real property to serve as continued public ownership and use of an interest in right-of-way property acquired from the department so that such property interest will not revert to the department, if the replacement property is at least equal in fair market value to the property being replaced and subject to the approval of TDOT. - Amends TCA Title 12.

As introduced, increases the distance of the required unobstructed view of stopped vehicles upon any highway outside of a business or residential district from 200 feet to 300 feet. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, revises duties of the commissioner to require the estimated dollar amount needed to implement the long range and coordinated statewide transportation plan be reported to the general assembly every year or more frequently as the commissioner may determine. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 47; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of correction to submit a report on inmate participation in local pre-release programs listed by county to the select oversight committee on corrections by February 1 of each year. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9 and Title 41.

As introduced, requires the controlled substance database advisory committee to address the program's effects on opiate availabity in its annual report. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 53; Title 63 and Title 71.
As introduced, requires medical laboratory board to elect officers once every two years instead of annually; requires the board to elect a secretary. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 29.

As introduced, requires department of education to submit its annual report on virtual education to education committees rather than entire membership of general assembly; requires the department to specifically identify funding sources in the report. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, requires that certain official actions be taken to honor members of the Tennessee national guard who die in the line of duty. - Amends TCA Section 4-1-406.

As introduced, enacts the "Convention Center Authorities Act of 2009"; revises certain provisions concerning financing and development of convention centers affecting Davidson County. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.

As enacted, specifies that in a post-conviction proceeding on a capital case a court may order a defendant to undergo an inpatient mental evaluation only if an outpatient evaluator concludes that inpatient evaluation is necessary.
As introduced, enacts the "Natural Gas Conservation and Annual Rate Review Act." - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 5.

As introduced, enacts the "Food and Business Tax Fairness Act" to require combined reporting for franchise and excise tax purposes; reduces sales tax on food from 5.5 percent to 4.5 percent. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, permits municipal electric plants to provide telephone, telegraph, telecommunications, cable service, two-way video transmission, video programming, Internet services, and other like systems beyond their service area to state and local governmental entities who request the service be provided. - Amends TCA Title 7.
As introduced, authorizes municipal electric systems to expand provision of broadband services. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 52.

As enacted, extends from "within one year of July 1, 2008" to "within one year of July 1, 2011" the time within which a facility that performs autopsies must receive accreditation by the National Association of Medical Examiners (NAME). - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As enacted, prohibits local government entities from adopting any ordinance or written policy that expressly prohibits a local government entity, official or employee from complying with applicable federal law pertaining to persons who reside in Tennessee illegally; prohibits local government officials from materially interfering with the ability of a local government entity, official or employee to comply with applicable federal law pertaining to persons who reside in Tennessee illegally; authorizes any person who believes that a violation of act has occurred to file a complaint in chancery court. - Amends TCA Title 7.

As introduced, conforms Tennessee's law relative to drug-free workplace testing to U.S. department of transportation rules pertaining to workplace drug and alcohol testing. - Amends TCA Section 50-9-105.
As introduced, revises method of appointing non-municipal regional members to a municipal planning commission designated as a regional planning commission. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, allows municipalities to take special census at their own expense any time between regular decennial federal censuses. - Amends TCA Section 6-51-114; Title 6, Chapter 56, Part 1; Section 54-4-203; Section 57-5-205 and Section 67-6-103.

As introduced, removes any civil liability for damages from physicians and their hospitals from actions arising by the transport of certain mentally ill persons by friends or family of such persons. - Amends TCA Title 33.
As introduced, requires health care plans to include or offer coverage for prosthetic devices. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As enacted, enacts the "Dairy Farmers Prosperity Act." - Amends TCA Title 44 and Title 53.
As introduced, deletes packaging and labeling requirements for horsemeat. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 1; Title 44 and Title 53, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires all closings under the Tennessee Home Loan Protection Act to be attorney supervised closings and only attorneys with sufficient errors and omission insurance shall be authorized to act as supervising attorneys. - Amends TCA Title 45 and Title 47, Chapter 32.
As introduced, creates the "Citizens' Right to Know: Pretrial Release Program." - Amends TCA Title 40.
As introduced, establishes vocational and craft-related internship pilot project in the Memphis city school system. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Apprenticeship and Job Stimulus Act of 2009." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 67.
As enacted, changes the reporting date for the commission to legislative committees concerning resource mapping from February 15 to April 15. - Amends TCA Section 37-3-116.

As enacted, establishes provisions governing the TCRS amount of service and salary credit for persons whose work hours are reduced due to reductions in funding levels; exempts certain deferred and tax-sheltered compensation plans for certain employees from approval requirements; revises other various provisions governing pensions and compensation programs for public employees and officers. - Amends TCA Sections 4-29-236(a)(6), 8-25-103, 8-25-104(a)(4), 8-25-105, 8-34-101(21), 8-34-321, 8-34-401, 8-34-402, 8-34-403, 8-34-604(c), 8-34-619, 8-35-404, 8-36-123(b); and Title 8, Chapter 34, Part 6,and Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 5.

As introduced, changes references in the Government Employees Deferred Compensation Plan Act from "consolidate retirement board" to "board of trustees of the consolidated retirement system." - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 25, Parts 1, 3 and .

As enacted, authorizes the chief governing body of an employer participating in the TCRS as a local governmental unit, by adopting a resolution with a 2/3 majority vote, to discontinue the noncontributory provisions for all employees employed after the effective date of the resolution and to have the contributions treated as employer contributions in determining federal income tax liability; employees who were employed prior to the effective date of the resolution will continue to be eligible for the noncontributory provisions. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36; Title 8, Chapter 3.

As enacted, establishes TWRA as the exclusive agency to participate in the mining or recovery of lead deposited as the result of the discharge of a firearm at shooting ranges on certain state property; state's share of any profits from such reclamation to be earmarked for scholastic clay target programs. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12 and Title 70.

As enacted, requires the state board of education to develop guidelines and criteria for the inclusion of foreign language instruction in grades kindergarten through six. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3.

As introduced, requires driver service centers to provide expedited services to the extent reasonably possible to persons who are disabled or visibly pregnant or frail. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50.
As introduced, requires swimming pools to maintain a chloramine level not to exceed 0.2 p.p.m. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 14, Part 4.

As introduced, requires law enforcement agencies seeking to conduct undercover investigations on school grounds to place certain authorities on notice prior to conducting such investigations. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39 and Title 49.

As enacted, requires persons appointed to the Tennessee home inspection advisory committee to be licensed home inspectors and requires the appointments to be from specific associations of home inspectors. - Amends TCA Section 62-6-303.
As introduced, creates a specialty earmarked license plate for Children's Hospital at Johnson City. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, provides that all contracts for standardized tests shall require that test scores be returned within 60 days of the test date. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, extends the time for the Children's Hospital at Johnson City Medical Center to meet applicable initial issuance requirements for specialty license plates to June 30, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, allows criminal court or district attorney to convert a defendant's unpaid fines, costs, and litigation taxes at time of sentence expiration to civil judgment; requires the administrative office of the courts to study the feasibility of implementing a system whereby indigent criminal defendants may satisfy outstanding court costs, fines and litigation taxes by performing community service work. - Amends TCA Title 40.

As introduced, prohibits professional employees' organization representing LEA professional employees from preventing another such organization from disseminating information to LEA professional employees. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 6.

As introduced, directs the commisioner of economic and community development, in consultation with MTAS and CTAS, to study the effects of state and local tax incentives on the economic development of municipalities and counties. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.
As introduced, creates exemption from petroleum tax for fuel used by an independent contractor under contract with an LEA to provide school transportation services. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3.
As enacted, requires the select committee on children and youth to study the effectiveness of the child protective services system in Tennessee and develop recommendations for its improvement.

As introduced, increases the time a CASA program is required to have been providing CASA services from six months to one year in order to qualify for grants from the CASA fund. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As enacted, provides for prescreening agents, physicians, and psychologists to be considered state employees when assessing persons for admission and transportation to involuntary inpatient treatment; authorizes transport of people with a mental illness who do not present a danger to themselves or are not in need of physical restraint or vehicular security by a friend, neighbor, relative, clergy, or other mental health professional familiar with the person; revises other provisions regarding transport of persons with mental illness.
As introduced, except in cases of fraud, reduces the period in which a health insurance entity can retroactively deny reimbursement to a provider from 18 to 12 months. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As enacted, authorizes a municipality that purchases land at a delinquent tax sale for municipal taxes only, and after the redemption period has expired, to sell the land for less than the full amount of the taxes, penalty, cost and interest owed if, upon a majority vote, the municipality's governing body determines that it is impracticable to sell the land for such full amount; exempts Davidson County. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 55, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, allows school buses to be used up to 20 years of service, subject to annual safety inspections, by extending permissible, yearly waiver limit for their service life after initial 12 years of service from current three years to eight years. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-2109.
As introduced, establishes franchise and excise tax credit for certain commercial broadcasting stations. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
As introduced, enacts the Tennessee Taxpayer and Citizen Protection Act. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 4.

As enacted, adds Meadow Creek Mountain Rustic Resort in Cocke County to those facilities authorized to sell alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, authorizes municipal official who collects revenue on behalf of state to retain 5 percent commission for receiving and paying over such state revenue; and declares that such commission shall accrue to municipality's general fund. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 56, Part 1.

As enacted, requires commissioner to establish dates for the administration of assessments required for graduation that provide the maximum number of instructional days possible prior to testing while maintaining compliance with federal law; requires the commissioner to establish yearly dates for the administration of the grades three through eight achievement tests that provide the maximum number of instructional days possible prior to testing while maintaining compliance with federal law; establishes August 1 as the earliest date for starting the school year, beginning with the 2010-2011 school year, unless an LEA's board of education establishes a year-round school year by majority vote.
As introduced, requires 30 days notice to terminate tenancy of a residential tenant who occupies the residential property at the time of foreclosure or other sale. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 7.

As introduced, prohibits employers from prohibiting persons possessing a handgun carry permit from transporting and storing a firearm out of sight in a locked vehicle on any property set aside for vehicles. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As introduced, reduces the maximum surety bond amount that may be required of textbook publishers and distributors that contract with the state textbook commission from $1 million to $500,000. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 22.
As introduced, specifically authorizes personnel of certain emergency management agencies to use blue flashing emergency lights. - Amends TCA Title 55; Title 58 and Title 68, Chapter 140.
As introduced, authorizes person with handgun carry permit to possess firearm in state parks and wildlife management areas. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13 and Title 70.
As introduced, requires 0.5 percent reduction of sales tax on food in next fiscal year when surplus revenues exceed $50,000,000 in current fiscal year. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, authorizes commissioner of correction to enter into agreement with federal department of homeland security concerning immigration enforcement. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 41.

As introduced, extends time period, from 15 business days to 30 days, within which sheriff or chief of police is required to execute certain documents required if purchaser is not prohibited from possessing firearm. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.
As introduced, creates 12 additional assistant district attorney general positions by October 1, 2009. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14 and Title 16, Chapter 2.
As introduced, authorizes same day voter registration. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, authorizes same day voter registration; allows county election commissions to establish vote centers that would allow a registered voter in that county to vote at any center regardless of the voter's precinct. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As enacted, creates a city court to be administered and presided over by a city judge instead of authorizing the council in a modified city manager-council charter by ordinance to establish and provide for the administration of a city court. - Amends TCA Section 6-33-103.
As introduced, changes reporting date for resource mapping report from the Tennessee commission on children and youth from February 15 to April 30, 2010. - Amends TCA Section 37-3-116.

As enacted, requires private schools and church-related schools to turn over records on a child who is the subject of a child abuse investigation and to cooperate fully with the investigation. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-406.
As introduced, imposes new penalties for noncompliance with insurance requirements. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

As enacted, adds community action agencies and nonprofit corporations that administer the Head Start or Community Service Block Grant programs to definition of governmental entity for purposes of governmental tort liability. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 20, Part 1.

As enacted, creates a special joint committee to study the creation of a department of aging and adult services. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 13; Title 33; Title 34; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, urges state librarian to develop historical pamphlet recognizing Tennesseans' service in WWI and archival endeavors of Mrs. Rutledge Smith. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 3 and Title 10.
As introduced, prohibits municipal governments from creating new or raising existing taxes on businesses by private act. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54.

As enacted, revises the present requirements for an historic interpretive center, which applies to the Center for Southern Folklore in Memphis, to no longer have the location of the center being in a restored theater but instead place the location of the center in an historic area where structures listed on the national register of historic places are located. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, establishes manner for determining years of service under certain voluntary separation plans. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51 and Chapter 1203 of the Public Acts of 2008.

As enacted, authorizes commissioner of commerce and insurance to waive requirement that foreign insurance company must have been organized and actively engaged in the insurance business in the state of its incorporation for a period of three years prior to the date of its application in order to be admitted and authorized to do business in this state, if the commissioner determines waiver is in the public interest.

As introduced, requires TDOT to conduct study for the transportation committees regarding motor vehicle accidents on S.R. 36 in Sullivan County and feasibility of improvements to such highway. - Amends TCA Title 54.

As introduced, requires TDOT to conduct study for the transportation committees regarding motor vehicle accidents on S.R. 93 in Sullivan County and feasibility of improvements to such highway. - Amends TCA Title 54.

As introduced, clarifies that a diploma from a home school or church-related school is equivalent to one from a public school, except for purposes related to lotttery proceeds. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, further defines "workbook" for purposes of sales and use taxes to include printed material reproduced by teachers through photocopying, printing, or other means. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As enacted, enacts the "Soil Scientist Licensing Act of 2009." - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 18 and Section 68-221-409.

As enacted, makes various revisions to the election laws including allowing a person to email a transfer of voter registration or email a request for an application to vote absentee. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112(a)(3)(C)(i); Section 2-2-129(a)(1); Section 2-6-103(b)(1); Section 2-6-202(a)(3); Section 2-6-304(f); Section 2-7-133(i); Section 2-7-142; Section 2-8-108 and Section 2-8-113(c).

As introduced, allows voters attending college outside the county where they are registered who register by mail and have not voted in election to receive an absentee ballot; requires such voter to provide student identification and evidence of residency. - Amends TCA Section 2-2-115(b)(7) and Section 2-6-201(2).
