As enacted, revises various provisions of the Tennessee Athletic Commission Act of 2008, which regulates professional and amateur unarmed combat contests. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 68, Chapter 115.

As enacted, increases from 10 percent to 20 percent the percentage of the proceeds allowed to be used by an organization to administer the sale or transfer of special elk-take permits issued to certain nonprofit wildlife conservation organizations. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 2.

As introduced, allows any local education agency to convert to a special school district, notwithstanding the prohibition of the creation of new special school districts after April 30, 1982. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-501.

As introduced, prohibits state from being required to participate in the implementation of the federal REAL ID Act of 2005, which mandates a national identification card for each citizen of the United States. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 55.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Small Farm Economic Revitalization Act." - Amends TCA Title 43; Title 44 and Title 53.

As introduced, requires commissioner of agriculture to post and keep current on the department's web site statistics and other information relative to Tennessee's equine industry compiled by the department. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 1; Title 44 and Title 53, Chapter 7.
As enacted, redefines "serious bodily injury" to include a broken bone of a child who is eight years of age or younger. - Amends TCA Section 39-11-106.

As enacted, adds $1.00 privilege tax on criminal cases to fund grants for a 24-hour a day victim information and notification system to be operated by the Tennessee sheriff's association; requires that upon initial deposit of $34,000 into the victim notification fund, the $1.00 tax provided for in this act be allocated to the department of revenue for defrayal of computer-related expenses required by this act. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 38 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 6.

As introduced, requires that a nonconforming establishment or use status expire upon the later of the expiration of 20 years from date of attaining such status or 20 years from this act's effective date, unless a shorter time period for expiration is specified by law. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 7, Part 2.
As enacted, includes a criminal gang that regularly engages in gang-related conduct as a "nuisance" for purposes of laws regarding abatement of nuisances. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 3.

As introduced, creates Class B fine only offenses of selling live animals on public streets, parks and for business to offer live animal as prize or for promotional purposes; places safeguards on sale of animals at flea markets. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.

As introduced, exempts certain locations from the requirements for mass gatherings and establishes a $1,000 annual license fee for persons owning a property on which over 50,000 persons attended an assembly. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, extends prohibition on new nursing home bed certificates of need to June 30, 2011, except for 125 Medicare SNF beds. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title 68.
As introduced, establishes remedies provided for in  56-7-105 as exclusive remedies for failure to make timely payment on a policy or bond. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.
As introduced, limits circumstances in which restraints may be used on a pregnant prisoner or detainee. - Amends TCA Title 41, Chapter 51.

As enacted, creates the Tennessee automobile insurance plan; requires all insurance companies licensed to write direct automobile liability policies in this state to be members of the plan. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12, Part 1.
As enacted, changes name of "juvenile referee" to "juvenile magistrate" and "child support referee" to "child support magistrate." - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 37.
As introduced, extends jurisdiction over certain criminal offenses to municipal courts of municipalities having populations less than 150,000. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 18.
As introduced, requires every public school student to participate in physical education every day during the school year. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As enacted, "H. Clay Turner Memorial Bridge," Old Franklin Road & I-24 in Metropolitan Nashville and Davidson County.

As introduced, extends time for foreclosure notice; requires notice be given to borrower of foreclosure counseling; requires mortgage loans be based upon ability of borrower to repay such loans. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 35; Title 45; Title 47 and Title 66.

As enacted, prohibits the state, counties, and municipalities from requiring the naming of parks and recreational facilities in dedication only to individuals who are deceased at the time of such naming. - Amends TCA Title 11.

As introduced, if the department of health fails to disburse grant funds for the nurse home visitor program by 12/31/2009, this bill requires the commissioner of health to testify accompanied by certain documents before certain legislative committees by March 1, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, authorizes municipal courts to suspend a person's driver license for up to 30 days upon a finding that such person has violated a traffic law or ordinance. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 18.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Death Penalty Representation Services Act of 2009." - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 11 and Title 40, Chapter 30, Part 2.

As enacted, rewrites provisions governing selection and retention of judges; replaces judicial selection commission with judicial nominating commission. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2; Title 16 and Title 17.

As enacted, provides that in order to practice law, a person must receive a license issued by supreme court and comply with Rule 6 of the rules of the supreme court, except for rule 19 pro hac vice admissions; clarifies that authorization to practice pro hac vice is an exception to the general requirement that attorneys be licensed and properly admitted to practice pursuant to the rules of the supreme court of Tennessee in order to practice law in this state. - Amends TCA Title 23.
As introduced, authorizes recovery of cost of collecting unpaid municipal court fees and costs from the defendant. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 24.
As enacted, adds the committee of a medical group practice to the definition of a medical review committee. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 2.

As enacted, confers immunity from civil action upon victim of crime for testimony given at offender's parole hearing unless testimony is intentionally and maliciously false and defamatory. - Amends TCA Title 40.

As introduced, provides that court-approved attorney fees in medical malpractice case are conclusively presumed to be reasonable in any subsequent action before the board of professional responsibility based on a complaint concerning the amount or reasonableness of the attorney fees. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 26.

As enacted, requires district attorney general to complete and file uniform judgment document within 30 days after sentencing; requires that the document be signed by all parties, but if not signed by the parties, the clerk must make a copy of the document available to the parties before entry by the court.
As introduced, removes certain responsibilities of the executive director of the district public defenders conference. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14 and Title 9, Chapter 4.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Death Penalty Open File Discovery Act." - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 11.
As enacted, prohibits certain persons restrained of their liberty from prosecuting a writ of habeas corpus. - Amends TCA Section 29-21-101.
As introduced, authorizes a municipal electric system to obtain a state-issued certificate of franchise authority. - Amends TCA Title 7.

As introduced, requires insurer to give written notice of claim amount to division of workers' compensation when apparent to insuror that the amount of medical benefits to which the employee may be entitled will exceed $10,000, rather than $5,000. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.
As introduced, adds two members to the pest control board. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 21, Part 1.
As introduced, revises and expands statute governing health insurance coverage of autism. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, authorizes a special license plate for certain volunteer firefighters free of charge. - Amends TCA Title 55.
As enacted, "Sam Cliff Smithson, Sr. Memorial Highway," segment of U.S. Highway 431 in Williamson County.
As introduced, adds costs to list of fees and penalties that may be recovered against a pipeline corporation in default. - Amends TCA Title 65 and Title 67.
As introduced, authorizes nonprofit organizations to collect and distribute donated legend drugs to indigent persons. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 1 and Title 63, Chapter 10.

As introduced, requires proof of valid motor vehicle liability insurance before issuance of motor vehicle registration or renewal of motor vehicle registration. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As introduced, establishes a homestead exemption of up to $75,000 from liens arising from services provided by a hospital. - Amends TCA Title 26, Chapter 2.

As enacted, incorporates the use of green building design, sustainable infrastructure, and energy efficiency technologies into the powers authorities are authorized to exercise for redevelopment projects. - Amends TCA Section 13-20-202.

As introduced, requires judge, when addressing a defendant who intends to plead guilty to a charge of domestic assault, to advise the defendant prior to the plea of the state and federal firearms consequences of such a plea. - Amends TCA Title 30, Chapter 13, Part 1.
As introduced, exempts drivers of well-digging rigs from commercial driver license requirements. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 4.

As enacted, provides that any employee who retains the right to reconsideration of an award of permanent partial disability benefits for a workers' compensation injury that occurs on or after July 1, 2009, and whose pre-injury employer is sold or acquired after such award is made, may seek reconsideration from the successor employer if either the employee's employment with the successor employer is involuntarily terminated through no fault of the employee or the employee's rate of pay is reduced to a level below the rate of pay that the employee had at the time of the injury.
As enacted, revises provisions concerning medical records of persons who are treated for work-related injuries - Amends TCA Title 50 and Title 56.

As introduced, increases the time a pharmacy that chooses to maintain a written register of purchasers of methamphetamine precursors, as opposed to an electronic register, from one year to two years. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 63, Chapter 10.

As introduced, requires juveniles 14-18 adjudicated delinquent for commission of offenses of aggravated rape of a child, rape of a child, aggravated rape, and attempt to commit any such offense to register with the sex offender registry as a violent juvenile sexual offender. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39.

As introduced, merges the board of cosmetology and barber's board; creates the board of cosmetology and barber examiners. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 4, Chapter 3; Title 62, Chapter 3 and Title 62, Chapter 4. Repeals l TCA Section 62-3-101; Section 62-3-102; Section 62-3-104 and Section 62-3-131.
As introduced, requires cooks to cover hair on head, including beards. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 8 and Title 68, Chapter 14.
As enacted, designates TBI headquarters in Nashville as "Arzo Carson TBI State Office Building."
As introduced, restates tax rate on attending any event at a municipal stadium from an amount not to exceed 10 percent of the ticket price to an amount not to exceed $2.00. - Amends TCA Title 7.
As introduced, creates the unified family court pilot program. - Amends amend TCA Title 16.
As enacted, "Jimmy 'Pap' Galloway Memorial Bridge," U.S. Highway 27 in Rhea County.

As introduced, specifies procedures to be followed for promulgation of rules relative to the assessment and taxation of the provision of video and satellite services. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.

As introduced, creates a presumption that an infectious disease acquired by a firefighter, paramedic, emergency medical technician, or emergency medical technician advanced was suffered in the line of duty unless the contrary is shown by competent evidence. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51, Part 2.

As introduced, prohibits commissioner from exercising measures of enforcement against a taxpayer with not-for-profit status until final adjudication of the taxpayer's appeal when the commissioner failed or refused to recognize an exemption or exception for such a taxpayer. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 67.

As enacted, changes the requirement that the firefighter representative to the board of trustees of the Tennessee consolidated retirement system be from a list submitted by the Tennessee professional fire fighters association instead of submitted jointly by the professional organizations that represent firefighters in this state. - Amends TCA Section 8-34-302.
As introduced, enacts the "Professional Fire Department Employees Negotiations Act." - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51.
As introduced, requires any increased court fees charged to the state in certain cases to be limited to the amounts charged before January 1, 2006. - Amends TCA Section 8-21-401.

As enacted, directs department of education to develop an alternative teacher licensing program for instructors of any military branch who have taught for a community college of any military branch. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, authorizes the Tennessee higher education commission and other state college systems to provide information about available financial assistance in the normal course of their business of development and recruitment. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
As introduced, requires THEC to gather and disseminate for public use the cost per instruction hour to students enrolled in higher education institutions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 20.

As introduced, requires board of regents and University of Tennessee board of trustees to study impact of mandatory American history class requirement and make any necessary recommendations for change. - Amends TCA Section 49-7-110.

As introduced, removes obsolete requirement that at least one member of the board of regents be the immediate past commissioner of education as of July 1, 1972, to serve for 29 years. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, extends state university and community college system, board of regents, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2.
As introduced, allows use of school buses for 20 years under certain conditions. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-2109.
As enacted, "Bobby James Killen Memorial Bridge," State Route 227 in Lawrence County.
As enacted, revises various provisions involving the practice of polysomnography. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 31, Part 1.

As introduced, directs that house and senate judiciary committees study application of death penalty in Tennessee; provides for moratorium on executions until study results are presented to the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2.
As introduced, makes various changes to the Tennessee Title Pledge Act. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 15.
As introduced, revises the Tennessee Title Pledge Act. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 15.

As introduced, clarifies that the administrative director of the courts shall not administer any funding or grants provided to any court appointed special advocate programs from the court appointed special advocate fund. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 36; Title 37 and Title 39.
As enacted, adds additional injuries that are not covered by workers' compensation. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-110.

As enacted, authorizes the state funding board to authorize the state treasurer to enter into short-term arrangements or obligations not otherwise authorized, in certain circumstances, for the sole purpose of meeting the liquidity needs of the pooled investment fund; requires the treasurer to report any such arrangements to the senate and house finance, ways and means committees.

As introduced, adds citation to statute that created board of claims in reference to requirement that state treasurer report to the board an alternative method for purchasing insurance for the state. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter .
As enacted, clarifies certain procedural elements of service of garnishments. - Amends TCA Title 26, Chapter 2, Part 2.

As introduced, establishes immunity from civil liability for persons furnishing, disclosing, or requesting information without malice pursuant to public records laws. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 8, Chapter 44 and Title 10, Chapter 7.

As introduced, deletes the authority of the commissioner of finance and administration to transfer department of transportation funds and programs in the highway fund to the state general fund. - Amends TCA Section 4-3-1016.
As introduced, prohibits principals under performance contracts from being members of negotiating units for collective bargaining purposes. - Amends TCA Section 49-5-602(7).

As introduced, prohibits LEAs from submitting budgets to local legislative bodies that do not maintain the local legislative body's funding effort, as adjusted for inflation, from the previous fiscal year, unless the reduction is based on fewer students in the system. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, authorizes random drug testing of students who participate in voluntary extracurricular activities. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-4213.
As introduced, allows any operating LEA to convert to a special school district. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 5.

As enacted, provides that, during negotiations between representives of public employee unions and representatives of state or local govenmental entities, planning or strategy sessions of either set of representatives when meeting with the entity it represents are not open to the public. - Amends TCA Section 8-44-201.
As introduced, exempts persons 21 years of age and older from requirement that persons riding a motorcycle must wear a helmet. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-302.
As enacted, provides terms for the engagement of services for certain termite inspection and prevention plans without initial chemical treatment. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 21, Part 1.
As introduced, designates TBI headquarters in Nashville as "Larry Wallace TBI State Office Building."

As introduced, makes information contained in handgun carry permit applications and renewals, information provided to agencies to investigate applicant, and records maintained relative to the permit application confidential and creates Class E felony of unauthorized publication of permit information or records. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As introduced, adds a citation to the provision of law that provides for the creation of the state school bond authority in the statute regarding the chairs of excellence endowment fund. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 5.

As enacted, authorizes the board of trustees of the baccalaureate education system trust fund program to establish, or contract for the establishment of an incentive plan to encourage Tennessee residents to participate in any such other college savings program or in any Section 529 college savings program established by the state. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 8.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Renewable Fuels Blending Act of 2009." - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 25.

As enacted, enacts the "Electric G&T Cooperative Act"; requires TACIR to study whether current wholesale power supply arrangements between TVA and municipal utilities and electric cooperatives likely to change in a way that could affect payment in lieu of taxes from TVA to the state and local governments; makes other changes relative to energy acquisition corporations. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 48.

As enacted, provides that it is not an offense for manufacturer of gambling devices or records to own, manufacture, possess, buy, sell, lease, rent, store, repair, transport, print, or make any gambling device or record solely intended for use outside of this state. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As enacted, revises provisions governing health care providers notifying health insurers regarding hospital admission to provide that a health insurance carrier may not require any hospital by contract, reimbursement or otherwise, to notify the health insurance carrier of a hospital inpatient admission within less than one business day of such admission if such notification or admission occurs on a weekend or federal holiday. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.
As introduced, modifies certain statutory provisions pertaining to certain types of theft. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 1.

As introduced, specifies that all property, not otherwise covered by Uniform Disposition of Unclaimed Property Act, including any income or increment thereon and deducting any lawful charges, that is held or owing in the ordinary course of the holder's business and that has remained unclaimed by the owner for more than five years after it became payable or distributable is subject to the custody of the state. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 29, Part 1.
As introduced, clarifies that the department of the treasury is required to administer the small and minority-owned business assistance program. - Amends TCA Section 65-5-112 and Section 65-5-113.
As introduced, allows charter schools to be managed or operated by private or for-profit entities. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.
As introduced, removes the prohibition on cyber-based charter schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13, Part 1.

As introduced, revises the Life Settlements Act to further define fraudulent or dishonest practices by a licensee, applicant for renewal, or any officer, partner, member or key management personnel. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 50.
As enacted, creates Class A misdemeanor offense for unauthorized dissemination of autopsy materials. - Amends TCA Title 38 and Title 39.
As introduced, enacts the "Private Process Servers Regulatory Act of 2009." - Amends TCA Title 62.

As introduced, adds to transit authority management boards a non-voting member recommended by the labor organization representing the plurality of employees and allows the chairperson to exclude the member from meetings on negotiations with labor organizations. - Amends TCA Section 7-56-101.

As introduced, allows Type D school buses to remain in service for 15 years, with the commissioner of education able to grant a waiver for an additional five years on a year-to-year basis upon inspection. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 21.

As enacted, requires the select oversight committee on education to conduct a hearing on the status of differentiated pay programs in Tennessee, including bonuses or other compensation tied to performance standards. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 6.
As introduced, enacts the "Emergency Care for Rape Victims Act." - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

As introduced, decreases time in which owner of property determined by municipal planning commission to be blighted must respond to written notice of such determination, from 90 to 60 days. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 21.
As enacted, removes requirement that a list of bondsmen posted in a correctional facility must be done in order of seniority. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-126(b).

As enacted, specifies that division of property assessments has right to intervene in contested cases before the state board of equalization; specifies persons who are authorized to represent the assessor. - Amends TCA Section 67-1-202 and Section 67-5-1514.
As introduced, authorizes the state to match local contributions for regional economic development districts. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3.

As introduced, combines consolidated disclosure of interest form with other forms created by Tennessee ethics commission; changes filing deadlines from February 1 to April 15, to clarify that consolidated form must only be filed once during the year. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10; Title 3, Chapter 6 and Title 8, Chapter 50.
As introduced, requires certain procedures for privatizing fire and related services.
As introduced, adds former municipal court judges to eligibility list for judiciary registration plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, phases out the inheritance tax over a four-year period beginning January 1, 2010, by incrementally reducing the amount of the tax each year until, for decedents dying in 2014 and thereafter, no such tax applies. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.

As enacted, classifies intentionally causing the physical injury of a public employee or public or private transportation system employee while the employee is performing a duty within the scope of the public employee's employment or while the transportation system employee is performing an assigned duty on or related to the operation of a transit vehicle as aggravated assault and a Class A misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-102.

As introduced, allows counties and municipalities to create exemption to local option sales tax for replacement trees purchased toward commercial or public utility property's required tree density. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, adds enterprise zones as location in which qualified business enterprise may be located to be eligible for $4,500 jobs tax credit upon approval of commissioners of the department of revenue and the department of economic and community development. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.
As introduced, allows TSAC to promulgate rules for the award of a lottery scholarship or grant in certain situations for extenuating circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As enacted, exempts persons licensed by the board of any of the professions of healing arts from liability for civil damages resulting from the voluntary provision of health services. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 7.
As introduced, revises conditions under which charitable clinics may accept donations of or dispense certain drugs. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, specifies citation to definition of "victim" in the Criminal Injuries Compensation Act of 1976. - Amends TCA Section 40-24-107, Section 67-4-606, and Title 29, Chapter 13, Parts 1 and 3.
As introduced, prohibits a health insurance plan or policy from altering certain aspects of prescription drug coverage for certain insureds. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As enacted, revises "Grape and Wine Law" based on a Sixth Circuit U.S. Court of Appeals decision including allowing out-of-state wineries to be licensed. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3, Part 2.
As enacted, authorizes renal dialysis clinics to employ physicians in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 63-6-204 and Section 68-11-205.

As enacted, establishes legislative intent concerning priority of services to behavioral health safety net; establishes 19 years of age as the minimum age at which a person qualifies as an adult for purposes of determining which persons qualify as seriously and persistently mentally ill adults for purposes of this bill.

As enacted, places restrictions on universal mental health testing, or psychiatric or socioemotional screening of juveniles; requires certain consent by a juvenile's parent, guardian, legal custodian, or caregiver before such testing can occur. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As introduced, exempts specified persons from the licensing requirements of the Tennessee Real Estate Broker License Act of 1973. - Amends TCA Section 62-13-104.
As enacted, authorizes creation of city court in each home rule municipality that does not have a city court established by the local governing body. - Amends TCA Title 16 and Title 17, Chapter 1.
As introduced, requires an affidavit of affixation for manufactured homes attached to real property to be a separate document. - Amends TCA Section 55-3-138.
As introduced, specifies that certain credits shall not be valued as income for appraisal purposes. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, creates department of juvenile justice. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8 and Title 37.

As introduced, authorizes the purchase of secondhand items by local governments as long as the general range of value of the item is documented through a listing in a recognized publication or through an appraisal and the price is no more than 10 percent of the documented range. - Amends TCA Section 12-3-1003.

As introduced, directs the department to work with deaf and hard of hearing organizations to provide a suitable facility in Nashville for deaf and hard of hearing persons. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 10 and Title 11.
As enacted, affords tenured teachers in Davidson County a hearing if such teachers are suspended from duty. - Amends TCA Section 49-5-512.

As enacted, requires that the notice of tow of an abandoned or unclaimed vehicle be given to the last registered owner within three business days of receiving verification of ownership of the vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 16.
As introduced, authorizes local governments to enact more stringent blasting standards than state requirements. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 105, Part 1.
As introduced, directs the department to complete work on the corridor management plan for the Donelson area in Davidson County. - Amends TCA Title 54.

As introduced, authorizes workers' compensation penalties to be abated and then voided after one year if employer obtains and maintains workers' compensation coverage. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6, Part 4.

As introduced, directs TDOT to confer with house and senate transportation committees before making any substantial changes in original route of Harding Place extension in Davidson County. - Amends TCA Title 54.

As introduced, requires certain persons who operate cranes over five tons in lifting capacity be certified by a national organization approved by the commissioner of labor and workforce development. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 3.
As introduced, urges TDOT to install a turning lane on a portion of Lebanon Road in Davidson County.
As introduced, directs TDOT to widen Lebanon Road in Nashville from Briley Parkway to Wilson County line; urges TDOT to seek federal funds for such project.

As introduced, directs the department working with the department of finance and administration to negotiate with Men of Valor in selling or leasing certain state properties for residential rehabilitative services for felons. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 41.

As introduced, specifies certain potential complications to elective cosmetic or plastic surgery that must be discussed with a patient prior to such surgery. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 63, Chapter 9.
As introduced, authorizes officers of corporations to exempt themselves from unemployment law provisions. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.
As introduced, exempts from state sales taxes the purchase and installation of solar and wind energy systems for residential use. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As introduced, requires longevity pay to state employees to be issued by a separate check or ACH transaction unless the employee elects not to receive a separate check or transaction. - Amends TCA Section 8-23-206.

As introduced, defines the AMA guide for impairment ratings to mean the 5th edition of the Guides, instead of either the 6th edition or any new edition that is designated by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.
As introduced, requires certain providers of hospitality services for compensation to be licensed by commissioner of commerce and insurance. - Amends TCA Title 62.

As introduced, establishes one-year statute of limitations for actions to recover damages based on a home inspection report. - Amends TCA Title 28; Title 62, Chapter 6, Part 3 and Title 66, Chapter 5.
As introduced, permits certain retired general sessions judges to participate in the health insurance plan for employees of local government under certain conditions. - Amends TCA Section 8-27-207.

As enacted, prohibits disciplinary action or discharge of an employee of the department of correction based solely upon the employee's refusal to take a polygraph examination or for failure of a polygraph examination.

As enacted, replaces references to "obviously intoxicated" with references to "visibly intoxicated" in certain statutes governing the sale of alcoholic beverages to an intoxicated person. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 10, Part 1.

As enacted, specifies that retailers are prohibited from selling intoxicating liquors to persons who are "visibly intoxicated" or accompanying a "visibly intoxicated" person rather than someone who is "drunk" or accompanying a "drunk" person. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-406 and Section 57-5-301.
As enacted, "Bob Couch Highway," segment of U.S. Highway 41A in Coffee County.

As introduced, increases the amount to which the local option sales tax may be applied from $1,600 to $3,200 and establishes an annual adjustment based on the percentage increase of the consumer price index to be rounded up to the nearest multiple of $100. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-702 and Section 67-6-202.

As enacted, excludes from the definition of "retail sale" in regard to alcoholic beverages (alcohol, spirits, liquor, wine) any transaction between a licensee and its employees in the normal course of employment for which no payment is expected or received and any depletions from a licensee's inventory related to routine business or marketing purposes where all applicable taxes have been paid; authorizes the manufacturer to make complimentary distributions on a periodic basis to its employees in the normal course of employment and to others for routine business or marketing purposes, if such alcoholic beverages are not intended for resale.
As introduced, enacts the "Rental Network Contract Arrangements Act." - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, establishes certain debt collection standards for hospitals; requires certain disclosures of hospitals; establishes new unfair practices for hospitals under the Consumer Protection Act. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 68.
As introduced, enacts "Tennessee Pregnant Women Support Act." - Amends TCA Title 49; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

As enacted, increases from $2.00 to $5.00 the authorized maximum amount of archives and record management fee that may be collected by county legislative bodies that have county records commission; authorizes municipalities and towns to collect such fee; extends authorization for collection of the fee through the office of county register and the courts. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 10 and Title 68, Chapter 3.
As enacted, authorizes veterans to request removal of their social security numbers from war records. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 10 and Title 58.

As enacted, specifies that if a property and casualty insurance policy includes a specified medical expense benefit payable without regard to fault, but does not permit assignment of such benefit, the insurer must establish a process that, when requested by the insured, the insurer will disburse funds in the names of the insured and the health care provider as joint payees. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, removes authorization to provide medical services in lesser amounts, duration, and scope to "medically needy" persons than to other medicaid recipients. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 71.

As introduced, places certain requirements on rural electric and community services cooperatives concerning acquisition of real property for new or expanded electric power distribution facilities; subjects such cooperatives to the open records and open meetings acts. - Amends TCA Section 8-44-102; Section 10-7-503 and Title 65, Chapter 25, Part 2.

As enacted, exempts Wilson County from the requirement that appeals from the Probate Court (i.e., General Sessions Court acting as the Probate Court) must be heard anew in Chancery Court de novo. - Amends TCA Section 30-2-609.

As introduced, increases the number of members of the print, radio, and television news media who are entitled to be present at the carrying out of an execution of a sentence of death from seven to eight. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 23, Part 1.
As introduced, removes the net worth requirement from an employee leasing application for license. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 43.
As introduced, provides that the general assembly supports the premise that employees have the right to privately decide whether or not to elect union representation. - Amends TCA Title 50.
As introduced, removes the requirement that a home medical equipment provider be accredited by the joint commission on accreditation of health care organizations. - Amends TCA Section 68-11-226.
As introduced, imposes certain bidding requirements upon water and wastewater authorities. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221.

As enacted, prohibits a government entity from substantially burdening a person's free exercise of religion unless it demonstrates the application of the burden is essential to further a compelling government interest and is the least restrictive means of furthering that interest.

As introduced, increases fee, from $5.00 to $5.50, due to the department of revenue for noting or transferring certain new liens or encumbrances on certificates of title. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 6.
As introduced, prohibits the disposal of hazardous waste in certain landfills. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As enacted, removes requirement that the trustee must report and make a settlement for all taxes with the commissioner of revenue; removes requirement that the trustee submit a financial report to certain state and local government officers for purposes of making a final settlement of taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, authorizes municipalities having a population of at least 100,000 to establish an ordinance and permitting process that would enable restaurants to allow admittance of patron companion dogs into designated outdoor dining areas. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 18 and Title 6, Chapter 54.

As enacted, authorizes municipalities having a population of at least 100,000 and certain other municipalities to establish an ordinance and permitting process that would enable restaurants to allow admittance of patron pet dogs into designated outdoor dining areas. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 18 and Title 6, Chapter 54.

As introduced, changes standard for denying workers' compensation benefits in cases involving alcohol and drug use from such use being a proximate cause of the injury or death to such use being a contributing cause of such injury or death. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-110.

As enacted, revises requirements governing bicycle use at nighttime to require that a bicycle be equipped with a lamp on the front that emits a white light visible from a distance of at least 500 feet to the front and either a red reflector or a lamp emitting a red light that is visible from a distance of 500 feet to the rear when directly in front of lawful upper beams of head lamps on a motor vehicle.
As introduced, requires the board of physical therapy to meet not less than quarterly. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 13.

As enacted, certifies medication aides who may administer certain medications in nursing homes or assisted living facilities under the supervision of licensed nurses. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, deletes certain provisions of the Grape and Wine Law; permits the transport of wine purchased from a winery licensed by the state of Tennessee; authorizes Alcohol Beverage Commission to assess inspection fees against licensees and permitees. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-401.

As introduced, deletes certain provisions of the Grape and Wine Law; permits the transport of wine purchased from a winery licensed by the state of Tennessee. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-401 and Section 57-3-207.

As introduced, establishes standards for stationary assembly points and mobile labor camps provided by a railroad company for maintenance of way employees; requires the department of health to adopt rules pertaining to mobile camps. - Amends TCA Title 65 and Title 68.

As enacted, changes the required base years for the nursing home occupancy rate for a relocating nursing home from the previous two years of the joint annual report to the calendar years 2006 and 2007 in such report. - Amends TCA Section 68-11-1628.
As introduced, requires gift certificates with a monetary value of less than $10.00 to be redeemable in cash for cash value. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.

As introduced, establishes presumptions of proximate cause of death, injury, or damage for certain motor vehicle accidents occurring within a construction zone; establishes immunity from claims for personal injury, property damage, or death arising from certain department of transportation projects. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 42; Title 12, Chapter 4; Title 29 and Title 54.
As introduced, removes certain exemptions that allow sexual offenders to be on school grounds. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.

As enacted, permits the alteration of a wet weather conveyance by any activity and does not require any notice or approval of the alteration, if certain conditions are met; allows person desiring to alter a specific water of the state to request a determination from the commissioner that it is a wet weather conveyance and submit a report from a qualified hydrologic professional in support of the request. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As introduced, revises certain determinations concerning water quality standards in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As introduced, adds a new classification of limited resource waters to the Water Quality Control Act of 1977. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3.

As introduced, requires the department to provide a municipality with electronic notification of any proposed rule that has the potential to affect that municipality. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2.
As enacted, specifies that only those operations that are required under the federal Clean Water Act to have a permit for CAFOs may be issued an NPDES permit.

Clarifies that bonds issued by an airport authority "must" instead of "may" be sold at public sale at not less than par; requires 10 instead of five days notice prior to any meeting at which the governing body of the municipality that created the authority will consider being a guarantor to the payment of principal and interest on authority bonds. - Amends TCA Title 42, Chapter 3; Title 42, Chapter 4; Title 42, Chapter 5; Title 42, Chapter 6 and Title 67, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires each county by July 1, 2012, to set a minimum entry level compensation for deputy sheriffs at 30 percent of the compensation to be received by the various county general officers. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 8.

As introduced, requires state rules, regulations, and standards relative to air quality, water quality, air emissions, and water discharges to be consistent with and not exceed the requirements of federal statutes, regulations, standards, criteria, and guidance on the same subject. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 69.

As introduced, specifies that in any criminal proceeding involving certain sex offenses committed against a victim less than 13 years of age the testimony of a forensic interviewer is admissible. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 2; Title 24, Chapter 7, Part 1; Title 37, Chapter 1 and Title 40, Chapter 17.

As enacted, exempts from the definition of heliport in a tourist resort county, land on private property used for landing a privately owned and operated helicopter for private purposes on a limited basis which is never used by or for commercial helicopter touring. - Amends TCA Title 42, Chapter 1, Part 3 and Title 42, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As introduced, excludes felons who have had rights restored and who were not convicted of a violent or drug-related felony from Class E felony of possession or carrying of a handgun. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As introduced, reduces the distance by which landowners must post signage to effectively restrict persons from hunting game inside the perimeter of the lands being posted from 100-yard to 50-yard intervals. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires minimum statewide building construction safety standards promulgated by the state fire marshal to also apply to one and two family dwellings. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 120, Part 1.

As enacted, prohibits the commissioner of environment and conservation from issuing a permit for the disposal of coal ash or for the expansion of an existing coal ash disposal facility unless the plans for the disposal facility include a liner and a final cap, with certain exceptions. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.
As enacted, requires the department of children's services to provide certain post-adoption services. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Environmental Protection and Recycling Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 49; Title 55; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 70.

As enacted, increases from five to 10 years the minimum age of an abandoned vehicle that can be destroyed without title and notification of last owner of record and lienholders. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, specifies that owner of private property cannot designate garage keeper or towing firm, or employee of either, as owner's agent to approve towing vehicle from the property. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As enacted, authorizes any alcoholic beverage collector to apply to the alcoholic beverage commission for a license to allow the collector to purchase wine and other alcoholic beverages from any authorized entity and sell collective alcoholic beverages, in a face to face transaction only, to any person 21 years of age or older. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3; Title 57, Chapter 5 and Title 57, Chapter 9.

As introduced, requires the bureau of TennCare to reimburse crossover claims for full benefit dual eligibles at 100 percent of the Medicare allowable charge for participating providers. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5.

As introduced, deletes limitation that once an absentee ballot is issued the person may only vote by absentee ballot; instead permits a person to whom an absentee ballot has been issued to vote a provisional ballot if the voter is in the state on election day except the provisional ballot will only be counted if the absentee ballot was not received by the election commission. - Amends TCA Section 2-6-301.

As introduced, exempts a person enrolled as a full-time student in an accredited college or university outside the county of residence from appearing in person at the first election following the person's registration by mail. - Amends TCA Section 2-2-115.

As introduced, revises the law concerning qualifications for and practices of notary publics in certain circumstances; creates protections for true owners of residential real property where deeds have been signed by persons involved in fraudulent and criminal activities concerning such property. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 39.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of license plates for firefighters and paramedics. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, establishes the specific portion of the sentencing range that must be applied on and after the second, third, and fourth felony convictions. - Amends TCA Title 40.

As introduced, in counties using computerized duplicate registration records, permits a person to whom an absentee ballot has been issued to vote a provisional ballot if the voter is in the state on election day except the provisional ballot will only be counted if the absentee ballot was not received by the election commission. - Amends TCA Section 2-6-301.

As introduced, places certain restrictions on members of the state election commission and their immediate family including prohibition on lobbying, holding elective office, and participating in election campaigns. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 11, Part 1.
As introduced, requires the state treasurer to publish annually the amount of funds available in the after school programs special account. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51.
As enacted, extends provisions regarding dismissal of tenured teacher in Davidson County to also apply in Shelby County. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5.
As introduced, increases from $25,000,000 to $50,000,000 the maximum amount of funds that may be appropriated from excess net lottery proceeds for Pre-K programs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, permits the Memphis City School System to establish and operate a police force for the school system. - Amends Chapter 30 of the Acts of 1868-69, and any other acts amendatory thereto, the same being the charter of the Memphis city schools as amended.

As introduced, establishes the Tennessee Board of Credentialing for Child Care Professionals; authorizes the Board to develop training and performance standards and to award all certification and credentials requirements. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 3.
As introduced, establishes a pilot program of mandatory attendance in an alternative school within the Memphis City Schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As enacted, directs the department to establish the "We Want To Learn English Initiative." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 14 and Title 49.

As introduced, appropriates $4 million to the Bureau of TennCare for the sole purpose of funding copay reimbursements for Medicare/Medicaid dual eligible enrollees who utilize emergency medical services.

As enacted, adds providing advice to the commissioner of finance and administration concerning the state health plan developed by the state health planning division of the department of finance and administration to the duties of the health equity commission. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15, Part 4.
As enacted, increases per diem for serving on board of podiatric medical examiners from $50.00 to $100; revises certain podiatric licensure requirements. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 3.
As introduced, expands the types of clinics at which volunteer health care licensees may render service. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 7.

As enacted, authorizes former members of the general assembly to request that emails sent to the former member's legislative email address be automatically forwarded to such former member for up to 12 months from the former member's last offical day of service as member of general assembly; not applicable to members who are removed or resign from office. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As enacted, makes doctoral clinical psychology students in university-operated clinics eligible for third-party reimbursement. - Amends TCA Section 63-11-224.

As enacted, specifies that the evaluation and treatment of persons who have had their lives significantly impacted by compulsive gambling disorder are within the scope of alcohol and other drug abuse counseling services that may be performed by licensed drug and alcohol counselors; requires that a counselor have at least 60 hours of specialized education in order to evaluate or treat a person significantly impacted by compulsive gambling disorder. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 68, Chapter 11 and Title 68, Chapter 24.

As enacted, requires the board of optometry to list on its web site the organizations whose continuing education courses are deemed approved to meet the requirements of the board; specifies that courses by such organizations will be considered approved by the board and will be available to optometrists as a means of satisfying annual continuing education obligation, in addition to the continuing education courses that have been approved by the Council on Optometric Practitioner Education. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, authorizes new specialty earmarked license plate to honor contributions of nurses in Tennessee; directs portion of proceeds to Tennessee Nurses Foundation. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires hospitals filing a joint annual report of the statistical particulars relative to their patients to include a report of community benefits provided by the hospitals. - Amends TCA Section 68-11-310.

As enacted, allows alcoholic beverages to be sold for on premises consumption in unincorporated areas of a county with a charter form of government that has held a countywide local option election approving liquor-by-the-drink. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3 and Title 57, Chapter 4.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of I RECYCLE new specialty earmarked license plates; earmarks proceeds from such plates for certain recycling efforts. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires health insurance entities to use a uniform health care provider credentialing application based on the application established by the Council on Affordable Quality Healthcare. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As enacted, modifies description and requirements of eligible properties for certain redevelopment or urban renewal plans containing tax increment financing. - Amends TCA Section 13-20-202 and Section 13-20-205.

As introduced, requires the Tennessee bureau of investigation to maintain an electronic purchase log of methamphetamine precursor sales throughout the state and requires that all reporting of such sales by the pharmacist be electronic and in real-time. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As introduced, enacts the "Uninsured Motorist Stipulation of Benefits Act." - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12, Part 1.

As enacted, allows a commissioned reserve deputy sheriff, as authorized in writing by the sheriff, or commissioned reserve or auxiliary police officer, as authorized by the chief of police, to carry firearms as a law enforcement officer. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-1350.

As introduced, exempts from certain charitable solicitation regulatory requirements certain service providers, licensed by the department of mental health and mental retardation, who contract with the department of finance and administration to provide certain services for persons with mental retardation. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 101, Part 5.

As enacted, increases the tax on coal products severed from the ground in this state and increases the amount of tax revenue collected that is allocated to the county from which the coal products were severed; allows department of revenue to retain certain amounts in two fiscal years to recover expenses. - Amends TCA Section 67-7-104 and Section 67-7-110.

As introduced, requires students to make a cumulative grade point average of at least 2.75 at any time continuing eligibility for a Tennessee HOPE scholarship is reviewed to continue to receive the scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As enacted, requires the department to coordinate with other state agencies and health care providers to promote access to services for persons in psychiatric emergencies, subject to funding; requires certain action if appropriations are inadequate to allow the department to maintain funding for the portion of the emergency psychiatric services continuum for uninsured persons at the annualized level provided as of January 1, 2009. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 6.
As introduced, enacts "Tennessee Economic Civil Rights Act."
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Business Ombudsman Act."
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Professional Licensure and Certification Reform Act."
As introduced, authorizes utility districts to own and operate natural gas vehicle fueling stations. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82, Part 3.

As enacted, requires the division of mental retardation services to do everything possible to provide referrals for new ICF/MR beds; requires division to demonstrate a commitment in assisting providers in locating referrals by obtaining a written statement from the conservator of every eligible service recipient indicating that they have been fully informed of the ICF/MR facilities and the specialized services they provide.

As introduced, permits the commissioner of correction to specifically deny in writing an employee's request to examine investigative records and reports of the internal affairs division of the department of ongoing investigations prior to a due process hearing at which disciplinary action is considered or issued. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-504.
As enacted, imposes penalty for failure of a tobacco distributor or manufacturer to provide certain information to commissioner of revenue. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-2604.
As introduced, requires developments to allow an owner to display political signs on the owner's property or exclusive common area. - Amends TCA Title 13 and Title 66.

As introduced, provides immunity from liability for nongovernmental independent contractors or other persons contracting to perform function of public transportation authority. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 56, Part 1 and Title 29, Chapter 20, Part 1.

As enacted, expands the facilities where infants can be voluntarily delivered to include law enforcement facilities that are staffed 24 hours a day, fire departments that are staffed 24 hours a day, and emergency medical services facilities. - Amends TCA Section 68-11-255.

As introduced, clarifies that certain private act metropolitan hospital authority is not exempted in the conduct of its powers from antitrust law, federal or state, otherwise applicable to private hospitals. - Amends TCA Section 7-57-501 and Section 7-57-502.

As introduced, prohibits exclusive provider agreements with hospitals for providing services to state employees covered by the state employees health insurance. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27, Part 2.
As introduced, changes limitation on maximum time in transit to or from school from one and one-half hours each way to one hour each way. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-2105.
As enacted, extends provisions on reemployment of teachers after retirement from June 30, 2010, to June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Section 8-36-821.

As introduced, requires applications for establishment of charter schools to provide, in addition to the names and addresses of the members of the governing body, a telephone number or email address for each member. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.

As introduced, requires the office of education to report periodically to the state board of education and the commissioner of education, in addition to the general assembly, concerning the overall school accountability system. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.

As introduced, requires certain prospective recipients of the Tennessee HOPE access grant to enroll in an eligible postsecondary institution no later than 28 months following graduation from high school. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 49.
As introduced, adopts an alternative base period, part-time worker eligibility, and extended benefits while in training into unemployment law. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

As enacted, provides that any insurance company formed as a successor in interest not entitled to receive a reduction in its apportionment ratio for property tax purposes if the previous company already received such reduction; provides exception for insurance company formed as successor in interest in 2006. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 12.
As introduced, limits a defense of usury in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 14, Part 1.
As introduced, reduces the sales tax on Energy Star qualified products to 3.5 percent and defines Energy Star qualified product. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.
As introduced, requires the state to purchase certain Energy Star qualified products. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3 and Title 12, Chapter 4.
As introduced, grants state recognition to certain Indian tribes, bands, and groups; provides means for other Indian tribes, bands, and groups to receive state recognition. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, limits the liability of certain facilities contracting with the department of mental health and developmental disabilities to provide residential services for individuals with developmental disabilities or mental retardation. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 8, Part 3 and Title 33.

As introduced, permits director of judicial district drug task force to petition court for destruction, sale, or law enforcement use of confiscated weapons. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
As introduced, limits application of the preemption provision in the "County Powers Relief Act" to counties and metropolitan governments. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-2913.

As introduced, directs the department of safety not to implement the REAL ID Act of 2005 as enacted by the United States Congress, which mandates a national identification card for each citizen of the United States. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, allows local government to require reasonable compensation for use of public rights-of-way for construction of telephone or telegraph lines; provides that fee of 5 percent of provider's gross revenues from operation of such line is presumed reasonable. - Amends TCA Section 65-21-103.
As enacted, enacts the "Market Regulation Act of 2009." - Amends TCA Section 65-5-109.

As introduced, requires judge to order that motor vehicle owned or driven by person convicted of DUI to be equipped with functioning ignition interlock device after period of license suspension. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 33 and Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.
As introduced, enacts the "Exclusionary Rule Reform Act." - Amends TCA Title 24, Chapter 7 and Title 40, Chapter 17.

As introduced, creates Class A and Class B misdemeanor offenses of failing to notify law enforcement upon observing commission of a criminal offense resulting in the death or serious bodily injury of another. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1.

As enacted, redefines "hotel" to clarify that the property of Blackberry Farm may not be contiguous and may be divided by a public or private road; further clarifies that privilege may be exercised anywhere within defined area. - Amends TCA Title 57.

As introduced, clarifies that members of the real estate commission shall not be subject to license forfeiture upon the finding of set fees or commissions on real estate transactions. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 13.
As introduced, increases the amount from $1.5 million to $2 million above which a general contractor's financial statement has to be audited. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6.

As enacted, establishes requirements for local governments to contract with construction management agents or advisor services for construction of local correctional facilities; provides for procurement of such services through a written request for proposals process through advertisement; specifies who may perform such services. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Healthcare Freedom of Conscience Act." - Amends TCA Title 68.

As enacted, specifies under the Personal Rights Protection Act of 1984 an individual is entitled to recover three times the amount to which the individual is otherwise entitled, plus reasonable attorney fees, if a person knowingly uses or infringes the rights of a member of the armed forces in violation of the Act. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 25, Part 11.

As introduced, requires the advisory committee on open government in consultation with the office of open records counsel to study the use of social security numbers by local governments and to report to the general assembly by February 1, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8 and Title 10.
As introduced, establishes efficiency standards for certain products and requires commissioner of commerce and insurance to administer and enforce such standards. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 25.

As introduced, directs the air pollution control board to promulgate rules to allow the sale of motor vehicles that meet California's emissions standards, requires the board to monitor California's standards, and when those standards have been adopted in states representing 50 percent of the United States population, promulgate rules to adopt emissions standards based on the California standard. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 55 and Title 68.

As introduced, grants pay raises to administrative employees who pass the Certified Administrative Professional Examination; provided, that funds are specifically appropriated for such purpose in the general appropriations act. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 49.
As introduced, requires the commissioner of financial institutions to report annually instead of biennially. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 15.

As introduced, decreases ownership required to be determined in control of a corporation and increases the length of time that a licensee must notify the department of financial institutions of a change in location or name before such change. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 17.

As introduced, eliminates reimbursement for airline travel by members of the general assembly living 100 miles or more from Nashville to Nashville during legislative sessions; prohibits reimbursement for airline travel to instate committee meetings; limits reimbursement for airline travel to out-of-state committee meetings to one ticket per year. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-106.

As enacted, authorizes TennCare pharmacy advisory committee to recommend new proposed deletions or additions to drugs currently on the TennCare bureau's auto-exemption list; requires the committee to establish a special review subcommittee comprised of practicing medical specialists and medical faculty members of institutions of higher learning with expertise in the usage and prescribing of the medications under review to provide expert advice on the proposed changes. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, exempts any farmer who does not receive farm subsidies and does not participate in state or federal agriculture programs for the receipt of funds or subsidies from any rules or regulations promulgated by the state or the federal government. - Amends TCA Title 43 and Title 44.

As introduced, revises restrictions on the ability of hospitals to employ physicians and establishes non-liability of hospital for non-employee physicians. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, relieves the sheriff or transportation agent in Hamilton County from further transportation duties after the person being transported to the hospital or treatment resource has been delivered to such facility; places further transportation duties on such facilities. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 6, Part 4.
As introduced, allows trade and professional associations to fund PACs. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 19, Part 1.

As enacted, authorizes manufacture of intoxicating liquors and/or drinks in certain counties that approved both retail package sales and liquor-by-the drink sales and in counties in the river resort district that have approved retail package sales, all by referendum; specifies that certain distance requirements of law will apply to manufacturers under this act. - Amends TCA Section 57-2-103.

As enacted, imposes certain requirements on health insurance entities such as notification regarding material changes to the entity's provider manual, establishment of a Web site, and inclusion of preadjudication tools on the Web site. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.
As introduced, expands definition of the securities valuation office of the National Association of Insurance Commissioners to include any successor organization. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, expands the definition of National Association of Insurance Commissioners to include any successive organization. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, creates new felony criminal offense "retail theft." - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14 and Title 40.
As introduced, subject to local approval, removes recall, initiative, and referendum provisions from charter. - Amends amend Chapter 84 of the Private Acts of 1991; as amended.

As introduced, creates a Class A misdemeanor offense for a person to knowingly provide, transfer, or submit to any other person false identification for the purposes of obtaining or maintaining employment. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14; Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 50.
As introduced, requires health insurance policies and contracts to cover treatment of lymphedema. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, seeks to enhance federal funding for TennCare and Coverkids through implementing certain options under 2009 federal Children's Health Insurance Plan legislation. - Amends TCA Title 71.
As introduced, makes assault with strangulation or attempt to cause serious bodily injury by strangulation an aggravated assault. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

As introduced, modifies the definition of "qualified defendant" for purposes of rendering certain sexual offenders ineligible for probation and expunction of official records. - Amends TCA Section 40-35-313.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Pet Groomers Act". - Amends TCA Title 62.

As enacted, requires the bureau of TennCare to reimburse crossover claims for full benefit dual eligibles at 100 percent of the Medicare allowable charge for pharmacy services. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5.

As introduced, repeals the provision relative to microwave systems licensed by the federal communications system as multi-channel/multipoint distribution systems. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 25, Part 2.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Employer Privilege Tax Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 67.
As introduced, increases the tax on intoxicating liquors and cigarettes to fund crime prevention grants. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 10; Title 16; Title 33; Title 57 and Title 67.

As enacted, grants a shooting range that had been in operation for at least 30 years prior to December 16, 2008, the right to continue operating at the same location and such right may not be amended, restricted, or terminated due to zoning changes, if certain conditions met. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-316.

As introduced, requires the departments of health and human services to make certain reports to the general assembly concerning nursing homes and adult protective services. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, establishes recording fee of up to $10.00 for registering pedigree of any jack or bull claimed to be pedigreed livestock; creates Class C misdemeanor for knowingly recording or presenting a fraudulent pedigree. - Amends TCA Title 44.
As introduced, makes teacher effect data for tenured teachers public records and requires the data to be posted on the Internet. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 6.

As introduced, tolls time period for taxpayer to file amended schedule of personal property when taxpayer's personal property account has been audited and the audit reveals that the assessment should be adjusted downward. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As enacted, redefines "historic inn" for the purposes of the sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption to include certain historic inns in Blount and Sevier counties. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As enacted, establishes certain qualifications and standards for real estate continuing education instructors. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 13.
As introduced, requires all public utilities to allow telecommunications service providers and cable operators to make pole attachments subject to reasonable fees. - Amends TCA Title 65.

As introduced, requires county clerks to verify county of residence of persons obtaining or renewing motor vehicle registrations; requires applicant to pay wheel taxes for previous years the applicant failed to pay the applicable wheel tax to the county where the applicant resides. - Amends TCA Section 55-4-105.
As introduced, creates select oversight committee on veterans affairs. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15.
As introduced, revises regulation of billing for cytopathology services to refer instead to "anatomic pathology services." - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 6.
As introduced, exempts railroads from certain notice requirements related to criminal trespass. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 4 and Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As introduced, permits person who has been voluntarily committed or hospitalized in a mental institution to apply for and obtain handgun carry permit if hospitalization was at least five years prior to application and applicant attaches statement from doctor that applicant does not pose immediate risk of serious harm due to mental illness. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As enacted, authorizes the department of economic and community development to allocate on behalf of the state the portions of the national recovery zone economic development bond limitation and the national recovery zone facility bond limitation that are allocated to the state among the counties and large municipalities pursuant to federal law; revises certain provisions governing recovery zones and energy production facilities; authorizes the Tennessee local development authority (TLDA) the authority to allocate on behalf of the state the portion of the federal "national qualified energy conservation bond limitation" that is allocated to the state. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.
Authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes.

As enacted, codifies existing policies regarding: funds involving purchases or trade-ins of motor vehicles that must be held in trust by dealers; funds necessary to perform certain obligations of manufacturers and manufacturers' distributors to dealers or customers that must be held in trust by manufacturers and manufacturers' distributors; and the required uses of such funds. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.
Makes appropriations to defray the costs of certain enactments of the 2009 annual session of the 106th General Assembly.

As introduced, allows access by the fiscal review committee staff to certain confidential tax information and records in the possession of the department of revenue; requires the fiscal review committee staff to maintain the confidentiality of such information and records. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 17.

As introduced, requires department of safety to deliver draft copy of public necessity rules to the government operations committees, simultaneous with the submission of such rules to attorney general for approval. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8, Chapter 23; Title 10; Title 39, Chapter 16; Title 49, Chapter 6; Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 55 and Title 65.
As introduced, requires each state agency head to complete periodic training for purposes of complying with the provisions of the Regulatory Flexibility Act. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5.

As enacted, places certain requirements on Davidson and Shelby county health departments in regard to grants for funding of family planning programs; removes the specific reference to consultation and coordination with planned parenthood affiliates in the development of family planning programs that are administered by the department. - Amends TCA Section 68-34-105.

As enacted, specifies circumstances under which an existing licensed and operating nursing home may relocate all or less than all of its licensed beds to up to two new locations. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 16.

As introduced, provides that court or jury may take into consideration the defendant's personal income and ability to pay when determining the amount of criminal fine to assess, if any. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35, Part 3.
As introduced, increases the amount required to be advanced by a lender in order to participate in a borrower's enterprise or venture from $500,000 to $750,000. - Amends TCA Title 47.

As enacted, defines "misconduct" for purposes of provisions whereby if an administrator finds that a claimant for unemployment benefits has been discharged for misconduct connected with the claimant's work, then the claimant is disqualified from collecting unemployment benefits; requires any person who receives unemployment benefits by knowingly misrepresenting, misstating, or failing to disclose any material fact, or by making a false statement or false representation without a good faith belief as to the correctness of the statement or representation to repay the amount of benefits received. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.
As introduced, establishes the "Tennessee Small Business Employer Health Benefits Fund" and authorizes a grant program. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires doctors and hospitals treating minor children to release the results of medical tests and procedures performed on the child to the child's parents upon request. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 1; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires department of finance to fully fund copay reimbursements for Medicare and Medicaid dual eligible enrollees who utilize emergency medical services. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 71.
As introduced, allows constables to collect mileage fees from sheriffs for transporting mentally ill patients. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 33.
As introduced, establishes grant program administered by department to support emergency services in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 9, Chapter 4; Title 38; Title 58 and Title 68.
As introduced, establishes certain agricultural economic growth and development grant pilot projects. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 43; Title 44; Title 53; Title 54 and Title 67.
As introduced, encourages the bureau of TennCare to take certain actions to improve health outcomes for premature infants. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, clarifies voting on boards of commissioners and adds the office of secretary. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 6.
