As introduced, subject to local approval, amends the charter of Cleveland to clarify that a vacancy shall occur if the mayor or a council member fails to attend three consecutive regular meetings of the city council, and further changes the required 13-day lapse between the first and second reading of an ordinance to a 12-day lapse. - Amends Chapter 78 of the Private Acts of 1993; as amended.

As enacted, requires information concerning those bidding for masonry contractor work be included on the outside of the envelope containing a bid, in addition to those contractors currently required to be listed. - Amends TCA Section 62-6-119.
As introduced, authorizes board's designee to administer clinical and didactic examination required for dental assistant eligibility to perform polishing. - Amends TCA Section 63-5-108(d).

As introduced, provides that offense of soliciting the sexual exploitation of a minor can be prosecuted in this state against person located outside the state if the person solicited a law enforcement officer posing as a minor located within this state. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5.

As enacted, creates certain exemptions from restrictions on motor vehicle height and length for certain motor vehicles carrying rafts or rafting apparatus used by an operator for commercial whitewater rafting purposes; exemptions only apply during certain times of the year. - Amends TCA Title 55 and Title 65, Chapter 15.

As introduced, allows registrar to email a ballot to each member of the armed forces and each citizen temporarily outside the United States who is entitled to vote and who has submitted a valid application for a ballot. - Amends TCA Section 2-6-301 and Title 2, Chapter 6, Part 5.
As enacted, revises various provisions regarding voting by members of the military and citizens who are temporarily outside the U.S.and vacancies in the house of representatives.

As introduced, requires that when a law enforcement officer causes a driver to be tested for the purposes of determining the alcohol or drug content of such driver's blood because there is probable cause to believe that the driver was driving under the influence and an accident occurred that such test shall be conducted within two hours from such accident occurring. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.

As enacted, authorizes a bail bondsman to return a defendant to the jurisdiction for which the bail bond is obligated for the defendant's appearance, provided that the bail bondsman is liable for the expenses of returning the defendant and the defendant is located within this state. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 1.
As introduced, changes the maximum amount by which the price of secondhand items purchased by local governments may exceed the value of the item. - Amends TCA Section 12-3-1003.

As introduced, declares that the Metropolitan Hospital Authorities chapter shall be liberally construed; changes report date concerning tort liability of public hospitals from March 30 to June 30. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 29; Title 33; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, changes sales tax holiday from the first Friday in August through the following Sunday to the last Friday in July through the following Sunday. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3004 and Section 67-6-393.

As enacted, provides that any local education agency may donate any apparently wholesome food fit for human consumption to a county jail or bona fide charitable or nonprofit organization for free distribution, and will not be subject to criminal penalty for violation of unfair trade practice laws or civil damages arising from the condition of the food, unless an injury is caused by the negligence, recklessness or intentional conduct of the agency. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 53, Chapter 13, Part 1.

As enacted, revises membership of Four Lake Regional industrial development authority to provide that in a county adopting a metropolitan form of government the mayor of such county must appoint a citizen member to serve on the authority. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 5, Part 2.
As introduced, requires hospitals to perform targeted surveillance for methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus in high-risk populations. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

As introduced, expands scope of medical services for certain individuals who are eligible for medical assistance to include services provided by nonprofits created specifically to care for related individuals with disabilities. - Amends TCA Section 71-5-107.

As introduced, authorizes the police department of the City of Portland to charge $5.00 for each accident report rather than requiring the city council to follow the per page fee guidelines established by the office of open records counsel in its schedule of reasonable charges for copies of public records. - Amends TCA Section 8-4-604 and Section 10-7-503.

As enacted, requires the office of education accountability within the office of the comptroller, in consultation with the department of education, to survey other states to determine how states use measures of parental involvement and student accountability in evaluating teacher performance; requires reporting and presenting of information. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, authorizes TDOT to allow volunteer groups to clean and assist in the maintenance of certain bridges on state highway system, in accordance with plans devised by the commissioner after consultation with the volunteers. - Amends TCA Title 54.
As introduced, revises filing deadlines for employer disclosure reports from within 45 days of March 31 and September 30 to within 45 days of June 30 and December 31. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6.

As enacted, diverts certain non-violent property offenders from sentence of incarceration to sentence to community correction, probation or diversion program and increases percentage of sentence person convicted of aggravated robbery with weapon must serve. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35.
As introduced, removes provision providing that certain highway signs are paid from the highway fund subject to appropriation by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 5.

As introduced, allows licensed drug and alcohol abuse counselors to assist clients with applications for state and federal benefits. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 68, Chapter 11 and Title 68, Chapter 24.

As introduced, removes certain prohibition to allow railroad authorities to negotiate and contract for all rehabilitation with the railroad company operating on the facilities to be improved. - Amends TCA Section 7-56-211.
As enacted, imposes same liability as state employees upon special inspectors for boilers and unfired pressure vessels. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 122.

As introduced, authorizes commissioner to issue a cease and desist order prohibiting out-of-state residents who practice locksmithing in this state without a license from engaging in such practice. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 11, Part 1.
As introduced, requires owners, harborers, and keepers of dogs to restrain or confine dogs; establishes certain penalties and defenses for violations. - Amends TCA Section 44-8-108.

As introduced, changes from September 30 to August 1 the date by which children must reach age four in order to enter preschool or prekindergarten or age five to enter kindergarten. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, establishes the "Tennessee Criminal Gang Registration Act of 2010." - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As enacted, requires promulgation of regulations authorizing a preference in the evaluation of proposals for state contracts requiring the performance of call center services for vendors through whom such services will be solely provided by citizens of the United States who reside in the United States, or any person authorized to work in the United States pursuant to federal law, including legal resident aliens in the United States; establishes certain requirements regarding participation in national flood insurance program. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 12, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As enacted, authorizes service animals, fish for decorative purposes, and birds in cages in barber shops; requires that cages be cleaned daily. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, provides for issuance of military registration plates for honorably discharged veterans upon documented proof at initial application only, rather than each year, to correspond with current practice for retired veterans obtaining such plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, changes the day on which the sales tax holiday begins from the first Friday of August to the third Friday of July. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As introduced, prohibits the acceptance and storage of radioactive waste at landfills or commercial facilities in this state. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As enacted, authorizes Shelby County legislative body to vote to allow community organizations the right to petition and enter upon vacant property for the purpose of removing litter. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1; Title 6, Chapter 54; Title 13, Chapter 21 and Title 13, Chapter 6, Part 1.
As introduced, adds various requirements for issuance of permit to dispose of coal combustion waste in landfills. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, requires 60 days advance written notice to members of general assembly before a coal ash disposal permit is issued for a facility in their district. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 5; Section 55-4-124; Title 62, Chapter 2; Title 68 and Title 69.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked license plates for Fisk University; allocates 50 percent of funds derived from sale thereof to university to further its academic mission. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, creates system of independent review of denial or recoupment of claims by persons with a business purpose of contracting with health care providers for delivery of health care services. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.

As introduced, allows person without handgun carry permit to transport rifle or shotgun in privately-owned motor vehicle provided there is no ammunition in the chamber or cylinder and no loaded clip or magazine in the weapon or in close proximity to the weapon. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As introduced, places restrictions on appointments to the assessment appeals commission; requires a member to recuse himself from voting on an issue before the assessment appeals commission in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-1502.

As introduced, requires county trustee to return commissions in excess of amount needed to operate the trustee's office to the school fund to the extent the excess commissions do not exceed the amount received by the trustee from the school fund. - Amends TCA Section 8-11-110.

As introduced, includes appointing someone as a member or chairman of, or a leadership position on, a committee, board or other governmental body within the definition of "pecuniary interest" for purposes of the bribery statutes. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 16, Part 1.

As introduced, grants reciprocity for licensure to embalmers licensed or certified in another state, the District of Columbia or a territory of the United States. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5, Part 3.

As introduced, includes all minerals under provision clarifying interpretation of property conveyances and requires permitting for rock harvesting. - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 2; Section 66-5-102 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, deletes the ability of any insured to reject uninsured motorist coverage thereby requiring every motor vehicle insurance policy to include uninsured motorist coverage. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 12.
As introduced, increases the penalty for the offense of boating under the influence of an intoxicant to approximate DUI penalties. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 55 and Title 69.
As introduced, enacts the "Ice Cream Truck Worker Registration Act." - Amends TCA Title 40; Title 53; Title 55 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires insurance company to provide an insured notice concerning the status of the insured's wrecked or damaged passenger motor vehicle and an opportunity to choose whether to retain such vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 3, Part 2.
As enacted, grants municipalities exclusive right to use their names and symbols. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Multilevel and Pyramid Distributorship Act." - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 47.

As introduced, lengthens suspension of requirement that sole proprietors and partners maintain workers compensation insurance on themselves from March 28, 2011, until April 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 3; Title 29; Title 39, Chapter 11; Title 50; Title 56 and Title 62.

As introduced, lengthens suspension of requirement that sole proprietors and partners maintain workers compensation insurance on themselves from March 28, 2011, until April 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 3; Title 29; Title 39, Chapter 11; Title 50; Title 56 and Title 62.

As introduced, revises various references to certain disabled persons throughout the code. - Amends TCA Title 1; Title 16; Title 20; Title 27; Title 28; Title 29; Title 30; Title 32; Title 34; Title 36; Title 50; Title 54; Title 66 and Title 69.

As enacted, prevents the Tennessee Independent Colleges and Universities Association and its member institutions from being held liable for breach of confidentiality of student data or records that are required to be submitted to THEC, if the breach was a result of the actions of the commission or its staff. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.
As introduced, revises fees assessed against the state in child support actions. - Amends TCA Section 8-21-401.
As introduced, creates a violent juvenile sexual offender registry. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 40; Title 49 and Title 55.

As introduced, revises notification requirements concerning coverage loss by a person covered under a policy of group accident and health insurance; makes a health insurance entity a Phase I certified health plan in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.

As enacted, increases the fees for court officers in Wilson County for attending on grand jury or waiting in court from $75.00 to $100 and establishes the fee as a minimum; authorizes the county legislative body of such county to increase the fee by resolution no more than once annually. - Amends Title 8, Chapter 21, Part 9.
As introduced, "Orville Depew 'Dick' Kitzmiller and Riley Lee Milhorn Memorial Bridge," on S.R. 75 in Sullivan County.
As introduced, "Veterans Memorial Highway," segment of S.R. 44 in Sullivan County.
As introduced, extends the department of education, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 8.
As introduced, extends the state election commission, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 11, Part 1 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
As enacted, extends the solid waste disposal control board, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 211.
As enacted, extends the petroleum underground storage tank board, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 215.
As enacted, extends the water quality control board, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 69, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends the department of environment and conservation, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As introduced, extends the state board of education, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3.
As enacted, extends the board of ground water management, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 69, Chapter 10, Part 1.
As introduced, extends the air pollution control board, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 201, Part 1.

As enacted, requires fiscal review committee staff to compare actual fiscal impact of at least five public chapters to the fiscal impact as stated in the fiscal note and present such review to fiscal review committee each year; requires written summary be submitted to general assembly members. - Amends TCA Title 3.
As introduced, prohibits the transfer of a person convicted of first degree murder to a minimum security correctional institution. - Amends TCA Title 40 and Title 41.

As enacted, adds continuing education requirements for members of utility district board of commissioners; and rewrites provisions for utility district commissioners' removal from office and filling of vacancies. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82, Part 3; Title 7, Chapter 82, Part 6 and Title 7, Chapter 82, Part 7.

As enacted, authorizes the board of mayor and alderman of the city of Farragut to adopt an ordinance to establish term limits, to become operative only if approved in a referendum. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 3.

As introduced, authorizes a court to increase the sentence for any offense committed against an elderly person, a minor, or a disabled person to the grade above the prescribed sentence for such offense. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As enacted, names campus at Senator Ben Atchley State Veterans Home in Knox County in honor of Gerald D. Clark.
As introduced, revises definition of "average weekly wage." - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.
As enacted, authorizes municipalities that collect their own property taxes to accept partial payments of property taxes under certain conditions. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 56, Part 1.
As introduced, revises mechanism for transfer of county government duties to water and wastewater treatment authority board. - Amends TCA Section 5-6-120.

As enacted, enacts the "Rachel Clawson Act of 2010," which classifies the reckless killing of an employee of the department of transportation or a highway construction worker in a posted construction zone by a motor vehicle operator's conduct as vehicular homicide and a Class D felony. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-213.

As introduced, subject to necessary federal approvals, provides for an optional prenatal care benefit in TennCare including $50.00 payments to pregnant enrollee, free transportation, and a visit schedule. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, removes certain powers of the commissioner of commerce and insurance relative to conducting rule making hearings concerning unfair practices in the business of insurance. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, authorizes use of red flags made from plastic materials instead of cloth to mark a projecting load on a motor vehicle, subject to commissioner's approval. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, removes authorization for the division of regulatory boards to assess investigation and prosecution costs in disciplinary hearings pursuant to schedule promulgated by commissioner of commerce and insurance. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, abolishes select oversight committee on corrections. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15; Title 40, Chapter 34, Part 1 and Title 41.

As introduced, abolishes select committee on children and youth. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15; Title 9, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 5; Title 37; Title 39, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 2 and Title 68.
As introduced, abolishes the oversight committee on TennCare. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15; Section 37-3-115 and Title 71, Chapter 5.
As introduced, abolishes the select oversight committee on education. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15; Title 41, Chapter 21, Part 2 and Title 49.

As introduced, authorizes department of safety to make available to public through an electronically searchable database whether person has an unrevoked handgun carry permit based upon information provided by requester; authorizes sale of permit holder addresses in bulk; and makes all other handgun carry permit information confidential. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5 and Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
As introduced, authorizes reimbursement to an insured for services provided by a licensed marital and family therapist. - Amends TCA Section 56-7-2401.

As introduced, prohibits installation of new traffic surveillance cameras by a municipality or county until such cameras have been placed at all school zones in the municipality or county. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 1.
As introduced, increases inheritance tax exemption for decedents dying in 2012 $100,000 per year until such amount equals $3.5 million. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8, Part 3.
As enacted, creates a small business advocate within the office of the comptroller of the treasury. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, requires applications for establishment of charter schools to provide, in addition to the names and addresses of the members of the governing body, a telephone number or email address for each member. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.
As introduced, limits noneconomic losses to plaintiff in medical malpractice action to $1 million. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 26, Part 1.
As introduced, requires landlords in Davidson County to secure water service fee security deposits from tenants. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 66, Chapter 28 and Title 68, Chapter 221.
As introduced, requires owner or operator of landfill to use native grasses to cover landfill after being closed to further operations. - Amends amend TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.

As introduced, requires all sexual offenders who are required to be on the sexual offender registry and whose victim was 15 years of age or younger to attend a class sponsored by the TBI on the evening of October 31 of every year. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39.

As introduced, creates a Class A misdemeanor offense for any person to rent or lease any primary or secondary residence or any other living accommodation to a tenant who is a sexual offender or a violent sexual offender and whose victim was a minor if such residence or living accommodation is within 1,000 feet of a school. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39.

As introduced, authorizes and encourages counties and municipalities to formulate programs to provide grants to owner/occupants to rehabilitate residential homes located in historic areas, districts, and zones from funds available to the county or municipality. - Amends TCA Title 13.

As introduced, adds to the purposes of zoning regulations a requirement to insure that a planned community does not violate any of the covenants as presented and approved by a planning commission. - Amends TCA Title 13.
As introduced, authorizes utility districts to enforce payment of garbage collection and disposal service fees by filing a lien. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7 and Title 68, Chapter 221.
As enacted, authorizes the board of medical examiners to issue a St. Jude Children's Research Hospital Global Collaboration license. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 2.

As enacted, authorizes issuance of various new special license plates; extended time in which minimum order must be met for certain plates; revises other special license plate provisions. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires institutions of higher education within the University of Tennessee and the Tennessee Board of Regents systems to accept courses completed within 20 years for transfer, credit, graduation, or matriculation; excludes science, technology, and medical courses. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.
As introduced, adds funding certain staffing requirements as permissible uses of the trauma center fund. - Amends TCA Title 55 and Title 68.
As introduced, enables a municipality to institute a residential rental inspection program to prevent deterioration. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 21, Part 3.

As introduced, revises manner in which members are appointed to the board of a water and wastewater treatment authority. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 6; Title 7, Chapter 82 and Title 68, Chapter 221.
As introduced, exempts diabetic testing equipment and supplies from sales tax. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10; Title 63, Chapter 10 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires manufacturers, wholesalers, and distributors of prescription drugs and medicines to have their licenses available on the premises and they shall be responsible for displaying the license on request. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 10, Parts 2 and 3.
As enacted, adds "Level III Office based surgery" to statute governing office-based surgery. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 6.
As enacted, decreases from five to three years the length of time a small employer must purchase coverage through a health group cooperative. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 22.

As introduced, specifies that when an employer provides certain evidence showing four or more complaints from customers concerning the employee's work performance, a discharge by an employer shall be deemed to be a discharge for misconduct, and thus, disqualify the claimant from unemployment benefits. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5 and Title 50, Chapter 7.

As introduced, under certain conditions, allows a job tax credit to be applied against the franchise and excise liability of a small business that fills at least one new full-time position and meets the required investment in a tax year. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.

As introduced, requires that no disciplinary action be taken against a law enforcement officer for a pursuit for an actual or suspected violator of a law or ordinance who flees from pursuit unless such pursuit violated pursuit policies established by the law enforcement agency that employed such law enforcement officer at the time of the pursuit. - Amends TCA Title 40 and Title 55.

As introduced, provides that inmates are entitled to two meals per day unless a physician determines that more than two meals are medically necessary for the inmate's health; provides that any savings to the department from implementation of this act is to be appropriated by the general assembly for educational purposes. - Amends TCA Title 41, Chapter 21.

As introduced, permits counties, by vote of county legislative body, to limit the access of sexual offenders to public libraries located within the county, either by library, day, or hour. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.
As enacted, enacts the "Forest Product Fairness Act." - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 4 and Title 43.

As introduced, requires any permit issued by the department of environment and conservation to specify the types of waste a facility is prohibited from receiving for disposal or processing; prohibits any person from knowingly accepting for disposal or processing certain nuclear or radioactive materials in any landfill. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of Down Syndrome awareness new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50 percent of funds derived from sale of such plates to The Down Syndrome Association of Memphis and the Mid-South. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, urges the commissioner of correction to report to the select oversight committee on corrections concerning a study of inmates incarcerated by the department who are nonviolent offenders and age 65 and older. - Amends TCA Title 41.
As enacted, urges the comptroller to study the number of state inmates who have been incarcerated for crimes for which they have not been convicted. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 41.
As enacted, urges the comptroller to study the number of inmates in county jails who have been incarcerated for offenses for which they have not been convicted. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 41.

As introduced, states that a court shall order equal parenting time unless the court finds by clear and convincing evidence that a parent is unfit or both parents agree to a parenting plan that does not provide for equal parenting time. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, requires certain DUI offenders to operate only a motor vehicle that is equipped with a functioning ignition interlock device. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 29; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 55; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, adds witness intimidation, discrimination, and drive-by-shootings as aggravating factors for purposes of imposing death sentence in first degree murder cases. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, clarifies that in any sale of land to foreclose a deed of trust, mortgage, or other lien securing the payment of money or other thing of value or under judicial orders or process, advertisement of such sale is to be made in a newspaper either published or distributed in the county where the sale is to be made. - Amends TCA Title 35.

As introduced, reclassifies Tennessee Technological University collegiate, cultural plates as new specialty earmarked plates; allocates proceeds from such plates to the university. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, reduces from 90 to 75 days period in which dealer via signed statement can deduct on a return sales tax collected but not yet remitted to commissioner for refunded items. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, makes appropriations for the purpose of defraying the expenses of certain legislative enactments passed during the 2010 session of the 106th General Assembly.
As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked license plates for Oak Ridge Revitalization Effort (ORRE); allocates 50 percent of funds derived from sale thereof to ORRE to restore Alexander Inn. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Responsible Server Act of 2010." - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 15 and Title 57.
As introduced, requires administrator of elections to reside in county in which he or she serves in such capacity. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 12.
As enacted, revises various provisions of the Tennessee Small Business Investment Company Credit Act. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 28 and Title 56.

As enacted, specifies that employees who have had a reduction in pay or a reduction in hours due to economic conditions will not be entitled to reopen their claims if the reduction in pay or reduction in hours affected at least 50 percent of other hourly employees operating at or out of the same location; not applicable to employees involved in layoffs, closures, or a termination of business operations.

As introduced, revises requirements involving a trade or professional association board of directors currently authorized to pool liabilities to qualify as self-insurers to have operating agreements, or a constitution or bylaws as required by present law. - Amends TCA Title 50.
As introduced, enacts the "TennCare Provider Recoupment Act." - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 8 and Title 71, Chapter 5.
As enacted, "Southport Community Bridge," S.R. 245 in Maury County.

As introduced, allows any sole proprietor or partner engaged in the construction industry, or a member of an LLC engaged in the construction industry, to elect to be exempt from the operation of this chapter, provided that no more than three members of an LLC may make such election. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 3; Title 29; Title 39, Chapter 11; Title 50; Title 56, Title 68 and Chapter ___ of the Public Acts of 2010 (Ex. Sess.) (Senate Bill 1 / House Bill 7 of the First Extraordinary Session).

As introduced, reinstates certain pay and retirement benefits for commissioned officers transferred from department of safety to department of revenue. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 7, Part 2 and Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 2.
As introduced, changes filing deadline to apply to operate public charter school from October 1 of the year preceding year of proposed operation to October 15 of such year. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires that annual report published by commissioner be made available on department's web site. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 5.

As introduced, clarifies that tuition credits or refunds during military service are to be given to students called to active duty while attending Tennessee technology centers as well as state universities and community colleges. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 14; Title 49, Chapter 4; Title 49, Chapter 50; Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.
As introduced, deletes a repetitive provision of the code that is more appropriately addressed in subdivision (a)(5)(A)(ii) of the amended section. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3.

As introduced, clarifies that THEC's duty to study and make recommendations concerning higher education programs and authorities includes the University of Tennessee system, TBR, and all of their respective institutions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 14; Title 49, Chapter 4; Title 49, Chapter 50; Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

As introduced, requires the department of education to notify electronically each LEA when the office of research and education accountability publishes a report pertaining to pre-K-12 education in order that the LEAs may disseminate the report to certificated staff. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires all written driver license examinations be given in English. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3.
As enacted, extends missing senior citizen alert program to persons with dementia; revises various provisions of program. - Amends TCA Section 38-6-121.

As introduced, requires insurers to pay the cost of covered medical procedures when provider orders a non-covered medical procedure and insured agrees to pay any difference in costs. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 23.

As introduced, prohibits driving on any highway while using mobile telephone without hands-free device; violation is a Class C misdemeanor punishable by a fine only of $50.00. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As introduced, changes time within which equalization board must act during its regular session and send the notice of decision and appeal procedure from no later than five days to no later than seven days prior to the date taxes are due. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.

As introduced, authorizes entry of a copy of a court order dismissing action to collect taxes that is barred by statute of limitations as an alternative to entering memorandum of court's judgment. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, removes declaration that tobacco tax is a levy on the consumer. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As enacted, authorizes schools to establish an International Baccalaureate Programme fund or an Advanced Placement fund to receive donations or grants from individuals or from private corporations, associations, or other artificial entities, both nonprofit and for profit, that desire to help support an International Baccalaureate Programme or an Advanced Placement program offered or attempted to be established by the school. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5; Title 49, Chapter 6 and Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, allows local jurisdictions to hold a referendum about whether to approve sale of wine in retail food stores; creates license for sale of wine in retail food stores. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 1 and Title 57, Chapter 3.

As enacted, authorizes health, educational and housing facility corporations to lease or sell projects to clinics or to enter into a loan agreement with clinics with respect to such projects. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 101, Part 3.

As introduced, excludes from recordation tax transfers between lineal relatives and siblings, and also excludes transfers to or from spouses and surviving spouses of lineal relatives; requires grantee to sign an oath concerning the actual value of the property. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-409.

As introduced, clarifies that refusing to accept a legal writ or other process attempting to be served by a public employee or private process server constitutes obstruction of the service of process. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 16, Part 6.

As enacted, prohibits local governments from punishing or rewarding law enforcement officers solely based on the number of traffic citations issued or collected upon. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 16 and Title 55, Chapter 8.
As introduced, codifies executive order placing the TennCare program in the department of finance and administration. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, requires local boards of education to develop short school day programs for high school seniors who have completed all requirements for graduation except for three or fewer classes. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires schools director to send certain disciplinary records and records concerning adjudications of delinquency by the transferring student to the new school or school district. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.

As introduced, authorizes counties to collect a certain fee designated exclusively for duplicating, storing, and maintaining records required by law to be kept permanently. - Amends TCA Section 8-21-1001.

As introduced, requires that a percentage of student's final grade in a subject to be derived from the student's TCAP score; the department of education will determine the percentage, but it must be at least 15 percent. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 6 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 60.
As introduced, requires that TCAP tests be given no earlier than May 1. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 60.

As introduced, prohibits reasonable costs assessed by a records custodian from including labor charges; deletes the requirement of an additional charge for frequent and multiple requests. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 4, Part 6 and Section 10-7-503.

As introduced, requires disclosure of exact amount of lobbyist compensation and employer expenditures for public entity that employs a contract lobbyist who is not an employee of such public entity. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As introduced, enacts the "Public Safety Employee Bargaining Act." - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, expands time in which the chief law enforcement official is required to notify a requestor of a law enforcement officer's personal information that there is a specific reason for withholding such information from two business days to seven business days. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.

As introduced, clarifies that TBI shall establish, authorize, approve, and certify remote breathalyzers for the scientific examination and analysis of evidence. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

As introduced, requires any person selling alcoholic beverages, wine, or beer to a person under the age of 21 to serve a mandatory minimum period of incarceration of 48 hours; conforms various code references to minor to reflect the more correct age 21 language. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39; Title 40, Chapter 7; Title 54, Chapter 4; Title 57, Chapter 3; Title 57, Chapter 4 and Title 57, Chapter 5.
As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the language conferring powers on the board of public utilities. - Amends Chapter 46 of the Private Acts of 2003.
As introduced, prohibits disposal of untreated sewage by certain boats and imposes certain requirements on boating facilities. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 69.
As introduced, requires an individualized disciplinary plan for each student in grades K-12. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As enacted, creates Class A misdemeanor for production, manufacture, distribution, possession, or possession with intent to produce, manufacture, or distribute the synthetic cannabinoids JWH-018, JWH-073, HU-210, and HU-211; does not apply to lawfully prescribed drugs or substances. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As introduced, requires certain prospective recipients of the Tennessee HOPE access grant to enroll in an eligible postsecondary institution no later than 28 months following graduation from high school. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 49.

As enacted, changes the reporting deadline of the Tennessee Advisory Commission on Intergovernmental Relations to the general assembly on the effectiveness of Tennessee's current underground utility damage prevention program from January 29, 2010, to January 17, 2011. - Amends amend Chapter 470 of the Public Acts of 2009.

As introduced, requires state-owned golf courses that fail to operate in a manner sufficient to satisfy the outstanding bonded indebtedness of the state for a certain period to be sold. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, reduces alcohol level required to constitute offense of DUI from .08 percent to .02 percent for person with one or more prior DUI convictions. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.
As introduced, requires that marital dissolution agreements include notice of fact that defendant will lose health insurance, if applicable. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 36 and Title 56.

As introduced, authorizes Internet posting on municipal web sites to be adequate public notice if the municipality has an Internet notice posting policy that contains provisions designed to educate residents on the availability of Internet notices and instructions on how to access Internet notices. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 44.

As enacted, requires state insurance committee to provide opportunity for eligible local education and local government employees to participate in the long-term care benefits program. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27.

As introduced, requires financial review prior to renewal, extension, or modification of contracts for goods or services requiring approval by the comptroller of the treasury under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4.
As introduced, sets the priority as to who has the right to dispose of a dead body through cremation. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5.

As enacted, makes it the duty of the department to care for and preserve the second floor of the capitol building subject to the approval of the speaker of each chamber of the general assembly and increases the minimum number of parking spaces on capitol hill that must be assigned to the chief clerk of each chamber of the general assembly from four to six.

As introduced, reduces from 90 to 60 days period in which dealer via signed statement can deduct on a return sales tax collected but not yet remitted to commissioner for refunded items. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, makes appropriations for the purpose of defraying the expenses of certain legislative enactments passed during the 2010 session of the 106th General Assembly.

As enacted, establishes that boating regulation laws will govern unclaimed or abandoned boats and vessels when in conflict with the Uniform Disposition of Unclaimed Property Act. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 29.
As introduced, exempts from tangible personal property tax equipment used for harvesting timber. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
As introduced, requires court of the judiciary to deliberate in public. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 5, Part 3.
As enacted, authorizes reimbursement to an insured for services provided by a licensed marital and family therapist or licensed professional counselor. - Amends TCA Section 56-7-2401.
As introduced, revises penalties for practicing medicine without a license. - Amends TCA Title 39, Title 53 and Title 63.
As introduced, permits reimbursement for services provided by a licensed marital and family therapist. - Amends TCA Section 56-7-2401.

As enacted, creates task force to review regulations governing residential and day provider agencies contracted by division of intellectual disabilities services. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 5, Part 1.

As introduced, imposes requirement that red-light cameras must be marked by appropriate signage warning drivers of surveillance cameras' presence on all surveillance cameras used to enforce or monitor traffic violations. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As enacted, specifies that any member of the superseded judges' retirement system who fails, through error of the state, to receive a retirement benefit to which the member is entitled to is entitled to that member's retirement benefit plus interest of 5 percent per annum, calculated on a monthly basis, from the date the payment should have been made through the date of payment; applies to benefits payable from April 1, 2008, to January 1, 2009. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 36 and Title 8, Chapter 37.
As enacted, "PFC John H. McCree Memorial Bridge," S.R. 11 in Giles County.
As enacted, changes word "tax" to "fee" in statement appearing on bill for storm water fees. - Amends TCA Section 68-221-1112.

As enacted, requires a child-placing agency to collect medical and social history on a foster child and child's biological family within 30 days of foster care placement. - Amends TCA Section 36-1-113 and Section 37-2-403.

As introduced, requires local law enforcement agencies to implement an endangered missing persons alert program, whereby local law enforcement agencies will have set protocol to investigate reports of missing elderly, or mentally or physically disabled persons. - Amends TCA Section 38-6-121.

As introduced, requires order review hearing before the petroleum underground storage tank board to be conducted in accordance with statutes as well as rules and procedures adopted by the board. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 49; Title 67 and Title 68.
As enacted, enacts the "Uniform Child Abduction Prevention Act." - Amends TCA Title 36.
As introduced, makes certain changes to the school start dates, administration of TCAP for non-proficient students, and the reporting of such results. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires the TBI to remove all data on a sexual offender from the sexual offender registry within 30 days of receipt of notice of the offender's death. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5 and Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.

As enacted, allows a municipality to contract with another collecting official within the same county to outsource processing of property tax relief applications. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 7.
As introduced, alters the acceptable time for foreclosure sales to noon to 7:00 p.m., rather than 10:00 a.m. through 4:00 p.m. - Amends TCA Title 35, Chapter 5, Part 1; Title 45 and Title 47.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of human services to report to the house health and human resources committee and the senate general welfare, health & human resources committee on or before February 15, 2011, concerning recommendations about the disability determination process under the social security law. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 50 and Title 71.

As introduced, makes public names of applicants for admission to the bar in this state; makes public the reason for a person being denied admission to the bar. - Amends TCA Title 23, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As enacted, implements and describes certain coverage limitations and benefits provided by the life and health insurance guaranty association. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 12.
As introduced, enacts "Tennessee Farm Winery Law." - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, revises certain requirements in the group health and life insurance plans for state employees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27.
As introduced, lowers the fee authorized to be charged for deferring the presentment of a check or for making a title loan. - Amends TCA Title 45.
As enacted, allows Walking Horse Hotel in Bedford County to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As enacted, encourages economic efficiency in state government through utilization of innovative approaches and methodologies. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As introduced, removes the reporting requirements from the black fly suppression program. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 6, Part 5.
As introduced, reduces minimum amount that applicant must have available to conduct business in order to qualify for pawnbroker's license from $75,000 to $50,000. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 6.

As introduced, removes authorization for commissioner of revenue to make certain disclosures concerning the Tobacco Manufacturer's Escrow Fund Act to the attorney general upon request. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 43 and Title 67.
As introduced, requires that TCAP tests be given no earlier than May 1. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 60.
As introduced, adds member to the Douglas Henry State Museum Commission. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 20, Part 3.
As introduced, exempts certain military health care officers from $400 professional privilege tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 17.

As introduced, requires licenses issued by the department of commerce and insurance and licenses required to work as athlete agents, lobbyists, and K-12 public school teachers to be denied, suspended, or revoked, if student loans are not paid. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 49 and Title 56.

As enacted, authorizes treating physicians of patients being treated under workers' compensation law to refer such patients for pain management; establishes a presumption that a patient who is beyond the expected period of healing but who is referred to pain management to be at maximum medical improvement for workers' compensation purposes upon the earlier of the date that the treating physician determines the patient to be at maximum medical improvement or 104 weeks after the commencement of pain management.

As introduced, requires director of legislative administration to develop and implement plan for general assembly to reduce use of paper by 10 percent by 2015. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4, Chapter 3 and Title 65.

As introduced, specifies that medical payments coverage is not subject to hospital liens; limits a hospital's recovery of damages for lien impairment to the amount of the policy coverage. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 22.

As enacted, prohibits the advertising, promotion, and sale of international driver's licenses; establishes that such practices and other related acts violate the Tennessee Consumer Protection Act; imposes certain civil penalties on such violations. - Amends TCA Title 47.

As introduced, requires any contest of a primary election to be heard by an administrative law judge appointed by the secretary of state and conducted as a contested case hearing. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 17.

As enacted, removes provision that requires a county to pay the state for the actual daily cost to the state for the length of stay of a child in state custody after such county exceeds 300 percent of the state average commitment rate for dependent and neglected children or delinquent children; requires department to provide report regarding commitments to state custody; authorizes collaborative planning process. - Amends TCA Title 37.

As enacted, removes the district attorney general from the list of participants involved with the independent local advisory board for each county in which the multi-level response system, which is used to protect children from abuse, is operating. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 5.

As enacted, specifies that drug court grant funds may be used to fund mental health services for drug court treatment participants, in addition to funding substance abuse treatment and other direct services for drug court treatment participants.
As enacted, "Tallent Bridge," U.S. Highway 27 in Rhea County.

As introduced, directs the comptroller to study traffic surveillance cameras, places a two-year moratorium on new cameras, and revises fines from traffic violations captured by such cameras. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As enacted, extends certain for-hire motor carrier provisions to any motor vehicle transporting passengers who are TennCare enrollees eligible for such transportation services under TennCare. - Amends TCA Title 65.

As introduced, authorizes human resource agencies and development districts to obtain governmental service plates for registration by use for vans used for such entities' activities. - Amends TCA Title 13 and Title 55.
As introduced, requires court-ordered alcohol or drug treatment programs be operated by certain entities. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.

As introduced, requires TSSAA to have member schools perform background checks on applicants for coaching or coaching assistant positions, including volunteer positions, before having contact with students. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, adds University of Tennessee System and Board of Regents as recipients of THEC's annual report on scholarship and grant programs data. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 49.

As introduced, requires the department to submit a report concerning the standards for parental involvement in public schools that it has developed to the chairs of the senate and house education committees by November 1, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, revises the castle doctrine to prohibit a person from criminal prosecution or civil action in the use of force which is justified; directs the commissioner of commerce and insurance to determine whether there are impediments inhibiting insurance companies from underwriting coverage for such events. - Amends TCA Section 39-11-622 and Title 56.

As introduced, requires all contracts for goods or services being purchased that are entered into between a county and an LLC include a requirement that the LLC shall disclose the name of each partner before the contract becomes effective; such disclosure to be posted on the countys web site, with sufficient information to identify the respective contract. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As enacted, authorizes attorney general to disclose to cigarette manufacturers information concerning number of cigarettes sold with manufacturer's tax stamp affixed in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.

As enacted, authorizes certain facilities in Dekalb County, Cumberland County, and Henry County to sell alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As introduced, increases amount debtor may claim as exempt personal property from $4,000 to $10,000. - Amends TCA Title 26.

As enacted, allows a court to modify the terms of a will in manner that is not contrary to the testator's probable intention in order to achieve the testator's tax objectives and the court may provide that the modification has retroactive effect. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 3 and Title 32, Chapter 3.

As introduced, clarifies that person may redeem property by paying money to the clerk within one year of date of order of confirmation of sale, evidenced by county register of deeds records. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-2702.

As introduced, clarifies that an owner, lessee, or occupant of land does not owe a duty of care to a trespasser on such land and is not liable for any injury to a trespasser on such land. - Amends TCA Title 29.

As introduced, authorizes a board established under a mayor-aldermanic charter to, by ordinance, create shorter, transitional terms for board members at the next regularly scheduled municipal election in order to coincide with a new municipal election date. - Amends TCA Title 6.

As introduced, allows a full-time POST-certified law enforcement officer to carry issued but blank subpoenas during course of official duties; permits the officer to complete and serve the subpoena at the scene of a crime or during the course of an investigation. - Amends TCA Title 38.

As enacted, authorizes commissioner, when awarding certain federal transportation enhancement grant funding for acquisition of scenic or historic sites to contract with certain civil war preservation organizations for use of such funds. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.

As introduced, revises property tax freeze income limit reference to the most recent decennial census to include reference to the American community survey five-year estimates released in the year following the most recent federal census. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-705.
As introduced, reduces the period of time permitted for compromise and settlement of future medical benefits in a case. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

As enacted, revises definition of "project" in industrial development corporation statute and authorizes certain assistance, including certain revenues, in cases involving a central business improvement district and an industrial development corporation. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53.
As enacted, authorizes supervision of psychological examiners by senior psychological examiners. - Amends TCA Section 63-11-202 and Section 63-11-206.
As enacted, specifies that TRA has no power in regard to standards for carbon dioxide transported via interstate pipeline that is subject to the federal Natural Gas Pipeline Safety Act.
As enacted, increases from $25,000 to $150,000 the value of an institutional fund for which modification of a restriction on a gift instrument is permitted. - Amends TCA Section 35-10-206.
As introduced, requires state insurance committee to establish a supplemental health insurance program that pays cash benefits for state employees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27.
As enacted, revises fees for medical records provided by certain health care providers. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As introduced, requires a party, or the party's attorney or agent, to pending civil litigation against a local governmental entity to make requests for records from the local governmental entity in compliance with the Tennessee Rules of Civil Procedure governing discovery. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.
As introduced, allows for modification of a garnishment judgment up to 90 days prior to the judgment being satisfied. - Amends TCA Title 26.
As introduced, increases the fine for assaulting a sports official of a school-sponsored activity to $5,000. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

As introduced, provides that no arrest warrant or criminal summons shall issue without the written approval of the applicable district attorney if the affiant knows the person to be arrested or summoned is a law enforcement officer. - Amends TCA Title 40.

As introduced, requires courtroom security committee of each county to establish guidelines by October 1, 2010, for allowing guide dogs and other service dogs into courtrooms in that county. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 2, Part 5.
As enacted, expands the daily commercial carrying capacity for whitewater rafting in the lower Ocoee River Recreational Area. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 13 and Title 11, Chapter 3.
As introduced, clarifies and adds to the duties of county administrators of elections. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 12.

As enacted, establishes requirements for actions brought by a creditor to recover a balance still owing on an indebtedness after a trustee's or foreclosure sale of real property secured by a deed of trust or mortgage and for judgments awarded in such actions. - Amends TCA Title 25; Title 28 and Title 35.

As introduced, requires fair market value of property to be taken by eminent domain be based on the highest and best use of such property. - Amends TCA Section 7-56-207; Title 64, Chapter 2, Part 3; Title 65, Chapter 6, Part 1 and Title 65, Chapter 14, Part 1.
As introduced, requires health care plans to include or offer coverage for custom fabricated and fitted prosthetic devices; exempts TennCare. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, changes the time prior to an election for a person to file a notice requesting such person's write-in ballots be counted from 50 days to 80 days prior to the general election. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, requires all contracts for goods or services being purchased that are entered into between the state or a county and an LLC include a requirement that the LLC shall disclose the name of each partner before the contract becomes effective; such disclosure to be posted on the state's or countys web site, as applicable, with sufficient information to identify the respective contract. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1, Part 1 and Title 12, Chapter 4.

As introduced, authorizes fundraising for office of governor by members of the general assembly and the governor during legislative sessions; requires funds not expended to be returned to donors or to charitable organizations. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 2, Chapter 5.
As introduced, prohibits physicians on sexual offender registry from treating children under 18 years. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2 and Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 2.
As introduced, limits reproduction of handgun carry permit records. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-504.
As introduced, prohibits the spending of public funds on the support or opposition of any referendum. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, prohibits members from voting on measures that financially directly benefit them or members of their immediate families; excludes voting on the general appropriations act. - Amends TCA Title 3.
As introduced, requires public assistance benefits be reimbursed from lottery winnings over $600. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes postsecondary educational institutions to not use the term "technical" in their name or designation. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 20.

As enacted, broadens authority for Shelby County government and municipalities therein to convey real property to nonprofit community development corporations for creation of affordable housing by authorizing such conveyances for any purpose that deemed proper to inure to the public benefit. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-2509.

As introduced, authorizes fair market value bid when less than amount due for taxes, interest, penalties, and the collection costs at tax sales of certain types of real property located in empowerment zones or renewal communities in Shelby County. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires that in municipalities in which charter provides for separate runoff election independent of primary election for municipal office, the runoff may be held not less than 30 days after the primary election. - Amends TCA Section 2-3-206.
As introduced, creates local emergency management agency trust fund; creates qualifications for local emergency management directors. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 58, Chapter 2.
As introduced, authorizes lump sum death benefit to beneficiary for noncontributory member dying prior to retirement as if such member had been a contributory member. - Amends TCA Section 8-36-107.

As introduced, requires THEC to periodically review the reduction in force policies in effect in public institutions of higher learning and make recommendations to the governing boards the of the University of Tennessee and the state university and community college systems and the house and senate education committees. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 49.
As enacted, grants up to 12 administrative leave days in a calendar year for state employees who are TSEA board members to attend board meetings. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, requires liability insurance be maintained on all motor vehicles operated in Tennessee and requires insurance companies to electronically notify department of revenue when coverage is sold, renewed, or terminated. - Amends TCA Title 55 and Title 56.

As introduced, adds to the offense of perjury any false statement made, not under oath, or any affirmation of the validity of, the use of, or introduction of evidence by a person during an official proceeding that the person knows to be false, and further classifies perjury committed by a licensed attorney to be a Class E felony. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, entitles employers to retain an administrative fee of $5.00 from the judgment debtor each time payment is made to the court for amounts of an employee's disposable earnings subject to the garnishment. - Amends TCA Section 26-2-222.
As introduced, authorizes certain all-terrain vehicles to be registered and operated on certain municipality or county highways, at discretion of such local governing body. - Amends TCA Title 55.
As introduced, "Specialist Jesse Harold Archer Memorial Bridge," Bridge No. 82-B-383-0.24 in Sullivan County.

As introduced, deletes requirement that the department pay for children in state custody based on a county's child population and the average state commitment rate per 1,000 children. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 2.

As introduced, extends the time when applicant for licensure as a social worker who has requisite educational experience can apply for license without examination from December 31, 2010, to December 31, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 23, Part 1.

As introduced, provides that the publication requirement mandated by Article XI, Section 3, is satisfied if the proposed constitutional amendment is timely posted on the official web site of the secretary of state or on the official web site of the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 2.

As introduced, adds the board of trustees for the University of Tennessee and the board of regents for the state university and community college system to the recipients of a THEC report on the lottery scholarship and grant programs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, creates limited excise tax exemptions for businesses having annual profits of less than $100,000 or between $100,000 and $200,000 for FY 2010-2011 and 2011-2012. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12, Chapter 3; Title 45, Chapter 8; Title 56, Chapter 7 and Title 67.
As introduced, requires that method of determining FICA withholding that results in least amount being withheld be utilized for separately issued longevity payments. - Amends TCA Section 8-23-206.

As introduced, requires commissioner to report annually on tourism promotion activities in Tennessee River Resort District jurisdictions. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As enacted, extends membership in the Tennessee consolidated retirement system to all employees instead of just the administrative employees of certain participating employers; and makes other revisions regarding the retirement system and retirement benefits under the system. - Amends TCA Sections 8-34-101(46)(B), 8-34-206(d), 8-34-321.

As introduced, changes the amount of contributions that must be paid by an employee of certain local governmental units who has three years of service prior to the unit joining the Tennessee consolidated retirement system in order for that employee to be a member of the retirement system. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36; Title 8, Chapter 37 relative to Tennessee Consolidated Retirement System and to amend Title 8, Chapter 38, Part 1.

As enacted, authorizes local government entity eligible to participate in the Tennessee consolidated retirement system to elect to participate in any deferred compensation program for state employees, subject to approval of the chair of the retirement system. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 25, Parts 1 and 3.
As introduced, creates a public higher education capital facilities program. - Amends TCA Title 9 and Title 49.

As introduced, requires THEC to report on the status of in-service training funds at public institutions of higher education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

As introduced, requires the AccessTN plan to provide a special subsidy for persons disenrolled from medical assistance under TennCare following loss of eligibility for Supplemental Security Income (SSI); the special premium assistance subsidy shall be set each year in the general appropriations act. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 71.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Food Desert Relief Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9; Title 13; Title 67, Chapter 5 and Title 68.

As enacted, allows employers to pay employees via electronic automated fund transfer into an account in the name of the employee or by credit to a prepaid debit card from which the employee is able to withdraw or transfer funds. - Amends TCA Section 50-2-103.

As introduced, requires administrative office of the courts to develop form for use by person who was arrested for criminal offense but charge was disposed of in manner making the records of such charge subject to expungement; person whose charge was dismissed entitled to form as evidence of favorable disposition of charge. - Amends TCA Title 40.
As introduced, broadens definition of dealer to include persons making sales of new tires by Internet. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 16 and Title 68, Chapter 211, Part 8.

As introduced, extends the time period for filing a petition for review of an order or assessment concerning a petroleum underground storage tank from 30 to 34 days after issuance of the order or assessment. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires TDOT to develop program to provide transportation challenge grants to local governments willing to match larger share of federal or state funding for transportation projects. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 2.
As enacted, allows LEAs greater flexibility in extending the school day in order to offset days used for professional development or weather-related closings. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3004.
As introduced, "Specialist Jesse Harold Archer Memorial Bridge," Bridge No. 82-B-383-0.24 in Sullivan County.

As introduced, requires the department of education, in consultation with UT and TBR, to evaluate the effect of cooperative innovative high school programs on job creation in the schools' communities. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 49.

As enacted, authorizes courts to void a summons for improper service if the service of the summons is made upon an employee of the garnishee rather than the garnishee, and such employee is also the judgment debtor. - Amends TCA Title 26.

As introduced, requires that the department accept electronic signatures on the IRS Form 8850 Pre-screening Notice and Certification Request for the Work Opportunity Credit. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 14; Title 47, Chapter 10 and Title 50.

As enacted, prohibits schools and boards of education from separating multiple birth siblings into different classrooms solely due to such children being multiple birth siblings. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3102.

As introduced, authorizes veterans with at least a 50 percent service-connected disability as certified by the veterans' administration to receive a 50 percent reduction in room fees in all state park inns and cabins and on greens fees on certain golf courses in state parks. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As enacted, revises provisions governing approval required for teachers to take personal leave. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 7.
As introduced, increases unemployment security benefits by $50.00 per week. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.
As introduced, requires a teacher be paid for supervision of extracurricular activities at an hourly rate equivalent to the teacher's salary. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, removes authorization to transfer funds from the agricultural resources conservation fund, local parks acquisition fund, state lands acquisition fund, and wetland acquisition fund to the state general fund. - Amends TCA Section 4-3-1016.

As introduced, establishes a ceiling of 100 percent for interest rates on payday loans; defines "payday loan" as short-term cash loan or funds provided to an individual in anticipation of future receipt of wages. - Amends TCA Title 45.
As introduced, prohibits a payday lender from providing loans to borrowers via the Internet, regardless of whether the lender is located inside or outside Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 45.

As introduced, requires the department of financial institutions to impose a fee of $2,500 on every payday lender at each of their business locations; creates special financial literacy trust fund. - Amends TCA Title 45.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee's Transitioning Youth Empowerment Act of 2010." - Amends TCA Title 37.

As introduced, makes certain changes to juvenile records requirements for law enforcement and juvenile courts and deletes the juvenile records task force. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 4 and Title 37, Chapter 1.

As introduced, establishes that a child left in the care of a relative caregiver for 18 months or more pursuant to a power of attorney instrument shall not be subject to dependent and neglected child proceedings. - Amends TCA Title 34, Chapter 6, Part 3; Title 36 and Title 37.

As introduced, requires that Prevent Child Abuse Tennessee provide child abuse prevention services for one year prior to application of grant funds from the child abuse fund instead of six months. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39, Chapter 13 and Title 40.

As introduced, specifies commissioner is able to contract with an entity, rather than governmental entity or nonprofit entity, to manage schools placed in achievement school district. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1 and Chapter _____ of the Public Acts of 2010 (Ex. Sess.)(Senate Bill 5 / House Bill 10 of the First Extraordinary Session).
As introduced, provides for modification of language on existing welcome signs for Metropolitan Nashville-Davidson County to read "Music City USA" in addition to "Home of the Grand Ole Opry."

As enacted, creates a mechanism in Davidson County, effective until June 30, 2012, for certain persons whose driver licenses have been suspended to apply to be allowed to pay outstanding judgments at a reduced rate. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12, Part 1 and Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 5.

As introduced, requires that a person be in full compliance with the Financial Responsibility Law of 1977 prior to having vehicle registration approved or renewed. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires secretary of state to publish schedule of dangerous drugs on secretary's official web site and make hard copies of schedules available on request. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.
As introduced, enacts the "Ben Nelson Act to Ensure Political Integrity." - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 16.

As introduced, corrects cross-reference in statute establishing factors for magistrate to consider when setting bond for person charged with stalking, sexual offenses, or order of protection violation. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13 and Title 40, Chapter 11.

As enacted, allows person with handgun carry permit to possess handgun in establishment where alcohol is served, provided it is not posted and person does not consume alcohol; specifies penalties for violations. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13; Section 57-3-204 and Section 57-4-203.

As introduced, requires any issuer of a Medicare supplement policy to not deny or condition the issuance or effectiveness of any Medicare supplement policy nor discriminate in the pricing of a policy because of the health status, claims experience, receipt of health care, or medical condition of an applicant in the case of an application for a policy that is submitted within 30 days of an annual policy anniversary date in which the applicant is currently enrolled. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, increases from "$100-$1,000" to "$200-$2,000" the range of the civil penalty that may be charged to a health care provider that renders excessive or inappropriate services. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.
As introduced, extends the deadline from March 1 to April 15 for businesses to file schedules with property assessor detailing personal property. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-903.
As introduced, adds the hallucinogenic drug 4-bromo-2, 5 dimethoxyphenethylamine (2C-B) to list of Schedule I controlled substances. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As enacted, enacts the "Teacher Code of Ethics." - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3 and Title 49, Chapter 5.
As enacted, authorizes bicycles to proceed through intersections with inoperative vehicle detection devices due to the weight of the bicycles. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-110.

As introduced, requires board of regents and UT board of trustees to report to the house and senate education committees whether instruction aimed at increasing the awareness and prevention of hate crime offenses, sexual battery, sexual harassment, and date rape are being offered to all entering freshmen during orientation or introductory studies at each of their respective institutions. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, clarifies the appeals process for tenured teachers who are dismissed by a local board of education; requires that if the commissioner of education who is initially appointed to the teacher evaluation advisory committee as chairperson ceases to be the commissioner of education because of resignation or retirement, then such former commissioner remains a member of the committee until the committee ceases to exist. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of education to report findings and recommendations on the system of competitive grants and technical assistance to the chairs of the education and finance, ways and means committees. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 49, Chapter 17; Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 1; Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 7 and Title 49, Chapter 9, Part 4.
As enacted, revises provisions governing state's subrogation interests. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 1.
As enacted, requires food service establishments that sell imported catfish or imported catfish products to label such catfish or catfish products as "imported" on their menus. - Amends TCA Title 53.

As introduced, allows TDOT or local government entity to advertise for bids on its web site, instead of by publication in newspapers, before awarding transportation enhancement grants. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 5, Part 1.

As enacted, mandates, rather than allows, release of surety's liability if detainer request is refused or if detaining authority releases principal upon the detainer's filing. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-201.
As enacted, changes references in several titles of Tennessee Code Annotated from "mental retardation" to "intellectual disability." - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 39; Title 41 and Title 49.

As introduced, requires comptroller to report annually total number of new telecommunication towers constructed in the previous calendar year to commerce committee chairs. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7; Title 39 and Title 65.
