As introduced, prohibits employers from prohibiting employees possessing a handgun carry permit from transporting and storing a firearm out of sight in a locked vehicle on any property set aside for vehicles; prohibits employer from terminating, demoting, or other discrimination against such employees. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As enacted, requires that the judge, upon finding that the respondent violated an order of protection or court approved consent order, order the respondent to post a bond of at least $2,500 until such time as the order of protection expires; specifies other requirements in regard to the bond, forfeiture of the bond and proceeds from a judgment for the amount of the bond. - Amends TCA Section 36-3-610.
As introduced, revises treatment of common carrier by motor vehicle from certain employments excluded from the Worker's Compensation Law. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.
As introduced, requires a radiologist assistant to work in the employment or direction of a radiologist. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As introduced, authorizes up to five days administrative leave per annum for TSEA district directors attending association meetings. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 50.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of honorably discharged registration plates to civilian veterans of the United States Army Corps of Engineers. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, authorizes consumption of alcoholic beverages at restaurants within one mile of Reelfoot Lake. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As enacted, allows LEAs to use reasonably obtainable information in determining whether a student who dropped out of school enrolled elsewhere; allows LEAs to include GEDs in calculating graduation rates for all purposes other than those in which such inclusion is prohibited by federal law. - Amends TCA Section 1-3-118 and Title 49.
As enacted, removes the June 30, 2010, termination date for the energy efficient schools council.
As introduced, eliminates the 18-month period of time in which certain permits may be issued for outdoor advertising in particular locations. - Amends TCA Section 54-21-116.

As introduced, clarifies that the department of safety is not authorized to issue a motor vehicle operator's license of any kind to a person who has a prior conviction for a violation of DUI within the past five years unless such person provides proof that such person has a functioning ignition interlock device installed and fully operational on all motor vehicles operated by such person. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 29; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 55; Title 68 and Title 71.
As enacted, revises provisions governing the composition of the commission on firefighting personnel standards and education. - Amends TCA Section 4-24-104.

As enacted, adjusts terminology to reflect data collected through the American Community Survey instead of the census long form questionnaire. - Amends TCA Section 1-3-105; Section 7-59-303; Section 13-23-103; Section 40-28-202; Section 67-5-705 and Section 68-202-601.

As introduced, creates search committee to recommend to the governor candidates for the position of executive director of the state film, entertainment and music commission. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 50.

As introduced, provides that any municipal electric system that provides cable or Internet services shall be subject to regulation by the Tennessee regulatory authority. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 52, Part 6.
As enacted, enacts "Katie Beth's Law," which requires pool alarms in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 47 and Title 68, Chapter 14.

As introduced, allocates a sum sufficient from the premium tax collected for workers compensation insurance to pay for the staff of the advisory council on workers compensation instead of making retention of council's staff subject to budgetary approval in the general appropriations act. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-121.

As enacted, revises the current requirements concerning information that must be contained on the outside of the envelope containing the bid to also require such information be included in an electronic bid; removes criminal penalty for noncompliance and instead authorizes civil penalty of up to $5,000. - Amends TCA Section 62-6-119.

As enacted, specifies that if a party withholding retained funds in regard to a construction contract fails to deposit the funds into an escrow account, the party would be responsible for paying the owner of the retained funds an additional $300 per day for each day that the retained funds are not deposited into an escrow account; specifies failure to deposit retained funds into an escrow account within seven days' receipt of written notice regarding such failure is a Class A misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 34, Part 7.

As introduced, clarifies that the only bid preferences that are permissible in public construction projects of local governments are those created by the general assembly by general law; prohibits local authorization for bid preferences for contracts unless general assembly specifically authorizes such actions to occur. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4, Part 8.
As enacted, allows any school resource officer who witnesses an offense by a student receiving special education to take the student into custody. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 10, Part 13.

As introduced, lengthens suspension of requirement that sole proprietors and partners maintain workers compensation insurance on themselves from March 28, 2011, until June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 3; Title 39, Chapter 11; Title 50, Title 56.

As enacted, creates a procedure for certain persons engaged in the construction industry to file for an exemption from obtaining workers compensation insurance to cover themselves; creates an employee misclassification advisory taskforce. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 3; Title 29; Title 39, Chapter 11; Title 50; Title 56, Title 68 and Chapter ___ of the Public Acts of 2010 (Ex. Sess.)(Senate Bill 1 / House Bill 7 of the First Extraordinary Session).

As enacted, revises the tax on unauthorized substances based on the decision of the Tennessee Supreme Court in Waters v. Farr to impose the tax on the merchant of unauthorized substances. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 28.
As introduced, creates an incentive for 911 districts to consolidate or select the direct dispatch method. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86.
As introduced, creates pilot project for reverse 911 notification system to notify persons of severe weather warnings and emergency information. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86.
As enacted, requires blasters to file a notice with commerce and insurance prior to the blast occurring. - Amends TCA Section 68-105-103.
As enacted, allows a local education agency to issue a diploma to a student who failed to receive a diploma due to service in the Vietnam War. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-119.

As enacted, requires the commissioner of revenue to offset any state tax refunds of $200 or more that are owed to a taxpayer by the amount of any debt that the taxpayer owes to a state agency or to any person on whose behalf a state agency acts to collect a debt; makes the present law system of submitting asset disclosure forms to inmates mandatory rather than discretionary; revises other provisions relating to tax refunds. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4; Title 18; Title 36, Chapter 5; Title 41, Chapter 21, Part 9; Title 49, Chapter 4; Title 50, Chapter 7; Title 67, Chapter 1 and Title 71, Chapter 5.

As introduced, directs that an injunction, restraining order, declaratory judgment, and other types of orders and pleadings cannot be issued or filed in lawsuits challenging state taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1.
As introduced, prohibits the state employee health plan or its contractors or third-party administrators from entering into exclusive contracts with hospitals in Putnam County. - Amends TCA Title 8.
As introduced, establishes a procedure for closing child protective services observation and assessment centers. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 37.
As introduced, clarifies that abortions performed during viability of the fetus must be performed in a hospital. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 2.

As introduced, requires parental or legal guardian consent for further testing or storage of blood or biological samples taken from a newborn for purposes other than the required test to be performed on the newborn. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title 68, Chapter 5.

As enacted, authorizes any municipality or municipal agency to participate in, sponsor, conduct, or administer a cooperative purchasing agreement for the procurement of certain supplies and services; revises other provisions regarding purchasing by local government unit. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3, Part 10.
As enacted, "Larry Lively HoPE Center," Taft Youth Development Center.

As enacted, revises provisions governing restrictions on the right of an employed or contracted healthcare provider to practice the healthcare provider's profession upon termination or conclusion of the employment or contractual relationship. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As introduced, prohibits any person involved in an accident with an insured from filing a claim against insured's policy if such person is not at fault. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 11.

As introduced, requires mandatory mediation between a bank or other financial institution and a borrower before foreclosure proceedings may be instituted on a deed of trust, mortgage, or other lien securing the payment of money or other thing of value. - Amends TCA Title 35 and Title 45.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of general services to develop guidelines to require a contractor or subcontractor who resides outside Tennessee to hire Tennessee citizens insofar as practicable when contracting with the state or local governments. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 12.

As enacted, prohibits sexual or violent sexual offender who is required to be on the sexual offender registry from establishing a primary or secondary residence with two or more other such offenders; prohibits person, corporation, or other entity from knowingly permitting more than three such sexual or violent sexual offenders to establish a primary or secondary residence in any house, apartment, or other habitation owned or under the control of such person, corporation, or entity. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39.

As enacted, revises provisions governing a corporation using its funds in regard to an election; prohibits contributions to candidates; authorizes use of funds for communications regarding election or defeat of candidate; specifies reporting requirements and exceptions. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 2, Chapter 19.
As introduced, requires psychologists to receive three hours of continuing education provided by the Tennessee Psychological Association. - Amends TCA Section 63-11-218.
As introduced, adopts the "Tennessee Taxpayer Equality Act of 2010." - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15, Part 6 and Title 67.
As enacted, classifies the Ryman Auditorium in Nashville as a "historic performing arts center" for purposes of consumption of alcoholic beverages on the premises.
As introduced, requires owners of all types of rental property to have photo electric smoke detectors in areas of high customer occupancy or be subject to a $1,500 fine. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, requires any local government undertaking a mass transportation project to notify TDOT's division of multimodal resources. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3; Title 4, Chapter 31, Part 12; Title 13, Chapter 10; Title 54, Chapter 4; Title 64, Chapter 8 and Title 67, Chapter 3.
As introduced, establishes aspects of a grievance procedure for certain public higher education employees. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires certain commissioners and agency heads to certify to comptroller that state employees could not have been used instead of contracting with outside entities in rendering services required under certain contracts. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8 and Title 12.
As enacted, designates procedures for delinquent tax sales when delinquent taxes are owed to both municipality and county. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 25.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Appraisal Management Company Registration and Regulation Act." - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 39.
As introduced, creates misdemeanor offense of possessing open container of alcoholic beverage within passenger area of motor vehicle on public highway. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.
As enacted, authorizes the provision of group medical health insurance for support staff of an LEA. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27, Part 3.
As introduced, exempts out of state couples who are married in Campbell County from paying the additional $62.50 imposed on the issuance of a marriage license. - Amends TCA Section 36-6-413.

As introduced, requires persons operating vessels on waters of the state to stop such vessels, if safe, upon a signal of an emergency vessel, and to obey any other reasonable signal given in directing the movement of traffic on such waters. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 9.

As enacted, requires TBI to maintain a DNA database of certain juvenile sexual offenders and adds an adjudication of delinquency for an act which if committed as an adult would constitute aggravated rape of a child to the list of acts for which a court shall require a juvenile to submit a DNA sample. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires any person selling alcoholic beverages, wine, or beer to a person under the age of 21 to serve a mandatory minimum period of incarceration of 48 hours; conforms various code references to minor to reflect the more correct age 21 language. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39; Title 40; Title 54, Chapter 4; Title 57, Chapter 3; Title 57, Chapter 4 and Title 57, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires person 18-21 who is charged with underage purchase or possession of alcohol to cooperate with authorities by revealing the establishment where the alcohol was purchased or who purchased the alcohol for the person in order to be eligible for pretrial diversion. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 15 and Title 40, Chapter 35.

As introduced, grants authority to the comptroller to audit the books of the public defenders conference, post-conviction defender, and administrative office of the courts pertaining to payment of funds for indigent defendants. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14; Title 16, Chapter 3, Part 8; Title 40, Chapter 30, Part 2 and Title 40, Chapter 14, Part 2.

As enacted, authorizes drug testing of students who participate in extracurricular activities if reasonable indications that student may have used or is under influence of drugs; requires LEAs testing students for drugs to have policies and procedures for assisting students testing positive. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-4213.
As introduced, requires carbon monoxide alarm detectors to be installed in all residential structures. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 120, Part 1.

As enacted, directs the department of health to encourage physicians to provide a publication dealing with umbilical cord blood banking to a woman by the end of her second trimester. - Amends TCA Section 68-32-105.
As enacted, increases the aggregate amount that a debtor can claim for a personal property exemption from $4,000 to $10,000. - Amends TCA Title 26.

As enacted, redefines "formula rate," with regard to bonds or other obligations issued by an energy acquisition corporation on or before June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 39 and Title 45, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of education to consider the costs to and the benefits for certain local school health collaborations in developing a coordinated school health program. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 71.

As introduced, removes additional unemployment insurance benefits payable to claimants with minor children, and deletes increases in benefits during high unemployment periods. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires contribution limits for individuals, political campaign committees controlled by a political party or caucus, and multicandidate political campaign committees be increased to reflect percentage of change in average consumer price index in every odd-numbered year starting in 2011. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 2, Chapter 19.
As introduced, increases time for written notice of completion of public work from within 90 days to within 180 days. - Amends TCA Section 12-4-205.

As introduced, allows franchise and excise tax credit for donations to certain charitable organizations that provide scholarships to Tennessee residents to attend Tennessee nonpublic elementary and secondary schools. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires policies and rules of the department of health to be fully consistent with the recommendations of the Centers for Disease Control concerning excluding children from school for head lice. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 68.

As introduced, includes in definition of "employer of a lobbyist" for corporations, associations, and other organizations persons who are in-house counsel, corporate officers, board members, and persons in government relations or oversight of government relations positions. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As introduced, increases from two to four the minimum number of hours of direct care that nursing homes must provide to each patient every day. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

As introduced, increases the punishment for kidnapping, aggravated kidnapping, and especially aggravated kidnapping by one classification if the defendant falsely imprisoned the victim for 14 days or more. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 3.

As introduced, establishes standards for drawing samples to test water quality of the Pigeon River and requires such samples be used as the primary data for analysis of the river's water quality. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3.

As introduced, sets ASHRAE Standard 90.1-2007 as the minimum requirements for energy use in new buildings other than one-family and two-family dwellings and townhouses. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 19, Part 1.
As enated, authorizes the allocation of state sales tax revenues to eligible counties in which commercial development zones are located. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
As introduced, creates an electronic high school. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, enacts the "Mercury Product Disposal Control Act." - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.
As introduced, authorizes employees of any company or municipality that provides electricity to cut trees or limbs that could affect the electric power lines. - Amends TCA Title 6 and Title 7.
As introduced, authorizes municipalities or counties to allow all-terrain vehicles on certain highways under such entity's sole jurisdiction. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, creates Class D felony for possessing a prescription drug, which was acquired outside of Tennessee, with the intent to sell such drug. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 1.

As enacted, changes the hearing date for an inmate to be released from a mental retardation facility from 21 days to 21 business days of receipt of notice to the court; changes the notice from the court to the facility from 15 days to 15 business days. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 5, Part 4; Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, appropriates $100,000 from the solid waste management fund to department of environment and conservation for removal of tires and associated debris from Nolichucky River.
As introduced, clarifies the meaning of the visible commencement of operations related to construction services and products. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 11, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 5.

As enacted, clarifies property that is excluded from being defined as a heliport in a tourist resort county is limited to private property used for the landing of a privately owned and operated helicopter for private non-commercial purposes. - Amends TCA Section 42-8-101.

As introduced, requires the secretary of state to send applications submitted by LLCs and LLPs to the state board licensing any professional services a member or partner renders. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 249; Title 61, Chapter 1 and Title 62.

As introduced, requires commissioner to maintain at least one dog trained to detect contraband telecommunication devices at each correctional facility. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 6; Section 39-16-201 and Title 41.
As introduced, removes authority to implement a private amusement tax on whitewater rafting on the Ocoee River. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-330.
As enacted, revises provisions governing vacation lodging services; requires such services to have a vacation lodging service firm license. - Amends TCA Section 62-13-104.

As enacted, requires the department, in consultation with the department of environment and conservation, to conduct a study relative to recurring flooding near the Sunshine Community in Blount County caused by clearing a landslide from the highway running parallel to the Little River into such river. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54 and Title 69.

As introduced, requires the University of Tennessee system and the board of regents to provide biennially their policies for minimizing costs of textbooks and course materials to the chairs of the senate and house education committees. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, changes the signage requirements for landowners who desire to prohibit hunting on their property; revises the exemption from storm water user fees for owners of agricultural land. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.
As introduced, deletes a repetitive provision of the code that is already and more appropriately addressed elsewhere. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires ethics commission to report annually the number and names of employees filing consulting disclosures in the previous calendar year to the appropriate employing authority. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10, Part 1; Title 8 and Title 10, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires TACIR to perform a study and provide recommendations to encourage the minimizing of solid waste in landfills and report to the legislature by February 15, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 202; Title 68, Chapter 211; Title 68, Chapter 212 and Title 68, Chapter 213.
As introduced, exempts from sales and use tax prescribed blood glucose monitoring devices. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
As introduced, requires run-off elections for members of Congress if no person receives a majority of the total votes cast. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16 and Title 2, Chapter 8.
As introduced, revises commitments for housing rehabilitation loans. - Amends TCA Title 13 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 4.
As introduced, clarifies the meaning of the visible commencement of operations related to construction services and products. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 11, Part 1.

As enacted, removes the authority of the governor to commandeer or limit the sale or transportation of firearms, ammunition, or firearm or ammunition components during a state of emergency, major disaster, or natural disaster. - Amends TCA Title 58, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As introduced, changes the requirement for undergraduate full-time attendance at public institutions of higher education from 12 semester hours to 14 semester hours. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4; Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

As introduced, allows HOPE eligible student, under certain circumstances, to regain a HOPE scholarship lost by leaving an eligible two- or four-year postsecondary institution, where the student had a HOPE scholarship, and enrolling at a Tennessee technology center, if the student subsequently returns to an eligible two- or four-year institution. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As enacted, authorizes the sale and consumption of alcoholic beverages on the premises of the Clayton Center for the Arts in Blount County. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-101; Section 57-4-102 and Section 57-4-301.
As introduced, expands beneficial end use of recycled, shredded tires to include other landscaping applications. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 202; Title 68, Chapter 211 and Title 68, Chapter 21.

As introduced, requires the department of environment and conservation to provide planning models for relocating, hauling, composting, or other processing of yard waste and food waste and to submit a report to the house conservation and environment committee and the senate environment, conservation, and tourism committee by December 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 202; Title 68, Chapter 211 and Title 68, Chapter 212.

As introduced, states that any person who requires emergency assistance from the division of parks and recreation on state park grounds shall reimburse the division for any costs associated with the assistance provided. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 3.
As enacted, creates "retired" licensure status for licensed surveyors. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 66, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As enacted, authorizes sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption at Country Boy Restaurant in Leiper's Fork in Williamson County and Memorial Auditorium and Tivoli Theater in Chattanooga. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4.
As enacted, "Bob Brown Administration Building," new TDOT building in Chattanooga.

As enacted, enacts the "Tanner Lee Jameson Act," which requires that when a school receives its first AED, the school must place the AED in the gymnasium or, if there is no gymnasium, a readily accessible location in an area used for physical education or activity. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 68, Chapter 140, Part 7.

As enacted, requires the board of medical examiners to enter into an agreement with the federal department of homeland security concerning enforcement of federal immigration laws, which may include participation in SAVE program. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title 68.

As enacted, grants special consideration for Tennessee service-disabled veteran owned businesses, similar to the consideration given to women owned businesses, in the awarding and procuring of state contracts. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3, Part 8.
As introduced, changes certain procedural requirements for counties making appropriations to nonprofit charitable organizations. - Amends TCA Section 5-9-109.

As introduced, clarifies that the bureau is subject to the one-year statute of limitations in which to file a claim against an estate; removes the requirement that the personal representative submit a release or waiver prior to closing an estate. - Amends TCA Title 30, Chapter 2 and Title 71, Chapter 5.
As introduced, extends until July 1, 2011, the initial issuance period for I RECYCLE new specialty earmarked license plates. - Amends TCA Section 55-4-304.

As introduced, directs the commissioner of health to report to the senate general welfare, health and human resources committee and the house health and human resources committee on or before February 15, 2011, concerning the issues surrounding and the impact and history of a provider tax involving hospitals. - Amends TCA Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, provides for health and sanitation rules governing offices, clinics, and centers of certain health care providers. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 63 and Title 68.
As introduced, removes restrictions on gifts from lobbyists and requires reporting of gifts by lobbyists. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6.
As enacted, revises law regarding the apportionment and collection of taxes in which a tax lien has been placed on personal property in which a secured party has an interest. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, provides for directional signs to Gospel Chapel on S.R. 251 in Davidson County.

As introduced, requires state registrar of vital records to promulgate rules to include as part of the certificate of birth process a system that would identify whether or not the parents choose to establish paternity through genetic or DNA testing. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 3.
As introduced, prohibits use of traffic surveillance cameras to enforce or monitor traffic offenses. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.
As enacted, revises requirements for registered sex offender to attend conference at school or similar place as parent and to drop off or pick up child at school. - Amends TCA Section 40-39-211.

As introduced, requires certain DUI offenders to operate only a motor vehicle that is equipped with a functioning ignition interlock device. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 29; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 55; Title 68 and Title 71.

As enacted, authorizes accident prevention courses that qualify for premium rate reductions for older drivers to be offered online, subject to the approval of the commissioner of commerce and insurance. - Amends TCA Section 56-7-1107.

As introduced, requires any private entity that provides probation supervisory services to post a performance bond in the amount of $50,000 instead of $25,000. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 3, Part 9 and Title 40.
As enacted, clarifies that municipalities may by ordinance adopt all provisions of law included in the rules of the road for local enforcement. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 3.

As introduced, creates a presumption that an infectious disease acquired by a firefighter, paramedic, emergency medical technician, or emergency medical technician advanced was suffered in the line of duty unless the contrary is shown by competent evidence. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51, Part 2.
As introduced, creates the separate Class C felony offense of manufacturing methamphetamine in a residence in which a child less than 13 years of age resides. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As enacted, clarifies that it is a Class B misdemeanor for any person, other than one carrying out clean up of the quarantined property, knowingly to inhabit quarantined property; to enter onto quarantined property without federal, state, county or municipal government authorization; to offer such property to the public for temporary or indefinite habitation; or to remove any signs or notices of the quarantine. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 12, Section 503.

As introduced, adds the offense of attempt to commit murder in the first degree to list of offenses for which a defendant must serve 85 percent of the sentence imposed by the court. - Amends TCA Title 40.

As introduced, provides that a person who solicits a minor to commit a sexual offense and travels in, to, or from this state for the purpose of completing the solicited offense commits the same classification of offense as the most serious offense solicited. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As introduced, creates Class D felony offense of intentionally discharging a firearm into an unoccupied habitation and Class C felony if the habitation is occupied. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As introduced, deletes provision permitting juvenile court to retain jurisdiction over a juvenile who has been transferred to adult court if the juvenile is acquitted in criminal court or the charges are dismissed. - Amends TCA Title 37, 39, and 40.
As introduced, authorizes county governments to adopt local preference purchasing policies. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3.

As introduced, creates Class C felony of manufacturing methamphetamine in residence where child under 14 resides or within 200 feet of any such residence; requires mandatory minimum sentence of six years to be served consecutive to any other sentence. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As enacted, deletes the requirement that a person being photographed must be readily identifiable in order for the offense of unlawful photographing to be committed; redefines "penal institution" for purposes of the provisions regarding obstruction of justice. - Amends amend TCA Title 39.
As introduced, adds conduct involving strangulation to the point of unconsciousness to the criminal code definition of "serious bodily injury." - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As enacted, directs that any appeal of a final judgment of a writ of error coram nobis is heard and determined by the court of criminal appeals instead of the supreme court. - Amends TCA Section 40-26-105.

As enacted, revises the substances that give rise to a DUI, so that it is unlawful to operate or be in control of a motor driven vehicle while under the influence of any intoxicant, marijuana, controlled substance, drug, substance affecting the central nervous system or combination thereof that impairs the driver's ability to safely operate a motor vehicle by depriving the driver of the clearness of mind and control of himself which he would otherwise possess.

As enacted, allows a court, when setting bail for a defendant arrested for certain alcohol related offenses and such defendant has prior convictions for certain alcohol related offenses or is currently already released on bail for certain alcohol related offenses, to order monitoring devices or in-patient treatment as a condition of release and requires the court to determine whether the defendant is a danger to the community prior to release. - Amends TCA Title 40.

As enacted, revises provisions governing which court will make determination of violation of implied consent law; revises other provisions governing implied consent law. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.
As introduced, eliminates deferral of proceedings prior to trial and consolidates methods for deferral of criminal proceedings under judicial diversion. - Amends TCA Title 40.

As introduced, adds a reckless act resulting in the death or serious bodily injury of another while operating a motor vehicle or watercraft in this state to the acts for which a crime victim may receive compensation from the Criminal Injuries Compensation Fund. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 13.
As introduced, prohibits the use of public funds for bottled water for employees and visitors to public buildings unless potable water is not available. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As enacted, establishes a certificate of birth resulting in stillbirth. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 3.
As introduced, requires legislative approval prior to adoption of regulatory programs concerning greenhouse gas or motor vehicle fuel economy. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, expands the use of automatic dialing equipment to authorize public schools to notify parents and guardians of school closures due to inclement weather. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 15 and Title 65, Chapter 4.
As introduced, requires approval of the general assembly before a permanent rule becomes effective. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires that at least one of the six educator members of the textbook commission be an employee of an LEA that consistently ranks among the state's top five LEAs based on enrollment. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
As enacted, extends the Tennessee court of the judiciary, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 17, Chapter 5.
As introduced, enacts the "Public Safety Employer-Employee Cooperation Act." - Amends TCA Title 4, to enact the Public Safety Employer-Employee Cooperation Act.
As enacted, sets the priority as to who has the right to dispose of a dead body through cremation. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5, Part 5.

As introduced, increases from 120 to 125 days a retired employee drawing benefits may return to service temporarily in a position covered by TCRS during a twelve-month period. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36.

As enacted, adds office of legislative budget analysis as recipient of various information and reports. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15, Part 5; Title 4; Title 7, Chapter 86, Part 1; Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 7; Title 9; Title 29, Chapter 37, Part 1; Title 37, Chapter 3, Part 1; Title 50, Chapter 7, Part 4; Title 64; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, requires 30 days notice prior to disconnection of utility service to state government users. - Amends TCA Title 65.
As introduced, authorizes additional year of creditable service for members serving in certain employment restricted positions. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 34, Part 6.

As introduced, requires the comptroller to report to the finance committee of each chamber and the joint TennCare committee concerning provider taxation involving hospitals by February 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

As enacted, permits association captive insurance companies to insure obligations under certain federal legislation that provides compensation and benefits to workers for job-related injuries, and further allows association captive insurance companies to hold any interest in qualified headquarters property. - Amends TCA Title 50 and Title 56.
As enacted, establishes requirements for authenticating or issuing execution upon a foreign judgment. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 19; Title 20; Title 21; Title 25; Title 26; Title 29 and Title 45.
As enacted, enacts the "Freedom From Coercion Act." - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 10, Part 3; Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 2; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires the county mayor to be a high school graduate or have acquired a GED, except such requirement does not apply to any person currently holding the office of county mayor. - Amends TCA Section 5-6-104.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for Tennessee Soccer; proceeds from such plates allocated to Tennessee State Soccer Association for programs and services that foster growth of youth through soccer. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, clarifies that certain private act metropolitan hospital authorities are not exempt from antitrust law, federal or state, otherwise applicable to private hospitals. - Amends TCA Section 7-57-501 and Section 7-57-502.
As introduced, requires the commissioner of financial institutions to submit certain reports concerning title pledge lending on an annual basis. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 15.

As introduced, changes from 25 percent to 50 percent the percentage of ownership required to be determined in control of a corporation and increases the length of time that a licensee must notify the department of financial institutions of a change in location or name before such change from five to seven days. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 17.

As introduced, establishes federal standards for federal recognition of Native American Indian tribes as the state standards for state recognition of Native American Indian tribes. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, adds to types of projects that industrial development corporations located in municipalities having a central business improvement district may undertake. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53.

As enacted, authorizes creation of regional airport authority by three or more municipalities and counties and at least one political subdivision of another state. - Amends TCA Title 42, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As enacted, enacts the "Annual Coverage Assessment Act of 2010." - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, directs the commissioner of health to develop a plan for ensuring that 90 percent of pregnant women in this state have access to prenatal care and to report concerning such plan to the house health and human resources committee and the senate general welfare, health and human resources committee by February 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, revises procedural requirement for challenging a tax sale in Shelby County. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-2504.

As introduced, permits a court to order a physician to give a deposition after a reasonable period of time instead of 90 days and provides that a nominee name for medical director in the workers compensation program may only appear on one list for appointment. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

As enacted, establishes duty of care of landowners, lessees and occupants of land whose land is entered by others for recreational non-commercial aircraft operations or recreational non-commercial ultra light operations on private airstrips. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 7.
As introduced, defines food and shelter for both livestock and non-livestock animals for the purposes of animal offenses. - Amends TCA Section 39-14-201.

As introduced, assesses all costs against a person or entity for continuing appeals following the first appeal challenging the decision of the health services and development agency granting a certificate of need to a hospital filing the application. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 16.
As introduced, revises coverage requirements for autism spectrum disorders. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, creates a Tennessee Advisory Commission on Autism Spectrum Disorders. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 68.

As introduced, changes the department of mental health and developmental disabilities' report to legislative committees on the impact of the available suitable accommodations statute from quarterly to monthly. - Amends TCA Title 33.

As introduced, requires criminal background checks on persons seeking renewal of locksmith licenses, exempts locksmiths with 10 years experience from continuing education requirements; sets license renewal fee at not less than $200. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 11, Part 1.

As introduced, clarifies that the duties of the Capitol Commission include establishing a policy relative to historical commemorative statues and monuments on the capitol grounds as well as on the Bicentennial Mall. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 8.
As introduced, imposes certain new coverage requirements for chemotherapy for cancer. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, requires the TennCare bureau to provide the prescription drug utilization review committee with information concerning enrollees who suffer from prevalent disease states. - Amends TCA Section 71-5-190.

As introduced, repeals statutory requirement that no one-family or two-family dwelling be approved for connection of new electric service unless the dwelling is equipped with at least one smoke detector. - Repeals TCA 68-120-111.

As introduced, clarifies that the employee representative on the advisory council on workers compensation from organized labor must be selected from a list of three "nominees," instead of "names," provided by the state labor council of the AFL-CIO. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 50 and Title 56.

As enacted, authorizes the treasurer to set a minimum dollar value for unclaimed property paid or delivered to the treasurer that requires the mailing of a notice instead of requiring that the minimum value be $50.00; and authorizes the treasurer to claim unclaimed property from any other state on behalf of any Tennessee state department, agency, board, commission, or institution, including a public institution of higher education. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 29, Part 1.

As enacted, requires each local government participating in the local government investment pool to transfer electronically to the pool any funds the local government desires to be invested in the pool. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 7.
As introduced, removes the definition of "task force," which was previously repealed in 2001, from present law regarding collateral pools for public deposits. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4.
As introduced, removes the definition of "task force," which was previously repealed in 2001, from present law regarding collateral pools for public deposits. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4.

As introduced, prohibits participation of magistrates or other certain government officials or employees from serving on an assessment appeals commission unless such persons receive only compensation in lieu of expenses or a per diem payment for services. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, sets the incentive amount for biodiesel manufacturers paid from the biodiesel manufacturers' incentive fund for fiscal year 2010-2011 at $0.40 per gallon. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3.

As introduced, authorizes all LEAs to operate innovative educational programs instead of only 24 school systems, and further allows principals implementing a plan for such programs to not have to consult with faculty beforehand. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1.
As introduced, requires the operators of driver education and DUI classes be subject to certain standards. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.
As enacted, enacts the "Financial Literacy Program of 2010." - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires that the annual valuation of the assets and liabilities of the Tennessee baccalaureate education system trust funds include the amount of any unfunded accrued liability of the program. - Amends TCA Section 49-7-804 and Section 49-7-820(d).

As introduced, increases the fine a judge may assess against the parent of a child adjudicated unruly for truancy from $50.00 to $100 and the number of hours of community service from five to 10. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.

As introduced, renames the "division of intellectual disabilities services" to the "division of developmental disabilities services." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12; Title 33; Title 63; Title 67 and Title 71.

As introduced, entitles property owner to recoup certain costs incurred in contesting eminent domain action from the condemning authority. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 20; Title 29, Chapter 16 and Title 29, Chapter 17.
As introduced, revises the appointment, authority, and duties of the select oversight committee on education. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15, Part 3.

As introduced, defines a restaurant on a boat dock located in a jurisdiction that has elected Tennessee River resort district status as having inside capacity of 40 and outside seating capacity of at least 200. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As enacted, specifies method of determining the rate of interest on Build America Bonds issued on or before June 30, 2012, by convention center authorities. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 89 and Title 47, Chapter 14.
As introduced, permits grain assessments to continue when grain indemnity fund exceeds $3 million, if greater amount is approved by referendum on producers. - Amends TCA Title 43.

As introduced, requires inspection by county agricultural extension agent of livestock animal that has been allegedly abused to be preceded by similar inspection by qualified representative of law enforcement agency investigating such allegation. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 43.

As enacted, authorizes sales of alcoholic beverages on charter boat departing certain premier type tourist resort in Jefferson County; revises geographic requirement for a facility to qualify as premier type tourist resort in Jefferson County; also adds Pinecrest Golf Course in Gibson County. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes licensed winery to conduct business at not more than two additional satellite facilities. - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, requires bureau of TennCare to mandate use of a standardized billing system for nursing home Medicaid claims by MCOs. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, directs the comptroller to review statutory financing available to local governments and make suggestions that would improve the credit ratings, reduce bond insurance costs, and improve the sale of securities by local governments; requires that comptroller file report with appropriate committees of general assembly by March 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 10; Title 12 and Title 49.
As introduced, excepts the office of the county register from the requirement of collecting the $5.00 archives and record management fee per document filed. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-408.
As introduced, requires the commissioner to review certain aspects of products being sold by insurance producers. - Amends TCA Title 45; Title 48 and Title 56.

As introduced, requires the agency proposing any new rule, amendment to a rule, or repeal of an existing rule to prepare a statement of benefit and transmit the proposal to the fiscal review committee for an analysis of the fiscal impact of the proposal. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 7; Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 1 and Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2.

As enacted, requires information be provided on the projected financial impact of rules and regulations proposed to be promulgated during a fiscal year. - Amends TCA Section 3-2-107; Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.

As introduced, prohibits the state emergency communications board from requiring the board of directors of any emergency communications district to hold more than 50 percent of the district's operating budget in reserve. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86.

As enacted, creates a procurement commission, state protest committee, procurement office, and an advisory council on state procurement and regulates the procurement, management, contracting, and disposal of goods and services by the state. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 12.
As enacted, authorizes the Sewanee Inn to sell alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As enacted, authorizes a local government to seek criminal background checks with the TBI or FBI for applicants for beer permits. - Amends TCA Section 57-5-103.
As introduced, authorizes a local government to require criminal background checks on applicants for licenses or permits from the alcoholic beverage commission. - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, requires proof of insurance before registration or renewal of registration for a motor vehicle will be issued. - Amends TCA Title 55 and Title 56.
As introduced, revises procedures governing approval of settlements of workers compensation cases by courts. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.
As introduced, decreases from four to three the maximum number of lawsuits in which a witness must prove personal appearance. - Amends TCA Title 24, Chapter 4.
As introduced, prohibits appropriations to certain program in fiscal year 2010-2011 and allocates savings to certain programs. - Amends amend TCA.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of Catholic Charities new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to Catholic Charities of East Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, establishes uniform markers along highways to commemorate persons killed in crashes. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 5.
As introduced, establishes a new pilot project on the donation and redispensing of prescription drugs. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10 and Title 63.

As introduced, requires the solid waste disposal control board and department of environment and conservation to demonstrate specific compliance with Public Chapter 462 of 2007 before taking any action concerning solid waste regulation. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for Western Kentucky University (WKU); allocates funds from sale of such plates to Music City Alumni Chapter of WKU to be used for funding scholarships for Tennessee students attending WKU. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires that Share the Road new specialty earmarked plates be redesigned for reissuance; redesign to be made in consultation with Jeff Roth Cycling Foundation and the majority caucus whip of the house of representatives. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires the commissioner to establish pilot programs modeled after the fetal-infant mortality review program and the mother resources program and to report the data to the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 37 and Title 68.
As enacted, clarifies nurses who can work with medication aides. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As enacted, establishes procedures for revocation of license to practice medicine or other restrictions on practice if licensee found to be, after hearing, a person required to register as a sex offender. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2; Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 63, Chapter 9.
As introduced, requires the TBI to report sexual offender registration and certain information to the FBI within 48 hours of receiving such information. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, prohibits traffic citations for failure to stop completely before turning right at an intersection based solely on evidence from surveillance cameras. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.

As introduced, requires a sufficient number of photographs of a building be taken, if requested by the owner or occupant of the building, as a part of the pre-blast survey, to document the structural integrity of the interior, exterior, foundation, and roof of the building prior to the blast. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 105, Part 1.

As introduced, places restrictions on types of services a dentist must provide based on a contract between a dental plan of a health insurance entity, health maintenance organization, dental service plan or other service plan organization and a dentist. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, requires any public water system or waterworks system that discontinues the fluoridation of its water supply to give notice of such discontinuance to applicable state agencies and affected customers. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221.
As introduced, authorizes repeal of Tennessee River Resort District status by two-thirds vote of municipal legislative body. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-103.
As enacted, creates the Class A misdemeanor of harboring or hiding a runaway. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4.

As introduced, creates Class D felony offense of statutory kidnapping, which is removing a person between 13-18 years of age from this state, where the defendant is at least four years older than the person, knows the person being removed is a minor and knows the defendant does not have the consent of the minor's parents or guardian to remove the minor. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 3.
As introduced, "Southport Community Bridge," S.R. 245 in Maury County.
As introduced, changes the required holding period by a humane society before destroying an abandoned animal from 72 hours to 120 hours. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.

As enacted, defines "employee" for the purposes of the prohibition on a deposition being taken by an employee of one of the parties or of an attorney for one of the parties. - Amends TCA Section 24-9-136.

As introduced, authorizes municipalities with zoning regulations to adopt ordinance to terminate nonconforming establishments or uses following a period of amortization from five to 20 years. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 7, Part 2.
As introduced, adds zoning violations and violations of building codes to definition of types of nuisances that can be abated by the courts. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 3.

As enacted, allows Davidson County as well as Shelby County and municipalities within to enact ordinance allowing for district attorney to petition general sessions court for destruction of dangerous dogs. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 17, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes any county or municipality, instead of just specified ones, to petition the general sessions court for the destruction of dangerous dogs instead of the district attorney general petitioning the circuit court of the county where the offense occurred for destruction of the dog. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 17 and Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 2.
As enacted, revises various provisions of the Tennessee Court Reporter Act of 2009. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 20 and Title 24.

As introduced, makes the offense of animal cruelty applicable to all animals and requires that a person intentionally rather than knowingly deprive an animal of food or water in order to commit the offense. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.
As introduced, requires nurses to provide updated contact information to the board of nursing when renewing their licenses. - Amends TCA Title 10; Title 49; Title 53; Title 63 and Title 71.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of revenue to remove a non-participating manufacturer from the directory if another state has removed the manufacturer from its directory for failure to pay escrow funds. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 26.

As enacted, requires all state employees who are supervisory personnel to be physically present in Tennessee while supervising employees working in this state, unless business reasons require out-of-state travel. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30, Part 2.

As introduced, defines public depository to include any state or federally chartered financial institution that has its main office located in this state, for purposes of the management of county government funds. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 8, Part 2; Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 5.
As enacted, authorizes circuit court judges in Davidson County having domestic or probate jurisdiction to appoint one or more persons to act as masters. - Amends TCA Section 17-2-123.

As introduced, requires state to purchase voter-verifiable paper ballot printers for any direct record electronic (DRE) voting machine in use in this state for the 2010 regular November election. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, makes physical therapy, occupational therapy, and speech and language pathology services available as essential services under medical assistance on and after July 1, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for Lion's Club; allocates funds from sale of such plates to each Lion's Club in Lawrence, Lewis, and Wayne counties for programming. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, extends hours when pawnshops can be open from "8:00 am to 6:00 pm" to "8:00 am to 9:00 pm." - Amends TCA Section 45-6-212.

As introduced, removes limited time periods within which headlights are required and creates new requirement that headlights be displayed at all times a motor vehicle is operated on public highway; violation is a Class C misdemeanor punishable by fine of $2.00 only. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8 and Title 55, Chapter 9.
As introduced, requires the bureau of TennCare to use the same reimbursement methodologies for public and private providers of ICF/MR services. - Amends TCA Section 71-5-105.

As introduced, allows alcoholic beverages to be sold for on premises consumption in unincorporated areas of any county that has held a countywide local option election approving liquor-by-the-drink. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3 and Title 57, Chapter 4.

As introduced, allows alcoholic beverages, wine, and beer to be sold for on premises consumption at any location in such jurisdiction that has held a local option election approving liquor-by-the-drink. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As introduced, removes resort in Crab Orchard from definition of premier type tourist resort; removes one of the duplicated definitions of Nashville Shores. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102(24).
As introduced, enacts the "Public Employer-Employee Negotiation Act." - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, prohibits the acceptance, processing, or disposal of radioactive waste material in any landfill located in the state. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 202; Title 68, Chapter 211 and Title 68, Chapter 212.

As introduced, enacts the "Per Diem Reconstruction Act of 2010," which requires the office of legislative budget analysis to conduct a survey of per diem reimbursement rates and other expenses paid to members of legislative bodies in states bordering Tennessee and to report findings to general assembly by February 5, 2011.

As enacted, authorizes any municipality, including those incorporated by private act, to change the date of municipal elections by ordinance to coincide with the August or November general elections and to extend the terms of incumbents to meet the new date so long as no term is extended for more than two years; if date is changed, it can be changed back at a later time, but cannot then be changed again. - Amends TCA Title 6.

As introduced, modifies nursing facility diversion requirements at time of nursing home admission concerning home and community based services. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 33; Title 56; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, directs TSSAA to develop a policy prohibiting athletic events from being scheduled contiguously with commencement ceremonies. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, increases fee to obtain motor vehicle accident report from $4.00 to $10.00. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.
As introduced, raises the fine for violations of safety belt laws to $50.00 and specifies the manner in which such money is to be distributed. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 6.

As introduced, allocates regular portion of funds from Trout Unlimited new specialty earmarked plates to Tennessee Council of Trout Unlimited for distribution to Tennessee chapters, instead of allocating equal amounts to each chapter. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, requires THEC to report the annual student tuition subsidy applicable to students at each public institution of higher education to the house and senate education and finance, ways and means committees. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, urges LEAs to consider the needs of working parents in scheduling parent-teacher meetings. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, revises various provisions governing the reporting of child abuse. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, allows students in graduate degree programs leading to licensure as a teacher to be recipients of a minority teaching fellowship; eliminates limitation on number of awards. - Amends TCA Section 49-4-706.

As introduced, requires semi-annual report of the commissioner of education on school disciplinary actions to be made to the select committee on children and youth as well as education oversight and the senate and house education committees. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.

As enacted, requires survey of extended learning programs to be disseminated by the department of education to all LEAs so that successful programs may be replicated. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

As enacted, requires the commissioner of education to encourage LEAP programs to provide extended learning that is complementary to school curricula. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 6 and Title 49, Chapter 1.
As enacted, authorizes industrial development corporations to finance infrastructure expenses serving certain mixed-use developments. - Amends TCA Section 7-53-312.
As introduced, requires the division of parks and recreation to establish an Internet reservation system by January 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 11.

As introduced, requires the commissioner to strive to minimize conflicts with local building codes when promulgating rules and to consider compliance with such codes to be a mitigating factor when assessing penalties. - Amends TCA Title 5 and Title 68.

As enacted, requires an official from the facility or the department of children's services to notify chief law enforcement officer of the county of an escape from a secure detention or correctional facility by a juvenile who is alleged or adjudicated delinquent for an offense that would be a felony if committed by an adult. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1.

As enacted, requires the weekly benefit amount to be paid by electronic transfer to a specific bank account if requested by the claimant; details requirements for benefits paid by check. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

As introduced, states that an advertisement in Tennessee for the placement of children for adoption in another state by an agency not licensed in this state shall prominently state that the agency or individual is not licensed to do such business in this state. - Amends TCA Title 36.

As enacted, states that a man shall not be a legal parent based solely on scientific testing, without either a court order or voluntary acknowledgment of paternity, but such testing may be a basis for a court of competent jurisdiction to establish paternity. - Amends TCA Section 36-1-102.

As enacted, states that the department of children's services may be found to have made reasonable effort if the department's efforts have exceeded the efforts of the parent or guardian to establish a suitable home for the parent or guardian's child. - Amends TCA Section 36-1-102 and Section 37-2-402.

As enacted, abolishes the requirement to run a publication for an unknown father when there is no legal father at the time the adoption is filed, under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 36-1-117.
As enacted, clarifies that any spouse of a relative is also a legal relative or related. - Amends TCA Section 36-1-102.
As enacted, establishes a presumption that each parent age 18 or older has knowledge of a parent's legal and moral obligation to support his or her child or children. - Amends TCA Section 36-1-102.

As enacted, assesses an administrative fee of $50.00 if a defendant in a termination of parental rights case is provided with court-appointed counsel; specifies that a defendant's willful failure to pay the fee may be considered by the court as evidence of the defendant's financial responsibility, or lack thereof, in any determination of the best interest of the child. - Amends TCA Section 40-14-103.

As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Beverage Container Recycling Act," whereby certain procedures, processes, and fees are described for the recycling of such waste. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211 and Chapter 86.

As introduced, requires the select oversight committee on long-term care to review the implementation efforts of the commission on aging and disability for the Long-Term Care Choices Act of 2008; requires a report to the committee concerning the nursing home transition initiative in the Act by the commissioner of finance and administration. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, revises the licensing of elevators.

As introduced, prohibits a petitioner from making certain arguments in a post-conviction petition when certain admissions by the petitioner in regards to accepting a plea bargain were made. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 30.
As introduced, enacts "Tennessee Health Freedom Act." - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, requires that minimum statewide building construction safety standards be selected from the 2006 International Building Code. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 120, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes real estate agents for a limited function referral office to be from anywhere in the state; defines "limited function referral office" as firm whose sole function is to receive referrals relative to parties seeking to obtain or divest an interest in real estate. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 13.
As introduced, removes "limousine" from list of commercial conveyances and removes the language specifying that the first adjustment shall take effect on November 6, 1984. - Amends TCA Title 3.

As introduced, authorizes a Tennessee historic property preservation or rehabilitation entity to be a limited partnership for determining certain excise tax considerations; revises tourist accommodation tax provisions. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 4 and Title 67, Chapter 4.
As introduced, "Purple Heart Trail," S.R. 33 in Hancock County.
As enacted, requires the board to adopt rules requiring out-of-state home medical equipment service providers to maintain an office within the state. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.
As introduced, sets minimum requirements for energy use in new state buildings. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12; Title 13, Chapter 19 and Title 68.
As introduced, sets minimum requirements for energy use in new state buildings. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12; Title 13, Chapter 19 and Title 68.

As introduced, increases time of effectiveness of orders of protection, specifies that a person who violates an ex parte order of protection is subject to arrest. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6.

As enacted, removes specific authority for Johnson City to implement redevelopment districts with tax increment financing; and provides for allocation and payment of property taxes on redevelopment districts subject to tax increment financing. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 20.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked license plates for University of Tennessee athletics; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to the Tennessee Fund. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, removes requirement that a veteran receive the "Armed Forces Expeditionary Medal" to receive preference points for the Lebanon Expedition, the Grenada Expedition, or the Panama Expedition to be added to the veteran's earned ratings for career service examinations. - Amends TCA Section 8-30-306.

As enacted, creates a special joint committee to study the feasibility of providing relief to senior citizens by freezing or capping their utility rates. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 65.

As enacted, requires the division of parks and recreation to designate one day per year during which access to and use of all state parks, including but not limited to campgrounds and golf courses, is free of charge for all veterans. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 49; Title 58 and Title 71.

As enacted, specifies that the general assembly finds that value for agricultural, forest, or open space land should not be deemed the value of property for any purpose other than a future assessment of rollback taxes, because it does not determine the actual tax liability of a qualifying owner at the time of valuation. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 10.

As introduced, authorizes spouses of military members who leave employment due to military reassignment to qualify for unemployment benefits; requires that state pay such benefits and does not count against employer's experience rating. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.
As introduced, authorizes leave to visit a sibling deployed for military duty out of the country. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, decreases from six to five years the reappraisal cycle required by counties to assess property; decreases from five to three years the alternative reappraisal cycle such counties may adopt upon local approval. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
As introduced, directs TDOT to erect a highway sign on Interstate 24 in Hamilton County designating the exits for Memorial Hospital. - Amends TCA Title 54.

As enacted, adds Pates Ford Marina in DeKalb County to those facilities authorized to sell alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102(24).

As enacted, requires that permanent educational records for students who have been in state custody be forwarded to the department when a department provider agency school ceases operations or when the department no longer contracts with the provider agency. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.

As introduced, requires coordinator of elections to develop and implement policies to preserve and protect integrity and reliability of voting machines and related equipment used in this state in the 2010 regular November election. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 20.

As enacted, provides that no voter may be purged due to a deficient registration form once the administrator has declared the person a registered voter, unless the administrator later determines the voter knowingly made or consented to false information being placed on the registration form or failed to provide a valid signature.

As introduced, requires the commissioner to file an annual report detailing with specificity the status of each economic and community development grant that has been authorized by the general assembly together with his recommendations on whether each grant should be continued, increased, or no longer funded and whether new grants should be developed. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9; Title 10; Title 12; Title 13; Title 49; Title 50; Title 54; Title 64; Title 66; Title 67 and Title 68.
As introduced, specifies that a petitioner has 15 business days from receipt of an order or determination of the technical secretary to appeal. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As enacted, revises various provisions regarding the health equity commission. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15, Part 4.
As introduced, authorizes courts to determine there is a need for additional bondsmen before additional bondsmen are qualified and approved by the court. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11.

As introduced, adds Boat N RV Supercenter in Cumberland County to those facilities authorized to sell alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As enacted, removes provision that would repeal the inclusion of certain nonprofit public benefit corporations as a "governmental entity" in Shelby County. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 20.

As introduced, requires funds deposited into the wildlife resources fund from the sale of new specialty earmarked license plates to be used in accordance with the provisions authorizing issuance of such plates. - Amends TCA Title 70.

As introduced, requires a claimant submitting evidence of actual damages in a personal injury action to submit into evidence the amount charged by providers for any services received as a result of the injury and the actual amount paid by the claimant for such services if the amounts differ. - Amends TCA Title 24; Title 25 and Title 29.

As enacted, specifies that registration requirements for using terms "engineer" and "architecture" do not apply to any person in business in this state in 1998 for the sole purpose of manufacturing and distributing federal aviation administration approved avionic equipment. - Amends TCA Title 62 and Title 63.

As introduced, increases membership of Tennessee heritage conservation trust fund board of trustees from 11 to 13 with the speaker of each respective house appointing one trustee. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 7 and Title 67, Chapter 4.

As introduced, reduces from 90 to 60 days period in which dealer via signed statement can deduct on a return sales tax collected but not yet remitted to commissioner for refunded items. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 54; Title 55; Title 57 and Title 67.

As introduced, extends to nonresidents between 13 and 15 years of age the privilege to fish without a license during one week of the year in same manner as resident junior sportsmen under present law. - Amends TCA Title 55; Title 69 and Title 70.

As enacted, adds Historic Rugby in Morgan County to the definition of premier type tourist resort for purposes of the sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, exempts a legal entity that offers prepaid vision care packages to the public from regulation as an insurance provider, if the packages offered include only discounted payments for eye examinations, frames, and lens and there is no indemnity coverage for these expenses. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As enacted, "Isaac Hayes Memorial Highway," I-40 in Shelby County.
As introduced, removes judicial review of health services and development agency. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 16.

As introduced, allocates increased funds resulting from modifications made in arbitration to the tobacco master settlement agreement in equal amounts to the agricultural reserve account to fund the agricultural enhancement grant program and to the health reserve account to fund wellness and prevention programs. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4.

As introduced, permits city and special school district with boundaries contiguous with the city limits to specify by contract that funding from the city to the district shall be used half for operations of the district and half for bond issue for maintenance and construction at existing schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3.

As enacted, requires a rule-making hearing be conducted for all permanent rules that were previously filed as emergency rules, unless the emergency rule was filed to avoid the loss of federal funds. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2.

As introduced, requires certain government-run proceedings that impose sanctions against a licensed entity to include notice and a hearing before an administrative law judge, and further clarifies that such licensed entity does not have to waive such rights when contracting with the state. - Amends TCA Section 4-5-320.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of blue star family license plates on a revenue neutral basis. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, authorizes an operator of a crematory facility or funeral establishment to dispose of unclaimed cremated human remains after 180 days have passed since the cremation occurred; provided, the operator maintains a record of the disposition for inspection during normal business hours. - Amends TCA Title 62.

As enacted, redefines "eligible independent postsecondary institution" to include institutions that are members of an accrediting agency that is recognized by the U.S. department of education and the Council on Higher Education Accreditation; designates Knoxville College as an eligible independent postsecondary institution for purposes of lottery scholarships. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As enacted, authorizes board to grant reciprocity to a person licensed and employed as a funeral director or embalmer in another state for five years; specifies requirements for nonresident applicants. - Amends TCA Section 62-5-311.

As introduced, directs department of revenue to study benefits and potential hurdles to collecting sales tax on all Internet sales and report to finance, ways and means committees by December 15, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
As introduced, moves moneys collected from civil penalties and damages from the Tennessee environmental protection fund to the state general fund. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 203, Part 1.
As introduced, requires the water quality control board to make final decision on certain appeals and render an order within 120 days. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3.
As introduced, requires LEAs to provide 30 minute lunch period for students and teachers. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, creates a cabinet level department for Tenn Care. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 56 and Title 71.
As introduced, improves retirement benefits of certain Tennessee public employees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36.
