As introduced, extends deadline for special joint committee to study the issues relating to services provided to persons with developmental disabilities, mental retardation, and other disabilities from February 1, 2010, to April 1, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 33.

As introduced, requires insurer to inform claimant that claimant has the right to choose a repair facility to repair a damaged vehicle; prohibits insurer from requiring insured or third-party claimant to use specific business for vehicle repairs. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As enacted, allows highway maintenance or utility vehicles to operate a white, amber, or white and amber light system on any location on the vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 4.

As introduced, allows retired member of the Tennessee consolidated retirement system or retired teacher to work and earn a salary of up to 60 percent of such person's preretirement income while continuing to draw such person's retirement allowance. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 8.
As enacted, expands list of animal related practices that are exempt from veterinarian licensure requirements. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 12.

As introduced, requires a service recipient receiving residential services funds by the division of intellectual disabilities (DIDS) to provide written notice and a reasonable time to cure any issues, to the current service provider before changing service providers. - Amends TCA Title 33.
As introduced, clarifies that communicating a "threat of death or serious bodily injury" instead of "death threat" to a school employee is a Class B misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As enacted, honors the memory of the late Connie Hall Givens by renaming, in her honor, the Coordinated School Health Improvement Act. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 10.

As introduced, specifies that when a defendant commits a homicide or assault against a pregnant woman, the woman's fetus, regardless of viability, is also considered a victim of the offense. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-107 and Section 39-13-214.
As introduced, requires business impact note on general bills upon request of two members of general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 2.
As introduced, revises award program for cost saving employee suggestions. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 27.
As introduced, allows any local education agency to convert to a special school district. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-501.

As enacted, requires that at least one staff member at the Tennessee school for the blind, the Tennessee school for the deaf, and the West Tennessee school for the deaf become certified as a CPR instructor and be responsible for training other members of the school in CPR. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 68.
As enacted, "Emmie Robertson Memorial Highway," segment of S.R. 242 in Lawrence County.

As introduced, authorizes an impact note to be prepared upon request by two or more members of the general assembly that describes the effect on business of any general bill. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 2.

As introduced, authorizes a court to consider in determining whether to enhance a defendant's sentence that the victim was particularly vulnerable due to a deteriorating health condition. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35.

As enacted, authorizes board to call meetings, in addition to annual meeting, with five days notice; clarifies that board may adjourn meetings to any date; revises other various provisions regarding higher education, including provisions governing audits and the Institute for Public Service. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, revises Electric G&T Cooperative Act to authorize certain payments in lieu of taxes; authorizes inclusion of TVA as governmental electric system. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 67.
As introduced, requires TACIR to study effect of court costs and litigation taxes on access to justice. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 16; Title 40 and Title 67.
As introduced, exempts from taxation property owned and operated by a nonprofit national guard association operating a group insurance trust. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 2.

As introduced, requires commissioner to study the feasibility of simplifying the employee log-on and password protection functions of the state payroll system. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 9 and Title 18.
As introduced, specifies that a tax lien or tax sale does not impair the validity of a leasehold or permanent easement where tax on such interest has been paid. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, provides for Tennessee opting out of federal aid highway program and electing instead to retain state's contributions to federal highway trust fund each fiscal year, if and when Congress enacts legislation to permit such action. - Amends TCA Title 54; Title 55 and Title 67, Chapter 3.
As introduced, creates joint congressional communications committee of general assembly; authorizes changing of congressional districts between apportionment. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 3.

As introduced, gives preference to those banks or other financial institutions that agree to provide low dollar loans to Tennessee citizens in making a decision on which banks or other financial institutions shall be the depository of state or local funds. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 9.
As introduced, requires state credit unions in which a majority of its members are state employees to make low dollar loans to its state employee members. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 4.
As introduced, permits the commissioner to deduct the reasonable costs of an audit of a taxpayer before any money received as a result of such audit gets distributed. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, exempts certain employers and employees from certain provisions of the Workers' Compensation Law on religious grounds. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires the department to develop a multi-agency taskforce that shall establish a plan to prepare and enhance the successful reentry of a nonviolent offender sentenced to state prison into the community. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

As introduced, eliminates parole for persons committing an offense on or after July 1, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 9; Title 10; Title 16; Title 33; Title 34; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 55 and Title 71.

As introduced, encourages local education agencies to study the STEP program, or any similar program, and to consider replicating such program in their school districts with the assistance of interested partners. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, adds placement of child at a substantial risk of injury or harm to the definition of child abuse. - Amends TCA Section 39-15-401.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of education in conjunction with the bureau of TennCare to develop a plan for securing federal reimbursements under the Medicaid Administrative Claim program and to report on such efforts. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 71.

As introduced, authorizes the department of transportation to erect signs designating the location of certain cemeteries listed on the National Register of Historic Places; requires payment of such signs by organization managing the cemetery. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 5, Part 7.

As enacted, requires each state governmental entity subject to the requirements of Title VI of the federal Civil Rights Act to submit annual Title VI compliance reports and implementation plan updates to "the human rights commission" instead of "the department of audit." - Amends TCA Section 4-21-901.

As enacted, authorizes voters to approve the issuance of liquor retailer's licenses to manufacturers of products containing alcohol by referendum as an alternative to holding a special local option election; revises provisions governing the serving of samples by a retail licensee manufacturer or distiller. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 2 and Title 57, Chapter 3, Part 2.
As enacted, establishes violations of the Consumer Protection Act concerning covered file sharing programs. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1.
As introduced, revises definition of "district fair" to mean a fair serving at least six, instead of five, counties. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 12; Title 43 and Title 67.

As introduced, makes permanent the temporary suspension imposed by HB7/SB1 of the 2010 Extraordinary Session of the requirement that independent contractors in the construction industry obtain workers compensation insurance. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 3; Title 29; Title 39, Chapter 11; Title 50; Title 56 and Title 62.

As enacted, creates a stand-alone "department of intellectual and developmental disabilities." - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 12; Title 33; Title 36; Title 37; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 45; Title 49; Title 50; Title 53; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 63; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, recognizes commissioner of health as state's e-health coordinator; administratively attaches the Tennessee health information committee to the department of health instead of the department of finance and administration; provides for commissioner of health instead of commissioner of commerce being chair of committee. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 56 and Title 68.

As introduced, establishes accounts for a lottery funded early intervention program; creates grant program to be administered by the department of education. - Amends amend TCA Title 4, Chapter 51 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, adds implementation of the Long-Term Care Choices Act of 2008 to the required duties of the commission on aging and disability and requires the commission to report annually on such activities to the select oversight committee on long-term care. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 13; Title 33; Title 34; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, allows certain special education teachers the opportunity to enroll in teachers' group health insurance during a 30-day period; provided the employing LEA pays any additional costs of providing the coverage. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27, Part 3.

As introduced, requires the board for licensing health care facilities to consider the rights enacted for nursing home residents in developing rules for specific rights for adult care home residents. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11 and Title 56, Chapter 32.
As introduced, requires certain reports to and by the select committee on long-term care concerning recent long-term care reform legislation. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.
As enacted, imposes a statewide prepaid wireless emergency telephone service charge of 53 cents on each retail transaction. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes the Weakley County legislative body and the municipal legislative bodies in Weakley County to make the decision of whether the minimum training requirements for firefighters are to apply within their respective jurisdictional boundaries. - Amends TCA Section 4-24-112.

As introduced, exempts firefighters located within the unincorporated area of Carroll County and any municipality located within Carroll County from the minimum training requirements unless the governing body of a municipality or the county adopts a resolution to apply such requirements within their respective jurisdictional boundaries. - Amends TCA Section 4-24-112.

As introduced, deletes requirement that the department pay for children in state custody based on a county's child population and the average state commitment rate per 1,000 children. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 2.
As enacted, designates fees for certain laboratory procedures conducted by the TBI and allocates proceeds from such fees to a fund for use by the bureau. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6.

As enacted, increases mandatory drug testing fee from $100 to $250 and additionally imposes fine on granting of pretrial or judicial diversion; establishes requirements for use of moneys in the TBI drug chemistry unit drug testing fund. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As introduced, extends period for curing failure to file certificate of compliance with continuing education requirements from 60 days to 90 days. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 8.

As introduced, directs the commissioner of financial institutions to review the practices of financial institutions that sell 26 USC 403(b) tax sheltered annuity plans and offer administration services for such plans to school districts. - Amends TCA Title 45; Title 47 and Title 49.

As introduced, requires board of regents and university of Tennessee board of trustees to develop guidelines to provide academic credit toward certain master's degree programs for certain state government employment. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, authorizes individuals to serve as president or chancellor of state universities with 10 or more years state service in certain positions in lieu of advanced degree. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

As enacted, increases blood alcohol or drug concentration test (BADT) fee from $100 to $250, and adds to present offenses mandating such fine conviction of reckless driving or simple possession or casual exchange of controlled substance; revises manner in which moneys in the TBI toxicology unit intoxicant testing fund are used. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.
As enacted, allows LEAs to donate computers removed from school inventories to low-income families in the school district. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 20.

As enacted, requires each local board of education to develop a policy by which students' TCAP test scores for grades 3-8 will comprise 15 to 25 percent of the student's final grade for the spring semester in the subject areas of mathematics, reading/language arts, and science and social studies; revises provisions governing when TCAP exams are to be administered. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires director of schools to submit salary ratings to the commissioner of education by November 1 rather than December 1 of the school year for which the personnel are elected. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, changes one of the reasons for license revocation or denial of a license to practice nursing from being guilty of a crime to being convicted of a felony. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 6; Title 63, Chapter 7 and Title 63, Chapter 9.
As introduced, permits a discontinuance of service by a natural gas provider for nonpayment to be mailed or sent electronically. - Amends TCA Title 65.
As enacted, provides for an indigent fund to be created for certain purposes once the balance in the pre-need funeral consumer protection account exceeds $2,500,000. - Amends TCA Section 62-5-414.
As introduced, exempts from taxation the sale of school yearbooks. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
As introduced, eliminates the limitation on the local option sales tax for sales of single articles; removes the additional state tax on single articles. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires an organ donor's body to be released to a crematory or undertaker within eight hours of consent being given and the parts becoming available for donation. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, requires that GPS coordinates of facility where waste was baled and destination of baled waste be included on manifest that is required to be kept for at least 30 years. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.

As introduced, authorizes representatives of certified animal control agencies to inspect Class I wildlife, facilities, and records. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 63, Part 2; Title 63, Chapter 12, Part 1 and Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 4.
As enacted, revises the prerequisites for and terms of loans to local governments operating a waste water facility. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 10 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 12.

As introduced, allows a juvenile court to instruct court-appointed special advocates to attend meetings on the child's behalf when the guardian ad litem is unable to attend. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, establishes certain presumptions and conclusive determinations regarding the determination of whether a person is an "employee" or an "independent contractor" for purposes of the workers compensation law. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

As introduced, broadens the offense of harassment to include the offense of communicating by electronic means to another that a relative or other person has been injured, killed, or is ill when the communication is known to be false. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As introduced, provides that a DUI offender may be sentenced as a multiple offender if the offender has a prior DUI conviction, regardless of the dates on which the offender was charged with each DUI. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As introduced, includes web site owners to list of types of media owners who are not liable for any damages for defamatory statements displayed on the web site by another unless the web site owner failed to exercise due care to prevent the publication or utterance of such statement on such web site. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 24.
As introduced, includes illegal sexual contact with a victim's mouth in the offense of aggravated sexual battery. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires local beer board to send notice of any violations by permit holder to alcoholic beverage commission if such permit holder also has a liquor-by-the-drink license; requires commission to send notice of any violations by licensee to local beer board if licensee also has beer permit. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4 and Title 57, Chapter 5.

As introduced, creates additional $500 fine for alcoholic beverage retailers and licensees and beer permit holders for selling alcoholic beverages or beer to any person under 21 years of age. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4; Title 57, Chapter 3; Title 57, Chapter 4 and Title 57, Chapter 5.
As introduced, requires trial judge to adjudge all costs in favor of the prevailing party in all civil cases. - Amends TCA Title 20.

As introduced, permits an original equipment manufacturer headquarters company located only in Hamilton County to apply for a wheel tax exemption on its company vehicles. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 8.

As introduced, increases punishment for perjured sworn testimony before committees of the general assembly from a Class E to Class D felony. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Title 39, Chapter 16, Part 7.

As introduced, requires the board of pharmacy to adopt rules concerning standards and conditions for operation of pharmacies, including, but not limited to, health and sanitation requirements. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 10.
As introduced, adds any relevant acts of deception by either party as a factor of consideration in the division of marital property. - Amends TCA Section 36-4-121.

As introduced, requires judicial assessment of costs and attorney fees based on finding by the senate or house of representatives that an election contest was maliciously or frivolously prosecuted. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 17, Part 1 and Title 3.

As introduced, creates Class C misdemeanor for an owner or employee of age-restricted venue to allow access to its buildings or facilities to persons who are under 21 years of age. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 18.
As introduced, requires licensure of proprietary security organizations. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 35, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits the assessment of civil penalties against a tobacco store owner where an employee sold tobacco products to a minor; immunizes alcoholic beverage store owners from civil liability for employees' sales to underage persons. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 57.

As introduced, prohibits any person who suffers an injury that is caused by another person committing a felony or attempting to commit a felony on the property of another from recovering actual or punitive damages resulting from such injuries from the owner, lawful occupier, or tenant of such property, provided the owner, lawful occupier, or tenant of such property did not participate in or facilitate the commission of such felony. - Amends TCA Title 29.

As introduced, eliminates the authority of the legislative body of Montgomery County to provide suitable office space, office furniture, equipment, and supplies for any member of the general assembly representing such county. - Repeals l TCA Section 3-1-109.

As introduced, authorizes the admission of signed affidavits into evidence at an unemployment hearing occurring on or after July 1, 2010, without such evidence constituting hearsay. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5; Title 24 and Title 50.
As introduced, limits the level of reimbursement that may be paid for in-state air travel by members of the general assembly. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-106.

As enacted, changes incorrect cross-references to definition of domestic abuse victim and domestic abuse. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39, Chapter 13; Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 1 and Title 40, Chapter 35, Part 3.

As introduced, allows a judge to include in a protection order that the respondent attend a certified batterer's intervention program. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 38, Chapter 12, Part 1; Section 39-13-111 and Section 40-35-303.

As introduced, holds a landlord civilly liable for damages resulting from the lessor preventing certain tenant-victims of domestic abuse from being able to alter or end such victim's rental agreement in order to seek safer shelter. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 34, Part 2; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 66.

As introduced, requires advanced practice nurses and physician assistants who perform certain invasive pain management techniques involving the spine to do so under certain direct supervision by a physician. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapters 7 and 19.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for Volunteer Wounded Warriors; allocates all of first year's funds, with regular allocation thereafter, from such plates to Veterans Affairs for assistance with veterans' rehabilitation and care. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, establishes procedure for handling disputes involving future medicals in a workers compensation case after judgment or settlement; extends to workers compensation specialists who hear requests for assistance to provide medical coverage that has been denied by the employer the same authority as trial judges to order attorney fees and reasonable costs, including reasonable and necessary court reporter expenses and expert witness fees for depositions, when conducting a hearing on such an issue. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.
As enacted, authorizes the chancery court clerks to invest idle funds of minor and incompetents in certain manners. - Amends TCA Section 18-5-105.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of health to report with legislative recommendations to legislative committees after consulting with the commissioner of environment and conservation concerning issues involved in disposing of needles. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, authorizes court clerks and local governments to provide public notice by electronic means under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 18.

As enacted, requires that a court, when appointing a lawyer to sit as a special judge for a general sessions judge or a juvenile court judge, state on the record the limitations of such special judge. - Amends TCA Section 16-15-209.

As introduced, requires corporations to file statement of contributions and expenditures when using corporate funds to aid in either the election or defeat of a candidate; requires corporation to disclose such corporation paid for public communication when it expressly advocates the election or defeat of a clearly identified candidate. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 2, Chapter 19.
As enacted, requires that notice of the right to foreclose be sent to debtor prior to foreclosure; requires that specific information be included in notice. - Amends TCA Titles 35 and 45.

As enacted, specifies that when applying the maximum interest rate for bonds issued by the Tennessee state school bond authority with respect to which the local government has elected to have the federal Build America Bonds program apply to such bond, the maximum interest rate will be determined by reducing the interest payable by the authority with respect to such bond by the amount of payments from the U.S. treasury that the authority expected, at the time of the issuance of such bond as a result of the foregoing elections; provisions to expire on June 30, 2012.
As introduced, allows any local education agency to convert to a special school district. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-501.

As introduced, revises provisions concerning state contracting with small, minority owned and women owned businesses; establishes Tennessee small business preference. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3.
As introduced, adopts the "Tennessee Small Business Procurement and Contracting Opportunity Act."

As introduced, applies loans protected under the Tennessee Home Loan Protection Act of 2006 to include purchase money mortgages as well as non-purchase money mortgages; creates a pilot project in Shelby County for voluntary mediation prior to the foreclosure of loans entered into under such act. - Amends TCA Title 35 and Title 45, Chapter 20, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked license plates for Shelby County Ask First Campaign; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to Shelby County Office of Early Childhood and Youth. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, provides buyers involved in home solicitation sales with additional cancellation rights, establishes additional notice requirements for sellers, and allocates the cost of any notary witnessing the signatures to sellers. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 7.

As introduced, enacts the "Tax Cut and Job Creation Act." - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.

As introduced, enacts the "Tax Cut and Job Creation Act." - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.
As enacted, revises provisions governing membership of regional megasite authorities. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 6.
As introduced, creates three additional assistant district attorney general positions by October 1, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 7 and Title 16, Chapter 2.

As introduced, authorizes the Tennessee local development authority to enter into loan or grant agreements with any local government unit, and vice versa, for projects under the Wastewater Facilities Act or the Drinking Water Revolving Loan Fund Act, from funds provided by the federal American Recovery and Reinvestment Act. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221.

As enacted, revises the composition of the state funding board; extends the authority for the sale of certain bonds at private sale to June 30, 2012; establishes interest rate for bonds with respect to which the funding board or local government has elected to have the federal Build America Bonds program apply to such bond. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapters 9 and 21.

As introduced, names the secretary of state as the vice chair of the Tennessee local development authority and removes the requirement that written minutes of the meetings be prepared by the secretary of the authority and be kept on file, open to public inspection. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31.

As enacted, specifies that a government joint venture that supplies or treats water or wastewater for wholesale use only to other governments will not fall under the jurisdiction of the utility management review board or the water and wastewater financing board, as appropriate, for the purpose of reporting negative change in the net assets annually, but will be referred to the board if the government joint venture is in a deficit or default position. - Amends TCA Section 7-82-401 and Section 68-221-1010.
As enacted, abolishes the division of local finance and the division of bond finance and transfers the powers, functions, and duties of such divisions to the comptroller.

As enacted, authorizes the comptroller to require all persons prior to employment with the office of the comptroller to agree to release of investigative records and to supply a fingerprint sample and submit to a criminal history records check; comptroller will pay cost of the background investigations. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 4.

As enacted, revises various property tax provisions including provisions governing assessments of public utility taxpayers and property, transfers of property from one exempt religious institution to another, and assessments of property damaged by disaster certifed by FEMA. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1 and Title 67, Chapter 5.

As enacted, clarifies that under present law regarding the classification and assessment of property taxes relating to public utilities, a motor bus and/or truck company owning or leasing real or personal property located in the state would include those owner operators who operate under such motor bus and/or truck company's motor carrier authority. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As enacted, increases the amounts that may be charged regarding the filing of an application for exemption from property taxes as a religious, charitable, scientific, or educational institution and the costs of a hearing on the assessment of property taxes; and increases the limit on the amount of the processing fees that may be assessed for electronically filed appeals prior to filing of the actual appeal forms from $1.00 per parcel to $2.00 per parcel. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-1501 and Section 67-5-21.

As enacted, removes the exceptions to the requirement that when property has been assessed for property taxation in a county for at least five years, the state board of equalization may not rule that the property is located in a different county; and authorizes the board to redress double assessment in these circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 5-2-115.

As enacted, removes the requirement that the comptroller devise standard procedures to assist the county legislative body in the disposition of funds that are appropriated by the body for the financial aid of any nonprofit charitable organization, any chamber of commerce exempt from taxation, or any nonprofit civic organization, as authorized in present law. - Amends TCA Section 5-9-109.

As enacted, requires a local agency that receives information from the toll-free hotline that receives allegations of fraud, waste, or abuse of public funds to investigate and remedy any illegal, improper, or wasteful activity noted in the information to the same extent that a state agency or community grant agency is required to do so under present law. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 4 and Title 8, Chapter 19.

As introduced, requires the bureau of TennCare to seek a federal waiver to provide bridge Medicaid eligibility to persons formerly eligible due to SSI who were disenrolled from TennCare pursuant to eligibility redeterminations pursuant to Daniels v Goetz until such persons become eligible for Medicare. - Amends TCA Title 50; Title 56 and Title 71.
As introduced, abolishes the oversight committee on long-term care. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5.

As introduced, revises conflict of interest provisions in the Tennessee Uniform Trust Code to refer to "material conflict of interest" instead of "conflict of interest". - Amends TCA Title 35; Title 45 and Title 66.
As introduced, requires mandated coverage of medical nutrition consultations along with medical nutrition counseling. - Amends TCA Section 56-7-2605.

As introduced, limits contracts with directors of schools to terms ending no later than 12 months after the next regularly schedule board of education election. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 2.
As introduced, limits renewal period for contract of director of schools to one year. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, entitles private non-profit institutions of higher education chartered in Tennessee to purchase and contract for the purchase of any materials, supplies, equipment, and services through the department of general services to the same extent the state public colleges, universities, and technology centers may do so. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Section 49-7-127.
As introduced, clarifies enclosure requirements for Class I wildlife. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 4.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of special license plates for the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, clarifies that an employer who knowingly violates  50-2-202 shall be liable for punitive damages. - Amends TCA Title 50.

As introduced, requires housing authorities to give priority in renting or leasing dwelling accommodations to persons who were in the custody of the department of children's services on the person's 18th birthday. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 20.

As introduced, requires TSAC to develop, implement, and administer student loan repayment programs for nurses who perform community service or accept employment with the state. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 49, Chapter 4; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, clarifies that a juvenile court may order that a child be assigned a long-term mentor or receive counseling services if the child is found to be a delinquent child based on conduct involving the use of a firearm and adds any offense involving the use of a firearm to the list of offenses for which a juvenile court may transfer a juvenile to adult court. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, prohibits students who are registered as sex offenders from residing in any on-campus student residence facility. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2 and Title 49, Chapter 8, Part 2.
As introduced, enacts the "Corporate Expenditure Disclosure Act." - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10; Title 2, Chapter 19 and Section 56-3-601.

As introduced, requires highway and bridge projects to receive the approval of the general assembly; initiation of new highway and bridge projects must receive approval of general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 54, Chapter 1.

As introduced, makes permanent the exemption that sole proprietors and partners engaged in the construction industry do not have to carry workers compensation insurance on themselves. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 3; Title 29; Title 39, Chapter 11; Title 50; Title 56, Title 68 and Chapter ___ of the Public Acts of 2010 (Ex. Sess.) (Senate Bill 1 / House Bill 7 of the First Extraordinary Session).

As introduced, requires the department to develop a logo identifying non-agricultural goods produced in Tennessee; allows the department to grant permission to producers of such goods to use the logo. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3.
As introduced, enacts the "Rural Land Protection Act."

As enacted, excepts the office of the county register from the requirement of collecting the $5.00 archives and record management fee per document filed; specifies that county and municipal legislative bodies will be authorized to establish and collect, through the clerks of court, an archives and records management fee of $5.00 for each document filed for the purpose of initiating a legal proceeding. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 10 and Title 68, Chapter 3.
As introduced, revises persons exempt from licensure as an alarms system contractor. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 32.

As enacted, requires any state department, agency, or institution, to procure bids for obtaining appropriate insurance on certain commercial grade vehicles prior to acquiring the vehicle. - Amends TCA Section 9-8-108 and Section 12-3-908(a).

As enacted, adds two law enforcement members to the advisory committee on open government from the Tennessee sheriffs' association and the Tennessee association of chiefs of police and adds one member from the Society of Professional Journalists and one member from the American Association of Retired People to the committee.
As enacted, authorizes certain commercially operated recreational facilities in Blount County containing specified characteristics to serve alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption.
As introduced, clarifies that alcoholic beverages may be served in any structure, location, open air, or dining facility located on Blackberry Farm property. - Amends TCA Title 57.

As introduced, prohibits the sale, distribution, or consumption of alcoholic beverages, wine, or beer between the hours of midnight and 8:00 a.m. at any establishment or facility receiving a license or permit to operate by the state, county, or municipality. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 57 and Title 67.
As enacted, directs that employees of the Board of Regents shall not elect whether to receive longevity pay by separate check until July 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Section 8-23-206.

As introduced, adds a law enforcement member to the advisory committee on open government who is a member of either the Tennessee sheriffs' association or the Tennessee Association of Chiefs of Police. - Amends TCA Section 8-4-602.

As introduced, authorizes the board of claims to establish incentive programs for state departments, agencies, and institutions to reduce liabilities to the risk management fund; and requires any state department, agency, or institution to procure bids for obtaining appropriate insurance on a commercial grade vehicle prior to acquiring the vehicle. - Amends TCA Section 9-8-108 relative to the board of claims and to amend Section 12-3-908(a).

As enacted, removes the present requirement that the law enforcement officials of the county or municipality must also sign the permits for the public fireworks display along with the fire department; requires that a permitee send a written notice to the chief supervisory law enforcement official for the county or municipality where the fireworks display will be held, which states the date, time, and location of the public display. - Amends TCA Section 68-104-211.

As introduced, changes the date a corporation or LLC must submit its annual report to the secretary of state; and revises present law regarding LLCs and LLPs pertaining to the number of members of such an LLC or LLP. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 61.

As enacted, requires that applications and certain documents filed by certain business organizations with secretary of state be accompanied by a confirmation of good standing, a tax clearance for termination or withdrawal, or another similar communication. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 61.

As enacted, authorizes anyone to apply to the secretary of state to furnish a certificate of existence for a domestic LLC, LLP, or LP or a certificate of authorization for a foreign LLC, LLP, or LP. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 61.
As enacted, revises provisions regarding distinguishable names for corporations and partnerships and application for use of a name that is not distinguishable. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 61.

As enacted, authorizes The Company Store and Maggie's Landing in DeKalb County to apply for licensure to sell alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption as premier type tourist resorts. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As enacted, revises Uniform Interstate Family Support Act. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 5.
As introduced, enacts the "Uniform Collaborative Law Act." - Amends TCA Title 29.
As introduced, enacts the "Uniform Environmental Covenants Act." - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 66; Title 68; Title 69 and Title 70.
As introduced, enacts the "Uniform Child Abduction Prevention Act." - Amends TCA Title 36.
As enacted, enacts the "Uniform Unsworn Declarations Act." - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 24 and Title 39.

As introduced, allows legislative body of Davidson County to impose annual $1.00 litigation tax, up to $5.00 maximum, on filings in general sessions and juvenile court for purpose of funding victim-offender mediation centers. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 20, Part 1.

As introduced, requires county to print paper ballots equal to 104 percent of registered voters or petition state election commission to print a lesser number if county can show the 104 percent would be too excessive. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 20.
As introduced, enacts the "Green Jobs Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 68.

As introduced, permits the filing of a petition to probate a will in a small estate solely for the purpose of establishing muniment of title to real estate and personal property. - Amends TCA Title 30, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As introduced, creates equity assessment of 2.25 cents per cigarette on all cigarettes sold by a nonparticipating tobacco manufacturer in this state. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 10.

As introduced, extends temporary tax on bottles of soft drinks and barrels of beer until June 30, 2015, or sooner upon state or federal law enacted imposing mandatory deposits on beverage containers. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 5, Part 2; Title 67 and Chapter 86 of the Public Acts of 2005.
As introduced, requires restaurant to be open four days a week, instead of three days a week, in order to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4.

As enacted, authorizes municipal governments to create an office of administrative hearing officer to hear building and property maintenance code violations. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54 and Title 66.
As enacted, "American Prisoners of War Pathway," Shelby Street Bridge in Nashville.

As introduced, allows the board or members of a G&T cooperative to change any bylaw that potentially exposes the G&T cooperative to legal or regulatory action, and further requires the board to send 30-day written notice of any annual or special meeting in which a recommendation to dissolve the G&T cooperative will be considered. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 69, Part 1.
As introduced, allows the board or members of a cooperative to change any bylaw that potentially exposes the cooperative to legal or regulatory action. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 25, Part 2.

As introduced, requires applicant for coal surface mining permit to demonstrate that best management practices have been followed in mine site preparation for a minimum of five years prior to the date of application. - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 3 and Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 4.

As introduced, requires permit applications, notices of violations, proposed abatements, directors and commissioners orders, and all other enforcement actions and outcomes related to coal surface mining be posted on the department's web site. - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8.
As introduced, enacts the "Property Rights Protection Act." - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 4 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, expands provisions in land reforestation plans submitted in application for coal surface mining permits to include the same percentage of hardwood trees present in undisturbed areas within the same locality. - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 3; Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 4 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, expands criteria for approval of a surface coal mining permit to include the cumulative impact on areas contiguous to the permitted area that are either currently being mined or to be mined within five years of the proposed date for granting the permit. - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 3 and Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 4.

As introduced, prohibits the department of environment and conservation from issuing permits related to surface mining activities under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 59 and Title 69, Chapter 3.
As introduced, enacts the "Common Sense Compliance Act." - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 4 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As introduced, prohibits the creation of new highwall within areas proposed to be mined for coal. - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 3 and Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 4.

As introduced, requires surface mining or reclamation plan revisions to include improvements to at least 70 percent of the permitted land previously disturbed by mining. - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 3 and Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 4.
As introduced, requires water quality testing on land adjacent to coal surface mining sites to assess potential water degradation. - Amends TCA Title 59 and Title 69, Chapter 3.

As introduced, requires notice to persons inhabiting buildings within one-half mile of blasting operations; requires damage surveys be conducted prior to blasting operations. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 105, Part 1.
As introduced, requires TDEC to inspect all coal surface mining operations having retention/sediment ponds to ensure adequate size for heavy rain runoff. - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 4.
As introduced, enacts the "Highest and Best Use Act." - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8.
As introduced, enacts the "Taxpayer Protection Act." - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 4.

As introduced, enacts the "Fair Assessment for Absentee Owners Act," which requires the state division of property assessments, with approval of the state board of equalization, to adopt a consistent, market-based methodology for the valuation of severed mineral rights for coal to be kept by each assessor for property having mineral rights. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-505.

As introduced, enacts the "Water Before Coal Act" which prohibits issuance of coal surface mining permit unless commissioner of TDEC finds such mining would not diminish water resources in the state. - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 4.

As introduced, enacts the "Fish Before Coal Act," which prohibits the issuing of a surface coal mining permit that would impact a stream that has fishing as a designated use, unless the commissioner of environment and conservation makes a finding that the mining activity would not cause a diminution of the stream as a fishing resource. - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 4 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Coalfield Development Act." - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, adds roach clips, rose and pen combinations, cocaine spoons, certain tobacco products, and other items to list of items that are considered drug paraphernalia. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, prohibits sales of certain tobacco products by certain persons and businesses; prohibits sales of certain tobacco products near schools, churches, and other locations. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 47 and Title 67.

As introduced, extends period to petition for review of a civil penalty or damage assessment for violating a municipal storm water ordinance from 30 to 35 days. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 11.

As introduced, requires state agency or political subdivision to disclose, on official web site, owners of vendors operating or maintaining traffic surveillance cameras. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As introduced, requires that in lieu of or in addition to participation in DUI school or an alcohol assessment, the court must order, as a condition of a DUI offender's probation, that the offender attend a victims impact panel if the program is offered in the offender's county. - Amends TCA Section 55-10-403.

As introduced, requires nursing presence in certain residential hospice care only as mandated by patient care needs; applies to residential hospice that solely provides respite or routine home care levels of care to hospice patients. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title 68.
As introduced, "Specialist Jesse Harold Archer Memorial Bridge," Bridge No. 82-B-383-0.24 in Sullivan County.
As introduced, enacts the "Parental Choice Scholarship Act." - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, authorizes a metropolitan government, city, county, or town to impose a pre-disposal fee for the sale of new tires of $1.60 per tire, instead of $1.35 per tire. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 16 and Title 68.

As introduced, authorizes counties having a charter form of government to levy wheel tax for trailers that are required to be registered with the state, by resolution and upon referendum of qualified voters. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1, Part 2.

As enacted, revises provisions governing bail for individuals with mental illness and other provisions governing how persons believed to have mental illness are to be handled when arrested. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11.
As introduced, requires state to fund all expenses related to the implementation of the "Tennessee Voter Confidence Act." - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 20.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of education to report findings and recommendations on the system of competitive grants and technical assistance to the chairs of the education and finance, ways and means committees. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51 and Title 49.

As introduced, requires commissioner to provide written documentation of production project qualifying for film/television incentive grant stating prospective monetary amount of such grant. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 49 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 50.

As introduced, prohibits county designated as non-attainment county from proposing planned growth areas that include certain agricultural property. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 58, Part 1; Title 7, Chapter 53, Part 1; Title 29, Chapter 16; Title 65, Chapter 15 and Title 68, Chapter 201.

As introduced, requires, effective August 1, 2010, each employer including the state and local government to use the e-verify system created by the federal governments to verify the employment eligibility status of any person seeking employment. - Amends TCA Title 50.

As introduced, authorizes a water utility district in the eastern portion of White County with over 1,000 customers to change the manner in which vacancies are filled and commissioners are selected. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82.

As introduced, requires public building authorities to contract for all services, including construction management and design-build services, through a bid process. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 10 and Section 49-2-203.

As introduced, requires, effective August 1, 2010, each employer including the state and local government to use the e-verify system created by the federal governments to verify the employment eligibility status of any person seeking employment. - Amends TCA Title 50.

As introduced, requires multicandidate political campaign committee annual registration fee payable to the registry of election finance to be at least $200. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 2, Chapter 19.

As introduced, requires all state agencies and political subdivisions to verify eligibility of all individuals 18 years of age or older before providing public benefits by using the federal "systematic alien verification for entitlements" or "SAVE" program, with limited exceptions. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 39.

As introduced, clarifies those provisions of law that control challenges for collection of state taxes collected or administered by the commissioner of revenue and those that control the challenges for collection of other state taxes as well as local governmental entities. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 18 and Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 9.

As introduced, requires that no disciplinary action be taken against a law enforcement officer for a pursuit for an actual or suspected violator of a law or ordinance who flees from pursuit unless such pursuit violated pursuit policies established by the law enforcement agency that employed such law enforcement officer at the time of the pursuit. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 40 and Title 55.
As introduced, makes the selling of human breast milk a Class C misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 1.
As introduced, authorizes candidates to enter into payment plans for civil penalties issued by the registry of election finance. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 8.

As introduced, requires each institution regulated by the commissioner to have a written explanation that clearly explains to the customer information concerning any fee assessed by the institution and to provide instructions for employees to clearly explain the fee information if the customer requires further explanation. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, limits the amount of the handling charge assessed to not more than the amount of the check, draft, or order if such instrument is less than $30.00. - Amends TCA Section 47-29-102.

As introduced, requires payor banks to process items sequentially as indicated by the numbers on the bank drafts on the day items are charged against a customer's account; places limits on handling charges for insufficient funds if items are not processed sequentially . - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 4, Part 4.

As enacted, requires that on and after July 1, 2010, as vacancies arise on the board of barber examiners, at least one of the four barber members must be an instructor, owner, employee, or manager of a barber school.

As introduced, requires students to demonstrate through grades or test scores an understanding of the curriculum and an ability to perform the skills required for the current grade before being promoted. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, requires students be allowed to take textbooks that are assigned to the student home in order to study. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 22.

As introduced, allows restaurants to post signs at public entrances permitting people with handgun carry permits to carry in restaurant as long as they are not consuming; provides restaurant owner incurs no civil liability for gun-related injury caused by permit holder. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-1305.
As introduced, creates Class B misdemeanor for corporations using funds to aid in the election or defeat of any judicial candidate. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 2, Chapter 19.

As introduced, prohibits corporations domiciled outside the state or not doing business in the state from using funds to aid either in the election or defeat of any candidate for office. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 2, Chapter 19.
As introduced, prohibits foreign corporations from using funds to aid either in the election or defeat of any candidate for office. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 2, Chapter 19.

As introduced, requires liability insurance be maintained on all motor vehicles operated in Tennessee; insurance companies shall notify division of financial responsibility when coverage is terminated; owner of motor vehicle has 30 days to obtain coverage again. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, requires insurers offering Medicare supplement policies and certificates in this state to persons 65 years of age or older to also offer Medicare supplement policies to persons in this state who are under 65 years of age and eligible for and enrolled in Medicare by reason of disability or end stage renal disease.

As introduced, requires that, for the purpose of ad valorem property taxation, the value of certain facilities that extract, purify, dehydrate, or otherwise treat landfill methane be assessed at the same percentage as a qualified pollution control facility. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 28, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 6.
As introduced, makes private duty nursing services for certain quadriplegics a covered medical service under TennCare. - Amends TCA Title 71.
As introduced, creates a task force to study the statewide replication of Carroll Academy. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.

As introduced, increases weight requirements for rear-facing child safety seat, mandating their use by children weighing more than 25 pounds, rather than 20 pounds. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 6.

As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes of public charter schools.

As introduced, directs office of education accountability to conduct study into capital needs of public charter schools and report findings to general assembly by January 15, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 9 and Title 49.

As introduced, adds the secretary of state to the list of agencies and officials that a county historian is authorized to work with in collecting history. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 7; Title 9 and Title 64.

As enacted, urges department to study permit fees imposed on the movements of oversize and overweight freight motor vehicles and report the results of such study to the transportation committee of each chamber of the general assembly no later than January 1, 2011.
As introduced, removes the death penalty as a possible punishment for first degree murder. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2.

As introduced, requires comptroller to study financing programs available to hospitals that have received both essential access payments and disproportionate share payments for infrastructure and capitol improvement needs. - Amends TCA Title 9 and Title 68.

As introduced, decreases from 50 percent to 40 percent the amount the district attorney or general sessions court clerk may retain for collecting unpaid fines, costs, and litigation taxes. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 40 and Title 67.

As introduced, includes the Pyramid in Memphis in the definition of a qualified public use facility for convention center and tourism financing. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 88 and Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, clarifies statutory requirements for licensure to ensure that a duly licensed architect or engineer who is performing normal architectural and engineering services within the architect or engineer's area of competence is not required to obtain additional licensure, certification, or registration to perform such services. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 13 and Title 62.
As introduced, exempts energy acquisition corporations from taxation of associated municipalities. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 39.

As introduced, defines a restaurant located in a jurisdiction that has elected Tennessee River resort district status as having inside capacity of at least 40 and outside seating capacity of at least 75. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As enacted, extends the pilot program for class size limits in career and technical education course in Davidson County for two years, through July 1, 2011; extends committee to study pilot program to January 1, 2012.

As introduced, allows metropolitan counties with a population of less than 100,000 that have approved the manufacture of intoxicating liquors to assess a fee up to $10.00 per 50 gallon barrel on the manufacturer. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As enacted, expresses intent to name appropriate bridge on Highway 130 in honor of the late PFC Nathan B. Clemons, USMC.
As enacted, expresses intent to name appropriate bridge on State Highway 41A in honor of the late Lance Corporal Gregory Posey, USMC.

As enacted, requires department of education, office of early learning to disseminate its annual report on the voluntary pre-K program to the public via its web site. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits sale of seeds that have been genetically modified to render plant produced or second generation seeds sterile; enacts the Anti-Terminator Gene Act of 2010. - Amends TCA Title 43.
As enacted, expresses intent to name appropriate bridge on Highway 41 over the Duck River in honor of the late Sgt. David Alexander Stephens, U.S. Army.
As enacted, expresses intent to name appropriate bridge on State Highway 53 over I-24 in honor of the late PFC Brian J. Schoff, U.S. Army.
As introduced, extends period in which person must hold a precious metal from 30 days to 60 days. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 45 and Title 62.

As introduced, requires that in lieu of or in addition to participation in DUI school or an alcohol assessment, the court must order, as a condition of a DUI offender's probation, that the offender attend a victims impact panel if the program is offered in the victim's county. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.

As introduced, adds the Tennessee licensed professional counselors association to the other groups who nominate candidates to the governor for appointment to the board for professional counselors, marital and family therapists, and clinical pastoral therapists. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 22, Part 1.
As introduced, increases the Hall income tax exemption for taxpayers 65 years of age or older $10,000 annually beginning January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.

As introduced, authorizes home schooled students to participate in extracurricular athletic activities of public school in which they are eligible to attend. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30.

As introduced, authorizes registered interior designers to prepare non-structural interior design plans and specifications for large commercial spaces, including assembly, institutional, or educational occupancies. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 2; Section 62-37-103; Title 62, Chapter 6 and Section 67-4-1702.

As introduced, creates special joint legislative study committee to study need for local dedicated funding for public transportation in Middle Tennessee; comprised of eight legislative members and three non-voting ad hoc members. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 13; Title 54; Title 55; Title 64 and Title 67.
As introduced, prohibits smoking within 50 feet of any entrance to any building that provides library services to children. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As enacted, provides immunity from civil liability for individuals, veterinarians, and animal control officers that provide, render, or obtain emergency care for non-livestock animals. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2 and Title 44.
As introduced, specifies that it is the court's discretion whether to approve a transfer of structured settlement payment rights. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 26.

As introduced, requires limited liability companies seeking administrative dissolution to receive a certificate from the department of revenue stating that all compliance with revenue laws of this state have been met prior to the secretary of state granting dissolution. - Amends TCA Section 48-245-305 and Section 48-249-608.
As introduced, enacts the "Interstate Health-Care Choice Act." - Amends TCA Title 56.

As enacted, urges that public transportation buses promote the existence of a parental help line organized by Prevent Child Abuse Tennessee as space allows in interior advertising; requires department of education to require LEAs to distribute information regarding the help line; requires department of human services to require licensed child care facilities to distribute information regarding the help line. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 10.

As introduced, requires fee increases greater than 10 percent annually for public use of a national guard firing range be approved by resolution of the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 58, Chapter 1, Part 5.
As introduced, requires the department of environment and conservation to maintain a seasonal interpretive ranger at Long Hunter state park. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 3.
As enacted, authorizes Tennessee state museum to contract for the repair, renovation, and maintenance of the McCampbell House in Donelson. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 13.
As introduced, prohibits the use of mechanical restraints, including high chairs, as punishment for children in day care. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 3, Part 5.

As introduced, requires notice be given of closure of state-owned residential facilities for persons with mental retardation or other developmental disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 1, Part 3.

As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of commerce and insurance to suspend or revoke eligibility of a surplus insurer if the commissioner finds that a surplus insurer is incompetent or not trustworthy and its operations are detrimental to policyholders. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 14, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts "Honey's Law" to revise punishment for animal abuse. - Amends TCA Section 39-14-202.
As introduced, imposes certain procedures and requirements on the closure of any state-operated residential facility for the mentally retarded. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 33 and Title 71.
As enacted, urges civics class be taught in high school. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, requires affiliated businesses at the same location that share tangible personal property be taxed as a single taxpayer on such personal property. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As enacted, requires the secretary of state to file a copy of the previous year's consolidated report on the Help America Vote Act requirements and payments to the finance, ways and means committees of both houses, the fiscal review committee, and the office of legislative budget analysis by February 1 of each year. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, requires election officials to examine documents and petitions before accepting them for filing to ensure all required information is provided properly and filing deadlines are met; presumes that documents and petitions accepted for filing have met all requirements for filing. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, phases out the inheritance tax by incrementally reducing the amount of the tax each year until, for decedents dying in 2013 and thereafter, no such tax applies. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.

As introduced, exempts health insurance entities from including state-mandated health benefits in accident and health policies provided to young adults and employees of small businesses, under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.
As enacted, establishes certain public policies in regard to the application of foreign laws, legal codes and systems to protect constitutional rights of citizens of this state.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of finance and administration to report to the select oversight committee on TennCare by January 31, 2011, concerning certain options for health care coverage for certain recent TennCare disenrollees. - Amends TCA Title 50; Title 56 and Title 71.

As enacted, allows for revocation, suspension, or denial of license if person is mentally incompetent, guilty of unethical or unprofessional conduct, or convicted of a misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 18.

As introduced, specifically adds to the offense of unlawful gratuity or compensation the receiving, consent to receiving, or agreeing to receive property or a thing of value or of personal advantage for procuring a loan for another person. - Amends TCA Title 45 and Title 47.

As introduced, enacts the "Regional Utility Authority Act of 2010." - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1, Part 2; Title 7, Chapter 82, Part 2; Title 64, Chapter 11; Title 64, Chapter 1 and Title 68, Chapter 221.
As enacted, permits a certificated provider of local exchange telephone services to file a tariff with the authority regulating such services. - Amends TCA Section 65-5-109.

As introduced, clarifies that an unexpended balance of contributions in a deceased candidate's campaign account may be allocated to any institution of public or private education in the state. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 2, Chapter 19.
As introduced, authorizes recommendations of the joint legislative services committee to be published on the web site of the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 3.

As introduced, requires the disclosure concerning transferability of credits that institutions authorized to operate by THEC must make to potential students to be in 18-point type rather than 16-point type. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires the state board to report on the use of the scholarship fund for deaf students graduating from the Tennessee school for the deaf and the amount of moneys in the fund and expended for scholarships by November 1, 2010, with an update of the report by November 1 every year thereafter. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires district maps posted on the web site of the general assembly to identify the member representing such district with a link to the member's web page on the official web site. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 3.

As introduced, prohibits annexing municipalities from providing garbage collection services to newly annexed territories for five years from date of annexation unless collectors who served territory prior to annexation are contracted with for such services or are otherwise compensated. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 51 and Title 7, Chapter 3.
As introduced, extends ordinary duration of driver licenses from five to eight years; increases fees for driver licenses and photo identification cards. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, establishes general requirement that gift tax be paid on or before April 15 of each year; requires that taxpayer be provided six-month extension to file gift tax return upon written request. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 55; Title 56; Title 67 and Title 71.
As enacted, enacts the "Property and Casualty Actuarial Opinion Law." - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 1, Part 4 and Title 56, Chapter 1, Part 5.

As introduced, revises certain fiscal impact assessment duties of the department and division of intellectual disabilities; revises provisions governing task force to conduct study of needs of persons with a developmental disability; revises other mental health and developmental disability provisions. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 12; Title 33; Title 37; Title 68 and Title 71.

As enacted, authorizes internal affairs director and agents of department to seize conveyances subject to forfeiture and have disposition of same inure to benefit of the department. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-420; Title 40, Chapter 33, Part 1; Title 53, Chapter 11 and Title 55, Chapter 5, Part 1.

As introduced, defines "transitional facilities" as certain institutions where offenders who are close to release from prison are provided transitional services for purposes of the Private Prison Contracting Act of 1986; increases from 90 to 120 days the notice period for cancellation of contract without penalty to state. - Amends TCA Title 41, Chapter 24.

As introduced, attaches the governor's books from birth program for administrative purposes to the department of finance and administration instead of the department of education. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 52.

As enacted, modifies various tax provisions, including provisions governing sales for resale, captive REITS, brownfield property and job tax credits; establishes tax relief in regard to certain flood-damaged property. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 55; Title 56; Title 67 and Title 71, Chapter 602 of the Public Acts of 2007; and Chapter 530 of the Public Acts of 2009.

As enacted, includes operation of transitional facilities within meaning of "correctional services" for purposes of the Private Prison Contracting Act of 1986; defines "transitional facilities" as certain institutions where offenders who are close to release from prison are provided transitional services. - Amends TCA Section 41-24-102.

As enacted, removes provisions regarding board of review and revises procedures governing review of claims. - Amends TCA Section 50-7-304; Section 50-7-601; Section 50-7-701; Section 50-7-702; Section 50-7-703 and Section 50-7-708.

As introduced, extends grace period for military persons stationed outside the U.S. to renew registration from within 14 to 30 days of owner's return; increases from 3/4 ton to one ton the truck rating above which plates must be on front rather than rear of pick-up truck. - Amends TCA Title 55; Title 65; Title 66 and Title 67.

As enacted, clarifies and adds to types of information that must be included in traffic citations and abstracts of court records pertaining to traffic violations; requires persons holding commercial driver licenses to have a medical card or provide evidence of exemption beginning January 1, 2011, makes other changes concerning motor vehicles. - Amends TCA Title 55.
As enacted, creates the Tennessee criminal justice coordinating council. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 41.
As enacted, classifies certain documents submitted to the state in response to a request for proposal or other procurement method as confidential after completion of the evaluation period.

As enacted, requires commissioner of education, in collaboration with the state-level school safety team, to develop guidelines and training for all public school administrators and human resource personnel regarding the prevention of workplace violence; authorizes the commissioner to direct up to 5 percent of the funds appropriated to the Tennessee school safety center for the development and delivery of training materials and guidelines on school safety issues.

As introduced, revises penalties for violations concerning employers' experience rating for purposes of calculating unemployment compensation premiums. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7 and Title 62, Chapter 43.

As introduced, assigns the state employee staff responsible for the administration of the group insurance for state officials and employees to the department of finance and administration; renames "Volunteer Rx" as "Cover Rx"; requires that grant payments under the grant assistance program for nursing home care be made "monthly or quarterly" instead of quarterly"; and makes other revisions. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 16; Title 33; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 42; Title 43; Title 44; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 50; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 58; Title 59; Title 60; Title 61; Title 62; Title 63; Title 65; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68; Title 70 and Title 71.

As introduced, authorizes Tennessee State University to establish and lead a research consortium of leading research and business entities in Nashville; and requires the university to report progress toward developing the consortium to the standing committees on education by February 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 8, Part 8.

As introduced, requires the establishment of a Tennessee STEM advisory council, attached to the department of education, to coordinate and schedule STEM initiatives; STEM stands for science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1.
As enacted, deletes Tennessee Public Livestock Market Charter Act; revises other various provisions regarding livestock. - Amends TCA Title 44.

As introduced, changes time a state entity must notify the board of trustees of the baccalaureate education system trust fund program of the beneficiary of a scholarship program authorized by the entity from funds of the educational savings plan from "30 days" to "60 days" prior to start of term in which benefits are applied; authorizes THEC to employ a designated individual to acts as liason between THEC and the general assembly, UT system and state university and community college system. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

As enacted, extends the termination date of the Access Tennessee Act, the Cover Tennessee Act, and the Cover Kids Act from June 30, 2010, to June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, and Title 71, Chapter 3 and 5.

As introduced, authorizes the department to establish an internal health council to assist the health information technology coordinator with making the health information technology infrastructure compatible with the health information exchange. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 10; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, clarifies that the present law provisions regarding confidential records that apply to the Tennessee venture capital network at Middle Tennessee State University also apply at the University of Tennessee. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-504.
As enacted, authorizes the department to provide low-income energy assistance at any percentage of the federal income poverty level that is permitted by federal law. - Amends TCA Section 71-1-105.

As enacted, revises the duties of the director of the division of health related boards; revises present law regarding the division, licensure to practice medicine, and veterinarians. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As enacted, authorizes the board of claims to establish incentive programs for state departments, agencies, and institutions to reduce liabilities to the risk management fund. - Amends TCA Section 9-8-108.
As introduced, lowers from 200 percent to 150 percent of the state average commitment rate the threshold for triggering the collaborative planning process. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 2, Part 2.

As introduced, grants an inmate classified as minimum direct an additional eight days of sentence reduction credits per month and grants an inmate classified as minimum trustee an additional 14 credits for sentence reduction per month. - Amends TCA Title 41, Chapter 21.

As introduced, designates the department as the state Opioid Treatment Authority; states that it is state policy that the department may license and regulate opioid treatment facilities; and requires all opioid treatment facilities licensed by the department to regularly report to the department to ensure the best possible care and treatment for Tennessee citizens. - Amends TCA Title 33.

As enacted, clarifies that the governor may enter into civil defense and disaster compacts with the "states" instead of the "contiguous states"; and renames the emergency management assistance compact that the governor may enter into under present law from the "southern regional emergency management assistance compact" to the "emergency management assistance compact." - Amends TCA Section 58-2-401 and Section 58-2-403.

As introduced, assigns the state employee staff responsible for the administration of group insurance for state officials and employees and activities regarding the state insurance committee, to the department of finance and administration; and adds the deputy commissioner of intellectual disabilities services as a member of the board of directors of Access Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27 and Title 56.
