As enacted, authorizes person with handgun permit to carry handgun while big game bowhunting during the archery-only deer season. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Section 70-4-123.
As introduced, authorizes home-schooled students to participate in athletics in public schools if they comply with certain conditions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As enacted, requires that the determination of whether a DUI offender is a multiple offender be made by counting the number of years that have elapsed between "the dates of the violations that resulted in the convictions" rather than the number of years that have elapsed between "the dates of the convictions"; applies to an offender if at least one DUI violation of the offender occurs on or after July 1, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.
As introduced, prohibits restricted driver license for person convicted under implied consent law. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, removes the exemption that prevents private physicians' and dentists' offices in which abortions are performed from being classified as ambulatory surgical treatment centers; requires the department of health, through the board for licensing health care facilities, to promulgate rules and regulations that contain certain minimum standards for the maintenance and operation of ambulatory surgical treatment centers. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires person claiming damages under Consumer Protection Act to prove causal nexus between alleged act and person's damages; claimant must show actual out-of-pocket loss based on actual market value of good or service received in order to recover damages. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.

As introduced, requires parties in a divorce to file certain documents with the court or with the mediator if the marital property includes real property owned during the marriage as the primary residence. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 66.
As introduced, establishes compensation program for qualified small in-state dealers to recoup portion of expenses derived from collecting and remitting tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 5.

As enacted, places restrictions on universal mental health testing, or psychiatric or socioemotional screening of juveniles; requires certain consent by a juvenile's parent, guardian, legal custodian, or caregiver before such testing can occur. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As enacted, authorizes home health nurses and aides to accompany a recipient outside the home during the course of prior approved home health services, if certain criteria met.

As enacted, revises and broadens requirement for the commissioner to provide a report of any death of any person in the custody of the department of children's services at a department facility to instead require report of fatality or near fatality of any child in custody and in other circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 8 and Title 37, Chapter 5.

As enacted, requires the department to consistently apply policies, rules, and regulations across the state; adds an annual legislative review of department policies and attached protocol and procedures; and requires the department to submit new policies for legislative review. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 5, Part 1.

As introduced, creates the legal status of de facto custodian; provides standards and procedures to be used by a court to determine if a person is a de facto custodian and to determine whether a de facto custodian should be awarded permanent custody or joint custody of a child. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 1 and Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 8.

As enacted, establishes procedures for reviewing actions of department of children's services when a foster parent believes that the department has failed to follow the foster parents bill of rights and such failure has harmed or could harm a child. - Amends TCA Section 37-2-415.

As introduced, requires the department to respond to all reports of harm to a child by either investigating such report or completing an assessment of the child and family and referring such child and family for services. - Amends TCA Title 37.

As enacted, creates procedures for dissolving certain municipal airport authority in certain circumstances; authorizes the appointing authority to remove a commissioner of the regional or municipal airport authority for incompetency, failure or neglect to perform the duties required by law, malfeasance, misfeasance, misconduct or corruption in office, or for any other good and sufficient reason, if certain procedures followed. - Amends TCA Title 42.

As introduced, creates Class E felony offense of selling drug paraphernalia and includes products sold for use in introduction of drugs into human body into definition of drug paraphernalia. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As enacted, defines "foster care" and "foster parent" for purposes of provisions governing juvenile courts and proceedings; revises various provisions regarding permanency plans, foster care, and dependent and neglected children. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 17; Title 18; Title 34; Title 36; Title 37; Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, adds an authorization for the department of health to designate patient safety organizations to the Health Data Reporting Act of 2002. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

As introduced, increases amount official may charge for collection and recording of business tax from $5.00 to $7.00; requires the additional $2.00 to be earmarked for computer related expenses including computer hardware purchases. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
As introduced, decreases from 90 days to 60 days notice required by court clerk to state librarian and archivist prior to destruction of records. - Amends TCA Title 18.
As introduced, clarifies that age-restricted venue exception to no smoking law applies only to persons entering such facilities other than employees. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As introduced, increases from 30 days to 45 days after the date a summons has been served upon the judgment debtor prior to execution or other process for enforcement of a foreign judgment. - Amends TCA Title 26.

As introduced, increases amount of personal property that can be distributed by means of a nuncupative will from $1,000 to $10,000 and from $10,000 to $50,000 for persons in military service during time of war. - Amends TCA Title 32.
As enacted, describes serious bodily injury in children to include second or third degree burns, bone fractures, concussion, and permanent or protracted disfigurement. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As enacted, describes dangerous instrumentality as any item in its manner of use or intended use as applied to a child that is capable of producing serious bodily injury. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As introduced, increases penalty for neglected child six years of age or younger from Class E felony to Class D felony; creates Class E felony for person knowingly endangering the health and welfare of child six years of age or younger. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As enacted, redefines "indecent exposure" to include knowingly engaging in the person's own residence certain conduct in the presence of a child for the purpose of sexual arousal or gratification. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, extends prohibition on new nursing home bed certificates of need to June 30, 2011, except for 125 Medicare SNF beds. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title 68.
As introduced, permits children of insured to continue health insurance coverage until age 30 in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As enacted, delays the implementation of certain provisions of the Tennessee Voter Confidence Act; revises provisions governing "top race" and audits; revises other various provisions of the Act. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Chapter 1108 of the Public Acts of 2008.
As enacted, revises procedures for forced assessment and equalization of tangible personal property. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-1509 and Section 67-5-903.

As enacted, adds Meadow Creek Mountain Rustic Resort in Cocke County to those facilities authorized to sell alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, eliminates prohibition on campaign contributions from lobbyists to the governor or any member of the general assembly or any candidate for the office of governor, state senator, or state representative. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 10; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 14; Title 15 and Title 16.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Environmental Protection and Recycling Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 49; Title 55; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 70.
As introduced, increases membership of medical care and cost containment committee from 15 to 18 voting members; adds three physicians to committee. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

As enacted, requires full-time, part-time, or volunteer firefighters hired or accepted on or after July 1, 2009, to meet certain minimum training requirements; not applicable in certain specified counties. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 24, Part 1.
As introduced, increases penalty for cockfighting to a Class E felony. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.

As enacted, requires certain personal information regarding a victim who receives compensation under the criminal injuries compensation fund to be treated as confidential. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-504 and Title 29, Chapter 13.
As enacted, expands the authority of the water quality control board concerning incentives for alternatives to discharges to surface waters. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As introduced, establishes certification category of limited herbicide applicator. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 21.
As enacted, revises provisions concerning manufactured homes affixed to real property including cancellation of certificate of title. - Amends TCA Section 55-3-138.

As introduced, prohibits driving motor vehicle while using wireless telephone without hands-free operation; violation is a Class C misdemeanor punishable only by a fine of $50.00. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50 and Title 55, Chapter 8.
As introduced, increases the commissions paid to lottery retailers from 6 1/2 percent of gross sales to 9 percent of gross sales. - Amends TCA Section 4-51-115.

As introduced, requires citizenship status to be proven prior to registration to vote and requires certain procedures to ensure identity and citizenship status prior to voting. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 4.
As introduced, authorizes filing offices to redact social security numbers from recorded documents. - Amends TCA Title 47.
As introduced, requires public swimming pools to have certain equipment designed to avoid entrapment by suction of users of such swimming pools. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 14.
As introduced, removes provision requiring mandatory hand count audits of at least 3 percent of the votes cast in an election. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 20, Part 1.
As enacted, subjects director of county emergency management agency to the control of the chief local elected official in lieu of county governing body. - Amends TCA Section 58-2-110.

As introduced, creates the ASPIRE work study program to provide additional postsecondary financial assistance from net lottery proceeds to students receiving both the Tennessee HOPE scholarship and the ASPIRE award. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, permits Tennessee HOPE scholarship recipient to maintain academic eligibility by maintaining good standing at the eligible postsecondary institution in which the student is enrolled; changes initial eligibility requirements for certain students to conform to the change in the continuing eligibility requirement. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
Expands open enrollment period of charter schools to include certain children in foster care. - Amends TCA Section 49-13-106.

As enacted, extends confidential status to certain identifying information compiled and maintained by the department of correction or board of probation and parole concerning a person who has requested that notification be provided regarding the status of criminal proceedings or of a sentenced felon. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3; Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5; Title 40, Chapter 28; Title 40, Chapter 38 and Title 41, Chapter 21.
As introduced, requires parent or guardian to notify LEA about whether or not student has health insurance coverage at time of student's admission to LEA. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, directs LEAs to make reasonable efforts to determine if students have health care insurance and to report findings to commissioner of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.

As introduced, requires departments of education and health to establish minimum guidelines for health insurance coverage required for attendance in K-12 schools; and requires children's proof of health insurance prior to school admittance yearly. - Amends TCA Title 49; Title 56 and Title 67.
As introduced, divides lottery scholarship ASPIRE award into a grant and a required work-study program. - Amends TCA Section 49-4-915.

As enacted, provides that in the event of a natural disaster or serious outbreak of illness affecting or endangering students or staff during a school year, the commissioner of education may waive for such school year the requirement for 180 days of classroom instruction, if the request is submitted to the commissioner by the director of schools. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, enacts the "Markie Voyles Act," which requires an adult convicted of contributing to delinquency of a minor to serve 100 percent of Class A misdemeanor sentence, which is 11 months and 29 days, if offense involved supplying substance to a minor that is unlawful for minor to possess and minor engages in conduct that causes death of another. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, requires the state to pay for court-ordered mental health evaluations of juvenile offenders when charged with an offense that would be a felony if committed by an adult. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-150.

As introduced, allows a tenant who is the victim of domestic abuse, sexual assault, or stalking to terminate a residential lease agreement upon submitting certain proof to the landlord in writing and vacating the premises. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 7, Part 1.
As introduced, permits use of school buses for 20 years under certain conditions. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-2109.

As introduced, allows disclosure of mental health records to a law enforcement agency conducting a law enforcement investigation or criminal background check. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, requires each local school system's budget to include paying at least 30 percent of medical insurance premium costs for support or non-professional employees who participate in the coverage out of BEP medical insurance component. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 2.

As introduced, establishes procedure for deducting from amount bid on state building commission project the estimated energy cost savings attributable to bidder's design modifications and proposals. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As introduced, requires that providers of services, material, and equipment in state and local building contracts meet energy efficiency standards. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4.

As introduced, provides for re-establishment of elected office of school superintendent for counties or cities upon two-thirds vote of governing body; any such ordinance or resolution once approved is not operative until approved in an election; provides for qualifications of candidates. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-203 and Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 3.

As introduced, requires the local education insurance committee to approve an optional long-term care insurance plan that provides local education employees with the same coverage offered to state employees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27.

As introduced, specifies that in any criminal proceeding involving certain sex offenses committed against a victim less than 13 years of age the testimony of a forensic interviewer is admissible. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 2; Title 24, Chapter 7, Part 1; Title 37, Chapter 1 and Title 40, Chapter 17.
As introduced, directs TDOT to install flashing caution traffic signals at the intersection of State Route 111 and State Route 293 in Overton County. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 5.
As enacted, designates "milk" as the official state beverage. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 1, Part 3.
As enacted, requires certain actions by buyers and dealers of scrap jewelry and metal and makes a violation of such requirements a Class A misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1, Part 2.

As introduced, exempts the Greater Nashville Council of Governments and the Upper Cumberland Development District from being included in the fully integrated risk-based long-term Care system developed under the Long Term Care Community Choices Act of 2008 for HCBS Medicaid waiver services and case management services. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, establishes incentive award program for veterinarians, to be known as "Tennessee Rural Veterinary Services Program." - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4; Title 49, Chapter 9 and Title 63, Chapter 12.

As introduced, directs the commission to review reports of child abuse and child sexual abuse that the department of children's services determines to be unfounded or unsubstantiated. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 4; Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 6 and Title 37, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As enacted, requires the department of human resources to develop job classifications for licensed marital and family therapists. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 50, Part 1.

As enacted, extends certain discretionary powers to the board of regents and the University of Tennessee when purchasing or acquiring software for use restricted solely to academic teaching or research. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As enacted, designates "agate" as the official state mineral. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 1, Part 3.
As introduced, revises and expands current laws requiring coverage of autism treatments. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.

As enacted, specifies that an "antique motor vehicle" additionally includes a motor vehicle at least 25 years old with a non-modified engine and body that is used on the highways for the purpose of selling, testing the operation of, or obtaining repairs to or maintenance on the motor vehicle.

As enacted, clarifies that the definition section of the Tennessee Condominium Act of 2008 applies only to the extent necessary in construing any of the sections relevant to such act. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 27, Part 2.

As introduced, prohibits any insurance company from increasing its premiums or canceling coverage on any insurance policy prior to the renewal or expiration date of the policy for the sole reason that the spouse of a policy holder has died. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, discontinues appointment of specified members of the general assembly as members on the board of directors of district management corporations, local neighborhood development corporations, and the West Tennessee River Basin Authority. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 84; Title 13, Chapter 13 and Title 64, Chapter 1, Part 11.
As introduced, increases the classification of aggravated robbery from Class B felony to Class A felony when accomplished by use of a firearm or explosive device. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13.
As introduced, establishes enhanced sentences for crimes of force or violence committed while acting in concert. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As enacted, specifies that in a post-conviction proceeding on a capital case a court may order a defendant to undergo an inpatient mental evaluation only if an outpatient evaluator concludes that inpatient evaluation is necessary.
As introduced, adds certain criminal offenses to the definition of "dangerous felony" for certain purposes. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, provides sentencing enhancements for certain crimes of force or violence when committed by a person acting in concert with two or more other persons. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As introduced, requires state board of education to mandate a semester course in personal finance for each high school student as requirement for graduation. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 12.

As introduced, exempts municipalities and counties from meeting the requirements for funeral directing for burials of human remains in municipally or county-owned cemeteries if no charge is made for the burial and the cemeteries are not operated for profit. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5, Part 1.
As introduced, increases fine for criminal offense of vandalism when committed against a house of worship. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14.

As introduced, enhances the penalty for abuse of corpse from a Class E felony to a Class C felony when the person causes the death of the person whose corpse is mistreated; adds enhancement factor by which a defendant's sentence can be increased within the appropriate range, that a defendant is convicted of second degree murder and the defendant knowingly mutilates the body of the victim after death. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, increases the penalty for the offense of arson from a Class C to a Class B felony and sets a minimum fine for arson of a place of worship at $25,000 and aggravated arson at $50,000. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14.

As introduced, increases the penalty for arson from a Class C to a Class B felony and sets a minimum period of incarceration for arson of a place of worship at eight years and aggravated arson at 15 years. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14.
As introduced, increases sentence for criminal offense of vandalism when committed against a house of worship. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14 and Title 40.

As introduced, provides that court or parole board may impose, as condition of release, that a person being supervised for a registrable sexual offense where the victim is a minor have restrictions placed on the offender's computer use by either prohibiting certain activity or requiring the offender to register certain information. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, authorizes nurse practitioners and physician assistants to sign death certificates. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 3.

As enacted, authorizes nurse practitioners and physician assistants to certify disability or deafness to the department of revenue for the purpose of obtaining disabled license tags, if such authority is expressly included in written protocol. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8 and Title 55, Chapter 21.

As enacted, authorizes Hamilton County register's office to collect a $2.00 electronic filing submission fee for each electronically-filed document recorded over the Internet through such register's county-run electronic filing portal; documents filed by governmental entities are exempt; requires approval of two thirds of local legislative body. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21, Part 10; Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 66, Chapter 24, Part 1.

As enacted, authorizes revenue received by the Hamilton County register's office from data processing fees, above an amount necessary to purchase equipment and services, to be used for other purposes directly related to the official function of such office. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21, Part 10; Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 66, Chapter 24, Part 1.

As enacted, credits former JROTC instructors currently teaching in subject areas other than JROTC or military science with years experience instructing JROTC or military science for purposes of salary ratings. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5.

As introduced, directs the commisioner of economic and community development, in consultation with MTAS and CTAS, to study the effects of state and local tax incentives on the economic development of municipalities and counties. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.
As enacted, revises "Grape and Wine Law" based on a Sixth Circuit U.S. Court of Appeals decision including allowing out-of-state wineries to be licensed. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3, Part 2.
As introduced, provides $4,000 annual supplement to full-time classroom teachers who achieve National Board for Professional Teaching Standards certification. - Amends TCA Section 49-5-5609.

As enacted, grants trial judge the option to resentence a defendant whose probation has been revoked to a sentence of community correction, if the probation violation was a technical violation, as well as ordering the original sentence reinstated and the incarceration of the defendant. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35.

As introduced, specifies that certain for-hire motor carriers providing passenger transportation are required to submit to an annual physical examination by a physician licensed in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 51 and Title 65.

As introduced, authorizes commissioned reserve deputy sheriffs authorized in writing by sheriff and reserve police officers authorized in writing by chief of police to carry firearms on and off duty to same extent as full-time law enforcement officers. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 8; Title 38 and Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As introduced, authorizes TDOT to employ analysts and economists in addition to other employees to perform duties related to railroad regulation. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 3, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires department to notify TDOT's division of multimodal resources when any county is designated as a "citizen transportation area." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 10; Title 38; Title 39; Title 55 and Title 65.
As introduced, removes outdated language from transportation equity trust fund provisions. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 56, Part 2; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 67.
As introduced, eliminates issuance of Sandhill Crane new specialty earmarked plate. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.

As introduced, removes provision providing that certain highway signs are paid from the highway fund subject to appropriation by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.

As enacted, requires a person to obtain an automotive mobility dealer license from the motor vehicle commission, prior to engaging or continuing in the business of an automotive mobility dealer after March 1, 2011; revises provisions governing automobile clubs and associations. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 47; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.
As introduced, requires TDOT to include recommended improvements to Tennessee Tollway Act in report to general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 12; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 67.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of hummingbird awareness new specialty earmarked plate; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to wildlife resources fund. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.
As introduced, defines "surveillance camera" as used in the rules of the road. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 54 and Title 55.

As introduced, increases from 10 days to two weeks time within which court clerk must notify department of safety of motor vehicle offense of commercial driver and within which department of safety must notify licensing authority of such offense. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3; Title 40, Chapter 33; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.

As enacted, requires the department to study the design and development of expanding qualifying HOV lanes to toll or HOT lanes and to report its findings to the transportation committee of each house of the general assembly by February 1, 2010.

As introduced, removes provision providing that certain highway signs are paid from the highway fund subject to appropriation by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.

As introduced, requires comptroller to report any audit of a nonprofit organization receiving funds from sale of new specialty earmarked license plate to senate and house transportation committees within 30 days of audit. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 54 and Title 55.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked license plates for Tennessee Cave Salamander; revenue allocated to Tennessee Wildlife Fund for fish and wildlife efforts. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54 and Title 55.

As introduced, requires TDOT to provide supplemental report of progress of Tollway Act pilot program to general assembly by January 1, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 12; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 67.
As introduced, extends sight distance required for certain parked vehicles from 200 feet to 250 feet. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, creates within the department of safety a "Repeat DUI Offender" registry of persons who have two or more DUI convictions and whose license is currently suspended or revoked; makes the registry available on the Internet. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As enacted, requires the department of safety, in the case of a conviction for vehicular homicide, to revoke the offender's driver license for the same period of time the court prohibits the person from driving a vehicle under present criminal law for committing the offense. - Amends TCA Title 54 and Title 55.
As introduced, urges commissioner to use wildflowers native to each grand division in new wildflower plantings. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.
As introduced, increases from three to five years moratorium between time plate has become obsolete and invalid until re-authorization by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, authorizes issuance of various special license plates; extends minimum order deadline for certain plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, defines "visible" for purposes of Billboard Regulation and Control Act of 1972. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 21, Part 1.
As introduced, requires applicants for licensure as motor vehicle dealers of used cars to complete a pre-licensing course. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 17.

As introduced, increases the dual enrollment grant award from $100 per credit hour to $200 per credit hour; permits students on block scheduling to take per school year two courses in one semester instead of one course per semester. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
As introduced, authorizes utility districts to own and operate natural gas vehicle fueling stations. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82, Part 3.

As introduced, increases from $1.00 to $2.00 the amount clerks may collect as a voluntary donation upon the registration of motor vehicles to benefit organ donations. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires military department to coordinate statewide wireless interoperable communication system (TnWin); and creates TnWin fund for development of TnWin system statewide. - Amends TCA Title 58, Chapter 1 and Title 58, Chapter 2.

As enacted, allows handgun permit holders to possess handgun while in parks, natural areas, campgrounds and similar public places; allows local governments to prohibit such possession in parks and similar areas owned by the local government, upon majority vote of its legislative body. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13 and Title 70.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of cultural license plates for teachers. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires state board of education to conduct a national survey on viable approaches for improving parental involvement and school safety in public schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 2.

As enacted, requires the department of education to study and report on sufficiency of extended learning opportunities complementary to school curricula that are occurring in the LEAP after school program. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

As enacted, requires the commissioner of education to file the annual report on the lottery for education after school program's system of competitive grants and technical assistance with the chairs of the house and senate education committees. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

As enacted, urges the commissioner of education to evaluate the effectiveness of the pilot after school programs funded by the lottery in increasing ACT and SAT scores, eligibility for lottery scholarships, and enrollment in postsecondary institutions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

As enacted, requires the department of education to survey LEAs concerning extended learning opportunities in LEAs or communities and to include the results of the survey in the commissioner's annual report. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
As enacted, clarifies that a retired judge or a general sessions judge may administer the required oath to support the constitutions to an inferior court judge. - Amends TCA Title 17.
As introduced, enacts the "Drinking Water Access and Resources Planning Act of 2009." - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221.
As introduced, revises regulation of billing for cytopathology services to refer instead to "anatomic pathology services." - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 6.
As enacted, "Howell Wayne Burns Memorial Bridge," Goose Creek on State Route 141 in Metropolitan Hartsville and Trousdale County.

As introduced, specifies citation to definition of "victim" in the Criminal Injuries Compensation Act of 1976. - Amends TCA Section 40-24-107, Section 67-4-606, and Title 29, Chapter 13, Parts 1 and 3.
As enacted, specifies that the sale of herbs or natural health information exchanges provided as a service are not considered to be naturopathy if certain requirements met.

As introduced, authorizes church-related and home-schooled students to participate in athletics in public schools if they comply with certain conditions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 50, Part 8 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, enacts the Tennessee Taxpayer and Citizen Protection Act. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 4.
As introduced, enacts the "Genetically Engineered Food Labeling Act of 2009." - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 53, Chapter 1.
As introduced, allows use of school buses for 20 years under certain conditions. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-2109.

As enacted, requires a seller to disclose to a buyer, prior to entering a contract, whether a residence has been moved from an existing foundation to another foundation, if such information is known to the seller. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 5, Part 2.
As enacted, extends Tennessee dairy promotion committee, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 44, Chapter 19, Part 1.
As enacted, extends review committee, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 12, Chapter 4.
As enacted, extends interstate compact on detainers, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 40, Chapter 31.
As enacted, extends health services and development agency, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 11.
As enacted, terminates Gibson County water projects authority. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 64, Chapter 1.
As enacted, extends regional transportation authority, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 64, Chapter 8.
As enacted, extends prevailing wage commission, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 12, Chapter 4.
As introduced, terminates fireworks advisory council. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 104.
As enacted, extends pest control board, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 21.
As enacted, extends occupational safety and health review commission, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends occupational safety and health administration labor advisory council, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 3.
As enacted, terminates families first advisory council. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71, Chapter 3.

As enacted, extends emergency communications board, June 30, 2013; directs TACIR to study impact on public safety of non-emergency communications district affiliated public service answering points. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 7, Chapter 86.

As enacted, extends elevator and amusement device safety board, June 30, 2011; increases the membership of the elevator and amusement device safety board from seven to eight members. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 121.
As introduced, extends department of veterans' affairs, June 30, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends department of labor and workforce development, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends department of general services, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
As enacted, extends department of financial institutions, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends department of economic and community development, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends department of commerce and insurance, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends commission on firefighting personnel standards and education, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 24 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
As introduced, extends commission on Indian affairs, June 30, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 34.
As enacted, extends commission for uniform legislation, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 9.
As enacted, cemetery advisory board, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 46, Chapter 1.
As enacted, extends Carroll County watershed authority, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 64, Chapter 1.
As enacted, extends board of standards, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 12, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends medical care and cost containment committee, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 6.
As enacted, extends local government planning advisory committee, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends Tennessee soybean promotion board, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 43, Chapter 20.
As introduced, requires joint evaluation committees to meet at least quarterly. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29.
As introduced, requires governor to submit legislation to revise TCA to reflect changes in governmental structure made by executive order. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As enacted, extends health equity commission, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
As enacted, extends board of boiler rules, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 122.
As introduced, extends alcoholic beverage commission, June 30, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 6.
As enacted, extends board of review, department of labor and workforce development, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 7.
As introduced, extends advisory council on workers' compensation, June 30, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 6.
As enacted, extends board of physical therapy, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 13.
As enacted, extends the board of occupational therapy, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 13.
As enacted, terminates the board of employee assistance professionals. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 42.

As enacted, extends advisory committee on women's health, June 30, 2015; requires a representative of department of health to appear before government operations joint subcommittee by August 13, 2010, to update the joint subcommittee on the advisory committee's response to questions submitted by division of state audit. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 1.
As enacted, extends board of claims, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 9, Chapter 8.
As enatec, extends department of correction, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends department of agriculture, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends Tennessee student assistance corporation, board of directors, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 4.
As enacted, extends Tennessee community resource board, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 41, Chapter 10.
As enacted, extends Tennessee peace officers standards and training commission, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 38, Chapter 8.
As enacted, extends Tennessee code commission, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 1 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
As enacted, extends utility management review board, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 7, Chapter 82.
As enacted, extends Tennessee state veterans' home board, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 58, Chapter 7.
As enacted, extends Tennessee sports hall of fame, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends Tennessee registry of election finance, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
As enacted, extends Tennessee public television council, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 50.
As enacted, extends Tennessee claims commission, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 9, Chapter 8.
As introduced, extends Tennessee bureau of investigation, June 30, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 38, Chapter 6.
As introduced, extends Tennessee Alzheimer's disease task force, June 30, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71, Chapter 2.
As enacted, extends state university and community college system, board of regents, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 8.
As enacted, extends state unemployment compensation advisory council, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 7.
As enacted, extends state textbook commission, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
As enacted, extends state capitol commission, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 8.
As introduced, extends state board for licensing contractors, June 30, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 6.
As enacted, extends Southern dairy compact, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 43, Chapter 35.
As enacted, extends interstate corrections compact, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 41, Chapter 23.
As enacted, extends selection panel for TennCare reviewers, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 56, Chapter 32.
As enacted, extends interstate compact on juveniles, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 37, Chapter 4.
As enacted, extends interstate compact for supervision of adult offenders, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 40, Chapter 28.

As introduced, requires local governments to notify owners of property seized by such local government by certified mail; notice must include method of appealing such seizure; if seized property is damaged or destroyed, local government must reimburse owner if property should have been returned to the owner. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1; Title 6, Chapter 54 and Title 7, Chapter 3.
As introduced, enacts the "Fair Campaigning Act." - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, requires only the last four digits of a person's social security number, instead of the entire social security number, to be provided and maintained on the permanent registration records in Shelby County. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As introduced, allows person convicted of simple possession of marijuana after July 1, 2009, who has no prior drug convictions to have records expunged after completing entire sentence and those convicted before July 1, 2009, one year after completing sentence. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As enacted, requires division of health-related boards to do an awareness campaign for health care providers concerning their reporting duties relating to domestic violence and removes the June 30, 2009, repealer for reporting duties imposed by 2007 Public Chapter 83. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6, and Chapter 83 of the Public Acts of 2007.

As introduced, provides that if obligor in noncompliance with order of support submits evidence at the license suspension hearing that obligor has been involuntarily unemployed for 30 days, noncompliance order stayed as to driver license for 90 days so obligor can find job. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 5, Part 7.

As introduced, requires alcohol and drug testing of certain pregnant women, provides that pregnant women testing positive for alcohol or drugs be referred for substance abuse treatment; requires notification to department of children's services if treatment is not sought as required. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, authorizes victims of certain violent crimes to have immediate access to their phone, banking, and credit card records. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 38, Part 1.

As introduced, requires driver service centers to provide expedited services to the extent reasonably possible to persons who are disabled or visibly pregnant or frail. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50.

As introduced, requires persons who hold a professional license regulated in the executive branch to wait 30 days before using information in a written motor vehicle accident report for solicitation purposes. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 1.

As introduced, directs that house and senate judiciary committees study application of death penalty in Tennessee; provides for moratorium on executions until study results are presented to the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2.
As introduced, authorizes certain persons to change the sex designation on their birth certificate. - Amends TCA Section 68-3-203.
As introduced, subject to necessary federal approvals, provides for an optional prenatal care benefit in TennCare with co-payments, free transportation, and a visit schedule. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, permits employees of Tennessee federally qualified health centers and the Tennessee Primary Care Association to participate in the Tennessee consolidated retirement system. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As enacted, exempts from the American History course requirement for a baccalaureate degree persons who pursue baccalaureate degrees in areas of study exempted, either by regulation of the board of regents or by regulations or delegated authority of the board of trustees of the University of Tennessee, if they have successfully completed a course in American History in high school. - Amends TCA Section 49-7-110.

As introduced, requires an international studies component in curriculum so that in order to graduate from a college or university after July 1, 2011, a student would have to complete eight such courses. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, requires the state board of education to develop guidelines and criteria for the inclusion of foreign language instruction in grades kindergarten through six. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3.

As introduced, clarifies that the Tennessee Ethics Commission has jurisdiction over consulting fee disclosures by certain executive branch officials. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 3; Title 4; Title 8 and Title 39, Chapter 16.

As introduced, clarifies that consolidated disclosure of interest form created by Tennessee Ethics Commission must only be filed once during a year. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 3; Title 4; Title 8 and Title 39, Chapter 16.

As introduced, establishes procedures to be followed by Tennessee ethics commission when a person fails to file a disclosure as required by title 8, chapter 50, part 5. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 3; Title 4; Title 8 and Title 39, Chapter 16.
As introduced, permits golf carts to be used on public streets if authorized by city or county with jurisdiction over such streets. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 1.
As introduced, exempts certain engineers from examination and experience requirements for licensure as a land surveyor. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 18, Part 1.

As introduced, provides that state regulatory scheme for sellers and purchasers of scrap metal preempts any local regulations or ordinances on the same subject. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 9, Part 1.

As introduced, enacts the "Convention Center Authorities Act of 2009"; revises certain provisions concerning financing and development of convention centers affecting Davidson County. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.

As introduced, appropriates $4 million to the Bureau of TennCare for the sole purpose of funding copay reimbursements for Medicare/Medicaid dual eligible enrollees who utilize emergency medical services.

As enacted, requires the board of regents to study feasibility of cooperative career and technical programs between LEAs and Tennessee technology centers or other two-year institutions offering career and technical education. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires fiscal review committee to utilize average cost recovery paid to counties for housing state inmates, plus 10 percent, when preparing fiscal notes with incarceration costs. - Amends TCA Section 3-2-107 and Title 3, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As enacted, increases the tax on coal products severed from the ground in this state and increases the amount of tax revenue collected that is allocated to the county from which the coal products were severed; allows department of revenue to retain certain amounts in two fiscal years to recover expenses. - Amends TCA Section 67-7-104 and Section 67-7-110.
As introduced, establishes crime of removing certain structures without paying monies owed. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As enacted, broadens prohibitions on window tinting to any motor vehicle operated on a public highway, rather than only to those registered in Tennessee; and creates exemption for motor vehicles registered in another state that comply with requirements of such state. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 1.

As enacted, enacts the "Electric G&T Cooperative Act"; requires TACIR to study whether current wholesale power supply arrangements between TVA and municipal utilities and electric cooperatives likely to change in a way that could affect payment in lieu of taxes from TVA to the state and local governments; makes other changes relative to energy acquisition corporations. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 48.

As introduced, allows access by the fiscal review committee staff to certain confidential tax information and records in the possession of the department of revenue; requires the fiscal review committee staff to maintain the confidentiality of such information and records. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 17.
As introduced, withholds BEP funds from an LEA that fails to comply with certain TCA purchasing and procurement provisions. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-203.

As enacted, prohibits any non-elected body of a municipality, county, or metropolitan government from enacting an ordinance or issuing a rule or regulation pertaining to the provision of food nutritional information or from otherwise regulating menus at food service establishments; extends primary responsibility for implementing and supervising any federally mandated requirement regarding the provision of food nutritional information at food service establishments to the department of health, if the federal action specifically authorizes state departments to enforce such requirements.

As introduced, makes killing of another while committing domestic abuse first degree murder if there was past pattern of abuse upon victim and circumstances of death manifested extreme indifference to life. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2.
As enacted, designates the tenth division of the Shelby County general sessions court as the domestic violence court for Shelby County. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 15, Part 50.
As introduced, provides that fourth or subsequent conviction for domestic assault or violation of a protective order is a Class E felony. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits a court from ordering either parent to pay child support to the other parent if both parents have been awarded and are going to be exercising a substantially equal amount of parenting time with the child or children of the marriage. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 5, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes at a court's discretion attorney fees to be awarded to an injured party in a nuisance suit. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 3.

As introduced, permits municipal electric plants to provide telephone, telegraph, telecommunications, cable service, two-way video transmission, video programming, Internet services, and other like systems beyond their service area to state and local governmental entities who request the service be provided. - Amends TCA Title 7.
As introduced, authorizes municipal electric systems to expand provision of broadband services. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 52.
As introduced, establishes remedies provided for in  56-7-105 as exclusive remedies for failure to make timely payment on a policy or bond. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.
As introduced, requires each local government to file an annual financial statement with the comptroller to include certain information. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6 and Title 7.
As introduced, expands tuition exemptions for the children and spouses of certain veterans. - Amends TCA Section 49-7-102.

As introduced, enacts the Pride of Tennessee program to be administered by the department to promote and distinguish products grown, made, or processed in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 2.

As introduced, exempts from sales or use tax tangible personal property or taxable services sold, given, or donated to any nonprofit school support organization. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As introduced, increases governmental tort liability limits for actions arising on or after July 1, 2009. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 20.

As introduced, prohibits an owner of a motor vehicle from knowingly allowing a person to operate such vehicle without the person having a valid driver license. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 55.

As enacted, establishes a special joint committee to study and develop ways to implement comprehensive water planning in Tennessee, both at the state and local levels of public water systems. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 5; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 65; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 69.

As introduced, revises certain requirements concerning the quarantine of property where methamphetamine is or was produced; revises requirements concerning the purchase or possession of an immediate methamphetamine precursor. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4 and Title 68, Chapter 212, Part 5.

As enacted, requires a person to obtain a license from the commissioner of commerce and insurance as a crop insurance adjuster in order to act as a crop insurance adjuster; prohibits an insurer that sells crop insurance from contracting, employing or using any person to adjust claims made under a crop insurance policy unless the person is licensed as a crop insurance adjuster; requires commissioner of commerce and insurance to establish qualifications for licensure. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Clarifies that bonds issued by an airport authority "must" instead of "may" be sold at public sale at not less than par; requires 10 instead of five days notice prior to any meeting at which the governing body of the municipality that created the authority will consider being a guarantor to the payment of principal and interest on authority bonds. - Amends TCA Title 42, Chapter 3; Title 42, Chapter 4; Title 42, Chapter 5; Title 42, Chapter 6 and Title 67, Chapter 4.

As introduced, provides that disabled parents receive certain credit toward child support obligations, no more than 4 percent of a parent's social security disability insurance payments can be withheld for arrearages, and becoming disabled is a substantial change in circumstance. - Amends TCA Title 36.

As introduced, requires state rules, regulations, and standards relative to air quality, water quality, air emissions, and water discharges to be consistent with and not exceed the requirements of federal statutes, regulations, standards, criteria, and guidance on the same subject. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 69.
As enacted, revises provisions governing expunction of records of person found not guilty following bench trial or trial by jury. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32, Part 1.

As enacted, specifies that the Dairy Law of the State of Tennessee does not prohibit the independent or partial owner of any hoofed mammal from using the milk from such animal for the owner's personal consumption or other personal use. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 19 and Title 53.

As introduced, authorizes driver licenses and state identification badges to have "Do Not Serve Alcohol" displayed prominently. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 50, Part 1; Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3 and Title 57.

As introduced, requires contribution limits for individuals, political campaign committees controlled by a political party or caucus, and multicandidate political campaign committees be increased to reflect percentage of change in average consumer price index in every odd-numbered year starting in 2011. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

As introduced, adds to transit authority management boards a non-voting member recommended by the labor organization representing the plurality of employees and allows the chairperson to exclude the member from meetings on negotiations with labor organizations. - Amends TCA Section 7-56-101.
As introduced, reduces the sales tax on Energy Star qualified products to 3.5 percent and defines Energy Star qualified product. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.
As introduced, requires gift certificates with a monetary value of less than $10.00 to be redeemable in cash for cash value. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.
As introduced, clarifies voting on boards of commissioners and adds the office of secretary. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 6.

As enacted, renames the "division of mental retardation services" as the "division of intellectual disabilities services"; removes antiquated terminology that is used to describe persons who lack the mental capacity to enter into contracts. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 33 and Title 71.

As enacted, requires court clerk to provide, upon request, debtor with copy of judgment or agreement when judgment required to be paid through court and copy of receipt of amount paid in discharge of the judgment or agreement. - Amends TCA Title 18.

As introduced, clarifies that an unexpended balance of contributions in a deceased candidate's campaign account may be allocated to any institution of public or private education in the state; allows family member of a staff person of the registry of election finance to make campaign contributions. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

As introduced, removes certain restrictions on immediate family members of ethics commission members and staff and registry of election finance members and staff. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 3, Chapter 6.

As introduced, broadens distribution of unexpended campaign contributions to include distribution to any 501(c) organization instead of limiting distribution to 501(c)(3) and (4) organizations. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

As introduced, makes information contained in handgun carry permit applications and renewals, information provided to agencies to investigate applicant, and records maintained relative to the permit application confidential and creates Class A fine only misdemeanor of unauthorized publication of permit information or records. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-504 and Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As enacted, allows person with handgun carry permit to carry in restaurants that serve alcoholic beverages as long as such person is not consuming alcoholic beverages; defines restaurant for purposes of this authorization. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, requires signage to effectively restrict persons from hunting game on landowner property be placed at all major points of ingress of the lands being posted, rather than at intervals along property line. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4.

As introduced, allows persons with handgun carry permit to carry in public parks, public postsecondary institutions, and places where alcoholic beverages are being served; allows judges to carry firearms where law enforcement can carry if they have permit or appropriate training. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13 and Title 70.

As introduced, provides that law enforcement officer from another state does not have immunity or power to arrest if in this state when in fresh pursuit of suspect unless the officer's communication device is compatible with the devices used in the jurisdiction of pursuit. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 7, Part 2 and Title 55, Chapter 8.

As introduced, provides that a law enforcement officer from another state does not have immunity or the power to arrest in this state when in fresh pursuit of suspect unless the officer is in compliance with the pursuit policy of the jurisdiction in which the pursuit occurs. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 7, Part 2 and Title 55, Chapter 8.

As introduced, creates 64 new assistant district attorney positions effective October 1, 2009; the district attorneys general conference to recommend where additional assistant DAs should be placed to the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14 and Title 16, Chapter 2.

As introduced, classifies criminal taking of fish in same manner as theft based on value of fish taken, unless value is unknown, in which case the offense will be a Class A misdemeanor instead of a Class C misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

As introduced, authorizes the county legislative body of Cumberland County to donate land comprising a horse trail acquired by the county by default at a tax sale; land to be given to Lake Tansi homeowners whose lots abut the horse trail. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 21; Title 5, Chapter 9 and Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, directs commissioner of revenue to establish system of registration for certain owners of four or more commercial vehicles to allow annual registration for all such vehicles to expire on February 28 each year instead of alternate, interval renewal for each vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, allows school buses to be used up to 20 years of service, subject to annual safety inspections, by extending permissible, yearly waiver limit for their service life after initial 12 years of service from current three years to eight years. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-2109.

As introduced, requires students to make a cumulative grade point average of at least 2.75 at any time continuing eligibility for a Tennessee HOPE scholarship is reviewed to continue to receive the scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, authorizes the state to support a voluntary animal identification program; prohibits the department of agriculture from forcing national animal identification premises registration without specific statutory authorization from the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires all funds received by Tennessee through the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 to be specifically appropriated in the general appropriations act. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9 and Title 67.

As introduced, allows inference that defendant committed offense of simple possession of controlled substance when controlled substance is found in defendant's blood that is lawfully obtained. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As enacted, requires POST commission to develop a standardized written procedure for verifying citizenship status of persons arrested, booked, or confined in a county or municipal jail or detention facility; requires the keeper of a jail to use such procedure and report those persons who are determined to be in the country illegally to the appropriate federal officials. - Amends TCA Title 40.

As enacted, authorizes the board of trustees of the baccalaureate education system trust fund program to establish, or contract for the establishment of an incentive plan to encourage Tennessee residents to participate in any such other college savings program or in any Section 529 college savings program established by the state. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 8.

As introduced, adds a citation to the provision of law that provides for the creation of the state school bond authority in the statute regarding the chairs of excellence endowment fund. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 5.
As introduced, enacts the "Prohibition of Negative Check-Off Act." - Amends TCA Title 47.

As introduced, restricts the use of food dye in foods served or sold in public schools and child care agencies; encourages manufacturers of packaged foods to provide labels warning consumers of any synthetic dyes contained therein. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6; Title 53 and Title 71, Chapter 3.
As introduced, removes the requirement that a home medical equipment provider be accredited by the joint commission on accreditation of health care organizations. - Amends TCA Section 68-11-226.

As introduced, requires that ethical standards adopted by local governments to require each member of a planning commission created by the local government to publicly disclose any conflict of interest the member may have before voting on items that may financially affect the member. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 17, Part 1.
As introduced, imposes certain bidding requirements upon water and wastewater authorities. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221.

As introduced, requires coordinator of elections to promulgate rules and regulations to allow certain members of the U.S. armed forces to return an absentee ballot by facsimile transmission or similar electronic means. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 6.
As introduced, requires county clerks to verify county of residence of persons obtaining or renewing motor vehicle registrations. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As enacted, designates "Gold Star Mother's Day," the last Sunday in September, as a day of special observance. - Amends TCA Title 15, Chapter 2.
As introduced, establishes franchise and excise tax credit for certain commercial broadcasting stations. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
As introduced, creates department of juvenile justice. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8 and Title 37.
As introduced, requires department policies regarding secondary employment by its employees be promulgated as rules and regulations. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 20.

As introduced, removes requirement that commercial advertising on school buses be composed of black lettering on white background by requiring it be composed of lettering on background color. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-2109.

As introduced, suspends driver license of the parent or legal guardian of a student who refuses to participate in parent-teacher conference following the expulsion of the student. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 55.

As introduced, allows school buses to be used up to 20 years of service, subject to annual safety inspections, by extending permissible, yearly waiver limit for their service life after initial 12 years of service from current three years to eight years. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-2109.

As introduced, redefines "person entitled to redeem property" to include only persons who on the date of the tax sale own a legal or equitable interest in the property sold at the tax sale. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-2701.
As introduced, maintains level of creditable service and final average compensation for public employees whose hours of employment are reduced due to a shortage of funds. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As enacted, exempts persons, firms, or corporations dealing solely in recyclable aluminum cans from the requirements on scrap jewelry and metal dealers. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1, Part 2 and Title 62, Chapter 9, Part 1.

As introduced, provides that court-approved attorney fees in medical malpractice case are conclusively presumed to be reasonable in any subsequent action before the board of professional responsibility based on a complaint concerning the amount or reasonableness of the attorney fees. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 26.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of community and economic development to study the effectiveness of municipal and regional planning activity for economic development and to report to the general assembly by January 15, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 13; Title 66 and Title 67.
As introduced, increases value of elderly and disabled residence on which tax relief is available from $25,000 to $30,000 on January 1, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 7.

As introduced, requires public and private institutions of higher education to accept proof of immunization from measles, mumps, and rubella derived from an antibody titer test in lieu of proof of vaccination. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits nonresidents as well as residents of Tennessee from engaging in the business of home inspections without first complying with the requirements of the Home Inspector License Act. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As enacted, authorizes a municipality that purchases land at a delinquent tax sale for municipal taxes only, and after the redemption period has expired, to sell the land for less than the full amount of the taxes, penalty, cost and interest owed if, upon a majority vote, the municipality's governing body determines that it is impracticable to sell the land for such full amount; exempts Davidson County. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 55, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 5.
As introduced, exempts certain items of tangible personal property from taxation. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As enacted, creates offenses regarding improper wearing of military decorations or falsely representing that one has been awarded military decorations; offense is Class B misdemeanor, unless medal involved is a Congressional Medal of Honor, Distinguished Service Cross, Navy Cross, Air Force Cross, Silver Star, or Purple Heart, in which case it is a Class A misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14 and Title 58, Chapter 1.

As introduced, permits local boards of education to adopt a four-day school calendar; provided, that the calendar conforms to policy developed by the state bord of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30.

As introduced, allows state residents who are 50 percent or more disabled as a result of rheumatoid arthritis to obtain a permanent hunting and fishing combination license at a reduced one-time fee of $10.00. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As enacted, creates a special joint committee to study the creation of a department of aging and adult services. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 13; Title 33; Title 34; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, increases from three to four years time period owner must not have resided at transferred property to be exempt from residential property disclosure. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 5.
As introduced, requires the school year, except for year-round schools, to start no earlier than September 1. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30.
As introduced, prohibits municipal governments from creating new or raising existing taxes on businesses by private act. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54.

As introduced, increases maximum amount of claims for tax refunds commissioner of revenue is authorized to approve from $15,000 to $25,000, and maximum amount that may be approved subject to attorney general review from more than $15,000 to more than $25,000. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As enacted, establishes certain qualifications and standards for real estate continuing education instructors. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 13.
As introduced, requires certain procedures for privatizing fire and related services.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of colon cancer awareness new specialty earmarked license plates; earmarks 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to promote public education and awareness about colon cancer. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, provides for revocation of licenses or certificates of a dentist, dental hygienist, or dental assistant if the licensee or registrant fails to pay license or registration fee within 90 days, instead of 60 days, after such fee becomes due. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As enacted, creates the Tennessee automobile insurance plan; requires all insurance companies licensed to write direct automobile liability policies in this state to be members of the plan. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12, Part 1.

As introduced, states that married couples with one or more minor children in the couple's custody are entitled to a $25,000 homestead exemption for real property owned and used as a principal place of residence by the couple. - Amends TCA Section 26-2-301.
As introduced, prohibits transfer of funds from the highway fund and other transportation funds. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9, Chapter 4; Title 54 and Title 67.
As introduced, defines "milldam" for navigable stream obstruction purposes. - Amends TCA Title 54 and Title 55.

As enacted, establishes a uniform provision whereby an individual may transport up to five gallons of untaxed alcoholic beverages, including beer, into or within this state, even in a dry county, for personal or household use of the individual; specifies that a person may transport in excess of five gallons if the person has the receipts to prove the taxes were paid. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 7 and Title 57, Chapter 3.
As introduced, authorizes fundraising activities conducted by school support organizations off school property. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 6.

As introduced, extends from three years to four the probationary period that public school teachers must serve before they can receive tenure; provides that probationary teachers with low teacher effect scores cannot be rehired for a fourth year. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes.
As introduced, adds University of Tennessee System and Board of Regents as recipients of THEC's annual report on scholarship and grant programs data. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires an LEA revising its policy prohibiting harassment, intimidation, or bullying, which was filed with the commissioner of education, to transmit the revised policy to the commissioner. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires the office of education accountability to update its statutorily required comprehensive study of Tennessee charter schools biennially. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires TSAC to annually prepare a status report for governor and general assembly on the Tennessee HOPE foster child tuition grant program. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 3.
As introduced, clarifies that state house districts must comply with all federal statutes and court decisions. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, deletes requirements that budget document include personal income statement for calendar year 1977 and actual state appropriations for fiscal year 1977-1978. - Amends TCA Section 9-4-5203.

As introduced, clarifies that medical interns, residents, and fellows issued a special training license while participating in an accredited training program are exempt from the occupational privilege tax. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 63; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.
As introduced, makes appropriations for the purpose of defraying the expenses of certain legislative enactments passed during the 2009 session of the 106th general assembly.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of bonds to fund state projects.

As introduced, clarifies that the address of the state Web site has changed from "www.state.tn.us" to "www.tn.gov" for purposes of posting whether nursing homes, residential homes for the aged and assisted-care living facilities have a fire suppression sprinkler system throughout the facility or a smoke detector or alarm in each patient room. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

As introduced, requires a facility, within seven days of notice of the unexpected loss of a nursing home administrator, to notify the members of the general assembly in whose district the nursing home is located. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 68.

As introduced, adopts amount of federal exclusion as amount of inheritance tax exemption for decedents dying in 2009 and continues at such amount for decedents dying in any year thereafter. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.

As enacted, defines "misconduct" for purposes of provisions whereby if an administrator finds that a claimant for unemployment benefits has been discharged for misconduct connected with the claimant's work, then the claimant is disqualified from collecting unemployment benefits; requires any person who receives unemployment benefits by knowingly misrepresenting, misstating, or failing to disclose any material fact, or by making a false statement or false representation without a good faith belief as to the correctness of the statement or representation to repay the amount of benefits received. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.
