As introduced, decreases aggregate amount individual can contribute to candidates and all PACs to $25,000 every two years. - Amends TCA Section 2-10-312.

As introduced, designates that 75 percent of all fines and fees collected as result of speeding ticket by municipality with a population of 5,000 or less on interstates within the territorial limits of such municipality shall be deposited into state's highway fund. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 3.
As introduced, creates the "Citizens' Right to Know: Pretrial Release Program." - Amends TCA Title 40.

As introduced, requires certain executive branch officials and staff and the secretary of state, comptroller of the treasury, and the treasurer to file certain income disclosures. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 3; Title 4; Title 8 and Title 39, Chapter 16.

As introduced, urges state librarian to develop historical pamphlet recognizing Tennesseans' service in WWI and archival endeavors of Mrs. Rutledge Smith. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 3 and Title 10.
As introduced, removes certain exemptions that allow sexual offenders to be on school grounds. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.

As introduced, adds residing with a parent who uses or has within 72 hours used certain drugs to the definition of abuse and requires immediate removal of a child whose parent uses or has within 72 hours used certain drugs. - Amends TCA Title 37.

As introduced, reduces the maximum surety bond amount that may be required of textbook publishers and distributors that contract with the state textbook commission from $1 million to $500,000. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 22.

As introduced, extends time period, from 15 business days to 30 days, within which sheriff or chief of police is required to execute certain documents required if purchaser is not prohibited from possessing firearm. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, requires bottled water containers manufactured in this state and sold here to state whether such bottles contain added fluoride; exempts bottled water not sold for human consumption from labeling requirements. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 53, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, revises certain provisions of the Tennessee charitable gaming implementation law. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 1.

As introduced, requires commissioner of agriculture to post and keep current on the department's web site statistics and other information relative to Tennessee's equine industry compiled by the department. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 1; Title 44 and Title 53, Chapter 7.
As enacted, enacts the "Dairy Farmers Prosperity Act." - Amends TCA Title 44 and Title 53.
As introduced, specifically authorizes personnel of certain emergency management agencies to use blue flashing emergency lights. - Amends TCA Title 55; Title 58 and Title 68, Chapter 140.

As introduced, reduces the distance by which landowners must post signage to effectively restrict persons from hunting game inside the perimeter of the lands being posted from 100-yard to 50-yard intervals. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4.
As introduced, requires employers to pay tipped employees wages at a rate of at least $3.28 per hour, which is one half of the federal minimum wage. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 2.

As introduced, revises the law concerning qualifications for and practices of notary publics in certain circumstances; creates protections for true owners of residential real property where deeds have been signed by persons involved in fraudulent and criminal activities concerning such property. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 39.
As introduced, specifies that certain credits shall not be valued as income for appraisal purposes. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, requires law enforcement officer to have search warrant issued upon showing of probable cause in order to attach a tracking device to the motor vehicle of a suspect; increases to Class B misdemeanor offense of unlawfully installing tracking device on vehicle or person of another. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 6 and Title 40, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, requires the comptroller to assemble a task force to recommend a K-12 capital outlay program funded from excess net lottery proceeds for construction of permanent school improvements to replace nonpermanent structures. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31, Part 10; Title 4, Chapter 51, Part 1; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 9, Part 1; Title 49 and Chapter 1203 of the Private Acts of 2008.

As enacted, exempts persons licensed by the board of any of the professions of healing arts from liability for civil damages resulting from the voluntary provision of health services. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 7.
As introduced, enacts the "Second Amendment Protection Act" prohibiting the sale of microstamped firearms or ammunition in this state. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
As enacted, adds additional injuries that are not covered by workers' compensation. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-110.
As enacted, changes name of "juvenile referee" to "juvenile magistrate" and "child support referee" to "child support magistrate." - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 37.
As introduced, exempts drivers of well-digging rigs from commercial driver license requirements. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 4.

As enacted, allows a commissioned reserve deputy sheriff, as authorized in writing by the sheriff, or commissioned reserve or auxiliary police officer, as authorized by the chief of police, to carry firearms as a law enforcement officer. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-1350.

As introduced, clarifies that a diploma from a home school or church-related school is equivalent to one from a public school, except for purposes related to lotttery proceeds. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, increases the amount to which the local option sales tax may be applied from $1,600 to $3,200 and establishes an annual adjustment based on the percentage increase of the consumer price index to be rounded up to the nearest multiple of $100. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-702 and Section 67-6-202.
As introduced, limits application of the preemption provision in the "County Powers Relief Act" to counties and metropolitan governments. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-2913.
As enacted, enacts the "Soil Scientist Licensing Act of 2009." - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 18 and Section 68-221-409.

As introduced, authorizes the purchase of secondhand items by local governments as long as the general range of value of the item is documented through a listing in a recognized publication or through an appraisal and the price is no more than 10 percent of the documented range. - Amends TCA Section 12-3-1003.

As introduced, reduces time period, from 30 days to 20 days, from date of filing petition within which Tennessee regulatory authority is required to dispose of such petition. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 1; Title 65, Chapter 2; Title 65, Chapter 28 and Title 65, Chapter 4.

As enacted, incorporates the use of green building design, sustainable infrastructure, and energy efficiency technologies into the powers authorities are authorized to exercise for redevelopment projects. - Amends TCA Section 13-20-202.
As introduced, increases from $50.00 to $60.00 the fee charged a person making an application to have criminal record expunged. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32.
As introduced, requires the state to purchase certain Energy Star qualified products. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3 and Title 12, Chapter 4.
As introduced, revises statement of legislative intent on prisoner labor and revises release provisions for inmates, including cash allowance. - Amends TCA Title 41.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Small Farm Economic Revitalization Act." - Amends TCA Title 43; Title 44 and Title 53.
As introduced, requires that the three physician members of the medical care and cost containment committee represent different specialty practice areas. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

As enacted, instructs the state board of education to review LEA policies on school personnel recommending psychotropic drugs such as Ritalin to treat elementary and secondary school students for behavioral concerns; requires the state board to report its findings to the select oversight committee on education. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires judge, when addressing a defendant who intends to plead guilty to a charge of domestic assault, to advise the defendant prior to the plea of the state and federal firearms consequences of such a plea. - Amends TCA Title 30, Chapter 13, Part 1.
As introduced, requires every public school student to participate in physical education every day during the school year. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, further defines "workbook" for purposes of sales and use taxes to include printed material reproduced by teachers through photocopying, printing, or other means. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, authorizes a special license plate for certain volunteer firefighters free of charge. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, requires the department to keep personal information obtained in connection with handgun permits confidential to same extent as information in motor vehicle records. - Amends TCA Section 55-25-104.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Renewable Fuels Blending Act of 2009." - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 25.
As introduced, includes handgun carry permits in definition of "motor vehicle record" for purposes of the "Uniform Motor Vehicle Records Disclosure Act." - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 25, Part 1.
As introduced, requires the department of environment and conservation to promulgate rules regulating the disposal and use of coal combustion byproducts. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.

As introduced, prohibits state from being required to participate in the implementation of the federal REAL ID Act of 2005, which mandates a national identification card for each citizen of the United States. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 55.

As introduced, allows local government to require reasonable compensation for use of public rights-of-way for construction of telephone or telegraph lines; provides that fee of 5 percent of provider's gross revenues from operation of such line is presumed reasonable. - Amends TCA Section 65-21-103.
As introduced, requires use of Comprehensive Health Education Curriculum by LEAs. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, extends time for foreclosure notice; requires notice be given to borrower of foreclosure counseling; requires mortgage loans be based upon ability of borrower to repay such loans. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 35; Title 45; Title 47 and Title 66.

As introduced, directs the department of safety not to implement the REAL ID Act of 2005 as enacted by the United States Congress, which mandates a national identification card for each citizen of the United States. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As enacted, replaces references to "obviously intoxicated" with references to "visibly intoxicated" in certain statutes governing the sale of alcoholic beverages to an intoxicated person. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 10, Part 1.
As introduced, requires the affidavit of affixation for a manufactured home to be a separate document. - Amends TCA Section 55-3-138.
As introduced, authorizes a municipal electric system to obtain a state-issued certificate of franchise authority. - Amends TCA Title 7.

As introduced, makes possession of between 1/1000 and 1/8 of an ounce of marijuana a fine only $250 minimum Class A misdemeanor with the first $250 of the amount of the fine going to the drug court in the county of conviction. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As introduced, establishes a homestead exemption of up to $75,000 from liens arising from services provided by a hospital. - Amends TCA Title 26, Chapter 2.

As introduced, requires TDOT to conduct study for the transportation committees regarding motor vehicle accidents on S.R. 93 in Sullivan County and feasibility of improvements to such highway. - Amends TCA Title 54.

As introduced, allows Type D school buses to remain in service for 15 years, with the commissioner of education able to grant a waiver for an additional five years on a year-to-year basis upon inspection. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 21.

As introduced, requires TDOT to conduct study for the transportation committees regarding motor vehicle accidents on S.R. 36 in Sullivan County and feasibility of improvements to such highway. - Amends TCA Title 54.

As enacted, specifies that retailers are prohibited from selling intoxicating liquors to persons who are "visibly intoxicated" or accompanying a "visibly intoxicated" person rather than someone who is "drunk" or accompanying a "drunk" person. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-406 and Section 57-5-301.
As introduced, encourages the bureau of TennCare to take certain actions to improve health outcomes for premature infants. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.
As enacted, "Jimmy 'Pap' Galloway Memorial Bridge," U.S. Highway 27 in Rhea County.
As introduced, subject to local approval, removes recall, initiative, and referendum provisions from charter. - Amends amend Chapter 84 of the Private Acts of 1991; as amended.

As introduced, allows counties and municipalities to create exemption to local option sales tax for replacement trees purchased toward commercial or public utility property's required tree density. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, requires the state treasurer to submit a written report each year concerning the assistance program for small and minority-owned businesses and the small and minority-owned business assistance program fund. - Amends TCA Section 65-5-113.

As introduced, creates six-member diversity business enterprise select oversight committee to review and evaluate diversity in state contracting and procurement; three members to be appointed by the speaker of the senate, one from each grand division; three members to be appointed by the speaker of the house, one from each grand division. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15; Title 4 and Title 12.
As enacted, enacts the "Market Regulation Act of 2009." - Amends TCA Section 65-5-109.

As enacted, authorizes manufacture of intoxicating liquors and/or drinks in certain counties that approved both retail package sales and liquor-by-the drink sales and in counties in the river resort district that have approved retail package sales, all by referendum; specifies that certain distance requirements of law will apply to manufacturers under this act. - Amends TCA Section 57-2-103.

As enacted, exempts from payment of food service establishment fees those bona fide charitable and nonprofit organizations that operate food banks and on-site feeding programs for free distribution of food to combat poverty and hunger; exempts from regulation as a food services establishment a house or other residential structure where seriously ill or injured children and their families are provided temporary accommodations in proximity to their treatment hospitals and where food is prepared, served, transported, or stored by volunteer personnel. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 14, Part 3.
As introduced, changes limitation on maximum time in transit to or from school from one and one-half hours each way to one hour each way. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-2105.
As introduced, reduces from 90 to 60 days period in which dealer can be reimbursed on refunded item for sales tax collected but not yet remitted to commissioner. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires department of agriculture to promulgate rules and regulations to ensure that gasoline that is not gasoline-alcohol blend is available for distribution or retail in each county. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 13.
As introduced, requires health insurance policies and contracts to cover treatment of lymphedema. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, creates select oversight committee on veterans affairs. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15.

As introduced, permits the commissioner of correction to specifically deny in writing an employee's request to examine investigative records and reports of the internal affairs division of the department of ongoing investigations prior to a due process hearing at which disciplinary action is considered or issued. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-504.

As introduced, requires applications for establishment of charter schools to provide, in addition to the names and addresses of the members of the governing body, a telephone number or email address for each member. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.
As introduced, removes the prohibition that the failure to wear a seat belt is inadmissible into evidence in a civil action. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-604.

As enacted, requires the bureau of TennCare to reimburse crossover claims for full benefit dual eligibles at 100 percent of the Medicare allowable charge for pharmacy services. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5.

As introduced, eliminates reimbursement for airline travel by members of the general assembly living 100 miles or more from Nashville to Nashville during legislative sessions; prohibits reimbursement for airline travel to instate committee meetings; limits reimbursement for airline travel to out-of-state committee meetings to one ticket per year. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-106.

As introduced, requires county clerks to verify county of residence of persons obtaining or renewing motor vehicle registrations; requires applicant to pay wheel taxes for previous years the applicant failed to pay the applicable wheel tax to the county where the applicant resides. - Amends TCA Section 55-4-105.

As introduced, increases minimum age of a motor vehicle exempt from title requirements for motor vehicle dismantlers and recyclers and scrap metal dealers from 10 years to 15 years. - Amends TCA Section 55-3-202.

As introduced, makes various revisions to the election laws including allowing a person to email a transfer of voter registration with a scanned signature and increasing maximum size of precincts from 5,000 voters to 7,500 voters. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, creates exemption from excise and franchise tax for entities owned by a branch of the U.S. armed forces that derive more than half of gross income from operation of facilities located on federally owned or leased property and operated primarily to benefit armed forces members. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2 and Title 67, Chapter 4.

As enacted, provides that non-resident parties secure judicial review of board of review decisions by filing in the chancery court of the county where the employer is located unless it is a tax case in which case filing would be in Davidson County. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

As introduced, creates alternative procedure for competitive bids for governmental utility board if board finds it is unlikely such procedure will encourage favoritism or substantially diminish competition for contracts. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3.

As enacted, makes confidential information regarding a public employee's health savings account, retirement account, and pension account; specifies that confidentiality provisions of this act and other existing law regarding public employees also applies to former public employees. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.
As introduced, makes teacher effect data for tenured teachers public records and requires the data to be posted on the Internet. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 6.

As introduced, requires treasurer to divest any holdings of the Tennessee consolidated retirement system in securities issued by companies that have substantial current operations in nations determined by the United States department of state to be state-sponsors of terrorism. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 37.

As enacted, modifies certain statutory provisions pertaining to criminal simulation and certain other types of theft related to the recording of live performances. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes pole attachments at just and reasonable rates to municipally owned utilities' and rural cooperatively-owned utilities' poles by telecommunications service providers and cable operators. - Amends TCA Section 65-21-105.
As introduced, grants state recognition to certain Indian tribes, bands, and groups; provides means for other Indian tribes, bands, and groups to receive state recognition. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As enacted, names Chattanooga Tennessee National Guard Armory in honor of the late CSM Bobby G. Davis, Tennessee Army National Guard, Retired.
As introduced, adopts an alternative base period, part-time worker eligibility, and extended benefits while in training into unemployment law. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Court Reporter Act of 2009." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 20, Chapter 9.

As enacted, extends the time by which the Tennessee Duck River development agency must deliver a written report for alternative source analysis to certain members of the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 1.
As enacted, "Bob Couch Highway," segment of U.S. Highway 41A in Coffee County.

As enacted, prohibits disciplinary action or discharge of an employee of the department of correction based solely upon the employee's refusal to take a polygraph examination or for failure of a polygraph examination.
As introduced, allows constables to collect mileage fees from sheriffs for transporting mentally ill patients. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 33.

As introduced, requires department of finance to fully fund copay reimbursements for Medicare and Medicaid dual eligible enrollees who utilize emergency medical services. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 71.
As introduced, establishes certain agricultural economic growth and development grant pilot projects. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 43; Title 44; Title 53; Title 54 and Title 67.
As introduced, establishes grant program administered by department to support emergency services in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 9, Chapter 4; Title 38; Title 58 and Title 68.
As introduced, increases radius within which a vehicle exceeding width and height requirements used only for certain purposes can be moved from 50 miles to 60 miles. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires a police officer to make a reasonable effort to verify a person's identity prior to determining that a citation cannot be issued in lieu of an arrest for a misdemeanor offense because the person failed to provide satisfactory evidence of identification. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, directs the board for licensing health care facilities to develop a rule to authorize certified medical technicians to administer medications to residents of assisted care living facilities and residential homes for the aged. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

As enacted, prohibits confiscations of lawfully possessed firearms and ammunition during periods of martial rule; clarifies firearm and ammunition restriction prohibitions during any state of emergency, major disaster, or natural disaster. - Amends TCA Title 58, Chapter 1, Part 1 and Title 58, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As introduced, requires department of safety to deliver draft copy of public necessity rules to the government operations committees, simultaneous with the submission of such rules to attorney general for approval. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8, Chapter 23; Title 10; Title 39, Chapter 16; Title 49, Chapter 6; Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 55 and Title 65.

As introduced, increases franchise and excise tax credit for financial institutions donating to the Tennessee rural development opportunity fund from 10 percent of contribution to 11 percent of contribution. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, defines "third party logistics provider" and establishes licensing requirements for third party logistics providers. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10; Title 53, Chapter 11 and Title 63, Chapter 10.

As introduced, clarifies that term "operating costs," for purposes of fiscal notes for bills resulting in net increase in periods of state incarceration, includes deductions for reductions in recidivism and cost savings to community. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 2.
As enacted, enacts the "Interstate Compact on Educational Opportunity for Military Children." - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, prohibits publication of any information contained in an application or application for renewal of a handgun carry permit; allows access by law enforcement for investigation or prosecution; gives civil cause of action to anyone whose information is published. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-504; Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13 and Title 55.

As introduced, requires citizenship status to be proven prior to registration to vote and requires certain procedures to ensure identity and citizenship status prior to voting. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 4.

As enacted, excludes temporary total benefits from the calculation of the maximum total benefit for injuries that occur on or after July 1, 2009; specifies that an injured worker claiming a mental injury will be conclusively presumed to be at maximum medical improvement upon the earliest occurrence of the certain events.
As introduced, revises reporting dates for certain specified reports related to workers' compensation to January 1 of each year. - Amends TCA Title 50 and Title 56.

As enacted, requires the select oversight committee on education to conduct a hearing on the status of differentiated pay programs in Tennessee, including bonuses or other compensation tied to performance standards. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 6.

As introduced, extends time period for requirement of any new voting system purchased or leased to be a system using precinct-based optical scanners from after January 1, 2009, to after June 30, 2009. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Chapter 1108 of the Public Acts of 2008.

As introduced, urges the department to undertake an analysis to assist the legislature in determining the future direction of licensing and oversight of methadone maintenance programs and to share any findings, if so undertaken, with the governor and the health and human resources committee of the house and the general welfare, health and human resources committee of the senate. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

As enacted, permits bureau to digitize sex offender files and provides that a digitized copy of original is same as an original for all purposes, including introduction into evidence in a judicial or administrative proceeding. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.
As enacted, extends termination date for select oversight committee on TennCare to June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Section 3-15-509.
As introduced, transfers bomb and arson section within the department of commerce and insurance to the Tennessee bureau of investigation. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6 and Title 68, Chapter 102.

As introduced, requires the lease for any residential rental property located in Davidson County to contain a provision requiring the tenant to pay the rent due under the lease to the county clerk to cover costs assessed by the county to remedy certain conditions on the property. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 7 and Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 5.

As introduced, requires state mileage rate to be set by department of finance and administration in amount at least 90 percent of the standard mileage rate allowed by IRS as deduction for taxpayer's use of automobile for business expense purpose. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 10.

As enacted, exempts Wilson County from the requirement that appeals from the Probate Court (i.e., General Sessions Court acting as the Probate Court) must be heard anew in Chancery Court de novo. - Amends TCA Section 30-2-609.

As introduced, requires local governments to post the status of any pledge made to obtain a loan from the wastewater facility revolving loan fund on a Web site maintained by the government, if one is maintained. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 10 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 12.
As introduced, increases the amount required to be advanced by a lender in order to participate in a borrower's enterprise or venture from $500,000 to $750,000. - Amends TCA Title 47.

As introduced, exempts entities that provide job training and employment for developmentally disabled adults, which are licensed as adult day habilitation facilities and receive no direct state or federal funding, from requirements to have an individual program plan and and to provide or procure assistance for clients in locating qualified medical, dental, and pharmaceutical care. - Amends TCA Title 33 and Title 49.

As introduced, mirrors the federal veterans' preference points for disabled veterans, their spouses or mothers of a veteran who died in service or who is permanently and totally disabled. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30, Part 3.

As enacted, authorizes the county legislative body of Knox County by a two-thirds vote to levy as court costs an additional litigation tax of $1.00 up to a maximum of $5.00 for each petition, warrant and citation, including warrant and citation for traffic offense, filed in the general sessions and juvenile courts; such tax may be increased yearly by $1.00. - Amends TCA Section 16-20-106.
As introduced, requires mortgage counselor be consulted before an adjustable rate mortgage can be completed. - Amends TCA Title 47.

As introduced, permits student who is eligible for in-state tuition as child of divorced parents, one of whom is domiciled in Tennessee, to be eligible for HOPE scholarships; provided, that such student meets all applicable academic and nonacademic requirements, other than residency, for the scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, removes exemptions that allow sexual offender to be temporarily on school grounds, during school hours, to attend an academic conference or school event; to drop off or pick up a child; or to make a mail, food, or other such delivery. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.

As introduced, requires the departments of health and human services to make certain reports to the general assembly concerning nursing homes and adult protective services. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.
As enacted, creates municipal court for any municipality that does not have such a court established by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 18, Part 3.

As introduced, requires all statutorily mandated smoke detectors installed after January 1, 2010, to be photo-electric devices or a combination of ionized and photo-electric. - Amends TCA Section 37-2-412; Title 68, Chapter 102, Part 1; Title 68, Chapter 11 and Title 68, Chapter 120, Part 1.

As introduced, subject to local approval, prohibits any purchases that comply with energy efficiencies standards and life cycles costing employed by the state of Tennessee in its procurement policies. - Amends Chapter 156 of the Private Acts of 1941; as amended.

As enacted, establishes an EFFECTs position to establish an accountability process to insure state government is efficient, forward-looking, focused, energetic, competent, and transparent. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, requires office of criminal justice programs in department of finance and administration to establish program, and seek federal funding, for use by drug courts to combat overt drug trafficking and associated violence. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 22.
As introduced, creates the "Forward Thinking for Education Task Force." - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, subject to local approval, creates position of city manager and various departments within the town. - Amends Chapter 13 of the Private Acts of 1979; as amended.

As enacted, specifies that the present law provision limiting the per meeting amount of $250 for Huntsville Utility District commissioners in Scott County will be repealed if the commissioners of the water and sewer utility district adopt a resolution applying the general law payment of $300 per meeting to such commissioners by December 1, 2009.
As introduced, subject to local approval, makes certain changes to the charter of the City of Harriman. - Amends Chapter 165 of the Private Acts of 1917; as amended.

As introduced, establishes a pilot program for the development and testing of coal to liquid fuels technology and coal to carbonite technology production techniques and conversion technology. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 13; Title 49; Title 59 and Title 67.

As enacted, requires the department of education to explore with the Tennessee congressional delegation and the United States department of education modification of No Child Left Behind determination of who is a dropout for students who receive a GED and pass appropriate examinations or have good scores on the ACT. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, authorizes a releasing facility and qualified mental health professional to consult with certain additional adult family members in developing an outpatient treatment plan. - Amends TCA Title 33.

As introduced, requires person convicted of DUI to obtain a special "DUI OFFENDER" license plate from department of revenue for display on the person's vehicle for a year plus any period of time the person has a restricted license.

As introduced, requires agency to develop and implement a system of county needs scores to, among other things, ensure that suburban communities have equal opportunity and awards similar to urban communities. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 23.

As introduced, subject to local approval, provides that the members of the municipal board of education shall be elected in the same manner used to elect the city council. - Amends amend Chapter 84 of the Private Acts of 1991; as amended by Chapter 140 of the Private Acts of 1996, Chapter 2 of the Private Acts of 1997, Chapter 130 of the Private Acts of 2002, Chapter 64 of the Private Acts of 2005.
As introduced, enacts the "Supreme Court Voter-Owned Elections Act." - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

As introduced, requires judge, when addressing a defendant who intends to plead guilty to a charge of domestic assault, to advise the defendant prior to the plea of the state and federal firearms consequences of such a plea. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

As enacted, revises provisions governing the notice to be given prior to enforcing a lien for uncollected property taxes; removes certain county exclusions from requirement. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
As enacted, includes wastewater facilities within the definition of local government for certain purposes. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31 and Title 68, Chapter 221.
As enacted, requires country trustee to submit plan to comptroller regarding partial tax payments prior to the trustee's accepting partial payment of property taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As enacted, replaces the term "qualified zone academy project" with the term "school credit bond project" in the Tennessee State School Bond Authority Act; authorizes the TSSBA to allocate, on behalf of the state, the national zone academy bond limitation allocated to the state among the state, local governments and public charter schools; revises other various provisions governing school credit bond projects. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 49.
As enacted, revises emergency financial aid law to consider the economic distress of a local government due to a natural disaster.

As enacted, requires that certain meetings of an audit committee abide by public notice and public meeting provisions; authorizes confidential meetings in certain circumstances; classifies certain audit-related documents as confidential. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Title 9, Chapter 3 and Title 4, Chapter 3.

As introduced, includes in the definition of "public deposits" certain funds held by a bond trustee; authorizes the investment of such funds in the pooled investment fund or local government investment pool. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4.
As enacted, authorizes Hamilton, Knox, Davidson and Shelby counties to sell bonds at private sale, until June 30, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 21.

As enacted, authorizes and directs the state funding board to cancel bonds that have been authorized to be issued by the board if the board determines that certain circumstances exist and that the canceled amount is no longer needed to fund the authorized project. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 9, Part 2.

As introduced, authorizes the entering into of loan and grant agreements between the Tennessee local development authority and local government units from funds provided by the federal American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31 and Title 68, Chapter 221.

As enacted, authorizes the Tennessee local development authority to charge and collect reasonable administrative fees and expenses from local governments under the Wastewater Facilities Act of 1987 and community public water systems under the Drinking Water Revolving Loan Fund Act of 1997; such fees will not become part of the wastewater facility revolving loan fund or the water system revolving loan fund.

As enacted, adds the governor, secretary of state, state treasurer, comptroller, and commissioner of finance and administration, or their designees, as ex officio members of the Tennessee local development authority. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31, Part 1.

As enacted, reduces from three to two the number of consecutive years a utility district, water system, or wastewater facility must have a negative change in net assets in order to be considered financially distressed. - Amends TCA Section 7-82-703; Section 7-82-401 and Section 68-221-1010.
As enacted, enacts the "Local Government Electronic Technology Act of 2009."

As introduced, expands county powers shared with municipalities for Hamilton County by a two-thirds vote to include the power granted to municipalities by  6-2-201(30) concerning the ability to regulate, tax, license, or suppress the keeping or going at large of animals; the exercise of such power is limited to the unincorporated areas of the county. - Amends TCA Section 5-1-118.

As introduced, authorizes department to issue certificate of free sale for food, drugs, or cosmetics if manufacturer or distributor is authorized to manufacture or distribute the product and it can be sold freely or the party has provided documentation of FDA inspection and the party appears to be authorized to sell. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 1.
As introduced, modifies the definition of domestic violence victim. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6 and Section 39-13-111.

As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Modernization and Economic Stimulus Act." - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.
As introduced, changes the effective date of Chapter 1041 of the Public Acts of 2008 from December 31, 2009, to July 1, 2012. - Amends Chapter 1041 of the Public Acts of 2008.

As introduced, permits Montgomery County upon adoption of a resolution by two thirds of the county commission to use Type D transit buses for 15 years or for up to 17 years, if the number of miles traveled does not exceed 225,000. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 21.
As introduced, requires TDOT to ensure share of federal stimulus funds for transportation are allocated directly to rural planning organizations in proportion to population. - Amends TCA Title 54.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for Cherohala Skyway; allocates proceeds from such plates to Cherohala Skyway Visitor Center. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of commerce and insurance to submit an annual report on or before July 1 to the governor and the general assembly concerning life settlements. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 2; Title 56, Chapter 50; Section 56-52-102 and Title 56, Chapter 7.
As introduced, delays unemployment trust fund balance report from February 1 to March 1. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.
As introduced, corrects cross-reference in code from " 62-11-108" to " 62-11-109." - Amends TCA Section 62-11-106.
As introduced, makes failing to accept a licensed physician in good standing into a network and pay fair market value an unfair trade practice. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, clarifies that certain homemade foods may be sold at farmers' markets; exempts preparer and seller of such foods from certain food regulations. - Amends TCA Title 53.
As enacted, designates TBI headquarters in Nashville as "Arzo Carson TBI State Office Building."
As introduced, subject to local approval, increases the hotel motel tax from 4 percent to 5 percent; redistributes the proceeds. - Amends Chapter 102 of the Private Acts of 1979; as amended.

As enacted, amends the Landfill Methane Development Act to identify certain circumstances and purposes for which refined, landfill methane shall be deemed to be natural gas. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 28, Part 2.

As introduced, exempts municipalities and counties from meeting the requirements for funeral directing for burials of human remains in municipally or county-owned cemeteries if no charge is made for the burial and the cemeteries are not operated for profit. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5, Part 1.
As enacted, authorizes county conservation boards, upon majority vote of membership, to meet no less frequently than quarterly rather than monthly. - Amends TCA Section 11-21-103.

As introduced, requires commissioner of tourist development to report annually to the transportation committees on recommendations of additions to the state scenic roadway system; requires consideration be given to roads that bicyclists can safely enjoy. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 17, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of cultural license plates for University of Illinois. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, establishes requirements for home health companies to provide assistance with medication to clients; requires background checks of employees, recordkeeping, and waiver. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 7 and Title 68.

As introduced, revises standards under which the department of human services must seek authorization to provide protective services for disabled adults. - Amends TCA Title 34 and Title 71, Chapter 6.
As introduced, expands the grounds upon which a search warrant may be issued to include reasonable suspicion of an act of terrorism. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, empowers the governor to enter into leasing arrangements to properly develop gas resources of property owned by the state. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 2; Title 60, Chapter 1 and Title 70, Chapter 1.

As introduced, decreases penalty for Class A misdemeanor offense of unlawful sale of air conditioner evaporator coil or condenser to a Class C fine only misdemeanor if the defendant is certified to repair and install HVAC equipment. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 9.
As introduced, clarifies that former members of all county legislative bodies may solemnize marriages. - Amends TCA Section 36-3-301.
As introduced, deletes residency requirements for wholesalers, retailers, and wineries. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3 and Title 57, Chapter 4.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Interior Design Act." - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 2; Section 62-6-501 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 17.

As enacted, creates a mechanism for local governmental units to purchase goods and services through a competitive reverse auction process after filing a plan with the comptroller to document internal controls to ensure the integrity of the process. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 12; Title 13; Title 41; Title 42; Title 49; Title 64 and Title 68.

As introduced, deletes existing false claims statutes and replaces them with a revised false claims statute; requires a mechanism for establishing the primacy of certain insurance claims. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 50; Title 56 and Title 71.

As introduced, limits claims by employees for certain injuries arising in time up through settlement approval or final trial order for an existing claim even if the injury occurred during medical treatment. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 56.

As introduced, specifies a psychiatrist, rather than a psychologist, must evaluate an inmate convicted of a sex crime and determine that the inmate does not pose a threat prior to release. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.
As introduced, enacts the Tennessee Solid Waste Commodity Management and Community Recycling Enhancement Act of 2009.
As introduced, requires credit card issuers to credit payments by mail to card holders' accounts as of the date the payment is postmarked. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 47, Chapter 22.
As enacted, names Knoxville, Tennessee, National Guard Armory in honor of the late Colonel Russell Austin Newman, USA, Retired.
As introduced, designates additional segment of Buffalo River, which is segment in Lewis County, as Class II Pastoral River. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 13.

As introduced, restores occupational and disability exemptions to jury service in effect prior to January 1, 2009, and adds dentists to exempt occupations. - Amends TCA Title 22, Chapter 1 and Title 63, Chapter 5, Part 1.
As introduced, revises accrediting agency for social worker programs to include colleges and universities approved by the board of social workers. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 23, Part 1.

As introduced, requires doctors and hospitals treating minor children to release the results of medical tests and procedures performed on the child to the child's parents upon request. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 1; Title 63 and Title 68.

As enacted, authorizes conveyance of certain property purchased at tax sale by Shelby County, or included municipality, to adjoining property owners upon actual or in-kind payments of property's fair market value. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-2509(d).

As enacted, specifies that if the regional area outside of the municipal boundaries is less than 50 percent of the entire regional area then only one member of a municipal planning commission will be appointed from the regional area outside the municipal boundaries regardless of the number of members on a municipal planning commission designated as a regional planning commission; in the alternative the commission may be increased in size by the number of members appointed from the regional area outside the municipal boundaries. - Amends TCA Section 13-3-102.

As introduced, designates certain utility facilities as being eligible for reimbursement from the department of transportation for the costs of relocation due to highway construction. - Amends TCA Section 54-5-804.
As introduced, authorizes repeal of Tennessee River Resort District status by two-thirds vote of legislative body of jurisdiction. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-103.

As introduced, requires any person convicted of a Class A misdemeanor who has been previously convicted of 10 or more Class A misdemeanors within the previous 10 years to be treated as if the person has committed a Class E felony. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35.

As introduced, requires physicians to notify department of children's services when treating an infant addicted to alcohol or controlled substances; directs department to monitor such children. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 5 and Title 68.

As introduced, permits person with handgun carry permit who is not consuming alcohol to carry handgun into unposted establishment that serves alcohol for consumption on the premises. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
As introduced, enacts "Tennessee Firearms Owners Relief Act of 2009." - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As introduced, requires secretary of state to promulgate rules and regulations to allow corporations to file annual report with department of revenue, accompanying franchise and excise tax return, for delivery to secretary of state; and imposes $30.00 fee for such filing. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 11 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires the secretary of state to promulgate a consolidated form for certain filings and requires the commissioner of revenue to convey certification to the secretary of state for purposes of termination of entities. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 3; Title 48 and Title 67, Chapter 1.

As introduced, sets the 2007-2008 fiscal year funding level as a floor beneath which total funds available for healthcare services to hospitals through the TennCare program may not fall. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5.

As enacted, authorizes certain municipalities to allow golf carts on certain public roads within their jurisdiction upon the adoption of an ordinance by a two-thirds vote. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 1, Part 1 and Title 55, Chapter 8.

As enacted, specifies in provisions governing liability of landowner to persons using land that the immunity will not be removed in cases of conduct that results in a failure to guard or warn against a dangerous condition, use, structure or activity if the dangerous condition was created by a force of nature. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 7.

As enacted, permits a principal broker to act as principal broker for two firms as long as both firms are in the same location, which means the firms have the same physical address. - Amends TCA Section 62-13-309.

As introduced, requires employers to report to department of human services certain identifying information regarding employment of subcontractors and independent contractors. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 5, Part 11.

As enacted, allows register in Knox, Blount, Shelby, and Sevier counties to redact social security numbers on recorded documents maintained on computers or removable computer storage media. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-515.
As introduced, requires THEC to report to the senate and house education committees on the adequacy of higher education employees' retirement benefits. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 49.

As enacted, prohibits local governments from restricting the authorized practice of veterinary medicine; specifies that local governments may regulate time and place of business operations of veterinarians, if not in conflict with state law. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 12.

As introduced, requires the health services and development agency to report to the senate general welfare, health and human resources committee and the house health and human resources committee concerning trends in the certificate of need process for hospitals by February 1, 2010, and every four years thereafter. - Amends TCA Section 68-11-1608.

As enacted, revises provisions governing notice that must be given by any person asserting a potential claim for medical malpractice to each health care provider against whom the claim is being made; revises provisions governing certificate of good faith that must be filed. - Amends TCA Section 29-26-121.

As introduced, authorizes governing bodies of local governments to make appropriations to reimburse taxpayers for overpayment of property taxes due to clerical errors; revises description of clerical errors; clarifies jurisdiction of state board of equalization. - Amends TCA Section 5-5-124; Section 6-55-604; Section 67-5-509; Section 67-5-1412 and Section 67-5-1501.

As introduced, requires that judicial review of action of the state board of equalization be conducted in accordance with the Uniform Administrative Procedures Act; authorizes reviewing court to remand to board for additional proof upon request of party who was pro se before board and whose case is not substantially prejudiced as a result. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-1511.

As enacted, requires apportionment and distribution of sales and use tax revenue of certain hotels in an amount equal to the amount of such revenue derived from sales of goods or services on the premises of the hotel or inn, excluding revenue derived from the increases in such taxes from 5.5 to 7 percent; revenue so distributed may only be used to retire debt incurred prior to April 1, 2009, in renovating the hotel or inn and will continue only until the debt is retired. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4 and Title 67, Chapter 6.

As enacted, provides that present law pertaining to rented premises unfit for habitation, which was enacted in 2008 and is scheduled to expire July 1, 2009, shall continue until later amended or repealed. - Amends TCA Section 68-111-109 and Chapter 1027 of the Public Acts of 2008.

As introduced, revises the membership of the judicial selection commission and the judicial evaluation commission; decreases term of commission members from six to four years; requires senate confirmation of governor's nominee to fill a vacancy for any state court judge; increases the vote from a majority vote to 60 percent vote that a judge must receive in a retention election; extends the sunset provision for the judicial selection and evaluation commissions to June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4; Title 16 and Title 17.

As enacted, provides that all aggravated burglaries a defendant commits within a 24-hour period count as separate prior convictions for purposes of determining if the defendant is a multiple, persistent, or career offender under the criminal sentencing reform act. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35.

As enacted, requires municipalities and counties to compile and maintain as public record a zoning ordinance and map; creates a presumption that a zoning ordinance and map made available to the public through a compilation is a true and accurate statement of the zoning ordinance and map, which presumption created may only be overcome by clear and convincing evidence that the ordinance and map is inaccurate.
As introduced, creates special joint committee to study unnecessary barriers hindering ability of small businesses to compete.

As introduced, designates certain counties containing areas designated as economically distressed by the federal government as tier 3 economically distressed counties for job tax credit purposes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.

As introduced, clarifies status of property leased or rented with medical equipment, substances, or implants as property held for lease or rent. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4 and Title 67, Chapter 5.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Transportation State Infrastructure Fund Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 12; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.
As introduced, enacts the "Rural, Agricultural and Natural Resources Act" (RANRA). - Amends TCA Title 43 and Title 68.

As introduced, enacts the "Streamlining Higher and Postsecondary Education (SHAPE) Act." - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 8; Title 9; Title 10; Title 12; Title 13; Title 20; Title 29; Title 39; Title 40; Title 43; Title 49; Title 50; Title 54; Title 62; Title 63; Title 64; Title 66; Title 67 and Title 68.
As introduced, prohibits the operation of proprietary schools where credit hours for coursework are not transferable. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 20.

As introduced, prohibits a stay or injunction for appeals cases involving public school funding where the amount of judgment entered by the trial court against the appellant exceeds $10 million. - Amends TCA Title 16.
As introduced, establishes a task force to reconstitute the current structure of the public school system. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires state board to create an occupational diploma for students with disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, exempts deliberations of civil service merit boards from the requirements of the open meetings law. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 44.

As introduced, appropriates amount equal to the amount received from federal government under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 for clean and drinking water state revolving funds to the Tennessee local development authority for water programs.

As introduced, prohibits convicted felons from being employed by mental health residential facilities; requires the department of mental health and developmental disabilities to maintain files on the employees of such facilities. - Amends TCA Title 33.

As introduced, changes composition of the judicial selection commission; makes all meetings and records of the commission open to the public; requires judicial applicants to submit to work and credit history checks and to submit to criminal record checks; requires that certain judges be elected by voters within the respective grand divisions of the state. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4; Title 16 and Title 17.

As enacted, authorizes the sale of liquid drain openers containing sulfuric acid in concentrations of 10 percent or more intended or packaged in a form suitable for use in households if the packaging conforms to federal laws and regulations. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 131, Part 1.

As introduced, requires the department to promulgate as a rule by means of cross-reference the manual relating to the child care certificate program and requires administrative hearings in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As enacted, revises various provisions of the Tennessee Public Charter Schools Act, including provisions governing eligible students, the authorized number of charter schools, and the authorized term of a charter. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

As introduced, includes bomb and arson special agents among those persons in the TCRS engaged in law enforcement activities on a day-to-day basis having a mandatory retirement age. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 2.
As enacted, designates a certain portion of I-65 as the "Deputy Brian Denning Memorial Highway."
As introduced, enacts the "Embryo Donation and Adoption Act of 2009." - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37 and Title 68.
As introduced, authorizes the state to issue bonds to fund grants for certain projects.
As introduced, appropriates funds for 2008-2009 fiscal year.
As introduced, revises method of appointing non-municipal regional members to a municipal planning commission designated as a regional planning commission. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As introduced, requires the state board of education to develop a green jobs vocational and technical education program. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, relieves the sheriff or transportation agent in Hamilton County from further transportation duties after the person being transported to the hospital or treatment resource has been delivered to such facility; places further transportation duties on such facilities. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 6, Part 4.
As introduced, creates a statewide elected office of lieutenant governor starting in 2010. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 8.

As introduced, limits admissibility in any civil action involving conduct that constitutes sexual harassment or sexual assault of certain evidence of plaintiffs sexual conduct by the defendant in order to prove consent by the plaintiff or the absence of injury to the plaintiff. - Amends TCA Title 24, Chapter 7 and Title 40, Chapter 17.

As introduced, allows recipient of a victim's first complaint of an alleged sexual assault to testify about the fact of the first complaint and the circumstances surrounding the making of that first complaint. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 17.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of Church of God in Christ cultural license plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, permits any state employee to obtain employment with another employer while working as a state employee so long as there are no conflicts with the employment schedule as a state employee. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30.
As introduced, empowers the authority to take any actions necessary to implement and administer the universal service program support mechanism fund.

As introduced, prohibits expenditure of funds by the department of labor and workforce development under unemployment law for any benefits under any policy or statute authorized by the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 that requires expenditure of state funds under the unemployment law after June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.
As enacted, establishes the "Douglas Henry state museum commission." - Amends TCA Title 4.

As enacted, requires law enforcement officers to request proof of compliance with financial responsibility laws upon charging a person with any motor vehicle violation instead of only moving violations. - Amends TCA Section 55-12-139.

As introduced, prohibits secretary of state, comptroller, and treasurer from donating money to or participating in any way in campaigns for candidates for general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 8.

As introduced, removes guardians ad litem from divorce and parenting plan proceedings. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 16; Title 20; Title 29; Title 30; Title 31; Title 33; Title 34; Title 35; Title 36; Title 37; Title 46; Title 50; Title 54; Title 69 and Title 71.

As introduced, authorizes use of fingerprint as form of acknowledgment in lieu of, or in addition to, a person's signature for citations and certain other notices and documents. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 63; Title 16, Chapter 1; Title 40, Chapter 7 and Title 55, Chapter 50.

As introduced, declares that any activity that is conducted and any condition that exists subject to the terms and conditions of a permit issued by any agency, office, or department of the state shall not be found to be a nuisance. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 3.
As enacted, "Bob Good Memorial Bridge," Interstate 26 and State Route 381 interchange in Washington County.

As enacted, codifies the generally accepted practice of municipal governing bodies to act by ordinance if the general law or charter requires the action to be by ordinance and definitely if the action levies a tax, makes a special assessment, is permanent in nature, or has a regulatory or penal effect. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54, Part 5.

As enacted, adds East Fork Stables in Fentress County to the definition of premier type tourist resort for purposes of the sale of alcholic beverages for on-premises consumption. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As introduced, requires department of safety to create identification cards for any resident of the state upon proof of identity and proof of residence. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 50 and Title 55.
As enacted, expresses intent to name appropriate bridge on S.R. 840 in honor of the late First Lieutenant William Eric Emmert, Tennessee Army National Guard.

As introduced, requires a survey of patients and families concerning satisfaction with performance of a long-term care facility; imposes certain requirements on tort actions involving a long-term care facility. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 68.

As enacted, clarifies that the POST commission will issue a certificate to any campus police officer or public safety officer upon the officers completing a training program. - Amends TCA Title 38 and Title 49.

As enacted, imposes certain penalties on employers and employees in certain cases involving employees not authorized to work in the U.S. under federal immigration laws. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 56.

As introduced, subject to local approval, clarifies that a majority of those present and voting shall be necessary for action by the council; clarifies that this voting procedure is to be used for election of Electric Power, Water and Sewage Board members. - Amends Chapter 754 of the Private Acts of 1947.
As enacted, limits tort liability of agritourism professionals under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 43 and Title 70, Chapter 7.

As introduced, permits dependent child of a religious worker who graduates from a high school in the foreign country that is not regionally accredited to eligible for a HOPE scholarship, if the student meets the same requirements as homeschooled religious workers' children who are presently eligible for the scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, lessens time period, from 30 days to 20 days, within which commissioner is required to turn over taxes collected and list of taxpayer information for audit purposes. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, waives handgun permit fees for persons over 65. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
As introduced, authorizes the governor to make interim appointments to fill judicial vacancies if the judicial selection commission sunsets on June 30, 2009.
As enacted, requires posting of a bond in order for a non-participating manufacturer to be included in the directory of tobacco product manufacturers. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 26.

As introduced, provides that student enrolled at a public institution of higher education in a course in which the instructor has a financial interest in the course textbook or materials does not have to purchase such textbook or course materials. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.
As introduced, specifies that government operations committees are standing committees for all bills referred to them. - Amends TCA Section 4-29-118 and Section 4-5-108.
As introduced, specifies elements of a pauper's burial a county must pay. - Amends TCA Section 5-9-101 and Section 5-9-311.

As introduced, prohibits radiology benefits managers from denying authorization for diagnostic radiology testing recommended by a treating physician; requires denial of such testing to be made by a licensed physician. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 63.
As introduced, subject to local approval, authorizes the county legislative body to approve or disapprove certain solid waste facilities based on specific criteria.

As introduced, requires that "shovel ready" highway projects included in the "Accelerated Primary Highway Plan" receive funding priority in utilization of transportation monies earmarked to Tennessee through federal American Recovery and Reinvestment Act. - Amends TCA Title 54 and Title 67, Chapter 3, Part 9.

As introduced, grants a shooting range that had been in operation for at least 30 years prior to December 16, 2008, the right to continue operating at the same location and such right shall not be amended, restricted, or terminated due to zoning changes. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-316.

As introduced, permits notice to dependent spouse in a divorce action of termination of health insurance coverage to occur by some method other than service under the rules of procedure provided the dependent spouse signs written acknowledgement of receipt of the notice. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 23.

As introduced, authorizes the division of consumer protection to consult with the office of open records counsel concerning policies on access to records and disclosure of information. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.

As introduced, creates wine direct shipper license to be issued through the alcoholic beverage commission that would allow certain entities to ship wine directly to consumers age 21 years or older in this state for personal use. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3.

As enacted, authorizes Tennessee State University and Middle Tennessee State University to research and develop methods to address how to use the materials in solid waste as raw materials to create jobs, business, and compost. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.

As introduced, authorizes accountants, engineers, architects, landscape architects, and real estate brokers to present a declaration in lieu of a certified affidavit attesting to such person's inactive status for purposes of demonstrating exemption from the professional privilege tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.

As introduced, clarifies that it is an offense if a person offering or conducting real estate classes represents to a student assurance of passing an examination given by the commission; limits the present Class C misdemeanor penalty to a fine only. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 13.
As introduced, removes requirement for county agricultural extension agents to investigate allegations of cruelty to livestock animals. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2 and Title 44.
As enacted, requires county mayors to administer certain funds for litter control programs. - Amends TCA Section 39-14-510.

As introduced, establishes additional grant of $500 to entering freshman receiving HOPE scholarship or access grant for completion of Tennessee scholars program. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As enacted, urges the state executive committees of each statewide political party to jointly establish a calendar of appearances in each county enabling their respective gubernatorial candidates to appear together during the time between the primary and general elections. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 13, Part 1.
As introduced, requires sale of wine at retail be regulated locally instead of by the alcoholic beverage commission. - Amends TCA Title 57.

As introduced, prohibits a pest control operator from initially entering into a contract for provision of termite prevention or control services on a structure or building until the operator has applied a suitable pesticide to such structure or building. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 21.
As introduced, requires continuing education for all licensees; establishes inactive status for funeral directors and embalmers. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5, Part 6.

As introduced, authorizes secretary of state, treasurer and comptroller of the treasury to establish service in Group 4 for retirement purposes. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 34 and Title 8, Chapter 35.

As introduced, allows ethics commission to provide information on the status of a complaint to the named complainant and the alleged violator. - Amends TCA Section 3-6-102; Section 3-6-107; Section 3-6-117; Section 3-6-202 and Section 3-6-308.

As enacted, allows a special school district to remain in existence when a county, in which there is at least one special school district, and a city or cities within the county choose to form a metropolitan government. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 49.
As introduced, authorizes creation of single source funding districts in counties where more than one LEA exists. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.

As introduced, creates a defense for actions filed to collect the balance due on certain consumer loans that the loan originator did not take into consideration the credit worthiness of the debtor when issuing such loan. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 20; Title 25 and Title 45.
As introduced, enacts the "Community Development Stimulus Grant Act of 2009." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 13; Title 49; Title 54; Title 64 and Title 67.

As enacted, authorizes, in a year of reappraisal, the assessor of property to recognize the effects on property values in areas where significant numbers of foreclosure sales have affected the values of other properties in the area. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, clarifies that only laws enacted prior to the effective date of a supreme court rule are of no further force if in conflict with such rule. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 3, Part 4 and Title 36, Chapter 4.

As enacted, requires juvenile detention facilities and facilities for children who are not in DCS custody that provide community-based alternative education programs to report to the department of education the number of youth detained or served, as well as relevant demographic and service delivery information as specified by the department; requires the department to provide to certain entities a report containing a compilation of the data and a detailed analysis of the findings; requires state board to develop or modify curriculum-based standards, as necessary. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 37; Title 41 and Title 49.

As introduced, allows a student who as an entering freshman meets all nonacademic requirements, but not the academic requirements for a HOPE scholarship, to qualify for the scholarship by meeting the collegiate grade point average continuation requirements after enrolling in an eligible postsecondary institution. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
As introduced, changes date of authority's report to the general assembly from first Monday in February to first Monday in March. - Amends TCA Title 65.

As enacted, exempts housing for persons on a temporary or transitional basis from the provision whereby any residential facility that houses persons with developmental disabilities and is required by law to be licensed by the department of mental health and developmental disabilities will not receive a license if the facility houses more than four such service recipients and is not licensed on June 23, 2000, and the provision whereby the department will not license more than two such residential facilities within 500 yards in any direction from other such facilities housing service recipients. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 24, Part 1 and Title 33, Chapter 2, Part 4.
As introduced, increases the one-time fee for a lifetime senior citizen sportsman license from $200 to $250. - Amends TCA Section 70-2-201.

As introduced, clarifies that general assembly may not substantively amend a proposed revision to a rule of court or procedure reported to it by the supreme court but may fail to approve the proposed revisions to a specific rule or a specific part of a proposed revision to a rule. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 3 and Title 36, Chapter 4.

As introduced, prohibits member of a county election commission or the state election commission from participating in the political management or leadership of a local, state, or federal political party organization or in the management or leadership of a political candidate's campaign during the member's term of office. - Amends TCA Section 2-1-112 and Title 2, Chapter 11, Part 1.

As enacted, requires forfeiture of access to health insurance benefits by any member of the general assembly convicted of a felony involving public office; applies to convictions occurring after this act's effective date. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, provides that members of special school district boards of education serving terms of length other than four years are not limited in the number of terms that they can serve. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.
As introduced, requires food handler employees of a food service establishment to wear plastic or latex disposable gloves. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 8, Part 2 and Title 68, Chapter 14.
As introduced, expands the type of securities in which utility districts may invest. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82.
As introduced, expands authorized investments for counties. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 8.
As introduced, expands authorized investments for municipalities. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 56.

As enacted, limits printed publication of Tennessee legislative record to conclusion of each annual session of the general assembly or as requested by a member of the general assembly for such member's official duties. - Amends TCA Title 3.
As introduced, expresses intent to name Tennessee National Guard Armory in Knoxville in honor of deserving member of United States armed forces from Tennessee.
As introduced, imposes various requirements on court ordered supervised visitation. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As introduced, authorizes prevailing party in a nuisance action to receive, in the court's discretion, court costs, attorney fees, and such discretionary costs as well as any damages to which such party is entitled. - Amends TCA Title 29.
As introduced, requires sausage sold in quantities greater than a pound to be frozen. - Amends TCA Title 53.

As introduced, adds Rarity Pointe in Loudon County to those facilities authorized to sell alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As introduced, enacts the "Rural, Agricultural and Natural Resources Act" (RANRA).

As introduced, specifies duties of administrator of the Tennessee athletic commission; prescribes term of administrator; provides that members of commission who miss three consecutive meetings can be removed for cause. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 115, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Market Regulation Act of 2009." - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 4 and Title 65, Chapter 5.
As enacted, revises the composition of the fiscal review committee's subcommittee on contract services. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 12.

As enacted, adds Laurel Cove in Williamson County to those facilities authorized to sell alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As introduced, makes it a discriminatory practice for an employer to run a "name only" background check without informing the applicant and to base a hiring decision on the information received when the information was actually based on another person whose name was the same or similar to the applicant. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 50.

As introduced, requires juveniles 14-18 adjudicated delinquent for commission of certain sexual offenses to register with the sex offender registry as a violent juvenile sexual offender; requires a juvenile sexual offender to submit a DNA sample to TBI. - Amends TCA Title 40.

As enacted, requires any person commissioned as a railroad police officer to receive POST certification prior to such commission; requires the POST commission to issue a certificate of compliance to any person seeking to be commissioned as a railroad police officer, if the person meets the qualifications for employment as a police officer and satisfactorily completes the approved recruit training program. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8 and Title 65, Chapter 6.

As enacted, requires the comptroller to conduct a study of the economic impact of commercial fishing in Tennessee and report findings to the senate and house environment and conservation committees by January 15, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7, Part 2 and Title 70.

As introduced, requires any person who makes a title pledge loan without a license and who does not return collateral and any money paid by borrower to pay interest to borrower at 10 percent per annum of amount owed. - Amends TCA Section 45-15-101; Section 45-15-102; Section 45-15-103; Section 45-15-104; Section 45-15-105; Section 45-15-106; Section 45-15-107; Section 45-15-108; Section 45-15-109 and Section 45-15-110.

As introduced, specifically prohibits title pledge lenders from advertising using words that are false or misleading. - Amends TCA Section 45-15-112; Section 45-15-113; Section 45-15-114; Section 45-15-115; Section 45-15-116; Section 45-15-117; Section 45-15-118; Section 45-15-119 and Section 45-15-120.
