As introduced, adds conduct involving strangulation to the point of unconsciousness to the criminal code definition of "serious bodily injury." - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As enacted, mandates, rather than allows, release of surety's liability if detainer request is refused or if detaining authority releases principal upon the detainer's filing. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-201.

As introduced, clarifies that refusing to accept a legal writ or other process attempting to be served by a public employee or private process server constitutes obstruction of the service of process. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 16, Part 6.

As introduced, directs the comptroller to study traffic surveillance cameras, places a two-year moratorium on new cameras, and revises fines from traffic violations captured by such cameras. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes lump sum death benefit to beneficiary for noncontributory member dying prior to retirement as if such member had been a contributory member. - Amends TCA Section 8-36-107.

As introduced, requires any contest of a primary election to be heard by an administrative law judge appointed by the secretary of state and conducted as a contested case hearing. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 17.
As introduced, improves retirement benefits of certain Tennessee public employees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36.

As introduced, replaces current, variable Tennessee inheritance tax rate based on total estate amount with a single inheritance tax rate of 6.0 percent for all persons dying in 2011 or later. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8, Part 3.

As enacted, authorizes attorney general to disclose to cigarette manufacturers information concerning number of cigarettes sold with manufacturer's tax stamp affixed in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.

As introduced, allows franchise and excise tax credit for donations to certain charitable organizations that provide scholarships to Tennessee residents to attend Tennessee nonpublic elementary and secondary schools. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 67.

As introduced, specifies that when an employer provides certain evidence showing four or more complaints from customers concerning the employee's work performance, a discharge by an employer shall be deemed to be a discharge for misconduct, and thus, disqualify the claimant from unemployment benefits. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5 and Title 50, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires certain DUI offenders to operate only a motor vehicle that is equipped with a functioning ignition interlock device. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 29; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 55; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, requires policies and rules of the department of health to be fully consistent with the recommendations of the Centers for Disease Control concerning excluding children from school for head lice. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 68.

As enacted, authorizes treating physicians of patients being treated under workers' compensation law to refer such patients for pain management; establishes a presumption that a patient who is beyond the expected period of healing but who is referred to pain management to be at maximum medical improvement for workers' compensation purposes upon the earlier of the date that the treating physician determines the patient to be at maximum medical improvement or 104 weeks after the commencement of pain management.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Multilevel and Pyramid Distributorship Act." - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 47.

As introduced, revises requirements involving a trade or professional association board of directors currently authorized to pool liabilities to qualify as self-insurers to have operating agreements, or a constitution or bylaws as required by present law. - Amends TCA Title 50.

As introduced, creates system of independent review of denial or recoupment of claims by persons with a business purpose of contracting with health care providers for delivery of health care services. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for Tennessee Soccer; proceeds from such plates allocated to Tennessee State Soccer Association for programs and services that foster growth of youth through soccer. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, grants municipalities exclusive right to use their names and symbols. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54, Part 1.

As introduced, requires reporting to general assembly of highway projects that exceed maximum number of calendar or working days for completion established in original contract. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23 and Title 54, Chapter 5, Part 1.

As introduced, requires certain commissioners and agency heads to certify to comptroller that state employees could not have been used instead of contracting with outside entities in rendering services required under certain contracts. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8 and Title 12.
As introduced, creates an electronic high school. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, "Purple Heart Trail," S.R. 33 in Hancock County.
As introduced, allows any local education agency to convert to a special school district. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-501.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of education in conjunction with the bureau of TennCare to develop a plan for securing federal reimbursements under the Medicaid Administrative Claim program and to report on such efforts. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 71.

As introduced, requires local law enforcement agencies to implement an endangered missing persons alert program, whereby local law enforcement agencies will have set protocol to investigate reports of missing elderly, or mentally or physically disabled persons. - Amends TCA Section 38-6-121.

As introduced, authorizes the department of transportation to erect signs designating the location of certain cemeteries listed on the National Register of Historic Places; requires payment of such signs by organization managing the cemetery. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 5, Part 7.

As introduced, requires limited liability companies seeking administrative dissolution to receive a certificate from the department of revenue stating that all compliance with revenue laws of this state have been met prior to the secretary of state granting dissolution. - Amends TCA Section 48-245-305 and Section 48-249-608.

As enacted, specifies that employees who have had a reduction in pay or a reduction in hours due to economic conditions will not be entitled to reopen their claims if the reduction in pay or reduction in hours affected at least 50 percent of other hourly employees operating at or out of the same location; not applicable to employees involved in layoffs, closures, or a termination of business operations.

As introduced, revises property tax freeze income limit reference to the most recent decennial census to include reference to the American community survey five-year estimates released in the year following the most recent federal census. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-705.

As enacted, changes the reporting deadline of the Tennessee Advisory Commission on Intergovernmental Relations to the general assembly on the effectiveness of Tennessee's current underground utility damage prevention program from January 29, 2010, to January 17, 2011. - Amends amend Chapter 470 of the Public Acts of 2009.
As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes.

As introduced, reduces from 90 to 75 days period in which dealer via signed statement can deduct on a return sales tax collected but not yet remitted to commissioner for refunded items. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, makes appropriations for the purpose of defraying the expenses of certain legislative enactments passed during the 2010 session of the 106th General Assembly.
As introduced, extends the air pollution control board, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 201, Part 1.
As enacted, extends the board of ground water management, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 69, Chapter 10, Part 1.
As enacted, extends the department of environment and conservation, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As enacted, extends the water quality control board, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 69, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends the petroleum underground storage tank board, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 215.
As enacted, extends the solid waste disposal control board, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 211.
As enacted, extends Tennessee heritage conservation trust fund board of trustees, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 11, Chapter 7.
As enacted, authorizes supervision of psychological examiners by senior psychological examiners. - Amends TCA Section 63-11-202 and Section 63-11-206.

As introduced, revises manner in which members are appointed to the board of a water and wastewater treatment authority. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 6; Title 7, Chapter 82 and Title 68, Chapter 221.
As introduced, enables a municipality to institute a residential rental inspection program to prevent deterioration. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 21, Part 3.
As enacted, revises fees for medical records provided by certain health care providers. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "TennCare Provider Recoupment Act." - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 8 and Title 71, Chapter 5.

As introduced, grants reciprocity for licensure to embalmers licensed or certified in another state, the District of Columbia or a territory of the United States. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5, Part 3.
As introduced, creates misdemeanor offense of possessing open container of alcoholic beverage within passenger area of motor vehicle on public highway. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As introduced, requires state-owned golf courses that fail to operate in a manner sufficient to satisfy the outstanding bonded indebtedness of the state for a certain period to be sold. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, reduces alcohol level required to constitute offense of DUI from .08 percent to .02 percent for person with one or more prior DUI convictions. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As enacted, requires certain DUI offenders to operate only a motor vehicle that is equipped with a functioning ignition interlock device. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 29; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 55; Title 68 and Title 71.

As enacted, requires that at the end of the trial court proceeding, the clerk pay any money collected from an indigent criminal defendant to the administrative office of the courts rather than directly to the defendant's attorney of record; provides for certain excess funds being paid to appointed attorney. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 14.

As enacted, directs that any appeal of a final judgment of a writ of error coram nobis is heard and determined by the court of criminal appeals instead of the supreme court. - Amends TCA Section 40-26-105.

As introduced, creates Class C felony of manufacturing methamphetamine in residence where child under 14 resides or within 200 feet of any such residence; requires mandatory minimum sentence of six years to be served consecutive to any other sentence. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As enacted, clarifies that it is a Class B misdemeanor for any person, other than one carrying out clean up of the quarantined property, knowingly to inhabit quarantined property; to enter onto quarantined property without federal, state, county or municipal government authorization; to offer such property to the public for temporary or indefinite habitation; or to remove any signs or notices of the quarantine. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 12, Section 503.

As enacted, revises the substances that give rise to a DUI, so that it is unlawful to operate or be in control of a motor driven vehicle while under the influence of any intoxicant, marijuana, controlled substance, drug, substance affecting the central nervous system or combination thereof that impairs the driver's ability to safely operate a motor vehicle by depriving the driver of the clearness of mind and control of himself which he would otherwise possess.
As introduced, creates the separate Class C felony offense of manufacturing methamphetamine in a residence in which a child less than 13 years of age resides. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As introduced, specifies that "professional nursing" includes the supervision of nurse aides. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 7.

As introduced, abolishes select committee on children and youth. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15; Title 9, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 5; Title 37; Title 39, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 2 and Title 68.

As enacted, removes provision that requires a county to pay the state for the actual daily cost to the state for the length of stay of a child in state custody after such county exceeds 300 percent of the state average commitment rate for dependent and neglected children or delinquent children; requires department to provide report regarding commitments to state custody; authorizes collaborative planning process. - Amends TCA Title 37.

As enacted, specifies method of determining the rate of interest on Build America Bonds issued on or before June 30, 2012, by convention center authorities. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 89 and Title 47, Chapter 14.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Food Desert Relief Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9; Title 13; Title 67, Chapter 5 and Title 68.

As enacted, permits association captive insurance companies to insure obligations under certain federal legislation that provides compensation and benefits to workers for job-related injuries, and further allows association captive insurance companies to hold any interest in qualified headquarters property. - Amends TCA Title 50 and Title 56.

As introduced, enacts the "Food, Sales and Franchise Tax Cut and Job Creation Act of 2010." - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.
As introduced, permits reimbursement for services provided by a licensed marital and family therapist. - Amends TCA Section 56-7-2401.

As introduced, adds to types of projects that industrial development corporations located in municipalities having a central business improvement district may undertake. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53.

As introduced, provides buyers involved in home solicitation sales with additional cancellation rights, establishes additional notice requirements for sellers, and allocates the cost of any notary witnessing the signatures to sellers. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 7.

As enacted, creates Class A misdemeanor for production, manufacture, distribution, possession, or possession with intent to produce, manufacture, or distribute the synthetic cannabinoids JWH-018, JWH-073, HU-210, and HU-211; does not apply to lawfully prescribed drugs or substances. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As enacted, authorizes Shelby County legislative body to vote to allow community organizations the right to petition and enter upon vacant property for the purpose of removing litter. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1; Title 6, Chapter 54; Title 13, Chapter 21 and Title 13, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, permits a court to order a physician to give a deposition after a reasonable period of time instead of 90 days and provides that a nominee name for medical director in the workers compensation program may only appear on one list for appointment. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.
As introduced, establishes the "Tennessee Criminal Gang Registration Act of 2010." - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, requires that marital dissolution agreements include notice of fact that defendant will lose health insurance, if applicable. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 36 and Title 56.

As introduced, requires any public water system or waterworks system that discontinues the fluoridation of its water supply to give notice of such discontinuance to applicable state agencies and affected customers. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221.
As enacted, revises requirements for registered sex offender to attend conference at school or similar place as parent and to drop off or pick up child at school. - Amends TCA Section 40-39-211.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of human services to report to the house health and human resources committee and the senate general welfare, health & human resources committee on or before February 15, 2011, concerning recommendations about the disability determination process under the social security law. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 50 and Title 71.
As introduced, requires an individualized disciplinary plan for each student in grades K-12. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, enacts the "Public Safety Employer-Employee Cooperation Act." - Amends TCA Title 4, to enact the Public Safety Employer-Employee Cooperation Act.
As introduced, allows the board or members of a cooperative to change any bylaw that potentially exposes the cooperative to legal or regulatory action. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 25, Part 2.

As introduced, allows the board or members of a G&T cooperative to change any bylaw that potentially exposes the G&T cooperative to legal or regulatory action, and further requires the board to send 30-day written notice of any annual or special meeting in which a recommendation to dissolve the G&T cooperative will be considered. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 69, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes veterans with at least a 50 percent service-connected disability as certified by the veterans' administration to receive a 50 percent reduction in room fees in all state park inns and cabins and on greens fees on certain golf courses in state parks. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As introduced, revises commitments for housing rehabilitation loans. - Amends TCA Title 13 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 4.

As introduced, authorizes a board established under a mayor-aldermanic charter to, by ordinance, create shorter, transitional terms for board members at the next regularly scheduled municipal election in order to coincide with a new municipal election date. - Amends TCA Title 6.
As introduced, requires Bureau of TennCare to establish a co-pay plan based upon a sliding scale for TennCare standard enrollees. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5.

As introduced, removes limited time periods within which headlights are required and creates new requirement that headlights be displayed at all times a motor vehicle is operated on public highway; violation is a Class C misdemeanor punishable by fine of $2.00 only. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8 and Title 55, Chapter 9.

As enacted, abolishes the requirement to run a publication for an unknown father when there is no legal father at the time the adoption is filed, under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 36-1-117.

As enacted, states that the department of children's services may be found to have made reasonable effort if the department's efforts have exceeded the efforts of the parent or guardian to establish a suitable home for the parent or guardian's child. - Amends TCA Section 36-1-102 and Section 37-2-402.

As enacted, states that a man shall not be a legal parent based solely on scientific testing, without either a court order or voluntary acknowledgment of paternity, but such testing may be a basis for a court of competent jurisdiction to establish paternity. - Amends TCA Section 36-1-102.
As enacted, establishes a presumption that each parent age 18 or older has knowledge of a parent's legal and moral obligation to support his or her child or children. - Amends TCA Section 36-1-102.

As enacted, assesses an administrative fee of $50.00 if a defendant in a termination of parental rights case is provided with court-appointed counsel; specifies that a defendant's willful failure to pay the fee may be considered by the court as evidence of the defendant's financial responsibility, or lack thereof, in any determination of the best interest of the child. - Amends TCA Section 40-14-103.
As enacted, clarifies that any spouse of a relative is also a legal relative or related. - Amends TCA Section 36-1-102.

As introduced, requires insurers to pay the cost of covered medical procedures when provider orders a non-covered medical procedure and insured agrees to pay any difference in costs. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 23.

As introduced, requires fee increases greater than 10 percent annually for public use of a national guard firing range be approved by resolution of the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 58, Chapter 1, Part 5.
As introduced, imposes mandatory minimum periods of commitment for certain juveniles adjudicated delinquent. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 1 and Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As enacted, creates offense of selling synthetic urine; exempts sales for bona fide educational, medical, and scientific purposes; violation punishable as Class C misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As introduced, prohibits employers from prohibiting employees possessing a handgun carry permit from transporting and storing a firearm out of sight in a locked vehicle on any property set aside for vehicles; prohibits employer from terminating, demoting, or other discrimination against such employees. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
As enacted, "PFC John H. McCree Memorial Bridge," S.R. 11 in Giles County.

As enacted, establishes duty of care of landowners, lessees and occupants of land whose land is entered by others for recreational non-commercial aircraft operations or recreational non-commercial ultra light operations on private airstrips. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 7.

As enacted, allows person with handgun carry permit to possess handgun in establishment where alcohol is served, provided it is not posted and person does not consume alcohol; specifies penalties for violations. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13; Section 57-3-204 and Section 57-4-203.
As enacted, encourages economic efficiency in state government through utilization of innovative approaches and methodologies. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As introduced, raises the fine for violations of safety belt laws to $50.00 and specifies the manner in which such money is to be distributed. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 6.

As introduced, requires THEC to report on the status of in-service training funds at public institutions of higher education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.
As introduced, creates an incentive for 911 districts to consolidate or select the direct dispatch method. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86.

As introduced, deletes requirement that the department pay for children in state custody based on a county's child population and the average state commitment rate per 1,000 children. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 2.

As introduced, requires the AccessTN plan to provide a special subsidy for persons disenrolled from medical assistance under TennCare following loss of eligibility for Supplemental Security Income (SSI); the special premium assistance subsidy shall be set each year in the general appropriations act. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 71.
As enacted, enacts "Katie Beth's Law," which requires pool alarms in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 47 and Title 68, Chapter 14.
As introduced, prohibits the state employee health plan or its contractors or third-party administrators from entering into exclusive contracts with hospitals in Putnam County. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, requires that a person be in full compliance with the Financial Responsibility Law of 1977 prior to having vehicle registration approved or renewed. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, allows a local education agency to issue a diploma to a student who failed to receive a diploma due to service in the Vietnam War. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-119.

As introduced, adds the board of trustees for the University of Tennessee and the board of regents for the state university and community college system to the recipients of a THEC report on the lottery scholarship and grant programs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
As introduced, authorizes employees of any company or municipality that provides electricity to cut trees or limbs that could affect the electric power lines. - Amends TCA Title 6 and Title 7.
As introduced, authorizes municipalities or counties to allow all-terrain vehicles on certain highways under such entity's sole jurisdiction. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As enacted, changes the hearing date for an inmate to be released from a mental retardation facility from 21 days to 21 business days of receipt of notice to the court; changes the notice from the court to the facility from 15 days to 15 business days. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 5, Part 4; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, creates Class D felony for possessing a prescription drug, which was acquired outside of Tennessee, with the intent to sell such drug. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes certain all-terrain vehicles to be registered and operated on certain municipality or county highways, at discretion of such local governing body. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, specifies commissioner is able to contract with an entity, rather than governmental entity or nonprofit entity, to manage schools placed in achievement school district. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1 and Chapter _____ of the Public Acts of 2010 (Ex. Sess.)(Senate Bill 5 / House Bill 10 of the First Extraordinary Session).

As enacted, authorizes courts to void a summons for improper service if the service of the summons is made upon an employee of the garnishee rather than the garnishee, and such employee is also the judgment debtor. - Amends TCA Title 26.
As enacted, allows LEAs greater flexibility in extending the school day in order to offset days used for professional development or weather-related closings. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3004.

As introduced, requires TDOT to develop program to provide transportation challenge grants to local governments willing to match larger share of federal or state funding for transportation projects. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 2.

As introduced, establishes federal standards for federal recognition of Native American Indian tribes as the state standards for state recognition of Native American Indian tribes. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As enacted, authorizes certain facilities in Dekalb County, Cumberland County, and Henry County to sell alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As introduced, exempts from tangible personal property tax equipment used for harvesting timber. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As enacted, creates a rebuttable presumption of substantial harm to a child if the child is not granted visitation with a grandparent who is the parent of the child's deceased parent. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As introduced, revises the provisions governing accumulated time resulting from extensions of the school day. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, allows LEAs greater flexibility in extending the school day in order to offset days used for professional development or weather-related closings. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3004(e).

As enacted, establishes requirements for actions brought by a creditor to recover a balance still owing on an indebtedness after a trustee's or foreclosure sale of real property secured by a deed of trust or mortgage and for judgments awarded in such actions. - Amends TCA Title 25; Title 28 and Title 35.
As introduced, prohibits the installation or maintenance of red light camera monitors on or after January 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As introduced, clarifies that the department of safety is not authorized to issue a motor vehicle operator's license of any kind to a person who has a prior conviction for a violation of DUI within the past five years unless such person provides proof that such person has a functioning ignition interlock device installed and fully operational on all motor vehicles operated by such person. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 29; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 55; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, authorizes consumption of alcoholic beverages at restaurants within one mile of Reelfoot Lake. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As introduced, extends the time when applicant for licensure as a social worker who has requisite educational experience can apply for license without examination from December 31, 2010, to December 31, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 23, Part 1.
As enacted, clarifies that municipalities may by ordinance adopt all provisions of law included in the rules of the road for local enforcement. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 3.

As enacted, mandates that wills or trusts of decedents, who die after December 31, 2009, but before January 1, 2011, that reference certain exemptions shall be construed as referring to the federal estate and generation-skipping transfer tax laws. - Amends TCA Title 32 and Title 35.
As enacted, increases from $25,000 to $150,000 the value of an institutional fund for which modification of a restriction on a gift instrument is permitted. - Amends TCA Section 35-10-206.
As introduced, exempts diabetic testing equipment and supplies from sales tax. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10; Title 63, Chapter 10 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of revenue to remove a non-participating manufacturer from the directory if another state has removed the manufacturer from its directory for failure to pay escrow funds. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 26.
As enacted, revises various provisions of the Tennessee Small Business Investment Company Credit Act. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 28 and Title 56.

As enacted, revises definition of "project" in industrial development corporation statute and authorizes certain assistance, including certain revenues, in cases involving a central business improvement district and an industrial development corporation. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53.

As introduced, requires contribution limits for individuals, political campaign committees controlled by a political party or caucus, and multicandidate political campaign committees be increased to reflect percentage of change in average consumer price index in every odd-numbered year starting in 2011. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 2, Chapter 19.

As enacted, changes the signage requirements for landowners who desire to prohibit hunting on their property; revises the exemption from storm water user fees for owners of agricultural land. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.

As enacted, clarifies the appeals process for tenured teachers who are dismissed by a local board of education; requires that if the commissioner of education who is initially appointed to the teacher evaluation advisory committee as chairperson ceases to be the commissioner of education because of resignation or retirement, then such former commissioner remains a member of the committee until the committee ceases to exist. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, deletes a repetitive provision of the code that is already and more appropriately addressed elsewhere. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires the University of Tennessee system and the board of regents to provide biennially their policies for minimizing costs of textbooks and course materials to the chairs of the senate and house education committees. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires board of regents and UT board of trustees to report to the house and senate education committees whether instruction aimed at increasing the awareness and prevention of hate crime offenses, sexual battery, sexual harassment, and date rape are being offered to all entering freshmen during orientation or introductory studies at each of their respective institutions. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, authorizes bicycles to proceed through intersections with inoperative vehicle detection devices due to the weight of the bicycles. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-110.

As introduced, entitles employers to retain an administrative fee of $5.00 from the judgment debtor each time payment is made to the court for amounts of an employee's disposable earnings subject to the garnishment. - Amends TCA Section 26-2-222.

As enacted, defines "employee" for the purposes of the prohibition on a deposition being taken by an employee of one of the parties or of an attorney for one of the parties. - Amends TCA Section 24-9-136.
As enacted, expands list of animal related practices that are exempt from veterinarian licensure requirements. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 12.
As introduced, revises commission membership and quorum provisions. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 1, Part 2.

As introduced, requires institutions of higher education within the University of Tennessee and the Tennessee Board of Regents systems to accept courses completed within 20 years for transfer, credit, graduation, or matriculation; excludes science, technology, and medical courses. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, requires one hour of physical activity per instructional school day for elementary and secondary school students beginning no later than the 2011-2012 school year. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 68.

As enacted, establishes that boating regulation laws will govern unclaimed or abandoned boats and vessels when in conflict with the Uniform Disposition of Unclaimed Property Act. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 29.
As enacted, enacts the "Uniform Child Abduction Prevention Act." - Amends TCA Title 36.
As introduced, changes body that fills vacancies on county and municipal school boards from the local legislative body to the local board of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 2.

As enacted, changes the date by which teachers must be notified in writing of their dismissal or failure of reelection for the next school year from April 15 to May 15. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 4.
As introduced, changes filing deadline to apply to operate public charter school from October 1 of the year preceding year of proposed operation to October 15 of such year. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires that annual report published by commissioner be made available on department's web site. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 5.

As enacted, clarifies and reiterates current law concerning what duties may be performed by general contractors and architects and engineers performing construction management agent or advisor services for the construction of school buildings or additions to existing buildings. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-203.
As introduced, expands beneficial end use of recycled, shredded tires to include other landscaping applications. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 202; Title 68, Chapter 211 and Title 68, Chapter 21.

As introduced, requires commissioner to report annually on tourism promotion activities in Tennessee River Resort District jurisdictions. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, creates limited excise tax exemptions for businesses having annual profits of less than $100,000 or between $100,000 and $200,000 for FY 2010-2011 and 2011-2012. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12, Chapter 3; Title 45, Chapter 8; Title 56, Chapter 7 and Title 67.

As introduced, permits the filing of a petition to probate a will in a small estate solely for the purpose of establishing muniment of title to real estate and personal property. - Amends TCA Title 30, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As introduced, requires any issuer of a Medicare supplement policy to not deny or condition the issuance or effectiveness of any Medicare supplement policy nor discriminate in the pricing of a policy because of the health status, claims experience, receipt of health care, or medical condition of an applicant in the case of an application for a policy that is submitted within 30 days of an annual policy anniversary date in which the applicant is currently enrolled. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, authorizes the Weakley County legislative body and the municipal legislative bodies in Weakley County to make the decision of whether the minimum training requirements for firefighters are to apply within their respective jurisdictional boundaries. - Amends TCA Section 4-24-112.

As introduced, permits the filing of a petition to probate a will in a small estate solely for the purpose of establishing muniment of title to real estate and personal property. - Amends TCA Title 30, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As introduced, sets the priority as to who has the right to dispose of a dead body through cremation. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires the department of education, in consultation with UT and TBR, to evaluate the effect of cooperative innovative high school programs on job creation in the schools' communities. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 49.
As introduced, requires that method of determining FICA withholding that results in least amount being withheld be utilized for separately issued longevity payments. - Amends TCA Section 8-23-206.

As introduced, authorizes counties to collect a certain fee designated exclusively for duplicating, storing, and maintaining records required by law to be kept permanently. - Amends TCA Section 8-21-1001.
As introduced, exempts energy acquisition corporations from taxation of associated municipalities. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 39.

As introduced, clarifies statutory requirements for licensure to ensure that a duly licensed architect or engineer who is performing normal architectural and engineering services within the architect or engineer's area of competence is not required to obtain additional licensure, certification, or registration to perform such services. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 13 and Title 62.
As introduced, requires owners of all types of rental property to have photo electric smoke detectors in areas of high customer occupancy or be subject to a $1,500 fine. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, ties certain reduction in force policies for certain public higher education employees to those in place for state employees. - Amends TCA Section 49-7-134.

As introduced, revises provisions concerning state contracting with small, minority owned and women owned businesses; establishes Tennessee small business preference. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3.
As enacted, revises provisions governing state's subrogation interests. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 1.
As introduced, makes certain changes to the school start dates, administration of TCAP for non-proficient students, and the reporting of such results. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires all contracts for goods or services being purchased that are entered into between the state or a county and an LLC include a requirement that the LLC shall disclose the name of each partner before the contract becomes effective; such disclosure to be posted on the state's or countys web site, as applicable, with sufficient information to identify the respective contract. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1, Part 1 and Title 12, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires fair market value of property to be taken by eminent domain be based on the highest and best use of such property. - Amends TCA Section 7-56-207; Title 64, Chapter 2, Part 3; Title 65, Chapter 6, Part 1 and Title 65, Chapter 14, Part 1.

As introduced, changes the time prior to an election for a person to file a notice requesting such person's write-in ballots be counted from 50 days to 80 days prior to the general election. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As enacted, requires the board of medical examiners to enter into an agreement with the federal department of homeland security concerning enforcement of federal immigration laws, which may include participation in SAVE program. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title 68.
As introduced, changes certain procedural requirements for counties making appropriations to nonprofit charitable organizations. - Amends TCA Section 5-9-109.

As enacted, adjusts terminology to reflect data collected through the American Community Survey instead of the census long form questionnaire. - Amends TCA Section 1-3-105; Section 7-59-303; Section 13-23-103; Section 40-28-202; Section 67-5-705 and Section 68-202-601.
As introduced, revises coverage requirements for autism spectrum disorders. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As enacted, requires food service establishments that sell imported catfish or imported catfish products to label such catfish or catfish products as "imported" on their menus. - Amends TCA Title 53.
As enacted, "Larry Lively HoPE Center," Taft Youth Development Center.

As introduced, increases the punishment for kidnapping, aggravated kidnapping, and especially aggravated kidnapping by one classification if the defendant falsely imprisoned the victim for 14 days or more. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 3.
As introduced, requires psychologists to receive three hours of continuing education provided by the Tennessee Psychological Association. - Amends TCA Section 63-11-218.

As enacted, requires that the judge, upon finding that the respondent violated an order of protection or court approved consent order, order the respondent to post a bond of at least $2,500 until such time as the order of protection expires; specifies other requirements in regard to the bond, forfeiture of the bond and proceeds from a judgment for the amount of the bond. - Amends TCA Section 36-3-610.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee's Transitioning Youth Empowerment Act of 2010." - Amends TCA Title 37.

As introduced, requires the department of financial institutions to impose a fee of $2,500 on every payday lender at each of their business locations; creates special financial literacy trust fund. - Amends TCA Title 45.
As introduced, prohibits a payday lender from providing loans to borrowers via the Internet, regardless of whether the lender is located inside or outside Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 45.

As introduced, establishes a ceiling of 100 percent for interest rates on payday loans; defines "payday loan" as short-term cash loan or funds provided to an individual in anticipation of future receipt of wages. - Amends TCA Title 45.
As introduced, increases unemployment security benefits by $50.00 per week. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.
As introduced, requires a teacher be paid for supervision of extracurricular activities at an hourly rate equivalent to the teacher's salary. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, creates a Tennessee Advisory Commission on Autism Spectrum Disorders. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 68.

As introduced, declares that the Metropolitan Hospital Authorities chapter shall be liberally construed; changes report date concerning tort liability of public hospitals from March 30 to June 30. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 29; Title 33; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, limits the damages a property owner may recover from a delinquent tax sale purchaser in suits to invalidate a tax title. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
As enacted, revises various provisions of the Tennessee Court Reporter Act of 2009. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 20 and Title 24.
As introduced, removes the death penalty as a possible punishment for first degree murder. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2.

As introduced, requires the solid waste disposal control board and department of environment and conservation to demonstrate specific compliance with Public Chapter 462 of 2007 before taking any action concerning solid waste regulation. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.

As introduced, changes the department of mental health and developmental disabilities' report to legislative committees on the impact of the available suitable accommodations statute from quarterly to monthly. - Amends TCA Title 33.

As introduced, prohibits governmental entities from denying access to books, records, and other materials available for public inspection because a governmental entity is involved in litigation or contemplating involvement in litigation. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.

As introduced, tolls statute of limitations for filing claim against state employee with claims commission as of the date suit is filed or criminal prosecution instituted in which claimant and employee or employee's agency participate. - Amends TCA Section 9-8-402.

As introduced, authorizes board of claims to determine claims for compensation by persons granted declaratory judgments for state agency's termination of program participation without compliance with rulemaking process. - Amends TCA Section 9-8-108.
As introduced, codifies executive order placing the TennCare program in the department of finance and administration. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, requires corporations to file statement of contributions and expenditures when using corporate funds to aid in either the election or defeat of a candidate; requires corporation to disclose such corporation paid for public communication when it expressly advocates the election or defeat of a clearly identified candidate. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 2, Chapter 19.
As enacted, "Bob Brown Administration Building," new TDOT building in Chattanooga.
As introduced, enacts the "Green Jobs Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 68.

As enacted, revises provisions governing which court will make determination of violation of implied consent law; revises other provisions governing implied consent law. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.

As introduced, requires person 18-21 who is charged with underage purchase or possession of alcohol to cooperate with authorities by revealing the establishment where the alcohol was purchased or who purchased the alcohol for the person in order to be eligible for pretrial diversion. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 15 and Title 40, Chapter 35.

As introduced, requires any person selling alcoholic beverages, wine, or beer to a person under the age of 21 to serve a mandatory minimum period of incarceration of 48 hours; conforms various code references to minor to reflect the more correct age 21 language. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39; Title 40; Title 54, Chapter 4; Title 57, Chapter 3; Title 57, Chapter 4 and Title 57, Chapter 5.

As enacted, allows LEAs to use reasonably obtainable information in determining whether a student who dropped out of school enrolled elsewhere; allows LEAs to include GEDs in calculating graduation rates for all purposes other than those in which such inclusion is prohibited by federal law. - Amends TCA Section 1-3-118 and Title 49.
As enacted, authorizes the provision of group medical health insurance for support staff of an LEA. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27, Part 3.

As introduced, requires the department of environment and conservation to provide planning models for relocating, hauling, composting, or other processing of yard waste and food waste and to submit a report to the house conservation and environment committee and the senate environment, conservation, and tourism committee by December 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 202; Title 68, Chapter 211 and Title 68, Chapter 212.

As introduced, requires TACIR to perform a study and provide recommendations to encourage the minimizing of solid waste in landfills and report to the legislature by February 15, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 202; Title 68, Chapter 211; Title 68, Chapter 212 and Title 68, Chapter 213.

As introduced, changes the requirement for undergraduate full-time attendance at public institutions of higher education from 12 semester hours to 14 semester hours. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4; Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

As introduced, requires persons operating vessels on waters of the state to stop such vessels, if safe, upon a signal of an emergency vessel, and to obey any other reasonable signal given in directing the movement of traffic on such waters. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 9.

As enacted, removes the district attorney general from the list of participants involved with the independent local advisory board for each county in which the multi-level response system, which is used to protect children from abuse, is operating. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 5.

As enacted, redefines "formula rate," with regard to bonds or other obligations issued by an energy acquisition corporation on or before June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 39 and Title 45, Chapter 5.
As introduced, creates a public higher education capital facilities program. - Amends TCA Title 9 and Title 49.
As introduced, creates equity assessment of 2.25 cents per cigarette on all cigarettes sold by a nonparticipating tobacco manufacturer in this state. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 10.

As enacted, revises the tax on unauthorized substances based on the decision of the Tennessee Supreme Court in Waters v. Farr to impose the tax on the merchant of unauthorized substances. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 28.

As enacted, requires the commissioner of revenue to offset any state tax refunds of $200 or more that are owed to a taxpayer by the amount of any debt that the taxpayer owes to a state agency or to any person on whose behalf a state agency acts to collect a debt; makes the present law system of submitting asset disclosure forms to inmates mandatory rather than discretionary; revises other provisions relating to tax refunds. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4; Title 18; Title 36, Chapter 5; Title 41, Chapter 21, Part 9; Title 49, Chapter 4; Title 50, Chapter 7; Title 67, Chapter 1 and Title 71, Chapter 5.

As introduced, directs that an injunction, restraining order, declaratory judgment, and other types of orders and pleadings cannot be issued or filed in lawsuits challenging state taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1.

As introduced, grants authority to the comptroller to audit the books of the public defenders conference, post-conviction defender, and administrative office of the courts pertaining to payment of funds for indigent defendants. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14; Title 16, Chapter 3, Part 8; Title 40, Chapter 30, Part 2 and Title 40, Chapter 14, Part 2.

As enacted, extends membership in the Tennessee consolidated retirement system to all employees instead of just the administrative employees of certain participating employers; and makes other revisions regarding the retirement system and retirement benefits under the system. - Amends TCA Sections 8-34-101(46)(B), 8-34-206(d), 8-34-321.

As introduced, changes the amount of contributions that must be paid by an employee of certain local governmental units who has three years of service prior to the unit joining the Tennessee consolidated retirement system in order for that employee to be a member of the retirement system. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36; Title 8, Chapter 37 relative to Tennessee Consolidated Retirement System and to amend Title 8, Chapter 38, Part 1.

As enacted, authorizes local government entity eligible to participate in the Tennessee consolidated retirement system to elect to participate in any deferred compensation program for state employees, subject to approval of the chair of the retirement system. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 25, Parts 1 and 3.

As introduced, requires the TennCare bureau to provide the prescription drug utilization review committee with information concerning enrollees who suffer from prevalent disease states. - Amends TCA Section 71-5-190.
As introduced, clarifies that abortions performed during viability of the fetus must be performed in a hospital. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 2.

As introduced, requires parental or legal guardian consent for further testing or storage of blood or biological samples taken from a newborn for purposes other than the required test to be performed on the newborn. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title 68, Chapter 5.
As enacted, clarifies nurses who can work with medication aides. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As introduced, requires bureau of TennCare to mandate use of a standardized billing system for nursing home Medicaid claims by MCOs. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, requires comptroller to report annually total number of new telecommunication towers constructed in the previous calendar year to commerce committee chairs. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7; Title 39 and Title 65.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of education to consider the costs to and the benefits for certain local school health collaborations in developing a coordinated school health program. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 71.

As introduced, establishes that a child left in the care of a relative caregiver for 18 months or more pursuant to a power of attorney instrument shall not be subject to dependent and neglected child proceedings. - Amends TCA Title 34, Chapter 6, Part 3; Title 36 and Title 37.

As introduced, requires the TBI to remove all data on a sexual offender from the sexual offender registry within 30 days of receipt of notice of the offender's death. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5 and Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.
As introduced, removes authority to implement a private amusement tax on whitewater rafting on the Ocoee River. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-330.
As introduced, clarifies terms of West Tennessee Seismic Safety Commission. - Amends TCA Title 58, Chapter 9, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked license plates for Shelby County Ask First Campaign; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to Shelby County Office of Early Childhood and Youth. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, requires a radiologist assistant to work in the employment or direction of a radiologist. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As enacted, revises provisions governing restrictions on the right of an employed or contracted healthcare provider to practice the healthcare provider's profession upon termination or conclusion of the employment or contractual relationship. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Appraisal Management Company Registration and Regulation Act." - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 39.

As introduced, prohibits the sale, distribution, or consumption of alcoholic beverages, wine, or beer between the hours of midnight and 8:00 a.m. at any establishment or facility receiving a license or permit to operate by the state, county, or municipality. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 57 and Title 67.
As introduced, prohibits use of traffic surveillance cameras to enforce or monitor traffic offenses. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As introduced, allows legislative body of Davidson County to impose annual $1.00 litigation tax, up to $5.00 maximum, on filings in general sessions and juvenile court for purpose of funding victim-offender mediation centers. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 20, Part 1.
As introduced, requires legislative approval prior to adoption of regulatory programs concerning greenhouse gas or motor vehicle fuel economy. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, enacts the "Ben Nelson Act to Ensure Political Integrity." - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 16.

As enacted, authorizes sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption at Country Boy Restaurant in Leiper's Fork in Williamson County and Memorial Auditorium and Tivoli Theater in Chattanooga. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4.

As enacted, revises provisions governing rental and assignment of network rights to expand the information required to be included in an explanation of benefits sent to medical provider and gives the provisions the short title the "Rental and Assignment of PPO Network Rights". - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6, Part 2.
As introduced, reduces the period of time permitted for compromise and settlement of future medical benefits in a case. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

As enacted, requires insurers offering Medicare supplement policies and certificates in this state to persons 65 years of age or older to also offer Medicare supplement policies to persons in this state who are under 65 years of age and eligible for and enrolled in Medicare by reason of disability or end stage renal disease.

As introduced, requires any private entity that provides probation supervisory services to post a performance bond in the amount of $50,000 instead of $25,000. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 3, Part 9 and Title 40.
As introduced, imposes certain new coverage requirements for chemotherapy for cancer. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, requires court-ordered alcohol or drug treatment programs be operated by certain entities. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.
As introduced, requires the operators of driver education and DUI classes be subject to certain standards. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.

As enacted, requires TBI to maintain a DNA database of certain juvenile sexual offenders and adds an adjudication of delinquency for an act which if committed as an adult would constitute aggravated rape of a child to the list of acts for which a court shall require a juvenile to submit a DNA sample. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires ethics commission to report annually the number and names of employees filing consulting disclosures in the previous calendar year to the appropriate employing authority. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10, Part 1; Title 8 and Title 10, Chapter 7.
As introduced, prohibits disposal of untreated sewage by certain boats and imposes certain requirements on boating facilities. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 69.
As enacted, revises the prerequisites for and terms of loans to local governments operating a waste water facility. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 10 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 12.

As introduced, allows TDOT or local government entity to advertise for bids on its web site, instead of by publication in newspapers, before awarding transportation enhancement grants. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 5, Part 1.
As enacted, designates procedures for delinquent tax sales when delinquent taxes are owed to both municipality and county. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 25.
As introduced, exempts certain employers and employees from certain provisions of the Workers' Compensation Law on religious grounds. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires that GPS coordinates of facility where waste was baled and destination of baled waste be included on manifest that is required to be kept for at least 30 years. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.
As introduced, enacts the Health-Care Choice Act. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, requires the judicial council to meet at least twice each year while the legislature is in session. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2 and Title 16, Chapter 21, Part 1.

As introduced, adds to duties of judicial council that, upon request or on own motion, it send suggestions for statutory changes pertaining to the judicial system. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2 and Title 16, Chapter 21.
As introduced, defines food and shelter for both livestock and non-livestock animals for the purposes of animal offenses. - Amends TCA Section 39-14-201.
As enacted, extends the Tennessee court of the judiciary, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 17, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires the board of medical examiners to collect certain information on medical malpractice related to emergency room care and to report concerning that information to the house and senate judiciary committees. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires criminal background checks on persons seeking renewal of locksmith licenses, exempts locksmiths with 10 years experience from continuing education requirements; sets license renewal fee at not less than $200. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 11, Part 1.

As introduced, assesses all costs against a person or entity for continuing appeals following the first appeal challenging the decision of the health services and development agency granting a certificate of need to a hospital filing the application. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 16.
As introduced, abolishes the select oversight committee on TennCare. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15; Section 37-3-115 and Title 71, Chapter 5.
As introduced, abolishes select oversight committee on corrections. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15; Title 40, Chapter 34, Part 1 and Title 41.
As introduced, abolishes the oversight committee on TennCare. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15; Section 37-3-115 and Title 71, Chapter 5.
As introduced, abolishes select oversight committee on corrections. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15; Title 40, Chapter 34, Part 1 and Title 41.
As enacted, establishes a certificate of birth resulting in stillbirth. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 3.

As introduced, requires state to purchase voter-verifiable paper ballot printers for any direct record electronic (DRE) voting machine in use in this state for the 2010 regular November election. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As enacted, specifies that the general assembly finds that value for agricultural, forest, or open space land should not be deemed the value of property for any purpose other than a future assessment of rollback taxes, because it does not determine the actual tax liability of a qualifying owner at the time of valuation. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 10.

As introduced, sets ASHRAE Standard 90.1-2007 as the minimum requirements for energy use in new buildings other than one-family and two-family dwellings and townhouses. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 19, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits the state emergency communications board from requiring the board of directors of any emergency communications district to hold more than 50 percent of the district's operating budget in reserve. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86.

As enacted, authorizes any municipality or municipal agency to participate in, sponsor, conduct, or administer a cooperative purchasing agreement for the procurement of certain supplies and services; revises other provisions regarding purchasing by local government unit. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3, Part 10.
As introduced, permits a discontinuance of service by a natural gas provider for nonpayment to be mailed or sent electronically. - Amends TCA Title 65.

As introduced, prohibits a petitioner from making certain arguments in a post-conviction petition when certain admissions by the petitioner in regards to accepting a plea bargain were made. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 30.

As introduced, specifically adds to the offense of unlawful gratuity or compensation the receiving, consent to receiving, or agreeing to receive property or a thing of value or of personal advantage for procuring a loan for another person. - Amends TCA Title 45 and Title 47.

As enacted, revises provisions governing a corporation using its funds in regard to an election; prohibits contributions to candidates; authorizes use of funds for communications regarding election or defeat of candidate; specifies reporting requirements and exceptions. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 2, Chapter 19.
As introduced, removes "limousine" from list of commercial conveyances and removes the language specifying that the first adjustment shall take effect on November 6, 1984. - Amends TCA Title 3.
As introduced, prohibits the governor and members of the general assembly from creating or controlling multicandidate political campaign committees. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.
As introduced, specifies that a petitioner has 15 business days from receipt of an order or determination of the technical secretary to appeal. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, clarifies that an unexpended balance of contributions in a deceased candidate's campaign account may be allocated to any institution of public or private education in the state. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 2, Chapter 19.
As enacted, increases the aggregate amount that a debtor can claim for a personal property exemption from $4,000 to $10,000. - Amends TCA Title 26.
As enacted, grants up to 12 administrative leave days in a calendar year for state employees who are TSEA board members to attend board meetings. - Amends TCA Title 8.
As introduced, authorizes up to five days administrative leave per annum for TSEA district directors attending association meetings. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 50.
As introduced, authorizes leave to visit a sibling deployed for military duty out of the country. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, clarifies that communicating a "threat of death or serious bodily injury" instead of "death threat" to a school employee is a Class B misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As introduced, changes from September 30 to August 1 the date by which children must reach age four in order to enter preschool or prekindergarten or age five to enter kindergarten. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, adds implementation of the Long-Term Care Choices Act of 2008 to the required duties of the commission on aging and disability and requires the commission to report annually on such activities to the select oversight committee on long-term care. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 13; Title 33; Title 34; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, requires the select oversight committee on long-term care to review the implementation efforts of the commission on aging and disability for the Long-Term Care Choices Act of 2008; requires a report to the committee concerning the nursing home transition initiative in the Act by the commissioner of finance and administration. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, requires the board for licensing health care facilities to consider the rights enacted for nursing home residents in developing rules for specific rights for adult care home residents. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11 and Title 56, Chapter 32.

As enacted, requires the division of parks and recreation to designate one day per year during which access to and use of all state parks, including but not limited to campgrounds and golf courses, is free of charge for all veterans. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 49; Title 58 and Title 71.

As introduced, authorizes spouses of military members who leave employment due to military reassignment to qualify for unemployment benefits; requires that state pay such benefits and does not count against employer's experience rating. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

As introduced, decreases from six to five years the reappraisal cycle required by counties to assess property; decreases from five to three years the alternative reappraisal cycle such counties may adopt upon local approval. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As enacted, creates a special joint committee to study the feasibility of providing relief to senior citizens by freezing or capping their utility rates. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 65.

As introduced, requires coordinator of elections to develop and implement policies to preserve and protect integrity and reliability of voting machines and related equipment used in this state in the 2010 regular November election. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 20.
As introduced, "Specialist Jesse Harold Archer Memorial Bridge," Bridge No. 82-B-383-0.24 in Sullivan County.
As introduced, "Specialist Jesse Harold Archer Memorial Bridge," Bridge No. 82-B-383-0.24 in Sullivan County.

As enacted, deletes the requirement that a person being photographed must be readily identifiable in order for the offense of unlawful photographing to be committed; redefines "penal institution" for purposes of the provisions regarding obstruction of justice. - Amends amend TCA Title 39.
As introduced, requires that minimum statewide building construction safety standards be selected from the 2006 International Building Code. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 120, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits the acceptance, processing, or disposal of radioactive waste material in any landfill located in the state. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 202; Title 68, Chapter 211 and Title 68, Chapter 212.

As enacted, creates a mechanism in Davidson County, effective until June 30, 2012, for certain persons whose driver licenses have been suspended to apply to be allowed to pay outstanding judgments at a reduced rate. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12, Part 1 and Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 5.

As introduced, requires mandatory mediation between a bank or other financial institution and a borrower before foreclosure proceedings may be instituted on a deed of trust, mortgage, or other lien securing the payment of money or other thing of value. - Amends TCA Title 35 and Title 45.
As enacted, classifies the Ryman Auditorium in Nashville as a "historic performing arts center" for purposes of consumption of alcoholic beverages on the premises.

As enacted, requires that permanent educational records for students who have been in state custody be forwarded to the department when a department provider agency school ceases operations or when the department no longer contracts with the provider agency. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.

As introduced, authorizes real estate agents for a limited function referral office to be from anywhere in the state; defines "limited function referral office" as firm whose sole function is to receive referrals relative to parties seeking to obtain or divest an interest in real estate. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 13.

As introduced, requires the commissioner to strive to minimize conflicts with local building codes when promulgating rules and to consider compliance with such codes to be a mitigating factor when assessing penalties. - Amends TCA Title 5 and Title 68.
As introduced, requires the division of parks and recreation to establish an Internet reservation system by January 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 11.

As introduced, directs the comptroller to conduct a survey on the effectiveness of traffic surveillance cameras; requires a POST certified law enforcement officer to review photographic evidence of a traffic violation before citation is issued. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes all LEAs to operate innovative educational programs instead of only 24 school systems, and further allows principals implementing a plan for such programs to not have to consult with faculty beforehand. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1.

As introduced, enacts the "Per Diem Reconstruction Act of 2010," which requires the office of legislative budget analysis to conduct a survey of per diem reimbursement rates and other expenses paid to members of legislative bodies in states bordering Tennessee and to report findings to general assembly by February 5, 2011.
As introduced, removes judicial review of health services and development agency. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 16.

As introduced, requires that the annual valuation of the assets and liabilities of the Tennessee baccalaureate education system trust funds include the amount of any unfunded accrued liability of the program. - Amends TCA Section 49-7-804 and Section 49-7-820(d).
As enacted, enacts the "Financial Literacy Program of 2010." - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, enacts the "Tax Cut and Job Creation Act." - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.

As introduced, enacts the "Tax Cut and Job Creation Act." - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.

As introduced, requires a parent desiring to relocate more than 100 miles from the other parent or outside the state to send notice of the move to the other parent no later than 90 days, rather than 60 days, before the move. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits convicted felons, probationers, and parolees from owning, harboring, keeping, residing with, or being in the company of dangerous, vicious, or wild animals; except when preapproved or preauthorized by a court or the board of probation or parole to own or keep such animal; makes a violation of this act a misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 1.
As introduced, requires owners of dangerous, vicious, and wild animals to secure minimal liability insurance. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 8.
As introduced, requires owners, harborers, and keepers of dogs to restrain or confine dogs; establishes certain penalties and defenses for violations. - Amends TCA Section 44-8-108.

As introduced, requires locksmiths to submit fee schedules to the department of commerce and insurance, and to display such schedules prominently in their places of business. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 62, Chapter 11, Part 1.
As introduced, enhances penalty for persons who engage in or offer to engage in locksmithing services without a license. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 11.
As introduced, enhances penalty for persons who engage in or offer to engage in locksmithing services without a license. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 11.

As introduced, prohibits convicted felons, probationers, and parolees from owning, harboring, keeping, residing with, or being in the company of dangerous, vicious, or wild animals; makes a violation of this section a misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 1.
As enacted, revises various provisions regarding the health equity commission. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15, Part 4.

As enacted, authorizes prosecutors to allow guardians of children violating truancy laws to attend parent education training and parent-teacher conferences as an alternative to criminal prosecution. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30.

As introduced, requires administrative office of the courts to develop form for use by person who was arrested for criminal offense but charge was disposed of in manner making the records of such charge subject to expungement; person whose charge was dismissed entitled to form as evidence of favorable disposition of charge. - Amends TCA Title 40.
As introduced, adopts the "Tennessee Small Business Procurement and Contracting Opportunity Act."
As introduced, increases from two to four the minimum number of hours of direct care that nursing homes must provide to each patient every day. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

As introduced, creates a presumption that an infectious disease acquired by a firefighter, paramedic, emergency medical technician, or emergency medical technician advanced was suffered in the line of duty unless the contrary is shown by competent evidence. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51, Part 2.
As introduced, removes restrictions on gifts from lobbyists and requires reporting of gifts by lobbyists. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6.

As introduced, authorizes a local education agency in Memphis to establish a pilot project of mandated attendance in an alternative school for students who have been expelled. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, allows any students eligible for free or reduced-price lunch to attend charter schools. - Amends TCA Section 49-13-106.
As introduced, requires all charter school governing board members to attend an annual training session; failure to attend may result in removal from such board. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.
As enacted, requires that LEAs shall update their policy pamphlets every two years, rather than annually. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.
As introduced, requires parents or caretakers receiving temporary aid for dependent children benefits to agree to participate in parent education training classes. - Amends TCA Section 71-3-154.

As enacted, revises the membership of the task force on charter schools; adds the design and method of training for charter schools' board members to the list of subjects that the task force is required to address; changes the date by which the comptroller must report the charter school task force's findings and recommendations to the general assembly from February 2, 2010, to February 2, 2011. - Amends TCA Section 49-13-129.

As introduced, authorizes an LEA to convert certain public schools into public charter schools, whereby the local board of education can serve as the governing body of such charter school. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

As introduced, enables certain employees at charter schools to participate in a government group insurance plan or an LEA self-funded group insurance plan instead of having the government group insurance plan as the only option. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27 and Title 49, Chapter 13.

As introduced, specifies that for purposes of a local board of education's allocation to a charter school, local education funds shall not include LEA investment, interest, or rental earnings. - Amends TCA Section 49-13-112.
As introduced, revises the licensing of elevators.

As introduced, establishes accounts for a lottery funded early intervention program; creates grant program to be administered by the department of education. - Amends amend TCA Title 4, Chapter 51 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, permits grain assessments to continue when grain indemnity fund exceeds $3 million, if greater amount is approved by referendum on producers. - Amends TCA Title 43.

As introduced, requires inspection by county agricultural extension agent of livestock animal that has been allegedly abused to be preceded by similar inspection by qualified representative of law enforcement agency investigating such allegation. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 43.
