As introduced, directs TSSAA to develop a policy prohibiting athletic events from being scheduled contiguously with commencement ceremonies. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, requires THEC to report the annual student tuition subsidy applicable to students at each public institution of higher education to the house and senate education and finance, ways and means committees. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, revises various provisions governing the reporting of child abuse. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, allows students in graduate degree programs leading to licensure as a teacher to be recipients of a minority teaching fellowship; eliminates limitation on number of awards. - Amends TCA Section 49-4-706.

As introduced, reduces from 90 to 60 days period in which dealer via signed statement can deduct on a return sales tax collected but not yet remitted to commissioner for refunded items. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 54; Title 55; Title 57 and Title 67.

As enacted, clarifies what a private act is for purposes of action required by the secretary of state; clarifies that a private act amends county or city charters, not the general law. - Amends TCA Title 8.
As enacted, removes language referring to the office of legislative services; changes office of management information systems to office of legislative information systems. - Amends TCA Title 3.
As introduced, revises the appointment, authority, and duties of the select oversight committee on education. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15, Part 3.

As introduced, requires funds deposited into the wildlife resources fund from the sale of new specialty earmarked license plates to be used in accordance with the provisions authorizing issuance of such plates. - Amends TCA Title 70.

As introduced, adds Boat N RV Supercenter in Cumberland County to those facilities authorized to sell alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, requires semi-annual report of the commissioner of education on school disciplinary actions to be made to the select committee on children and youth as well as education oversight and the senate and house education committees. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.
As enacted, urges LEAs to consider the needs of working parents in scheduling parent-teacher meetings. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, removes the present requirement that the law enforcement officials of the county or municipality must also sign the permits for the public fireworks display along with the fire department; requires that a permitee send a written notice to the chief supervisory law enforcement official for the county or municipality where the fireworks display will be held, which states the date, time, and location of the public display. - Amends TCA Section 68-104-211.
As introduced, requires proof of insurance before registration or renewal of registration for a motor vehicle will be issued. - Amends TCA Title 55 and Title 56.

As introduced, repeals statutory requirement that no one-family or two-family dwelling be approved for connection of new electric service unless the dwelling is equipped with at least one smoke detector. - Repeals TCA 68-120-111.

As introduced, exempts any person who has successfully completed all handgun training of not less than four hours as required by any branch of the military from paying the $115 handgun carry permit application and processing fee. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, deletes provision that a person is not a multiple DUI offender for purposes of sentencing if 10 or more years elapse between the first and second convictions. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.
As introduced, excludes members of the military from the application of the additional single article sales tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, provides for depreciation of repairs and for railway improvements when proceeds from sale of short-line railroads are deposited in transportation equity fund. - Amends TCA Section 9-4-207 and Title 67.
As introduced, requires, instead of allows, suspension of license to sell alcoholic beverages when license to sell beer is suspended. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4, Part 2.
As introduced, limits the district attorney's discretion to accept a plea to lesser offenses of driving under the influence. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, requires state agency or political subdivision to disclose, on official web site, owners of vendors operating or maintaining traffic surveillance cameras. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.
As introduced, prohibits traffic citations for failure to stop completely before turning right at an intersection based solely on evidence from surveillance cameras. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of education to report findings and recommendations on the system of competitive grants and technical assistance to the chairs of the education and finance, ways and means committees. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 49, Chapter 17; Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 1; Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 7 and Title 49, Chapter 9, Part 4.
As introduced, prohibits any person involved in an accident with an insured from filing a claim against insured's policy if such person is not at fault. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 11.

As enacted, prohibits sexual or violent sexual offender who is required to be on the sexual offender registry from establishing a primary or secondary residence with two or more other such offenders; prohibits person, corporation, or other entity from knowingly permitting more than three such sexual or violent sexual offenders to establish a primary or secondary residence in any house, apartment, or other habitation owned or under the control of such person, corporation, or entity. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39.
As introduced, directs TDOT to erect a highway sign on Interstate 24 in Hamilton County designating the exits for Memorial Hospital. - Amends TCA Title 54.
As introduced, removes length of service limitations and increases maximum mileage from 200,000 to 250,000 allowed for operation of school buses by LEAs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 21.
As introduced, sets minimum requirements for energy use in new state buildings. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12; Title 13, Chapter 19 and Title 68.

As introduced, includes the Pyramid in Memphis in the definition of a qualified public use facility for convention center and tourism financing. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 88 and Title 67, Chapter 5.
As enacted, changes word "tax" to "fee" in statement appearing on bill for storm water fees. - Amends TCA Section 68-221-1112.
As enacted, removes provision that would repeal the inclusion of certain nonprofit public benefit corporations as a "governmental entity" in Shelby County. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 20.

As introduced, eliminates parole for persons committing an offense on or after July 1, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 9; Title 10; Title 16; Title 33; Title 34; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 55 and Title 71.

As introduced, exempts health insurance entities from including state-mandated health benefits in accident and health policies provided to young adults and employees of small businesses, under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires that no disciplinary action be taken against a law enforcement officer for a pursuit for an actual or suspected violator of a law or ordinance who flees from pursuit unless such pursuit violated pursuit policies established by the law enforcement agency that employed such law enforcement officer at the time of the pursuit. - Amends TCA Title 40 and Title 55.
As introduced, limits the level of reimbursement that may be paid for in-state air travel by members of the general assembly. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-106.

As introduced, requires complaints against certain law enforcement officers and firefighters to be in writing, signed by the complainant, and a copy given to the affected officer or firefighter. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 24, Part 1 and Title 38, Chapter 8.

As introduced, requires that the department accept electronic signatures on the IRS Form 8850 Pre-screening Notice and Certification Request for the Work Opportunity Credit. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 14; Title 47, Chapter 10 and Title 50.
As introduced, enacts the "Corporate Expenditure Disclosure Act." - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10; Title 2, Chapter 19 and Section 56-3-601.

As enacted, authorizes schools to establish an International Baccalaureate Programme fund or an Advanced Placement fund to receive donations or grants from individuals or from private corporations, associations, or other artificial entities, both nonprofit and for profit, that desire to help support an International Baccalaureate Programme or an Advanced Placement program offered or attempted to be established by the school. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5; Title 49, Chapter 6 and Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.
As introduced, extends the deadline from March 1 to April 15 for businesses to file schedules with property assessor detailing personal property. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-903.

As introduced, prohibits participation of magistrates or other certain government officials or employees from serving on an assessment appeals commission unless such persons receive only compensation in lieu of expenses or a per diem payment for services. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, creates Class D felony offense of intentionally discharging a firearm into an unoccupied habitation and Class C felony if the habitation is occupied. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As introduced, deletes provision permitting juvenile court to retain jurisdiction over a juvenile who has been transferred to adult court if the juvenile is acquitted in criminal court or the charges are dismissed. - Amends TCA Title 37, 39, and 40.

As introduced, requires students to demonstrate through grades or test scores an understanding of the curriculum and an ability to perform the skills required for the current grade before being promoted. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, revises the castle doctrine to prohibit a person from criminal prosecution or civil action in the use of force which is justified; directs the commissioner of commerce and insurance to determine whether there are impediments inhibiting insurance companies from underwriting coverage for such events. - Amends TCA Section 39-11-622 and Title 56.
As enacted, requires students be allowed to take textbooks that are assigned to the student home in order to study. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 22.

As introduced, requires parents of truant students to attend counseling, mentoring, or parenting classes; requires truant students to receive counseling or mentoring; creates task force on truancy. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30.

As introduced, requires employers to submit information on newly hired employees to the department of human services for the purposes of determining alimony and child support within 15 days of the date of hire, rather than 20 days. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6 and Title 36, Chapter 5.

As enacted, provides that an adjudication or finding by a juvenile court that a defendant committed an act as a juvenile that constitutes a Class A or Class B felony if committed by an adult counts as a "prior conviction" for purposes of determining the appropriate sentencing range for such defendant. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35.

As introduced, clarifies that TBI shall establish, authorize, approve, and certify remote breathalyzers for the scientific examination and analysis of evidence. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.
As introduced, provides for erection of directional signs for Soulsville USA neighborhood and Stax Museum of American Soul Music on I-240 in Shelby County.
As enacted, revises the County Sheriff's Civil Service Law of 1974 in regard to political activities. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 8.

As introduced, expands aggravated rape of a child to include the rape of a victim who is under 10 years of age and requires punishment of life imprisonment without the possibility of parole. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5 and Title 40, Chapter 35.

As introduced, expands aggravated rape of a child to include the rape of a victim who is under 10 years of age and requires punishment of life imprisonment without the possibility of parole; requires death penalty for murder that occurs during the rape or attempted rape of a child. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2; Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5 and Title 40, Chapter 35.

As enacted, requires survey of extended learning programs to be disseminated by the department of education to all LEAs so that successful programs may be replicated. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

As enacted, requires the commissioner of education to encourage LEAP programs to provide extended learning that is complementary to school curricula. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 6 and Title 49, Chapter 1.
As introduced, decreases from four to three the maximum number of lawsuits in which a witness must prove personal appearance. - Amends TCA Title 24, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires county to print paper ballots equal to 104 percent of registered voters or petition state election commission to print a lesser number if county can show the 104 percent would be too excessive. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 20.
As introduced, authorizes repeal of Tennessee River Resort District status by two-thirds vote of municipal legislative body. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-103.
As introduced, authorizes a local government to require criminal background checks on applicants for licenses or permits from the alcoholic beverage commission. - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, creates three additional assistant district attorney general positions by October 1, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 7 and Title 16, Chapter 2.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of blue star family license plates on a revenue neutral basis. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked license plates for University of Tennessee athletics; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to the Tennessee Fund. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, removes requirement that a veteran receive the "Armed Forces Expeditionary Medal" to receive preference points for the Lebanon Expedition, the Grenada Expedition, or the Panama Expedition to be added to the veteran's earned ratings for career service examinations. - Amends TCA Section 8-30-306.
As enacted, authorizes a local government to seek criminal background checks with the TBI or FBI for applicants for beer permits. - Amends TCA Section 57-5-103.

As introduced, requires the secretary of state to send applications submitted by LLCs and LLPs to the state board licensing any professional services a member or partner renders. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 249; Title 61, Chapter 1 and Title 62.

As introduced, requires advanced practice nurses and physician assistants who perform certain invasive pain management techniques involving the spine to do so under certain direct supervision by a physician. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapters 7 and 19.
As enacted, revises Electric G&T Cooperative Act to authorize certain payments in lieu of taxes; authorizes inclusion of TVA as governmental electric system. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 67.
As introduced, requires state to fund all expenses related to the implementation of the "Tennessee Voter Confidence Act." - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 20.
As enacted, revises provisions governing membership of regional megasite authorities. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 6.

As introduced, makes permanent the temporary suspension imposed by HB7/SB1 of the 2010 Extraordinary Session of the requirement that independent contractors in the construction industry obtain workers compensation insurance. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 3; Title 29; Title 39, Chapter 11; Title 50; Title 56 and Title 62.
As introduced, exempts from taxation the sale of school yearbooks. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
As enacted, changes references in several titles of Tennessee Code Annotated from "mental retardation" to "intellectual disability." - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 39; Title 41 and Title 49.

As enacted, authorizes sales of alcoholic beverages on charter boat departing certain premier type tourist resort in Jefferson County; revises geographic requirement for a facility to qualify as premier type tourist resort in Jefferson County; also adds Pinecrest Golf Course in Gibson County. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As introduced, eliminates the limitation on the local option sales tax for sales of single articles; removes the additional state tax on single articles. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As enacted, creates a stand-alone "department of intellectual and developmental disabilities." - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 12; Title 33; Title 36; Title 37; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 45; Title 49; Title 50; Title 53; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 63; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, authorizes recommendations of the joint legislative services committee to be published on the web site of the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 3.

As introduced, deletes the energy efficient schools initiative and transfers remaining amounts in the energy efficient schools council fund to the lottery for education account. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51, Part 1 and Title 49.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of general services to develop guidelines to require a contractor or subcontractor who resides outside Tennessee to hire Tennessee citizens insofar as practicable when contracting with the state or local governments. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 12.
As enacted, "Isaac Hayes Memorial Highway," I-40 in Shelby County.

As enacted, allows a court, when setting bail for a defendant arrested for certain alcohol related offenses and such defendant has prior convictions for certain alcohol related offenses or is currently already released on bail for certain alcohol related offenses, to order monitoring devices or in-patient treatment as a condition of release and requires the court to determine whether the defendant is a danger to the community prior to release. - Amends TCA Title 40.
As introduced, eliminates deferral of proceedings prior to trial and consolidates methods for deferral of criminal proceedings under judicial diversion. - Amends TCA Title 40.

As enacted, exempts from taxation of real property buildings on land owned by charitable institutions and developed for construction of residences for low-income households. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 2.
As introduced, makes appropriations for the purpose of defraying the expenses of certain legislative enactments passed during the 2010 session of the 106th General Assembly.

As enacted, makes it the duty of the department to care for and preserve the second floor of the capitol building subject to the approval of the speaker of each chamber of the general assembly and increases the minimum number of parking spaces on capitol hill that must be assigned to the chief clerk of each chamber of the general assembly from four to six.

As introduced, reduces from 90 to 60 days period in which dealer via signed statement can deduct on a return sales tax collected but not yet remitted to commissioner for refunded items. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, requires that in municipalities in which charter provides for separate runoff election independent of primary election for municipal office, the runoff may be held not less than 30 days after the primary election. - Amends TCA Section 2-3-206.

As introduced, adds the offense of attempt to commit murder in the first degree to list of offenses for which a defendant must serve 85 percent of the sentence imposed by the court. - Amends TCA Title 40.

As enacted, encourages the department to consider the development, implementation, and administration of a program for payment of licensing test costs for adult students who received a high school diploma or GED through a career and technical education program. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 14 and Title 49, Chapter 11.

As introduced, requires the disclosure concerning transferability of credits that institutions authorized to operate by THEC must make to potential students to be in 18-point type rather than 16-point type. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, creates a supplemental bridge scholarship program for the 2010-2011 academic year for Tennessee HOPE scholarship students; funds bridge grant program using unobligated and unexpended funds from the energy efficient schools initiative. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 49, Chapter 17 and Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, requires the state board to report on the use of the scholarship fund for deaf students graduating from the Tennessee school for the deaf and the amount of moneys in the fund and expended for scholarships by November 1, 2010, with an update of the report by November 1 every year thereafter. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires order review hearing before the petroleum underground storage tank board to be conducted in accordance with statutes as well as rules and procedures adopted by the board. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 49; Title 67 and Title 68.
As enacted, authorizes the board of medical examiners to issue a St. Jude Children's Research Hospital Global Collaboration license. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 2.
As introduced, permits the commissioner to deduct the reasonable costs of an audit of a taxpayer before any money received as a result of such audit gets distributed. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As enacted, allows a municipality to contract with another collecting official within the same county to outsource processing of property tax relief applications. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 7.

As enacted, establishes procedures for revocation of license to practice medicine or other restrictions on practice if licensee found to be, after hearing, a person required to register as a sex offender. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2; Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 63, Chapter 9.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for Western Kentucky University (WKU); allocates funds from sale of such plates to Music City Alumni Chapter of WKU to be used for funding scholarships for Tennessee students attending WKU. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, requires nurses to provide updated contact information to the board of nursing when renewing their licenses. - Amends TCA Title 10; Title 49; Title 53; Title 63 and Title 71.

As introduced, permits city and special school district with boundaries contiguous with the city limits to specify by contract that funding from the city to the district shall be used half for operations of the district and half for bond issue for maintenance and construction at existing schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3.

As introduced, requires payor banks to process items sequentially as indicated by the numbers on the bank drafts on the day items are charged against a customer's account; places limits on handling charges for insufficient funds if items are not processed sequentially . - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 4, Part 4.
As introduced, changes the required holding period by a humane society before destroying an abandoned animal from 72 hours to 120 hours. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.

As introduced, requires each institution regulated by the commissioner to have a written explanation that clearly explains to the customer information concerning any fee assessed by the institution and to provide instructions for employees to clearly explain the fee information if the customer requires further explanation. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes candidates to enter into payment plans for civil penalties issued by the registry of election finance. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 8.
As introduced, clarifies that an employer who knowingly violates  50-2-202 shall be liable for punitive damages. - Amends TCA Title 50.
As introduced, adopts the "Tennessee Taxpayer Equality Act of 2010." - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15, Part 6 and Title 67.

As introduced, extends temporary tax on bottles of soft drinks and barrels of beer until June 30, 2015, or sooner upon state or federal law enacted imposing mandatory deposits on beverage containers. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 5, Part 2; Title 67 and Chapter 86 of the Public Acts of 2005.
As introduced, requires restaurant to be open four days a week, instead of three days a week, in order to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4.
As introduced, enacts the "Public Employer-Employee Negotiation Act." - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, requires secretary of state to publish schedule of dangerous drugs on secretary's official web site and make hard copies of schedules available on request. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, reinstitutes the requirement that the purchaser of a firearm give a thumbprint as part of background check process and that the TBI furnish thumbprint cards and pads to firearm dealers. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As introduced, creates various gun show offenses, including prohibiting any person who is not a licensed firearms dealer from transferring a firearm to another person if any part of the transfer takes place at a gun show or within 1,000 feet of a gun show. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.
As introduced, requires child protective restraints in shopping carts. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of special license plates for the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, changes incorrect cross-references to definition of domestic abuse victim and domestic abuse. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39, Chapter 13; Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 1 and Title 40, Chapter 35, Part 3.

As introduced, holds a landlord civilly liable for damages resulting from the lessor preventing certain tenant-victims of domestic abuse from being able to alter or end such victim's rental agreement in order to seek safer shelter. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 34, Part 2; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 66.

As introduced, allows a judge to include in a protection order that the respondent attend a certified batterer's intervention program. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 38, Chapter 12, Part 1; Section 39-13-111 and Section 40-35-303.

As introduced, authorizes any county or municipality, instead of just specified ones, to petition the general sessions court for the destruction of dangerous dogs instead of the district attorney general petitioning the circuit court of the county where the offense occurred for destruction of the dog. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 17 and Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 2.

As introduced, requires a service recipient receiving residential services funds by the division of intellectual disabilities (DIDS) to provide written notice and a reasonable time to cure any issues, to the current service provider before changing service providers. - Amends TCA Title 33.

As enacted, requires a rule-making hearing be conducted for all permanent rules that were previously filed as emergency rules, unless the emergency rule was filed to avoid the loss of federal funds. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2.

As introduced, requires certain government-run proceedings that impose sanctions against a licensed entity to include notice and a hearing before an administrative law judge, and further clarifies that such licensed entity does not have to waive such rights when contracting with the state. - Amends TCA Section 4-5-320.
As introduced, requires LEAs to notify parents and guardians of disabled children of services available to such children. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, applies loans protected under the Tennessee Home Loan Protection Act of 2006 to include purchase money mortgages as well as non-purchase money mortgages; creates a pilot project in Shelby County for voluntary mediation prior to the foreclosure of loans entered into under such act. - Amends TCA Title 35 and Title 45, Chapter 20, Part 1.

As introduced, requires the comptroller to report to the finance committee of each chamber and the joint TennCare committee concerning provider taxation involving hospitals by February 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, increases membership of Tennessee heritage conservation trust fund board of trustees from 11 to 13 with the speaker of each respective house appointing one trustee. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 7 and Title 67, Chapter 4.
As introduced, authorizes additional year of creditable service for members serving in certain employment restricted positions. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 34, Part 6.

As enacted, provides that no voter may be purged due to a deficient registration form once the administrator has declared the person a registered voter, unless the administrator later determines the voter knowingly made or consented to false information being placed on the registration form or failed to provide a valid signature.
As introduced, establishes aspects of a grievance procedure for certain public higher education employees. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, authorizes the chancery court clerks to invest idle funds of minor and incompetents in certain manners. - Amends TCA Section 18-5-105.

As introduced, directs the commissioner of financial institutions to review the practices of financial institutions that sell 26 USC 403(b) tax sheltered annuity plans and offer administration services for such plans to school districts. - Amends TCA Title 45; Title 47 and Title 49.
As introduced, improves retirement benefits of certain Tennessee public employees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36.
As enacted, honors the memory of the late Connie Hall Givens by renaming, in her honor, the Coordinated School Health Improvement Act. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 10.
As enacted, "American Prisoners of War Pathway," Shelby Street Bridge in Nashville.

As enacted, authorizes creation of regional airport authority by three or more municipalities and counties and at least one political subdivision of another state. - Amends TCA Title 42, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, enacts the "Regional Utility Authority Act of 2010." - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1, Part 2; Title 7, Chapter 82, Part 2; Title 64, Chapter 11; Title 64, Chapter 1 and Title 68, Chapter 221.
As introduced, enacts the "Regional Utility Authority Act of 2010." - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 1; Title 64, Chapter 11 and Title 68, Chapter 221.
As introduced, removes resort in Crab Orchard from definition of premier type tourist resort; removes one of the duplicated definitions of Nashville Shores. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102(24).

As introduced, allows certain special education teachers the opportunity to enroll in teachers' group health insurance during a 30-day period; provided the employing LEA pays any additional costs of providing the coverage. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27, Part 3.

As introduced, authorizes an impact note to be prepared upon request by two or more members of the general assembly that describes the effect on business of any general bill. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 2.

As introduced, states that an advertisement in Tennessee for the placement of children for adoption in another state by an agency not licensed in this state shall prominently state that the agency or individual is not licensed to do such business in this state. - Amends TCA Title 36.

As introduced, places restrictions on types of services a dentist must provide based on a contract between a dental plan of a health insurance entity, health maintenance organization, dental service plan or other service plan organization and a dentist. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As enacted, establishes violations of the Consumer Protection Act concerning covered file sharing programs. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1.

As enacted, requires each state governmental entity subject to the requirements of Title VI of the federal Civil Rights Act to submit annual Title VI compliance reports and implementation plan updates to "the human rights commission" instead of "the department of audit." - Amends TCA Section 4-21-901.
As introduced, creates a cabinet level department for Tenn Care. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 56 and Title 71.
As enacted, provides for an indigent fund to be created for certain purposes once the balance in the pre-need funeral consumer protection account exceeds $2,500,000. - Amends TCA Section 62-5-414.
As enacted, sets the priority as to who has the right to dispose of a dead body through cremation. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5, Part 5.
As introduced, authorizes courts to determine there is a need for additional bondsmen before additional bondsmen are qualified and approved by the court. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11.

As introduced, adds a reckless act resulting in the death or serious bodily injury of another while operating a motor vehicle or watercraft in this state to the acts for which a crime victim may receive compensation from the Criminal Injuries Compensation Fund. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 13.

As introduced, increases time of effectiveness of orders of protection, specifies that a person who violates an ex parte order of protection is subject to arrest. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6.

As enacted, removes specific authority for Johnson City to implement redevelopment districts with tax increment financing; and provides for allocation and payment of property taxes on redevelopment districts subject to tax increment financing. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 20.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for Volunteer Wounded Warriors; allocates all of first year's funds, with regular allocation thereafter, from such plates to Veterans Affairs for assistance with veterans' rehabilitation and care. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, directs the commissioner of health to report to the senate general welfare, health and human resources committee and the house health and human resources committee on or before February 15, 2011, concerning the issues surrounding and the impact and history of a provider tax involving hospitals. - Amends TCA Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, provides for health and sanitation rules governing offices, clinics, and centers of certain health care providers. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 63 and Title 68.
As introduced, revises award program for cost saving employee suggestions. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 27.
As introduced, requires business impact note on general bills upon request of two members of general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 2.

As enacted, requires that on and after July 1, 2010, as vacancies arise on the board of barber examiners, at least one of the four barber members must be an instructor, owner, employee, or manager of a barber school.
As introduced, makes the selling of human breast milk a Class C misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 1.

As introduced, increases period of denial of license due to withdrawal from secondary school from 18 to 21 years of age with certain exceptions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30 and Title 55, Chapter 50.

As introduced, deletes requirement that the department pay for children in state custody based on a county's child population and the average state commitment rate per 1,000 children. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 2.
As enacted, allows LEAs to donate computers removed from school inventories to low-income families in the school district. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 20.

As introduced, requires an organ donor's body to be released to a crematory or undertaker within eight hours of consent being given and the parts becoming available for donation. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As enacted, requires each local board of education to develop a policy by which students' TCAP test scores for grades 3-8 will comprise 15 to 25 percent of the student's final grade for the spring semester in the subject areas of mathematics, reading/language arts, and science and social studies; revises provisions governing when TCAP exams are to be administered. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, authorizes municipal governments to create an office of administrative hearing officer to hear building and property maintenance code violations. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54 and Title 66.
As introduced, provides for directional signs to Gospel Chapel on S.R. 251 in Davidson County.

As enacted, requires that multifamily residential establishments, whether used as owner-occupied property or rental property, that were permitted to operate under zoning regulations or exceptions thereto immediately preceding a change in zoning, be allowed to reconstruct new facilities necessary to the conduct of such multifamily residential establishment subsequent to the zoning change, in the event of damage by involuntary fire or wind damage or other natural disaster. - Amends TCA Title 13.

As enacted, diverts certain non-violent property offenders from sentence of incarceration to sentence to community correction, probation or diversion program and increases percentage of sentence person convicted of aggravated robbery with weapon must serve. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35.
As enacted, urges civics class be taught in high school. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, requires trailers have safety devices to prevent trailers from becoming detached from the towing vehicle; violation is a Class C misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 2.

As introduced, requires any group health insurance plan for state officials and employees to meet the requirements of a high deductible health plan as defined by 26 U. S. C.  223. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27, Part 2.

As enacted, authorizes a highway patrol member that retires involuntarily after 20 years of honorable service to keep his badge and weapon and to receive a retired commissioned card. - Amends TCA Section 4-7-110.

As introduced, allocates regular portion of funds from Trout Unlimited new specialty earmarked plates to Tennessee Council of Trout Unlimited for distribution to Tennessee chapters, instead of allocating equal amounts to each chapter. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of health to report with legislative recommendations to legislative committees after consulting with the commissioner of environment and conservation concerning issues involved in disposing of needles. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, increases the fine a judge may assess against the parent of a child adjudicated unruly for truancy from $50.00 to $100 and the number of hours of community service from five to 10. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.

As enacted, revises provisions governing bail for individuals with mental illness and other provisions governing how persons believed to have mental illness are to be handled when arrested. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11.

As introduced, requests the Tennessee code commission to change the name of the "division of intellectual disability services" as it appears in titles 4, 33 and 71 to the "division of developmental disability services" as volumes are replaced and supplements published. - Amends TCA Title 4, Title 33 and Title 71.

As introduced, encourages local education agencies to study the STEP program, or any similar program, and to consider replicating such program in their school districts with the assistance of interested partners. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, establishes uniform markers along highways to commemorate persons killed in crashes. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 5.

As introduced, enacts the "Equal and Fair Parenting Act" to create a rebuttable presumption that equally shared parenting is the custody arrangement in the best interest of a child. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, requires a school or day care official to verify the identity of a person seeking custody of a child before permitting the requested change in the child's custody arrangement at the school or day care center. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, clarifies that a juvenile court may order that a child be assigned a long-term mentor or receive counseling services if the child is found to be a delinquent child based on conduct involving the use of a firearm and adds any offense involving the use of a firearm to the list of offenses for which a juvenile court may transfer a juvenile to adult court. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires 24-hour notice of approximate time of removal pursuant to writ of possession and holds plaintiff liable for damages to defendant's removed personal property if notice requirements are not followed. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 15; Title 29, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 66, Chapter 28.
As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the language conferring powers on the board of public utilities. - Amends Chapter 46 of the Private Acts of 2003.
As introduced, exempts out of state couples who are married in Campbell County from paying the additional $62.50 imposed on the issuance of a marriage license. - Amends TCA Section 36-6-413.
As enacted, removes the June 30, 2010, termination date for the energy efficient schools council.
As introduced, authorizes licensed winery to conduct business at not more than two additional satellite facilities. - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, requires the water quality control board to make final decision on certain appeals and render an order within 120 days. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3.

As introduced, directs department of revenue to study benefits and potential hurdles to collecting sales tax on all Internet sales and report to finance, ways and means committees by December 15, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
As introduced, requires LEAs to provide 30 minute lunch period for students and teachers. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, extends deadline for special joint committee to study the issues relating to services provided to persons with developmental disabilities, mental retardation, and other disabilities from February 1, 2010, to April 1, 2010. - Amends TCA Title 33.

As introduced, requires insurer to inform claimant that claimant has the right to choose a repair facility to repair a damaged vehicle; prohibits insurer from requiring insured or third-party claimant to use specific business for vehicle repairs. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, allows retired member of the Tennessee consolidated retirement system or retired teacher to work and earn a salary of up to 60 percent of such person's preretirement income while continuing to draw such person's retirement allowance. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 8.
As enacted, allows highway maintenance or utility vehicles to operate a white, amber, or white and amber light system on any location on the vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 4.
As introduced, increases fee to obtain motor vehicle accident report from $4.00 to $10.00. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.
As enacted, creates the Class A misdemeanor of harboring or hiding a runaway. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4.

As introduced, requires the bureau of TennCare to seek a federal waiver to provide bridge Medicaid eligibility to persons formerly eligible due to SSI who were disenrolled from TennCare pursuant to eligibility redeterminations pursuant to Daniels v Goetz until such persons become eligible for Medicare. - Amends TCA Title 50; Title 56 and Title 71.

As introduced, creates Class D felony offense of statutory kidnapping, which is removing a person between 13-18 years of age from this state, where the defendant is at least four years older than the person, knows the person being removed is a minor and knows the defendant does not have the consent of the minor's parents or guardian to remove the minor. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 3.
As introduced, alters the acceptable time for foreclosure sales to noon to 7:00 p.m., rather than 10:00 a.m. through 4:00 p.m. - Amends TCA Title 35, Chapter 5, Part 1; Title 45 and Title 47.

As introduced, requires a sufficient number of photographs of a building be taken, if requested by the owner or occupant of the building, as a part of the pre-blast survey, to document the structural integrity of the interior, exterior, foundation, and roof of the building prior to the blast. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 105, Part 1.
As enacted, authorizes the Sewanee Inn to sell alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, increases from 120 to 125 days a retired employee drawing benefits may return to service temporarily in a position covered by TCRS during a twelve-month period. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36.
As introduced, requires 30 days notice prior to disconnection of utility service to state government users. - Amends TCA Title 65.
As introduced, revises persons exempt from licensure as an alarms system contractor. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 32.

As introduced, increases from "$100-$1,000" to "$200-$2,000" the range of the civil penalty that may be charged to a health care provider that renders excessive or inappropriate services. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Beverage Container Recycling Act," whereby certain procedures, processes, and fees are described for the recycling of such waste. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211 and Chapter 86.
As introduced, requires licensure of proprietary security organizations. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 35, Part 1.

As enacted, requires an official from the facility or the department of children's services to notify chief law enforcement officer of the county of an escape from a secure detention or correctional facility by a juvenile who is alleged or adjudicated delinquent for an offense that would be a felony if committed by an adult. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for Lion's Club; allocates funds from sale of such plates to each Lion's Club in Lawrence, Lewis, and Wayne counties for programming. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, creates a Class A misdemeanor offense for any person to rent or lease any primary or secondary residence or any other living accommodation to a tenant who is a sexual offender or a violent sexual offender and whose victim was a minor if such residence or living accommodation is within 1,000 feet of a school. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39.

As enacted, adds office of legislative budget analysis as recipient of various information and reports. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 15, Part 5; Title 4; Title 7, Chapter 86, Part 1; Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 7; Title 9; Title 29, Chapter 37, Part 1; Title 37, Chapter 3, Part 1; Title 50, Chapter 7, Part 4; Title 64; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, classifies a violation of certain prohibitions or restrictions placed upon a person convicted of animal cruelty by the sentencing court as a Class A misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2 and Title 40.

As introduced, applies the limit on the amount of methamphetamine precursor that can be sold to the same person in a 30-day period to all pharmacies in a chain of pharmacies that are owned by the same parent company. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of finance and administration to report to the select oversight committee on TennCare by January 31, 2011, concerning certain options for health care coverage for certain recent TennCare disenrollees. - Amends TCA Title 50; Title 56 and Title 71.
As introduced, makes private duty nursing services for certain quadriplegics a covered medical service under TennCare. - Amends TCA Title 71.
As introduced, enacts the "Rural Land Protection Act."

As enacted, excepts the office of the county register from the requirement of collecting the $5.00 archives and record management fee per document filed; specifies that county and municipal legislative bodies will be authorized to establish and collect, through the clerks of court, an archives and records management fee of $5.00 for each document filed for the purpose of initiating a legal proceeding. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 10 and Title 68, Chapter 3.

As introduced, prohibits students who are registered as sex offenders from residing in any on-campus student residence facility. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2 and Title 49, Chapter 8, Part 2.

As introduced, requires public school curriculum to include content on energy conservation, including instructing students on how to perform an energy audit. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 10.
As introduced, increases inheritance tax exemption for decedents dying in 2012 $100,000 per year until such amount equals $3.5 million. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8, Part 3.
As enacted, creates a small business advocate within the office of the comptroller of the treasury. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, authorizes home schooled students to participate in extracurricular athletic activities of public school in which they are eligible to attend. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30.
As introduced, limits noneconomic losses to plaintiff in medical malpractice action to $1 million. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 26, Part 1.

As introduced, requires applications for establishment of charter schools to provide, in addition to the names and addresses of the members of the governing body, a telephone number or email address for each member. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.
As introduced, increases the Hall income tax exemption for taxpayers 65 years of age or older $10,000 annually beginning January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.

As enacted, allows municipality to expand its urban growth boundaries to include tracts of land that are 10 acres or smaller when certain criteria are met; effective until July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Section 6-58-104.

As introduced, defines a restaurant on a boat dock located in a jurisdiction that has elected Tennessee River resort district status as having inside capacity of 40 and outside seating capacity of at least 200. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As introduced, "Specialist Jesse Harold Archer Memorial Bridge," Bridge No. 82-B-383-0.24 in Sullivan County.

As introduced, changes date on or about which secretary must publish compilation of data from agencies from November 15 to December 15; requires that the compilation be published on the secretary's web site. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 10 and Title 16.

As introduced, directs the comptroller to study the impact of the fees authorized for clerks or court on access to the justice system and report to the judiciary committee of each chamber by January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21.

As introduced, requires the department to develop a logo identifying non-agricultural goods produced in Tennessee; allows the department to grant permission to producers of such goods to use the logo. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3.

As enacted, increases the fees for court officers in Wilson County for attending on grand jury or waiting in court from $75.00 to $100 and establishes the fee as a minimum; authorizes the county legislative body of such county to increase the fee by resolution no more than once annually. - Amends Title 8, Chapter 21, Part 9.

As introduced, reduces from 10 to eight the number of members who are appointed to serve on a special joint committee to make recommendations concerning removal of judges based on charges affirmed by the supreme court. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires the comptroller to conduct an annual survey of number of disputes that are resolved by victim-offender mediation centers and report the results to the judiciary committee of each chamber. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 10; Title 16 and Title 17.
As introduced, enacts "Tennessee Health Freedom Act." - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of honorably discharged registration plates to civilian veterans of the United States Army Corps of Engineers. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, makes permanent the exemption that sole proprietors and partners engaged in the construction industry do not have to carry workers compensation insurance on themselves. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 3; Title 29; Title 39, Chapter 11; Title 50; Title 56, Title 68 and Chapter ___ of the Public Acts of 2010 (Ex. Sess.) (Senate Bill 1 / House Bill 7 of the First Extraordinary Session).

As introduced, extends period to petition for review of a civil penalty or damage assessment for violating a municipal storm water ordinance from 30 to 35 days. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 11.

As introduced, allocates increased funds resulting from modifications made in arbitration to the tobacco master settlement agreement in equal amounts to the agricultural reserve account to fund the agricultural enhancement grant program and to the health reserve account to fund wellness and prevention programs. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires that Prevent Child Abuse Tennessee provide child abuse prevention services for one year prior to application of grant funds from the child abuse fund instead of six months. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39, Chapter 13 and Title 40.

As introduced, makes certain changes to juvenile records requirements for law enforcement and juvenile courts and deletes the juvenile records task force. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 4 and Title 37, Chapter 1.
As introduced, limits renewal period for contract of director of schools to one year. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires nursing presence in certain residential hospice care only as mandated by patient care needs; applies to residential hospice that solely provides respite or routine home care levels of care to hospice patients. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, limits contracts with directors of schools to terms ending no later than 12 months after the next regularly schedule board of education election. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 2.

As introduced, authorizes representatives of certified animal control agencies to inspect Class I wildlife, facilities, and records. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 63, Part 2; Title 63, Chapter 12, Part 1 and Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 4.
As introduced, clarifies enclosure requirements for Class I wildlife. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 4.

As introduced, authorizes the sick leave bank trustees to grant reasonable time exceeding 90 days upon a member's application, made in good faith, asserting extenuating circumstances or other good cause. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 50.

As introduced, requires the department to develop a multi-agency taskforce that shall establish a plan to prepare and enhance the successful reentry of a nonviolent offender sentenced to state prison into the community. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

As enacted, entitles private non-profit institutions of higher education chartered in Tennessee to purchase and contract for the purchase of any materials, supplies, equipment, and services through the department of general services to the same extent the state public colleges, universities, and technology centers may do so. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Section 49-7-127.

As enacted, adds continuing education requirements for members of utility district board of commissioners; and rewrites provisions for utility district commissioners' removal from office and filling of vacancies. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82, Part 3; Title 7, Chapter 82, Part 6 and Title 7, Chapter 82, Part 7.

As enacted, creates task force to review regulations governing residential and day provider agencies contracted by division of intellectual disabilities services. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 5, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of blue star family license plates on a revenue neutral basis. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, "Tallent Bridge," U.S. Highway 27 in Rhea County.

As introduced, changes time within which equalization board must act during its regular session and send the notice of decision and appeal procedure from no later than five days to no later than seven days prior to the date taxes are due. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.

As enacted, requires the weekly benefit amount to be paid by electronic transfer to a specific bank account if requested by the claimant; details requirements for benefits paid by check. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.
As enacted, requires that notice of the right to foreclose be sent to debtor prior to foreclosure; requires that specific information be included in notice. - Amends TCA Titles 35 and 45.

As introduced, authorizes a Tennessee historic property preservation or rehabilitation entity to be a limited partnership for determining certain excise tax considerations; revises tourist accommodation tax provisions. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 4 and Title 67, Chapter 4.
As introduced, exempts from taxation property owned and operated by a nonprofit national guard association operating a group insurance trust. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 2.
As enacted, updates the trust laws. - Amends TCA Title 35; Title 45, Chapter 2 and Title 66.

As introduced, exempts a legal entity that offers prepaid vision care packages to the public from regulation as an insurance provider, if the packages offered include only discounted payments for eye examinations, frames, and lens and there is no indemnity coverage for these expenses. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, requires that Share the Road new specialty earmarked plates be redesigned for reissuance; redesign to be made in consultation with Jeff Roth Cycling Foundation and the majority caucus whip of the house of representatives. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, recognizes commissioner of health as state's e-health coordinator; administratively attaches the Tennessee health information committee to the department of health instead of the department of finance and administration; provides for commissioner of health instead of commissioner of commerce being chair of committee. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 56 and Title 68.

As enacted, authorizes any municipality, including those incorporated by private act, to change the date of municipal elections by ordinance to coincide with the August or November general elections and to extend the terms of incumbents to meet the new date so long as no term is extended for more than two years; if date is changed, it can be changed back at a later time, but cannot then be changed again. - Amends TCA Title 6.

As enacted, requires that a court, when appointing a lawyer to sit as a special judge for a general sessions judge or a juvenile court judge, state on the record the limitations of such special judge. - Amends TCA Section 16-15-209.
As enacted, enacts the "Annual Coverage Assessment Act of 2010." - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.
As enacted, enacts the Tennessee Community Property Trust Act of 2010. - Amends TCA Title 35.
As introduced, requires health care plans to include or offer coverage for custom fabricated and fitted prosthetic devices; exempts TennCare. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, enacts the "Uniform Collaborative Law Act." - Amends TCA Title 29.
As introduced, enacts the "Uniform Child Abduction Prevention Act." - Amends TCA Title 36.
As introduced, enacts the "Uniform Environmental Covenants Act." - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 66; Title 68; Title 69 and Title 70.

As introduced, requires board of regents and university of Tennessee board of trustees to develop guidelines to provide academic credit toward certain master's degree programs for certain state government employment. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, authorizes individuals to serve as president or chancellor of state universities with 10 or more years state service in certain positions in lieu of advanced degree. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.
As enacted, revises provisions governing vacation lodging services; requires such services to have a vacation lodging service firm license. - Amends TCA Section 62-13-104.

As enacted, clarifies property that is excluded from being defined as a heliport in a tourist resort county is limited to private property used for the landing of a privately owned and operated helicopter for private non-commercial purposes. - Amends TCA Section 42-8-101.

As enacted, requires the department, in consultation with the department of environment and conservation, to conduct a study relative to recurring flooding near the Sunshine Community in Blount County caused by clearing a landslide from the highway running parallel to the Little River into such river. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54 and Title 69.
As introduced, enacts the "Official Tennessee Prescription Program Act." - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10 and Title 63, Chapter 10.

As enacted, creates a Class A misdemeanor offense for a person who was previously convicted of animal cruelty if such person subsequently violates an animal custody restriction imposed by the sentencing court. - Amends TCA Section 39-14-202.

As introduced, establishes a grant for a pilot project in one LEA to provide laptop computers to all seventh graders for use through the 12th grade to enable teachers to integrate technological fundamentals of Internet research, understanding, and use of spreadsheets, word processing, and presentation skills throughout the curriculum. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 4.

As introduced, adds roach clips, rose and pen combinations, cocaine spoons, certain tobacco products, and other items to list of items that are considered drug paraphernalia. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, prohibits sales of certain tobacco products by certain persons and businesses; prohibits sales of certain tobacco products near schools, churches, and other locations. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 47 and Title 67.
As introduced, expands temporary assistance for dependent children to a legal guardian who is living with a dependent child. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As enacted, adds Historic Rugby in Morgan County to the definition of premier type tourist resort for purposes of the sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, makes the offense of animal cruelty applicable to all animals and requires that a person intentionally rather than knowingly deprive an animal of food or water in order to commit the offense. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.
As enacted, directs that employees of the Board of Regents shall not elect whether to receive longevity pay by separate check until July 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Section 8-23-206.
As introduced, excepts the office of the county register from the requirement of collecting the $5.00 archives and record management fee per document filed. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-408.

As enacted, requires information be provided on the projected financial impact of rules and regulations proposed to be promulgated during a fiscal year. - Amends TCA Section 3-2-107; Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.

As introduced, requires the agency proposing any new rule, amendment to a rule, or repeal of an existing rule to prepare a statement of benefit and transmit the proposal to the fiscal review committee for an analysis of the fiscal impact of the proposal. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 7; Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 1 and Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2.

As enacted, adds two law enforcement members to the advisory committee on open government from the Tennessee sheriffs' association and the Tennessee association of chiefs of police and adds one member from the Society of Professional Journalists and one member from the American Association of Retired People to the committee.

As enacted, authorizes The Company Store and Maggie's Landing in DeKalb County to apply for licensure to sell alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption as premier type tourist resorts. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As enacted, adds Pates Ford Marina in DeKalb County to those facilities authorized to sell alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102(24).
As introduced, clarifies the meaning of the visible commencement of operations related to construction services and products. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 11, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 5.
As introduced, clarifies the meaning of the visible commencement of operations related to construction services and products. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 11, Part 1.

As introduced, directs the comptroller to review statutory financing available to local governments and make suggestions that would improve the credit ratings, reduce bond insurance costs, and improve the sale of securities by local governments; requires that comptroller file report with appropriate committees of general assembly by March 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 10; Title 12 and Title 49.
As introduced, requires the commissioner to review certain aspects of products being sold by insurance producers. - Amends TCA Title 45; Title 48 and Title 56.
As introduced, "Southport Community Bridge," S.R. 245 in Maury County.

As introduced, provides that a DUI offender may be sentenced as a multiple offender if the offender has a prior DUI conviction, regardless of the dates on which the offender was charged with each DUI. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As introduced, includes web site owners to list of types of media owners who are not liable for any damages for defamatory statements displayed on the web site by another unless the web site owner failed to exercise due care to prevent the publication or utterance of such statement on such web site. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 24.
As introduced, includes illegal sexual contact with a victim's mouth in the offense of aggravated sexual battery. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires local beer board to send notice of any violations by permit holder to alcoholic beverage commission if such permit holder also has a liquor-by-the-drink license; requires commission to send notice of any violations by licensee to local beer board if licensee also has beer permit. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4 and Title 57, Chapter 5.

As introduced, creates additional $500 fine for alcoholic beverage retailers and licensees and beer permit holders for selling alcoholic beverages or beer to any person under 21 years of age. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4; Title 57, Chapter 3; Title 57, Chapter 4 and Title 57, Chapter 5.

As introduced, creates Class C misdemeanor for an owner or employee of age-restricted venue to allow access to its buildings or facilities to persons who are under 21 years of age. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 18.
As introduced, requires trial judge to adjudge all costs in favor of the prevailing party in all civil cases. - Amends TCA Title 20.

As introduced, permits an original equipment manufacturer headquarters company located only in Hamilton County to apply for a wheel tax exemption on its company vehicles. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 8.

As introduced, increases punishment for perjured sworn testimony before committees of the general assembly from a Class E to Class D felony. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Title 39, Chapter 16, Part 7.
As introduced, adds any relevant acts of deception by either party as a factor of consideration in the division of marital property. - Amends TCA Section 36-4-121.

As introduced, requires judicial assessment of costs and attorney fees based on finding by the senate or house of representatives that an election contest was maliciously or frivolously prosecuted. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 17, Part 1 and Title 3.

As introduced, prohibits the assessment of civil penalties against a tobacco store owner where an employee sold tobacco products to a minor; immunizes alcoholic beverage store owners from civil liability for employees' sales to underage persons. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 57.

As introduced, prohibits any person who suffers an injury that is caused by another person committing a felony or attempting to commit a felony on the property of another from recovering actual or punitive damages resulting from such injuries from the owner, lawful occupier, or tenant of such property, provided the owner, lawful occupier, or tenant of such property did not participate in or facilitate the commission of such felony. - Amends TCA Title 29.

As introduced, authorizes the admission of signed affidavits into evidence at an unemployment hearing occurring on or after July 1, 2010, without such evidence constituting hearsay. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5; Title 24 and Title 50.

As introduced, eliminates the authority of the legislative body of Montgomery County to provide suitable office space, office furniture, equipment, and supplies for any member of the general assembly representing such county. - Repeals l TCA Section 3-1-109.

As introduced, broadens the offense of harassment to include the offense of communicating by electronic means to another that a relative or other person has been injured, killed, or is ill when the communication is known to be false. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As enacted, "Southport Community Bridge," S.R. 245 in Maury County.
As introduced, enacts "Tennessee Farm Winery Law." - Amends TCA Title 57.

As introduced, allows local jurisdictions to hold a referendum about whether to approve sale of wine in retail food stores; creates license for sale of wine in retail food stores. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 1 and Title 57, Chapter 3.
As enacted, allows Walking Horse Hotel in Bedford County to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As enacted, authorizes reimbursement to an insured for services provided by a licensed marital and family therapist or licensed professional counselor. - Amends TCA Section 56-7-2401.

As introduced, specifies that medical payments coverage is not subject to hospital liens; limits a hospital's recovery of damages for lien impairment to the amount of the policy coverage. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 22.
As introduced, requires carbon monoxide alarm detectors to be installed in all residential structures. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 120, Part 1.

As introduced, provides that any municipal electric system that provides cable or Internet services shall be subject to regulation by the Tennessee regulatory authority. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 52, Part 6.
As enacted, allows any school resource officer who witnesses an offense by a student receiving special education to take the student into custody. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 10, Part 13.

As introduced, removes authorization for the division of regulatory boards to assess investigation and prosecution costs in disciplinary hearings pursuant to schedule promulgated by commissioner of commerce and insurance. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, adds the hallucinogenic drug 4-bromo-2, 5 dimethoxyphenethylamine (2C-B) to list of Schedule I controlled substances. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As introduced, authorizes use of red flags made from plastic materials instead of cloth to mark a projecting load on a motor vehicle, subject to commissioner's approval. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, removes certain powers of the commissioner of commerce and insurance relative to conducting rule making hearings concerning unfair practices in the business of insurance. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, places restrictions on appointments to the assessment appeals commission; requires a member to recuse himself from voting on an issue before the assessment appeals commission in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-1502.
As enacted, establishes requirements for authenticating or issuing execution upon a foreign judgment. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 19; Title 20; Title 21; Title 25; Title 26; Title 29 and Title 45.

As enacted, requires all state employees who are supervisory personnel to be physically present in Tennessee while supervising employees working in this state, unless business reasons require out-of-state travel. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30, Part 2.

As enacted, creates a procedure for certain persons engaged in the construction industry to file for an exemption from obtaining workers compensation insurance to cover themselves; creates an employee misclassification advisory taskforce. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 3; Title 29; Title 39, Chapter 11; Title 50; Title 56, Title 68 and Chapter ___ of the Public Acts of 2010 (Ex. Sess.)(Senate Bill 1 / House Bill 7 of the First Extraordinary Session).

As introduced, authorizes the board of claims to establish incentive programs for state departments, agencies, and institutions to reduce liabilities to the risk management fund; and requires any state department, agency, or institution to procure bids for obtaining appropriate insurance on a commercial grade vehicle prior to acquiring the vehicle. - Amends TCA Section 9-8-108 relative to the board of claims and to amend Section 12-3-908(a).

As enacted, requires any state department, agency, or institution, to procure bids for obtaining appropriate insurance on certain commercial grade vehicles prior to acquiring the vehicle. - Amends TCA Section 9-8-108 and Section 12-3-908(a).

As introduced, adds a law enforcement member to the advisory committee on open government who is a member of either the Tennessee sheriffs' association or the Tennessee Association of Chiefs of Police. - Amends TCA Section 8-4-602.

As introduced, requires local boards of education to develop short school day programs for high school seniors who have completed all requirements for graduation except for three or fewer classes. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, allows alcoholic beverages, wine, and beer to be sold for on premises consumption at any location in such jurisdiction that has held a local option election approving liquor-by-the-drink. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As enacted, authorizes certain commercially operated recreational facilities in Blount County containing specified characteristics to serve alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption.

As enacted, creates a procurement commission, state protest committee, procurement office, and an advisory council on state procurement and regulates the procurement, management, contracting, and disposal of goods and services by the state. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 12.

As introduced, allows alcoholic beverages to be sold for on premises consumption in unincorporated areas of any county that has held a countywide local option election approving liquor-by-the-drink. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3 and Title 57, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires schools director to send certain disciplinary records and records concerning adjudications of delinquency by the transferring student to the new school or school district. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.

As introduced, sets the incentive amount for biodiesel manufacturers paid from the biodiesel manufacturers' incentive fund for fiscal year 2010-2011 at $0.40 per gallon. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3.
As enacted, revises provisions governing the composition of the commission on firefighting personnel standards and education. - Amends TCA Section 4-24-104.

As introduced, lengthens suspension of requirement that sole proprietors and partners maintain workers compensation insurance on themselves from March 28, 2011, until June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 3; Title 39, Chapter 11; Title 50, Title 56.

As enacted, specifies that if a party withholding retained funds in regard to a construction contract fails to deposit the funds into an escrow account, the party would be responsible for paying the owner of the retained funds an additional $300 per day for each day that the retained funds are not deposited into an escrow account; specifies failure to deposit retained funds into an escrow account within seven days' receipt of written notice regarding such failure is a Class A misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 34, Part 7.

As introduced, allocates a sum sufficient from the premium tax collected for workers compensation insurance to pay for the staff of the advisory council on workers compensation instead of making retention of council's staff subject to budgetary approval in the general appropriations act. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-121.

As introduced, clarifies that the only bid preferences that are permissible in public construction projects of local governments are those created by the general assembly by general law; prohibits local authorization for bid preferences for contracts unless general assembly specifically authorizes such actions to occur. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4, Part 8.

As enacted, revises the current requirements concerning information that must be contained on the outside of the envelope containing the bid to also require such information be included in an electronic bid; removes criminal penalty for noncompliance and instead authorizes civil penalty of up to $5,000. - Amends TCA Section 62-6-119.
As enacted, requires blasters to file a notice with commerce and insurance prior to the blast occurring. - Amends TCA Section 68-105-103.

As introduced, entitles property owner to recoup certain costs incurred in contesting eminent domain action from the condemning authority. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 20; Title 29, Chapter 16 and Title 29, Chapter 17.

As enacted, authorizes voters to approve the issuance of liquor retailer's licenses to manufacturers of products containing alcohol by referendum as an alternative to holding a special local option election; revises provisions governing the serving of samples by a retail licensee manufacturer or distiller. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 2 and Title 57, Chapter 3, Part 2.
As introduced, requires TACIR to study effect of court costs and litigation taxes on access to justice. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 16; Title 40 and Title 67.
